Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Like the other two, Dwal is ensnared in the grasping, crushing tentacles and is now restrained. 2. Bludgeoning damage:18 Gerrard whips a daggerat the back of the old man's neck. 3. It pierces his skin and draws blood, butthis strange beingseems to be made of tough stuff. 4. Nevertheless, he grunts in pain. 5. (Concentration check:16) Gerrard lets fly a second,perfectly-aimed blade.It similarly does relatively minor damage. 6. (Concentration check:23) The grasping tentacles release Kei, and he slides between them, caressed by their loving embrace. 7. He dreams of flying, and of dark clouds. 8. Bjorn, circling high above, tries to overcome his fear: Charisma check:20 Dwal is restrained, but may try to break free, or attack with disadvantage. 9. Peri may act unrestrained. 10. The man is at the bottom of the pit, still trying to scramble out. 11. "Foolish!" 12. he mutters. 13. "So regrettable."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Graddik's man Balrich eyes Vin over the rim of his cup as he drinks his water. 2. He looks over at Graddik who is now snoring lightly in a medically induced stupor and a grotesque smile spreads slowly across his face Here now, what's a pretty little thing like you doing in a place like this with only boys and dwarves to keep you company? 3. Why don't we get off to somewhere and I can show you what having a man around is like? 4. He sets the cup down on the table and crosses over to you. 5. Vin, give me a intimidation check at advantage because of Kestrell’s aid.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Crispy's attack would successfully hamstring the second quaggoth, causing it to tumble over. 2. Within moments after transforming, Immotichey would feel a powerful alien presence in his mind, the weight of thousands of years pushing him out of his own body while it was yet trapped within, seeing what it was doing/ Millenia streamed in every direction, darkness, deciet, lies, plans within plans, all woven on the web. 3. Cast out for betrayal, rage, hatred, vengeance were fuel. 4. Spiders exploded across a barren, jagged land, spires reaching for the sky, spiders exploding out from them like Scarabs from a corpse, flowing, flowing into eternity. 5. His body would begin careening towards Jimjar, who had just jumped over the edge and upon seeing both him and Arthasis, blood-lust filled his mind the urge to kill them both was intense as the burning sun. 6. You are no longer in control of your own body. 7. ( make either a Charisma saving throw, DC 20. 8. Or, attempt to break your own concentration over the spell, with your spellcasting modifier, DC 17 ) The rest of the prisoners turned tail almost with Arthasis, leaving Cade the only one atop the platform, having just witnessed venom dripping from Immo's spider form, hearing the agitated screeching form his spider-like maw. 9. Everyone including Immo, please make a Perception Check, at disadvantage. 10. (due to the murkyness of the water, as this is where all the chamberpots and trash are dropped into) As you all fall into the water, creating massive splashes, none of you can stop hearing the droning of the demons locked in combat, drowning out all other noise. 11. The ooze engulfs in flame, ironically enough sparing Jimjar from the flowback. 12. The ooze doesn't move however, continuing to digest Jim. 13. By this point, all of jimjars clothing and gear was beginning to become unusable.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Becoming more and more familiar with this spell as he's found himself in life-threatening situations more often than he ever expected to, Kwisatz becomes faster at sending out his icy spectral hand. 2. Considering the tight quarters of the battle space, casting spells is somewhat more difficult and he doesn't hurt it as much as he was hoping. 3. The icy hand reaches out and definitely makes contact, but the jelly seems to barely notice. 4. Andrømeda is up! 5. Recovering from the jelly's previous hit,Andrømeda collects her senses and grabs her [Tooltip Not Found]. 6. Still in a rage, she furiously slashes at the jelly, injuring it gravely with the first swing and then watching it collapse into a lifeless puddle after the second swing. 7. The ochre jelly is dead. 8. The last twelve seconds seemed to both last a lifetime, and end in the blink of an eye. 9. With the jelly dead, there is a palpable silence. 10. It's the kind of quiet that actually rings in your ears - or is that the sound ofAndrømeda's handaxe hitting the ground reverberating off of the walls? 11. Either way, as your nerves calm and the quiet settles back over you, the realization that you've been in this temple for a long time starts to set in. 12. You can hear footstep shuffling into the secret door behind where the large group entered. 13. Dazlyn sheepishly asks, "Is it dead? 14. Is everyone okay?" 15. ((At this point, it is about 6:00am or so.))

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Tim gives you a nod, now rubbing the back of his neck. 2. Aye, was a member of the Red Paw Paladins few years ago. 3. Since retired and comes here to watch the place till the morning for me. 4. Aye, handsome lass she is. 5. And aye, lemme see, was maybe a month ago she showed up here looking for work. 6. Think she said she was from up way up north, though, she dont often talk about it. 7. Got a feeling she might have fallen on hard times. 8. Even as he says this, he slowly steps away from the table, occasionally his eyes wondering to an adjacent room by the kitchen and bar, nofhing but a small cot and table inside the small room. 9. Hate to say but bed is calling me ladies and gents. 10. Mayhaps over breakfast I can come up with some better answers for you. 11. Thank you and goodnight. 12. He says as he pushes the door open, being resisted by a pile of cloths behind the door before finally getting in and closing it behind him. 13. Janice smiles again and leads you out the door towards the shed out back. 14. Only a brief walk along the cobblestone street and you can see ghe shed, doors latched tight, more than likely to dissuade any would be thieves of even trying to jimmy it open. 15. As you walk behind her, asking a few questions, she slows her walk and responds, oh no, I'm originally from up north. 16. And working for tom has been alright I guess. 17. Hes not the worst employer ive ever had, that's for sure. 18. Nearing the shed, she pulls out a key and unlocks the lock and slides the large piece of timber out of the way so the doors can be opened. 19. Striking a match she lights the lantern inside the shed before looking back at you. 20. I dont think ive heard of them unfortanetly... 21. Even as she speaks, you feel a sort of tingle in the back of your head. 22. (Go ahead and make a Wisdom saving throw if you could please)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Yes, that is correct, south is into the wilderness, the same direction the bandit is going. 2. Marshlands would be under the swamp classifcation, so it would not contribute to Favored Terrain) As the bandit flees, Andivus gives chase and fires off another lance of arcane energy, striking him in the back. 3. He lets out a yelp of pain ( 6 force damage). 4. The rest of the team regroups near Gark as he takes a cautious look around the village. 5. As you enter, you see that you are walking on an elevated walkway that rise about three feet off the water's surface. 6. They branch off into different directions and seem to connect all of the huts. 7. The huts range in size from about 10 feet in diameter to 25 feet in diameter. 8. While he does not see any bandits lurking around the wooden walkways of the village, he does see other bandits on other sections of wall that also look like entrances. 9. They seem to be facing out from the village. 10. The large hollowed out tree trunk almost directly to the north is the centerpiece of the village and seems to be an important location judging by what looks like a crude altar near an opening in the trunk. 11. As he is looking around, he hears a splash nearby and sees some ripples nearby to the east.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Yorvalor's performance was solid, but nothing too flashy. 2. Enough to give those watching some entertainment, and those who were nearby could tune it out and continue their own conversations. 3. Isabella while watching, that little smile on her face, did seem energized; unable to tell if it was nervousness or excitement as her hands continued to hold the note in her hands. 4. A few people who were in heated discussions around Emund seem to calm down, but it's the four armed ones at the back that... (WIS Saves (v DC 13) ) #1 6 / #2 17 / #3 10 / #4 17 Two of them remove the tension of the crossbows. 5. Removing the bolt taking a step closer into the room, placing their crossbow down on some of the nearby tables - surprising the patrons sitting there. 6. "Yeah, a chat sounds pretty good." 7. The other two in the back of the room look at each other then to the others. 8. "Boss told us to be careful!" 9. one shouts. 10. The other takes aim with the crossbow, swinging it around towards Emund, finger on the trigger. 11. "What'cha do to them!" 12. he demands. 13. Looking a little bit nervous after seeing the two disarm and head closer, without a care in the world. 14. Keegan, as you watch from your spot, tucked behind some people and with a bit of cover, your eyes drift over to the window. 15. Outside in the faint lights of the street you see a few more figures. 16. Nothing out of the ordinary until there's a few strikes of what could be flint or a set of matches. 17. Someone's trying to set something on fire outside, and it isn't a cigarette. 18. The one with the crossbow aimed.... ( 7 v DC 13)... falls on to the floor, rolling in laughter. 19. The other who remains uncharmed.... ( 6 v DC 13)...sits himself down in a chair. 20. But seems confused as to why he's even doing that. 21. The two near Emund who are charmed shake their heads a bit. 22. The charming effect somewhat beginning to fade, but not entirely. 23. "Well. 24. Boss said that some people from here are causing trouble. 25. Said that we need to teach 'em a lesson. 26. Think he said play with fire be burned."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Valrish roars with rage, leaping at the shambling mound, dawnbringer shining in his two handed grip. 2. The mass of vegetation manages to dodge the first swing, but twigs and leaves are burned away in the light of the longsword as Valrish comes around for a second attack. 3. Eldeth provides ranged support with her crossbow, managing to stick a bolt into a gnarled root in the mound. 4. Round 1 17 - Oorr/Zippy 16 - Grimnir/Jimjar 12 - Valrish/Eldeth 06 - Belwar/Derendil 04 - Shambling Mound (HP: 76/136) Loobamub is surprised to see you back so quickly. 5. "You are mighty hunters indeed. 6. Perhaps this next task will be no problem as well." 7. The myconid gives you directions just outside the grove and tells you how to recognize the grick cave. 8. They then warn you that it will not be easy to sneak up on the creature as it watches everything that passes through the cavern, waiting to strike. 9. You head out into the underdark once more. 10. After maybe an hour of travel, you cross a fungal patch where several myconid are tending the fungi. 11. You spot the cave towards the back of the cavern, exactly as Loobamub described. 12. There doesn't appear to be anyway to approach it without being seen.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Reminder, Lord Niyra will be at the docks. 2. The task is to find out what if they saw anything suspicious during their last time they saw Myra. 3. Same with Conner.) 4. "Yea, it's tradition, the first inherits the throne, while the second is to help relations between the nobles and the church. 5. And yes, it's the cathedral of Ilmater. 6. She does live in the royal palace but is currently out on a pilgrimage...If I didn't know any better, I'd say you'd be trying to court her." 7. Sargt gives a slight laugh as he pats Hatt's shoulder, "And for Jarrick, I can ask around in the barracks and see if anyone knows where he lives at the moment. 8. And see if his old squadmates are in, have them go check on him if they are." 9. @Quarry "...Well, if Lord Opsola sent you two...During my last confession, the priestess seemed bothered by something. 10. Like she was worried about something. 11. Even kept glancing about the cathedral, like she was looking out for someone or waiting for someone. 12. She never said who but it was pretty obvious that she was...Is she alright? 13. Did something happen on her pilgrimage?" 14. @Tower Sargt nods, "Yes, its just the west of the bazaar. 15. It's the place for entertainment for the people and I have the men train there in sparing matches against the gladiators there. 16. And you all take care as well, good luck on your task." 17. Sargt heads off to join with his men.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gold, Lia, Kodrith, and Chikra are enjoying each other company in the cab, and getting to know one another better. 2. About 5 miles from the Bridged City, apart from the usual animals in the forest, Hallanann notices some suspicious people lurking around. 3. To the left of the cab there are 2 people hiding behind trees, and on the right are three more. 4. Just before Hallanann has a chance to raise an alarm, a lanky figure in a ragged red cloak steps out onto the road before them brandishing a shortsword. 5. Tiarsus applies the breaks, “Whoa!” he says to his two horses. 6. “There’s two ways off this road, friends,“ the boy says. 7. ”You pay the toll, or my mates drag your bodies into the woods. 8. What’ll it be?” (Sorry, I should have made it more clear as to who can see who. 9. Gold, you can edit your post, or make a new one.) 10. Gold and Lia can see bandit 5 and bandit captain. 11. Chikra and Kodrith can see bandit 1 and the captain. 12. Krusk can see bandit 5 Hallanann sees everyone. 13. If you want to use a skill, please feel free to roll. 14. (Lia sees all the bandits) "This is how my dad made a living to support us," The boy says, "And it's how I'm going to provide for us now!" 15. He seems hesitant, and takes a step back when approached. 16. Nevertheless, he raises his sword, and repeats his demand. 17. "Five gold pieces each." 18. The other bandits also fall back when approached, and look to their leader for a signal, but keep their crossbows trained on you.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Dang it, I had found a map of the ward but I'm not finding it now. 2. So we'll go for it and say that they've found their way to the Spider.) 3. Crush and Veryes have found their way to The Crawling Spider. 4. No one seems to be there right now. 5. Waiting for the rest of the party, they post up nearby and Veryes begins to perform in the street, earning 7 gold in the process. 6. At the market, Aria's arrow finds its mark and buries itself in the foot of one of their attackers. 7. He screams, startled, unable to move. 8. The guards tackle the other dwarf, allowing the Aria, Usul, and Sen to make their escape. 9. OK, we'll go with the majority - if anyone wants to retcon in any kind of extra RP for flavor prior to everyone reuniting at the Crawling Spider, please feel free to do so. 10. You are all together again. 11. Veryes and Crush have gathered quite a crowd outside of the Crawling Spider; Veryes' performance has earned them a fair amount of coins. 12. In the distance, you hear -- or you think you hear -- a raven. 13. There were no checks made and both groups were distracted. 14. And, for all you or your characters know, they're not the same birds. 15. Plus, it isn't as if the birds would be hovering 10 feet over them the entire time (if they are the same birds and aren't flavor added).

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Jalt, the four men look about as uninterested in you as possible, at least to your eyes. 2. You can roll an Insight check if you wish. 3. They show no interest in Nate's movements either. 4. You walk forwards, and before you is the entrance to perhaps the largest cave on the plateau. 5. The cave mouth is tall and broad, and seemingly unguarded. 6. You enter and see that the cave very quickly becomes a tunnel that heads down and doubles back on itself; you realise that this may be a very large series of caves occupying a sizable area underneath the main camp, and that you know little of what you may face here. 7. As you head in, the light dims as you draw away from the cave mouth; without some form of light, Jalt and Nate will soon be unable to see. 8. Jalt, you don't get much sense of dishonesty or subterfuge from the men. 9. They seem to have been employed to be here and do something, and that's what they're doing. 10. They're certainly not hired to keep you out, whoever you are. 11. Nate, you now have a small flickering flame, which illuminates a very small area around you, for the next ten minutes. 12. Are you entering the cave? 13. I'll assume the same marching order - Soar, Jalt, Nate, Elspeth. 14. You circle round and head down, andup ahead is a wide tunnel; you see a couple of large pillars, possibly stalagmites and stalactites that have met up, occupying part of the way up ahead. 15. The tunnel bends round to the right/south ahead of you. 16. Soar, you don't see any sign of anyone up ahead or behind you. 17. (OOC: You are entering a potentially large complex where you are unlikely to be able to take multiple consequence-free rests. 18. Spellcasters and others with limited resources please bear this in mind. 19. :) )

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Grim scans the storefronts to find a seedy tavern, he finds what he assumes to be the seediest one open. 2. It is called The Crooked Pixie, and you can hear a cacophonous blend of music, yelling, and cheering coming from within. 3. As you enter you see people holding drinks everywhere, the building is packed full of people. 4. Applying Varis' knowledge of the area you assume that many of the large, dirty men are lumber-types. 5. There are a few adventure-types around, dressed in their armor, telling grand tales to excited patrons. 6. The bar is being tended by two people. 7. One a man, large with a flowing beard. 8. The other, a woman, shorter but still a little rough looking. 9. There are bar-maidens serving drinks, maybe half a dozen or so. 10. Despite the rowdy group you are able to notice that the bar-maidens are being treated very well, almost as if there is some sense of community among these rabblerousers. 11. You see one man standing on a table leading the group in some sort of a drinking song, he belts a loud final note before collapsing face down on the floor. 12. Varis you recall a very quaint bookstore called Barnum and Barnum Books and Breads. 13. Your memory is clear enough that you think it should be an easy find in the morning. 14. Varis The bearded man looks at you with piercing eyes. 15. His face is weathered and seems to wear a permanent scowl. 16. He replies in a surprisingly soft voice, "Fallowsynn, is as it always is... 17. drunken!" 18. he cackles at his own joke, "HA! 19. Least round here it is. 20. That's how I like it too. 21. Good for business. 22. What brings you through?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The halfling children are delighted with their flower crowns, though they slip over their little heads and end up as necklaces instead. 2. One of the children grabs something from Strix's box, but her mother deftly snatches it and returns it. 3. She's a tender stomach, this one. 4. Best not chance it, eh. 5. The other halflings politely refuse Strix's offering, claiming that as this is their campsite, they are the hosts and must provide the food. 6. Where are we going, you ask Ullia responds. 7. Well, to Neverwinter city up north; it's not so cold there as you'd think, or so they say. 8. I guess you're coming from there, am I wrong? 9. Simeon and I have found work at one of the new breweries there; that's what we do, you see. 10. Many years of work in Waterdeep, serving halflings, gnomes, elves and other sorts too. 11. But Neverwinter's growing fast, and it's a good position, a good opportunity. 12. The conversation goes on for a while; one of the halflings brings out a fiddle, and there are some songs and a chance to try some of the halflings' beer, their own brew they brought with them. 13. After a while, the halflings go to their tents to sleep. 14. Sadly, by the time Vaz awakens, almost everyone else is already sleeping peacefully. 15. Asher takes first watch, and watches from a distance as the halflings talk and eat and eventually turn in. 16. There seem to be a few more clouds in the sky than before, but the watch passes uneventfully. 17. Asher wakes Scupper to take the second watch, just as Vaz wakes up over at the halfling camp where he fell asleep. 18. The camp fire is still burning fitfully, and one of the halflings is standing watch for their group, and greets him politely before looking back to the wooden object he is carving. 19. Scupper, please re-roll a d20 for your Perception check. 20. If Strix wanted to continue the conversation further, or anyone else joined them to talk to the halflings, let me know and we'll add that in below. 21. If Asher would like to know more about Soodi, he'll probably need to ask Vaz. 22. :)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The she wolf quietly ponders. 2. “The one who smelled of Stone and Magic was taken away almost immediately, we have not learned his smell enough to track him. 3. His companion, the one who smells of Steel and Wisdom has been trapped in this cave for many a moon, we hear his cries of help and pain when ‘He who plays with Venom’ is aroused.” Once freed, the two other wolves immediately slink out of the room, heads hanging low, but the deceased Alpha’s mate stays and eyes you four with eyes as green as Emerald. 4. She slowly picks up the skull of a rodent, and peels off the top section with her teeth. 5. Inside is a perfectly preserved 4 leaf clover. 6. ”You will also find something buried in the ash of the furnace. 7. I will be anxiously awaiting your return by the source of the gunpowder I smell on you. 8. Be cautious, the goblins may be unobservant as sleeping toads, but ‘She who dances in the Hunt’ most likely already knows you are here. 9. I imagine since the room hasn’t been flooded with their kind, she thinks she can gain something from you. 10. Do not trust her, she betrayed her pack, she will most likely betray her new caretakers, she would not hesitate to betray you if she feels she can gain a more advantageous position.”

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Vincent swoops closer to the horses he confirms that they are lying motionless on their sides and also that they have saddles on and numerous black arrows protruding from them. 2. He also catches a glimpse of a goblin lounging lazily under a tree just to the north of the roadbeyond the top of a steep embankment. 3. (G2) Tarja's wolf nose does catch a subtle waft of a familiar stench on the air, although not nearly as potent as the previous evening. 4. As she and Zeke approach through brush and trees north of the road a startled voice calls out what seems like a brief sentence in a low, somewhat hushed tone. 5. It does not take a great intellect to surmise from the voice or the unfamiliar words spoken that they may have been from a goblin speaking in the language of the same name. 6. (G1) (You guys didn't necessarily get the jump on the goblins, but your initiative is far superior so you should still get to have your fun. 7. Let's start things off with...) Zeke steps out from behind a thicket and spots the goblin Tarja had been pointing towards. 8. With one swift motion and a whoosh the goblin is lying on the ground dead, Zeke's handaxe buried in the side of his skull. 9. INITIATIVE21 Zeke20 Arvel18 Fae16 Tarja11 Elra & Vincent9 Ethan6 Goblins / F&F

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. [OOC – I will allow it yes. 2. But you have to specify – if you say everyone, then everyone within 30ft that you can see and that understand at least one language will hear your thoughts] It takes Dreel only a short moment to catch up to Clipclop, despite the distance he had already put between himself and the edge of the fog. 3. Due to the fog, Ignus’s flame has a different effect than anticipated. 4. For the first 10 ft it does produce bright light and allows everyone to see clearly within that space. 5. However, beyond the 10-foot range, it causes the fog to appear as a thick white wall, obscuring everything beyond it. 6. The forest itself is still lit by the sunlight, although only a portion of that light hits the thicket and the fog covered ground. 7. So, while the light is not a problem for the travellers, the fog and the thick growth that surrounds them only allows for a limited vision. 8. With Rutah in front and Baconoid legging behind, the group of travellers makes their way deeper into the forest. 9. Soon, the sound of the wind is drowned out, except for the ruffling of the treetops far above. 10. Increasingly, the sound of flapping wings, chirping, and the buzzing of bugs replaces it. 11. After walking through the forest for a while, the travellers see a faint light in the distance. 12. Dreel and Jaylen Dreel and Jaylen notice a faint trace of a path underfoot as they are about to step over it and continue away. 13. It’s barely noticeable as the plants have already attempted to retake it, but the ground underneath the leaves is still barren and flattened. 14. [Note: This path leads parallel to the light you have noted, so if you were to follow it, it would lead you away from the light source.] 15. For some time, the travellers walked along the path, without noticing any changes in their surroundings. 16. The chirping and buzzing sounds still echoed through the forest. 17. The trees continue along the path in a similar spacing and the fog still obscured much of their surroundings. 18. The pieces of cloth Rutah is tying to the lower branches leave a clear trail behind the group. 19. [Everyone roll perception please]

A massive stone altar, stained with layers of centuries of bloodletting, stands in the middle of the room, cracked in half by sledgehammer blows. 4. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. I don't remember if you brought the materials with you but I'll just assume you have (because the internet is being a bitch and I need to go to bed now) and say that you do. 2. Also, I'm ruling that you guys are taking the 4 day off due to majority rule (3/4). 3. Elsara finishes her scrolls on Day 1 of 4 ( Summer 45) Gendan has the stuff in the spoiler happen on Day 2 of 4 (Summer 46) The fort is huge and I am running on the assumption that each of the 4 party members are in their own corner of the fort doing their own thing. 4. The party is currently separated but what could possibly happen in a well guarded fort? 5. There are well trained guards everywhere. 6. Like I said, Elsara's disease are very infectious (not to horses though) but not really serious (unless it turns into the Crimson Flu). 7. She can visit the horses. 8. They are treated well but the sickness is really taking it's toll on them. 9. Twinkle Snow seems to be happy to see Elsara Gendan and Runt, the Tabaxi says, "No one's hiring. 10. Get lost!" 11. Elsara, roll Animal Handling. 12. Don't add +2.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. SilverTongue runs forward, but is not actually able to see the last kobold due to the winding tunnel. 2. It is obvious to Lily that she is too far to catch the last fleeing kobold and instead turns her interest towards the body of the kobold that has been killed by the party in this cavern. 3. She searches meticulously (investigation 25 on discord), but finds only 1GP on the kobold. 4. She can see a couple of more areas where the kobolds might have stored or tried to hide their treasures, and in addition, there is something else that catches her eye on the floor underneath the body. 5. Some of the soil and dirt of this room doesn't seem to be 'real'. 6. The last kobold runs again as far as his ugly little legs are carrying him, but he is limping and he knows he won't get away. 7. So he shouts as loud as he can: 'aaragah aaragah, errragidies!!' 8. Oleksi cannot see the kobold anymore because of the winding of the path. 9. Blake is trying to really convince the weasel that he doesn't mean him any harm, by pulling things from his backpack, making a lot of noise, swearing when he gets his hands on a variety of items that he doesn't need right now, with the rations stuck all the way at the bottom. 10. Lily (15/15) SilverTongue (17/17) Kobold (A) Kobold (B) Kobold (C) Blake (16/16) Mokrai (21/25) Giant Weasel ( 9 ) Oleksi (15/15 ) The weasel , scared for his life, being attacked, blinded, hurt, then comforted all of a sudden by Blake, spooks again at the noises Blake makes with his backpack and runs past his outstretched hand towards the exit of the cave system. 11. Oleksi follows the kobold deeper into the winding warren and sees him not too far in front of him. 12. Again he uses his thorn whip to stop the opponent from running away, but when it makes impact, it takes the little kobold down and he falls dead to the ground. 13. Everything falls quiet for a moment, then the bone chilling noises of small animals like the tapping from cockroaches and chewing on bones from rats start up again.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Maldorn: Thank you for the reminder. 2. Yes, you feel a jolt to your sense. 3. Mechanically, you get a +1 to all DEX-based rolls and -1 to all CON-based rolls for the next hour. 4. Jack once again moves forward, the flame diminishing greatly once it enters the deep shadows beneath the trees. 5. The group follows with Anafrey in the lead. 6. As each follows, stepping within the shadows of the trees, they feel not resistance, per se, but pass through a kind of invisible curtain. 7. It does not hurt, but a few things happen as soon as they "enter": The air on the other side is cooler, the flame of Jack's torch once again looks like a normal flame combating the darkness by lighting up the ground and trees, and they can no longer hear the ebb and flow of the waves. 8. The sea wind still blows through the trees. 9. Jack "walks" in a straight line north, only diverting to dodge a tree in "his" way. 10. After only a short distance (Anafrey estimates it to be about 45 feet), she can see the flame is moving through the small clearing Maldorn pointed out from the peak. 11. The trees are thick, so it was hard for her to see previously. 12. And, she can't tell for sure, but she thinks there isn't as much sunlight in the clearing as there should be. 13. Right now, Anafrey isfive feet from what she perceives as the edge of the smaller clearing. 14. She can see shapes past the trees, but doesn't know what they are. 15. She is 30 feet behind Jack, so Erric is 35, Anafrey is 40, Maldorn is 45, and Ebokk is 50. 16. Ebokk has only been in the trees about 15 feet. 17. Consistent with night time is a good way to look at it!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The Triboar Trail was dead the last time you travelled; you recall heading up and down this road and barely encountering another living soul. 2. Now, the situation is... better. 3. A little. 4. As in, you actually meet two groups of people headed east as you near the coast. 5. One merchant and his two guards are headed to Phandalin, delivering two wagons of supplies to 'some Rockseeker gnome, or something'. 6. The other larger caravan of around fifteen people, traders and guards together, is headed to Triboar itself. 7. They set off from Neverwinter a few days before and comment on how quiet the roads seem - some kind of trouble with goblins or orcs in the Neverwinter Woods, says the gossip in Neverwinter. 8. They seem upbeat about their chances of making it safely to Triboar and beyond, and their leader, an elderly elf woman named Sunila, remarks that this is only the second time in her life that she's seen a camel. 9. You hit the High Road, and turn south. 10. You meet people here and there - merchants, bards with their guards, soldiers, rangers, even a few adventurers, but most are keen to get to Neverwinter or further north and don't seem keen to stop. 11. Varinth, please make a WIS saving throw. 12. On the fourth day out of Phandalin (please mark down that you have consumed four sets of rations, and let me know if you have run out!) 13. you see someone headed towards you, an older human man with a long white beard, white hair, faded blue robes with large silver stars dotted here and there. 14. He has his head down, but from a distance you can hear him grumbling, muttering and occasionally barking an angry laugh at no-one in particular. 15. There is plenty of space on the wide High Road to let him pass if you wish, or you could approach him.

Tanrick, you’re up! 4. (He’s prone, so you’d have to roll at disadvantage, but you can’t get worse than that.) 5. ( 8 ) (no you wouldn’t, the smoke, but still.) 6. Tanrick attempts to shoot at the enemy, but screws up and hits a conveniently placed pipe that sprouts fog around him. 7. It’s almost as if the kid knew that would happen..... (DC13 constitution save or 16 poison damage.) 8. The Flag moves away. 9. You all hear a thud as it lands in the pit. 10. Jathon, you’re up! 11. You’re prone, and 10ft underground! 12. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Alton, the woman shrugs. 2. I can salvage a fair amount, put some new supports on, put the metal studs in. 3. I'm not going to lie, this is going to cost you more than if you just buy new armour but... well, that's up to you. 4. The smithy will charge you fifty gold for upgrading Alton's armour to studded leather. 5. It will take them five days, which is well within your downtime period. 6. Silent, the woman inspects your armour too, but aside from cosmetic changes, any actual improvement to the armour will cost the same or more than just purchasing the better armour, which would be splint for 200 gold. 7. Balassar, you can sell any weapons or armour here for half their purchase price in the PHB. 8. They don't have many items on display - you could ask, and they will bring you what they have to show you. 9. This is not the smithy where Magnum will be working next week. 10. This one is on the very edge of town and Geta is looking at you all and making impatient noises, keen to get you back into Felderwin proper and not upset her bosses. 11. Aww, never mind son, says the burly halfling as Silent's effort doesn't even net him the most minor of prizes. 12. After the half-orc, a halfling teenager steps up and does a little better. 13. She takes a small bag of candy as her winnings, and offers one to Silent. 14. It's a small purple sweet seemingly made from some fruit you don't recognise.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (I was just thinking that the dogs obviously haven't been eating very much, so they're probably dehydrated, too. 2. Jerky isn't going to be the easiest thing for them to eat and they're trying to eat it fast because they're dogs and this might be a good way to win their trust) Aria pours some of her water over Crush's wounds and he winces, so he's still with us. 3. While this is happening, Veryes comes to Sen's aid with the guard and really has him on his heels with her questioning where he was during all of this. 4. "I was -- that's none -- I don't -- that's Waterdeep business I'll have you know, not anything you need to be concerned with. 5. But it looks like everything here is all well and good except for those three, I'll have someone from the city come round them up and dispose of them. 6. Reckon some urchins will come claim the crows, heh." 7. He's referring to the thugs and Crush, assuming they're all dead. 8. He isn't really aware of what Aria's doing. 9. The guard sees the dogs rush over to Aria, and he blinks a couple of times trying to process this situation. 10. "Wait. 11. Is that -- thing -- one of yours?" 12. he asks Veryes, in reference to Crush. 13. The guard removes a small canteen from his coat and deliberately unscrews the top and pours a quick splash down Crush's throat. 14. "You all clear out of here. 15. Thank you to for your service to Waterdeep, the Masked Lords thank you for your service, please note that this official thank you does not make you employees or otherwise official representatives of the Masked Lords in any way, shape, or form." 16. He looks at Sen. "You forget your potion? 17. Rookie." 18. and he begins dispersing the crowd. 19. Crush is back up with 1 HP from a quick sip of a healing potion.

Torla, The Dwarven cleric seems to be having some trouble but not enough to warrant you Treading water to help her. 6. Unfortunately, With the sun so High and so bright You cant make out much in the water itself. 7. Via Passive perception you can see a LOT of clothes and drift wood has washed ashore onto this island. 8. Brythal, Upon looking at your firearm. 9. You do note that it is water logged, It can work but the Misfire score will go up. 10. You would have to clean and dry the firearm to use it properly. 11. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As you advance through the south passage, Utar leads the way guiding the humans of the party with the aid of his rope. 2. Graxx, the fourth in line, carries Rose atop his shoulders who illuminates the way with her lantern. 3. Drazzim brings up the rear, careful not to go too deep into the water an lose his footing. 4. As you progress, the ground becomes steep quickly, and before you can get used to wading forward, you find yourselves out of the pond. 5. You enter a roomwhich is better furnished than the previous ones, with some serviceable tables and chairs, some palatable food and drink, and even a larger chair sitting on a granite slab at the far end. 6. Atop the chair, sitsa 3-footstatue of a female human figure with a crayfish head, a crayfish’s claws, and an articulated shell covering her shoulders (If your character would be interested in such things, you are welcome to roll a religion check, {DC 12}). 7. Several passages lead out of the room deeper into the cave.ThreeKuo-Toa stand around the room, wielding net s and spear s, but noticeably lacking their traditional shield s. All three stand facing you as you enter, waiting for directions from a larger Kuo-Toa who wields a pincer staff . 8. Two large cages at the back of the room hold the eleven prisoners taken from the peat bog, one of which lies face down on the mud and displays deep cuts throughout his skin. 9. In addition, adrow elfdressed in black underclothing, the kind you would typically wear under armor, iskept separately inside a third cage. 10. This room is well-lit by torches. 11. As you step forward, the Kuo-Toa leader speaks in a guttural language you do not understand. 12. The distinct prisoner, quickly understanding you are his only hope out of here, translates almost immediately. 13. "The fish leader is asking who you are, and why do you kill his brethren." 14. Both the tribe leader and the impromptu drow translator await your response. 15. UPDATED MAP: Cages are all the way on the back (column 34); leader's table and chair with statue are located along the northern wall (row D). 16. There are several smaller tables, chairs, and torches throughout the room. 17. The prisoners look like they've been kept well-fed, despite their dire situation.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Unaffected Erevan is standing in the threshold of the temple when Aldaryn who had been flanking the group trying to protect y'all form an attack by hidden foes in the square was on the temple steps when Darik and Saarebas fell! 2. Now he sees the lot of you! 3. "What happened," Aldaryn asks Erevan with a worried expression looking down at the pile of party members as Erevan stands unharmed! 4. Erevan: Darik & Saarebas the best you can gather from your knowledge need lesser restoration to become conscious again. 5. You also once the trigger which is not the salt/black powder which is a crude ward but instead it's a mechanism that was engaged inside the temple after the blasting of the doors! 6. Roll sleight of hand to disarm it, DC 15 Pitero & Andulra: Bride leads you into the house calling for her father and her aunt but receives no reply. 7. Frantically she looks around until something hits her and she bolts from the house out the rear door for the barn. 8. Do you follow? 9. Any checks you'd like to do in the house? 10. Andulra: The house looks like it was left in the middle of a meal, a hasted mess is about the place not like someone was looking through things but as if the people who live there knew where specific hidden things were and pushed what hid them out of hte way to get to them. 11. Following Brida outside you find she's gone into the barn. 12. It is large, bigger than the house even, and houses two milking cows and two oxen. 13. The animals look nervous but not harmed. 14. Brida is looking around the barn before scurrying to an area the looks like a common barn floor strewn with straw and animal droppings. 15. You watch as Brida closes her eyes holding her hands out over the doors muttering before a trap door appears in the floor right before you where first there was none!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Early the following morning, under cloudy skies, the party makes its way east (back the way you originally came, toward Death House, the village of Barovia, etc. 2. ), and walks for a couple of hours back to an intersection you do not likely remember: the main path has curved to point southeast, but a hairpin turn leads to a narrow track due west. 3. Sort of like this: ---\ Except that the slash is at a shallow angle. 4. Anyway, you follow that track up a hill overlooking the valley housing Vallaki, and you climb for about an hour.The sky darkens and there's a cool, damp breeze, perhaps signaling rain. 5. The forest opens up into a clearing, gloomy even at midday, and you see a windmill. 6. The onion-domed edifice leans forward and to one side, as though trying to turn away from the stormy gray sky. 7. You see gray brick walls and dirt-covered windows on the upper floors. 8. A decrepit wooden platform encircles the windmill above a flimsy doorway leading to the building’s interior. 9. Perched on a wooden beam above the door is a raven. 10. It hops about and squawks at you, seemingly agitated. 11. You can see beyond the windmill, at the far edge of the large clearing, there are four large stone statues. 12. In the gloom, you can't make out the features of the statues. 13. Before you is the windmill. 14. It looks like this, and I've left some markings as visual aids for us to share.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Crossing over a small creek as clear as a blue winter sky, the wagon's reflection undisturbed. 2. Ismark takes a second to think before responding, "Yes, sir Allen. 3. There will be a ways out. 4. Roughly a couple hours up ahead. 5. Did you come this way?" 6. Ireena has taken out a set of crocheting needles and has begun working quietly. 7. Turning back towards to the cart, she says, "If a powerful evil entity terrorized your family and sought you for an unknown reason, would you willingly submit?" 8. The wagon continues onward down the path for about two hours until coming to a crossroads. 9. Ismark pulls the cart to a stop and hops out to care for the horses. 10. An old wooden gallows creaks in a chill wind that blows down from the high ground to the west. 11. A frayed length of rope dances from its beam. 12. The well-worn road splits here, and a signpost opposite the gallows points off in three directions: BAROVIA VILLAGE to the east, TSER POOL to the northwest, and RAVENLOFT/VALLAKI to the southwest. 13. The northwest fork slants down and disappears into the trees, while the southwest fork clings to an upward slope. 14. Across from the gallows, a low wall, crumbling in places, partially encloses a small plot of graves shrouded in fog. 15. Allen, the fork is identical to your dream, but the gallows are unfamiliar. 16. A wind lazily pushes the frayed rope to and fro.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. So, as you all leave the headquarters of the Rough Riders the hot outside air outside is a drastic change from the cool air you got use to inside. 2. The immediate area still has low traffic but you do notice that the shadows have started to get longer as the sun has begun its descent into the afternoon. 3. It is early afternoon as you all make your way from the outskirts of the town into the more populate areas. 4. On your way to the Grand Market Square you all notice that more people are starting to move about to finish their day. 5. The civilians that you pass by stare at your group, particularly at Umuni, some stare in curiosity and others give more of a stink eye; the GoR keep a particular eye on your group as you all pass through. 6. After about 45 minutes you all manage to reach the edge of the Grand Market Square, which is more of a L shape than an actual square. 7. You all walk in in the shorter and narrower section of the market. 8. The Grand Market Square, despite the heat and time of day, is fairly busy. 9. There are various stalls scattered about that you can see, the owners shouting out trying to get the attention of passerby's to buy their goods. 10. There is the faint ringing sound of a hammer hitting metal, the smell of fresh baked and cooked goods fill the air, and just an overall din of noise from people talking and haggling prices. 11. Farther up the market, past the stalls and where the market bends to the left, is a raised medium sized stage that is used for public announcements, entertainment, and public displays of criminal punishment; there is also a public notice board stationed in front of the stage. 12. From where you all are at, it appears that this section is used mostly for mobile stalls, there are buildings that line the edge of the market but they appear to be houses.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "If I were to know of such places, then my duty as a crownguard is to apprehend and shutdown such places." 2. The guard answers then looks to Isobi, "We serve her gruel and a roll of bread. 3. They were made by the cook, who cooks for both the recruits and prisoners. 4. But we do not show preference for either and just grab a plate when it is time to feed her." 5. (Is there anything else the party would like to investigate or question?) 6. Isobi's Persuasion: 12 The gnome guard draws her gaze over to others and gives a slight shrug. 7. "Alright, just don't touch anything and don't get near any materials. 8. I'm sure gaffer is still here, working his ass off." 9. The smell only gets stronger as you all enter the building. 10. Even more so as the guard leads you to a black haired gnome tolling over an table filled with tools and powders. 11. The guard taps his shoulder, "What?" 12. , the man asks, not giving a glance back. 13. "Boss, you got visitors." 14. "Tell them to go away." 15. "Boss, city watch visitors." 16. With a groan he turns back, lifting his magnifiers up. 17. The gnome is old, the black in his hair actually ash along with dark circles around his eyes. 18. He looks annoyed as he grumbles to himself, "And what the hell does the Bram want with me? 19. I'm trying to double my quota for this month so I don't need any distractions."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. To speed things up a bit, I'll just take Kent's vicious mockery roll and apply it to the Goblin South of the Horses. 2. Sorry Kent! 3. Goblin Wisdom Save: 6 The goblin(1) starts audibly crying in fear of the scary humanoid species he's never encountered before, who is yelling at him in a very scary sounding language. 4. The goblin will then very shakily aim his bow and arrow at Kent and fire at disadvantage. 5. Goblin 1 Hit: 6 The arrow goes wide, and veers to the right of the horses, nowhere near any of the group. 6. Berrus then charges at the Goblin(1) who just fired the arrow and cleaves him with his battle axe, he diddn't need any second wind to fell this foe. 7. Turn Order has now restarted, and Val has made his move Goblin Con Save: 17 The Goblin is hit in the face with a cloud of poisonous gas, and you see it writhing around on the ground madly, clawing at his face for agonizingly long few seconds, before it's movements slow, and it falls into a state of dangerously still comatose. 8. The goblin was literally at half a HP left, so I used my DM caveat to decide that he is unconscious, but will most likely die if he receives no medical help in the next few minutes. 9. Thirty seconds pass with the group tense, waiting for another wave of attackers, but the woods seem to calm down around them, and those with high passive perceptions notice that the birds and insects seem to be singing once more. 10. You have one unconscious goblin with a minor head injury, and one unconscious with deadly poison in their system. 11. You also have the two dead horses blocking the road with a backpack between them, what would you all like to do?

What taverns are in that area? 4. "I'm not 100% but I'd say we're in the area of a few places. 5. Shipmasters' Hall, which is an inn rather than tavern not that there's much difference on the ground floor. 6. Or the Spouting Fish. 7. It's basically across the street from the other. 8. But Xanathar's known for operating in the sewers. 9. Do you think they'd have Floon topside? 10. As Asariel and Kestrell start discussing what they know and what they've seen. 11. Vassa pipes up to offer help. 12. Suddenly it dawns on them that they're over complicating it. 13. There's two paths to choose from and only one has a symbol next to it. 14. Silver has been leading them down the path nearest the symbol. 15. So the only meaning is simply, "Go this direction." 16. Correct assumption! 17. Until he opens it anyway. 18. :) Silver slowly starts to run his hands around the outside of the door but doesn't find any sort of mechanism to unlatch the door. 19. Then he starts to run his hands down the door itself and feels it move. 20. Surprised and a little confused, Silver pushes on the door and it opens into a small tunnel. 21. From what you can see, the tunnel opens into a room in 15 to 20 feet.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. A couple hours later you find yourselves back in town. 2. Adabra leads you to Harbin Wester's home, her anger has yet to wear off. 3. She bangs on the door and demands that he open up, but he refuses to do so. " 4. You worthless coward, you can't even open your door and you send these thugs to abduct me from my home! 5. You go ahead and live your life in fear, but I will not! " 6. She then steps to the side. 7. You are able to speak to Harbin and you inform him you brought Adabra back to town as requested. 8. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Another hit, somehow it is clear that this thing is not feeling well. 2. On to Lothar, then Tibern again. 3. Lothar's greatsword cleaves the one ooze in half, making it two smaller oozes. 4. Before the two oozes can recover from their forced fission Tibern looses a bolt, which just barely manages to hit one of them. 5. The stricken ooze shivers a moment then withers away leaving a sticky film where it died. 6. The remaining ooze strikes out at Lothar. 7. Attack: 9 Damage: 11 plus 2 acid damage if it connects. 8. Back to Vandar. 9. The farther into this mine you move the louder the sound of crashing waves gets. 10. The pool of water in this room remains still as you move through the room. 11. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Fenthaza clasps her hands, "Excellent. 2. I knew you would see reason in the end. 3. Any good Yuan-ti knows how to play the end game. 4. Perhaps you would make acceptable converts yourselves." 5. See looks at your caretaker, "Liss'ard, please have your charges select some chores from the list, or force them to do this or that; I don't care as long as it gets done. 6. Cleanliness is next to diabolicalness, you know." 7. She turns towards the party, "Now, I expect you to put your pathetically short backbones into these tasks, and I expect you to work the whole day with no complaining. 8. Liss'ard will show you your nice hole instead of the sacrificial altar at the end of the day as your reward." 9. With a subtle gesture she concludes the meeting, and the guards force you back outside of Fenthaza's quarters. 10. Liss'ard unfurls the scroll and has a look. 11. He rolls his eyes (if that is possible for a snake) and begins to mete out chores arbitrarily. 12. "Goldilocks, you..." he looks at the busted ankle, "ugh, pathetic... you go assist Xopal in the poison distillery... watch your step." 13. Next he looks at Daner, "Wee Man, you look fit for work.. how about you muck out the dinosaur pen?" 14. He laughs to himself, "...that stool is bigger than this fool!" 15. Next he turns towards Tempest, "You look like you need to be somewhere dry, let's send you to rearrange the contents of the storeroom." 16. Then finally he looks at Darion, "You, ordinary...guy? 17. Go to the bathing area and scrub down some of our extraordinary warriors!" 18. Before closing the door, Fenthaza adds one more thing. 19. "Oh, slaves, one more thing. 20. Our most noble leader, Slithotep, do not let him see you. 21. He is known to lop the head off any non-reptilian on sight, hoist the body above his head, and take a shower of blood right then and there. 22. He is not as... pragmatic as I. 23. Please do not fail me in this."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Pockets, you think you saw flowers like this somewhere nearer the village of Palma Flora but not in the forest. 2. To Arael: I don't know much more than that they've been causing trouble, or so people say. 3. The dwarf laughs. 4. Maybe they're just bandits who have painted their faces blue. 5. I wouldn't know, really. 6. Ask around the village to the north if you are headed overland, or in Port Damali if you get there first. 7. I'm afraid I'm just not that interested in wild tales - my only concern is not to get into any delays. 8. To Pockets: Oh, well, thank you, but I have a reasonable map myself, and I have been to Palma Flora in previous seasons. 9. I've noticed the kordsblood flowers around the village, but there's been trouble there of late, I hear. 10. I'm hoping to find a new supply, a little closer to Port Damali. 11. Arael, you vaguely recall seeing the flowers near Palma Flora, same as Pockets. 12. (OOC: That would be a Nature check. 13. I don't think proficiency with alchemist's tools would give advantage or a bonus.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. ===DM=== Cora takes her tools and start to tinker with both chests' lock mechanisms. 2. It took a while, and some sounds that the lock mechanism make when Cora is tinkering with it is unnerving, as if threatening that even a single mistake will break the rusted lock. 3. But finally, every gear inside smoothly moves, allowing the chests be easily open with both hands. 4. Inside both chests is a collection of over a hundred copper coins (you estimate they are about 300 copper coins in each chests), and on one of them, also a small statue made of clean jade. 5. You can tell at a glance that the jade is real, and the statue is worth some gold. 6. Over the statue is an inscription in primordial: Bane for those who seek the night, death for those who seek the temple of the bat.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Where thinks for a moment, making exaggerated expression all the while, “Well, did you know that there can only be one unicorn in existence at a time? 2. They hunt each other down if any more appear. 3. Oh you meant the other thing! 4. Well, I told you all the general information we have and I gave you a location, so if you have some specific questions, I’m all ears.” What looks at you for a moment, clearly confused even with her skill, “You have an interesting taste in company. 5. Commonly try to pick up people who tried to fight you? 6. Listen, I appreciate the offer, but I can’t just leave my family like that. 7. That being said, you do play a mean lute.”

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Truk chuckles heartily That... That was a beast worth slaying! 2. Never before have I seen such bloodlust from a single creature! 3. This is a story I will have to tell my comrades when I get back to them! 4. before he re-sheathes his weapons, looking around at the fires, being dutifully put out by the group. 5. Bugree, listens to gustov, nodding, and with the voice of a man in duress, says Got it! 6. Ok! 7. I'll do it! 8. though his actions didn't give off the impression that he felt pressured in the slightest. 9. He used his powers to manipulate the weather, and alter where the water went, as Era, Minos, andGus did what they could elsewhere, they eventually managed to snuff all the tiny flames that had sprouted. 10. Even in death, the tyrannosaur was fearsome looking. 11. Giving an aura of intimidation that few other creatures, even some from the nine hells could manage, because with this beast, it was only hunger, and instinct, and rage, while atleast Demons and Devils had a reason behind their depravity. 12. The sun continues to beat down in the jungle, and you all once again notice you're sweating, but feel cool, between Burgee's air, and the wet rain. 13. Unfortunately that would just make you feel muggy the moment you left the area. 14. Truk and Burgee both begin talking, each over the other as they start making suggestions... Well... what are we gonna do with the big guy here? 15. Anything? 16. Should we proceed to wheever this Gnome was who lured us here? 17. though do we know if it was intentional or not? 18. SHould we go back to camp? 19. I made it fully, so it's ready! 20. What should we do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Black Cat, everyone seems preoccupied enough to not quite notice your presence as you try to slip into the room. 2. But Aldin, the old floor creaks mercilessly beneath your feet before you can make it inside the room. 3. Just as you cross the threshold, you hear a few confused whispers that become raised whispers. 4. "What was that?" 5. Then you hear someone walking toward the room. 6. Make a final Stealth check, Aldin. 7. Jorel, as soon as you put on the goggles, they seem to fit snug and intensify your vision. 8. Making it clearer, and eliminating all shadows present anywhere near. 9. Everything is crystal clear. 10. Weylin, to check the scroll, you can make an Arcana check. 11. Aldin, whoever was interested in the sound, seems to dismiss the idea after quickly viewing the area, and not finding you. 12. You and Black Cat are both safely in the room, which seems to be a small display room for the antique shop--old heirlooms and items and trinkets that seem quite dated. 13. There is a hallway that extends along the side of the small room, at the other end of it, opposite of the entrance you came through. 14. The antique shop didn't look large from the outside, but it is surely full on the inside.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. ROOM 1 -THEFALSE CHANTERELLE Chanterelle leaves the room, promising to take the painting away in 30 days. 2. Not knowing what to expect this is new reality, whereverand whenever it is, you hope to return in a month's time before you are trapped here for all eternity. 3. Goggick is inside the prison room, your senses and perception adjusting to your new reality. 4. Alira is in the prison room, and has adjusted well, ready to open the door to the next room. 5. Jax and Kyah have entered the room as well, ready to experience wonders beyond reality. 6. Joundral also appears, with an interesting idea on how to track where the party has been. 7. Percival reluctantlyenters to room as well, joining the party. 8. Jotumheim is there as well, eager to continue the adventure. 9. Can't say I blame him. 10. With acrobatic flair, Astrid appears from the painting into the room, rolling, and landing on her feet. 11. Impressive! 12. Dundur is probably very happy to see all of you. 13. FOOD: 100 GOLD: 160 DAY: 1 Jax, as you look and feel the walls, you are amazed at how smooth they are, like they have a supernatural quality to them. 14. Sometimes, you look at certain areas of how the walls meet, and you can swear your eyes are playing tricks on you, but..most of them meet at angles you're familiar with, and sometimes..not.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Pike looks at Harpy with a half-smile playing around his lips. 2. "Sure, pick me up some sweetmeats. 3. This should cover it." 4. He flicks her a gold coin. 5. Roll a Dex check. 6. On a 5+ you catch it. 7. Fail and you fumble. 8. Feel free to narrate how you catch it or fumble it. 9. On his way out, Rothanr is stopped by one of the guards. 10. "Boss said to give you guys these. 11. Just in case." 12. He hands you three Potion of Healing . 13. The journey to Hangman's Lane takes about half an hour by foot. 14. The rain has turned much of the roadways into mud, which slows your progress. 15. This area of town in much more run down. 16. Beggars huddle from the rain in most doorways and the buildings are made of wood and many are in need of urgent repairs. 17. The Rusty Nail has three storeys are seems to lean precariously out into the street. 18. The rowdy sounds of music and drunks shouting rings out from inside. 19. It's in better shape than some of the buildings around it but still has a broken window on the ground floor with a bar stool and broken glass lying on theground in front of it in the street. 20. The Pantry is visible a few doors down from the Rusty Nail. 21. It's a small shop with a dirty blue canopy outside it covering an assortment of fruits and vegetables laid out on trays. 22. Katar's Emporium and Aelid's Good and Sundries aren't visible, but you know they're down side streets branching off Hangman's Lane, no more than a two minute walk from where you stand. 23. Where would you like to go?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. the party completes its morning activities (getting dressed, having breakfast, etc) and begins their adventure for the day. 2. Hati is a sneaky one, despite the conditions he knows how to hide even when logic would dictate it is impossible. 3. Using clouds, trees and groups of birds when available, no one looking would notice hati is actually a tiefling adventurer. 4. sadly the extra effort of trying to be stealthy has kept him from keeping an actual good eye out. 5. Plus Hati was thinking of last night, from the battle and what came after. 6. All the more reason he should pay attention. 7. Gimble, leading the party and keeping your eyes peeled for danger, you watch as your two airborne allies sort of make fools of themselves not doing the job they said they would do. 8. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Thank you for the laugh. 2. :) OK, to be fair to everyone else, let's roll a fumble for that first shot: 17 —17-18. 3. Ammo Accident. 4. Your quiver spills (50% strap broken, 50% you tilt it over by accident), and the remainder of your arrows / bolts fall to the floor. 5. If you remain still you can use a bonus action to pick up one a round and still fire using your action. 6. Otherwise you can use an action to pick up 2d8 and put them back in your quiver. 7. OK, so, no exploding bow. 8. Anafrey quickly draws an arrow, being a bitslipshod about it and doesn't realize it. 9. As she's about to loose her arrow, her quiver shifts on her shoulder, throwing off her balance. 10. She fires the arrow, it goes high, and then the sound of her remaining arrows clattering onto the stone floor echoes off the walls of the cavern. 11. A few roll off the ledge/bridge to the floor 20 feet below. 12. Saying a few choice words, she bends down and begins collecting her arrows. 13. Trying not to laugh (and not succeeding too well), Erric picks up where the huntress began and slings a projectile at each chest. 14. The first rock hits the chest at the end of the ledge/bridge, makesno sound ... and sticks to it. 15. The second rock tonk s against the chest below, bouncing off. 16. You don't detect any traps. 17. The only apparent danger is the floor below, and that's only dangerous if you fall. 18. Erric, you wrap one end of a rope around your waist, hand the other end to someone, and begin climbing down. 19. The roughness of the walls provides ample handholds and places to put your toes. 20. You climb down with relative ease. 21. Erric, you walk over to the chest, walk around it, scrutinize it, poke at it with your rapier, and when you finally decide it seems OK, you try to open it ... but it's locked.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The axe flies into the back of the already dead Goblin, sticking firmly as it collapses into the ground. 2. As the goblin lands in an echoing thud against the ground where the snow ceased to be, deeper within, Cirrus heard growls suddenly erupt from within the darkness. 3. It didn't seem to move, and the sound of metal clinking could be heard, as if it were being pulled tightly. 4. Everywhere else, was silent. 5. It seemed that the party had taken care of the advanced scouts/guards in the area. 6. The only noises now being the soft trickle of the stream, and the cautiously returning sound of the crickets to slowly fill the night. 7. The party gains 100 exp (75 for finding the goblin cave, 25 for defeating the goblins.) 8. So far, nothing seems to be coming out of the cave. 9. What is your next move? 10. (you find the other axe. 11. the DC checks, unless otherwise specifies for findign will always be 10, just can't use passive investigation to find a tossed object unles its in an enemy then.. well you already know where it is. 12. lol) (So, all of your ideas sound good, I just need to know what course of action you take.Feel free to keep RPing with eachother until a decision is made, and I will respond to it!)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "Easy big guy, we're changed goblins here! 2. We'll probably just spend our days fixin' up this castle a bit, fishin' in the lake, hunting with the beasty, that sort of thing. 3. Come to think of you, you could stay too and help repair this castle, Mr Fix It." 4. Yeemik is obviously speaking to Ethan. 5. (Nice post Ixi! 6. Inspiration to the wizard, I vote!) 7. I love this because it had occurred to me that Arvel's 'average' Intellect of 10 gets him pretty far. 8. Don't get me wrong, I'd never want to diminish role play by saying "your character isn't smart enough to do or say that", that's silly, of course. 9. I just love the justification here. 10. That and I believe you said awhile back that half of the time he's just making it up, assuming his audience won't know enough to call him on it, which is also a great and amusing justification! 11. :)

Knowing Mimzy's ways you can find her without too much trouble following the path of smiling people she's left in her wake. 7. Boofa, by his side focuses as any immediate dangers. 3. Dor and Jilrana take to the middle and planning to provide light as needed with Elisha following up the rear. 4. The group made their way in keeping track of their direction with a compass. 5. Roughly two hours of travel pass by with little sign of anything important. 6. The sound of a typical forest fills the air, birds, bugs, the rustling of leaves from small animals, the occasional cold tracks of a dear or old scrape marks from on trees from an antler. 7. Then Boofa holds up an a hand to stop everyone. 8. Quietly, everyone comes to a stop and silences over takes you. 9. Then faintly you all hear it as well. 10. The sound of an animal grunt off in the distance. 11. Then a faint squeal, then nothing.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Using the most intact room, the base of the tower, the party set up camp near the magic circle. 2. Onyx sspeaks to the animsla round, getting a very rough idea of the previous day's activities. 3. Raynor gathers and prepare dinner for the night. 4. Gotch mills over the circle over throughout the night as there is not much else in the tower. 5. Lyrant and Resfaen remains on lookout for dangers. 6. Gotch is able todetermine the two symbols after a long rest, the internal circle was a summoning circle for a Elemental and the outer circle was made to bind the elemental tot his plane. 7. It was designed to trigger the summoning as a defense measure. ' 8. Between Lyrant, Resfaen and Onyx keeping a lookout and some words from the wildlife, they can figure out about three different parties had come and gone, all three different directions. 9. One seem to have gone back in direction of town, one to the woodland one to the swamp separately. 10. (Any addition acitivies can be added if wanted) (with two for swampone for woodlands) Taking the trials of the group before them for few feets before losing the track but they had enough of a direction with the winged cat in the air. 11. Jungle gives way to ankle deep swamps, mud and water. 12. Onyx is quick to find the path of the party that came before, look like one of the member is really big guy and just smashed their way through the swamp land. 13. With more open sky, cat is sent ahead and around as everyone slowly makes their way through the swamp, slowed down by the mud underneath.Sebastian flies into what seems like a wall in the air but there's nothing solid before flying back to the party, indicating what it found as wellas it could. 14. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Kryinor launches a glowing stone with his sling, it whipcracks and hisses through the air striking the Thug onthe back of his head. 2. He yells out in anger, stops running for Eedim and dives into the bushes. 3. "So you've go friends 'ave ya. 4. Well they can come die too!" 5. Kargan hits the bandit charging a hastily reloading Eedim, and with a good swing of his battleaxe drives the bolt and axe head deep into his bowels. 6. The force of the dwarfs blow stooping him dead in his tracks. 7. His lifeless body slumps to the ground. 8. Titus's arrow follows the bandit into the bushes and a howl of pain and anger is his reward. 9. For a moment he disappears. 10. Then Kryinor sees the thug moving carefully through the undergrowth towards the cave trying to escape and warn his comrades. 11. The sling cracks again, the magic stone flies into a bush and there is a loud thud and a crash of branches as the ruffian slumps unconscious to the ground. 12. Titus, and Eedim keep watch on the area bow and cross bow at the ready, as Kargan moves quickly through the brush to the still form on the leaves. 13. Only seconds have passed but the violence has given way to the quiets sounds of the forest gain.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The carriage continues to move forward across the ground, which seems a bit less treacherous than before, smoother and not as many rocks to bounce over. 2. Fargoth, you indeed see as you look out the back that the rain has stopped and the road behind you is dotted with deciduous trees here and there speckled with the colors of Autumn. 3. Your queries to the front of the cart go unanswered and the cart keeps right on moving. 4. Doc, you are not sure what befell Kindra, but she does not appear to be harmed. 5. As a matter of fact she, along with Roland just seem to be asleep. 6. With a quick shake, they both come to their senses, groggy, but otherwise unharmed. 7. Baymen, your intuition about magic seems almost beyond intuiting at this point. 8. Something very strange and clearly magical has happened. 9. As your comrades stir, you feel the carriage gaining speed... Kindra, as Ashlar peeks out and looks around it becomes apparent that you covered a great distance in the time that you were traveling. 10. As the bird circles around the front of the cart, what you immediately realize is not the health of your gnomish companion. 11. It is the fact that she, and her team of mules, are gone. 12. The carriage is speeding without pilot down a long, sloping hill toward a grove of trees. 13. Baymen, it was not an attack per se...in that there appears to have been no use of weapons, hostile spells, etc. 14. However, something has been done to your vessel and you can only assume that what was done was magical in nature, but there are no clear markers as to what spell, or potentially spells, were used to create the current dilemma. 15. Roland, that IS the question...isn't it? 16. As the carriage continues to move it gathers speed and you feel it jostle this way and that on the road. 17. As of right now, only Kindra and her companion know that your vehicle has no driver.

The two thugs advance, one hitting Oni in the midsection with his mace, shattering the tiefling's ribs and dropping him into unconsciousness, while the second fires off a crossbow bolt at Jill. 6. Attack: 5 Damage: 3 The archer proceeds to draw a shortsword and counter Kelric's attack. 7. Attack: 11 Damage: 5 Attack: 14 Damage: 4 Misha! 8. Natasha's arrow buries itself in the thug's stomach, and Grum follows it up with two savage hacks of his shortswords. 9. The wererat ducks and weaves, cleverly evading Misha and Jill's attacks. 10. He retaliates with a low swing of his jagged shortsword at Jill and a bite at Misha. 11. JillAttack: 12 Damage: 5 MishaAttack: 23 Damage: 4 (On a hit make a DC 11 Constitution Save to avoid wererat lycanthropy) The wounded thug swings his mace at Grum while the second fires off a crossbow bolt at Natasha. 12. Grum Attack: 20 Damage: 4 Natasha Attack: 5 Damage: 3 On the rooftops a wild chase begins as the archer makes her escape. 13. Kelric, if you attempt to follow her first make an Acrobatics or Athletics check. 14. The archer hurdles the ten foot gap between the building you are currently on and an adjacent one, but Kelric will not he so easily deterred. 15. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The rage within Torq sustains his paralyzed body through the pain but you watch as feathers from his right wing are disintegrated and the exposed flesh in that area turn blistered and grey. 2. A still steaming Mucor cries out in anger and pain as he tosses his shield to the ground and slams down his staff. 3. As Aryn shrugs off the damage and spells she feels the earth beneath her tremble violently. 4. Torq immediately collapses to the ground in a heap unable to move. 5. All but the NW werewolf by Aryn are knocked to the floor by the violent shaking. 6. Aryn finishes off the NW werewolf first with a thrust through the jaw that pierces through the back of the skull. 7. She turns and begins to methodically slash and stab at each of the werewolves who bleed from the lacerations but begin scrambling to their feet. 8. The ground continues to shake within the cavern and dirt and stone fall from the ceiling as a large fissure opens up in the floor to the west that swallows the southernmost table into the 100 foot deep chasm. 9. ( 10 X10 ) Two of the caster wolves fall prone to the ground and Torq feels his body loosen and manages to right himself. 10. The huge black werewolf remains upright growling loudly. 11. Jinara walks forward beside of Mucor andmutters something in draconic before casting Fire Storm . 12. A similar long pillar of flames shoot up from teh ground and instantly incinerate the two werewolves south of Aryn. 13. The three casterwolves to the east and huge black werewolf stand with patches of their hair smoking. 14. Gaelin ! 15. ( Torq - you are no longer paralyzed. 16. Casterwolf lost concentration but you still lose your turn for the current round but I at least gave you half movement to stand up. 17. :) ) Map:

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ramal, Eider, and Grianne each gain 600 exlerience and 200 gold coins. 2. Nykkan, Calgin, and Shmitty wake in the Doc's office having gained 400 experience and 80 gold. 3. Ramal, Eider, and Grianne move through a tunnel surrounded by the excited crowd, reaching and shouting as they pass. 4. Basil shows you down to the prize room. 5. Inside... 6. Tier 1: "Take any one item. 7. We're well equipped." 8. The room contains every item from Chapter 5 of the Player's Handbook weighing 70 pounds or less, armor of varying sizes, instruments, tool kits. 9. There are also spell scrolls, every first level spell is present (as well as spell scrolls of a level for which a magic user of the characters new level would have slots for), and an encyclopedia of knowledge. 10. Reading these books will grant you proficiency with any one of tool kit or any one language, depending which book you choose. 11. The books are magically infused to allow easy retention, but the magic is lost once used. 12. Upper Tier: The victor may choose an item from a magically infused chest that summons 10 randomly selected magic items to choose from (rarity determined by level). 13. Alternatively they may exchange a magic item for another item of their choosing of the same rarity or lower, if the administrator has the requested item in his extensive collection. 14. "You name it, we've probably got one somewhere." 15. Ramal'sChest: Ammunition +1(20 crossbow bolts), Potion of Healing (Greater), Spell Scroll (Rope Trick), Rod of the Pact Keeper +1, Bag of Holding, Potion of Healing (Greater), Rod of the Pact Keeper +1, Wand of Magic Missiles, Boots of Elvenkind, Light Hammer +1 Eider's Chest: Spell Scroll (Locate Object), Javelin +1, Goggles of Night, Broom of Flying, Spell Scroll (Protection from Energy), Hat of Disguise, Deck of Illusions (30 cards), Pearl of Power, Potion of Healing (Greater), Ammunition +1 (20 crossbow bolts) Grianne's Chest:

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. While Delirious collects ingredients for kobold hot dogs... 2. The lady answers, "Thank you, Lyria. 3. I am Linan Swift, and that's my husband Cuth and our children." 4. Your medical check results: Linan is unhurt, Cuth is hurt badly, Lyria has taken 3 damage. 5. Linan says to Place', "We have to getto the keep, it’s the only safe place left in Greenest. 6. They are driving people out of their homes and taking everything but the keep is untouched so far. 7. Even if they do attack it, if we get inside beforehand it's defensible." 8. Looking down the street, you see several groups consisting of kobolds, black-robed figures, giant lizards, and small drakes between yourselves and the keep. 9. Place' and Lyria: Ilmater is the god of endurance, martyrdom, perseverance, and suffering. 10. He's the god of those who suffer, the oppressed, and the persecuted, who offered them relief and support, encouraged them to endure, and who encouraged others to help them, to take their burdens or take their places. 11. He was called the Crying God , the Broken God , the Lord on the Rack , and the One Who Endures. 12. Followers of his church try to embody kind-heartedness, generosity and are often healers who attempt to end the suffering of others, either physically or spiritually. 13. "Thank you so much!" 14. She hurriedly rushes it to him and makes him drink it. 15. He heals 9 and stands up, his leg having mended enough to walk without hindrance.Cuth picks up two of the small children and Linan picks up one, keeping her shield out but stowing her spear. 16. (A good call, his limping and no one carrying the children would have slowed you down. 17. Keep in mind you all haveone inspiration to use as well, which will give you advantage on any attack, save or check. 18. You can even decide to use it after you see your roll.) 19. "Yes, we'll stick with you, but if you don't mind we're going to hang back from any further fighting."
