Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Once done putting on the ill-fitting women's clothes Sim offered him, Renaer sees Adrasteia running around and looking into the boxes and says: "M'lady, I'm afraid these boxes have nothing but low workmanship weapons and armor, the kind the Zhentarim use to arm their initiate mercenaries if I had to guess. 2. I meant that it would probably be in our interest to investigate upstairs, once your friend is done snooping around." 3. He points to Mokiakia on the other side of the staircase, who is getting ready to open the secret sliding door. 4. Sim and Adrasteia also notice Mokiakia 's intention, and find strategic locations to wait for whatever is inside. 5. Mokiakia opens the door and you can allhear the faint sound of a bell ringing in thechambersupstairs, but no further reaction for now. 6. The room beyond the sliding door is no larger than the closet Renaer was hiding in up until a moment ago. 7. It looks like the Zhentarim have stashed two open wooden crates here. 8. The first, stolen from the docks judging by the markings on it, contains four wood-framed paintings wrapped in leather.The second crate contains fifteen 10-pound silver trade bars, all black from corrosion. 9. LORE BOX (KENKU: ADVENTURERS) Kenku adventurers are usually the survivors of a flock that has sustained heavy losses, or a rare kenku who has grown weary of a life of crime. 10. These kenku are more ambitious and daring than their fellows. 11. Others strike out on their own in search of the secrets of flight, to master magic, or to uncover the secret of their curse and find a method tobreak it. 12. Kenku adventurers, despite their relative independence, still have a tendency to seek out a companion to emulate and follow. 13. A kenku loves to mimic the voice and words of its chosencompanion. 14. A kenku adventurer's constant attempts to mimic noises can come across as confusing or irritating rather than entertaining. 15. A well known kenku adventurer named Snapper, for example, would constantly imitate the noise of a hammer slowly and rhythmically tapping a stone to show how bored he is, and to the annoyance of his companions.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Just to let you guys know what's going on: (Chandra I assume you can see all this from a safe vantage point, the guards checked your room and missed you) Gairlick and Ixalin you're standing near the bottom of the gangplank with a crowd of sailors. 2. The Captain of the ship is arguing with one of the guards. 3. The other 2 guards are finishing up their search of the ship. 4. You can see that other guards are searching other ships, and then moving along down the line, nobody is being allowed to leave the port area without being checked over by some other guards. 5. You hadn't seen Ashlee since he went to look for Tonk in the crowd. 6. The guards walked right by Gairlick once or twice and paid him no mind. 7. *You hadn't seen him since he went to go get Tonk, but you did see him just now in the cart. 8. I'd say yeah, you are within 120ft. 9. And from what you can tell, Ashlee didn't stand out particularly from any other half-elf on the docks. 10. Ixalin - You hear a whisper in your mind " Ixalin! 11. Is that you? 12. It seems I missed some of the blood I had gotten on me. 13. Someone on the pier pointed me out to the guards, and now they're taking me in for questioning. 14. Tonk's here too. 15. They have some kind of list of people they're trying to round up, I couldn't get a look at it."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Shadrach exits the pit and, outfitted with their new trinkets, begins down the caverns of the Undermountain. 2. Aria is in the lead, Crush not far behind her. 3. Getting away from the wreckage, there is a fairly clear trench in the ground where the kobolds were moving the bomb. 4. Everything is quiet, even for the Underdark. 5. Maybe the explosion scared the life away. 6. (Anything anyone wants to do/check for before I continue?) 7. Stealth and perception checks from Aria, please. 8. Aria is completely hidden. 9. She approaches slowly, making her way through a narrow stretch of the cavern that opens up into a larger area. 10. There, she sees the remnants of a camp that has been recently abandoned. 11. There are a few embers still glowing from the small campfire, freshly discarded bones of ... something that someone ate. 12. She can hear the voices of the former occupants of the campsite echoing as they move down the hallway: V1: "Who [inaudible] like tonight?" 13. V2: "Man, I dunno- I heard Grunt[inaudible] fight [inaudible]." 14. V1: "GRUNT. 15. MAN. 16. You're outta [inaudible]on that fool." 17. V2: "[inaudible] mess with that man when [inaudible] heard Cyril [inaudible]." 18. V1: "Whatever. 19. Hey, you [inaudible] password?" 20. V2: "Yeah, yeah." 21. I should also add that it's been a few hours at least, and besides a few encounters with some harmless rats that kept their distance from the party, this is the first real sign of life they've seen. 22. The time it would take Aria to sneak up into the campsite and then back to tell the party to move up would be about 10 minutes. 23. Just long enough for people to start to worry.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (oh boy) Arlo, you begin to carefully traversing the switchback. 2. You take a step expecting it to be about the same as the last lichen, but find that it is a bit more slick. 3. Your foot slides out to the side. 4. Your sudden jerk to catch yourself throws Catherine off as she attempts to establish a higher anchor point by climbing to the next section of stairs. 5. Unfortunately the stairs you grab onto, Catherine, are also covered in lichen, not setting you up for a great climb to begin with. 6. Happy, as you start to move, you notice Catherine slipping. 7. Attempting to adjust your feet to aid in bracing her, you momentarily forget the size of the stairs and take a misstep. 8. You begin to lose your balance. 9. Sieghart and Lucas notice the devolving situation and aide in preventing Happy and Catherine from falling. 10. Lucas attempts to shove Happy against the wall. 11. If Sieghart likes, he could probably take the flat side of a sword, or his longbow and push Catherine against the cliff as well. 12. Unfortunately, Arlo, you are to far away to be helped by those that can. 13. Dex saves needed from Arlo (straight), Catherine (advantage), and Happy (advantage).

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. End of Round 4 : Rand steps into the room, and seeing only two more zombies, attacks the first one cowering in the corner. 2. His solid hit damages it, but releases the now familiar puff of ash and dust. 3. (Make a DC10 Con Save) The yellow zombie strikes back at the paladin!Attack: 20 Damage: 7 The other one in the nice armor stays in the corner. 4. Round 5 : Salty Joe nails the yellowish zombie with his crossbow, potentially dropping it! 5. (DC14 Con save: 12 ) Penumbra follows the other two in and (either kills the yellow on once and for all) or (makes two quick cuts on the last remaining zombie, releasing the ash cloud that gets in her face. 6. (Make a DC10 Con Save) ) Bankur and Rand up! 7. (Got it. 8. Will route you through the buildings at 2, then building 3, then 1, then the tower 7.) 9. After Bankur's blessings, the bodies remain dead - and outside! 10. The night passes fairly peacefully - except for an awful sound heard shortly before dawn passing overhead and towards the keep on the hill. 11. It sounded like a sheep having its guts ripped out...if it really is a dragon up there, then it might very well have been exactly that... 12. So the next morning you skirt the hill and decide to clear the last few buildings before checking out that structure. 13. Walking westwards, you come upon a couple of ruined, side-by-side cottages that look as though they might have been the homes of prosperous shopkeepers or well-off farmers in their time. 14. Wind and weather have done their work here, though. 15. All that remains are collapsed walls and piles of debris. 16. Several young trees and vines have grown up in the midst of the ruins.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Quill and Demoiselle: You force your way forward as quickly as possible. 2. When you finally reach the steps to Sir Gable's mansion, the beautiful woman is gone. 3. You search the nearby crowd for the beloved face of your spiritual leader and your friends. 4. Make a perception check (14 or higher succeeds). 5. Korlan: The woman puts down her quill and takes your hand warmly. 6. "Welcome to Lichfield, Brother Korlan," she greets you with a genuine smile. 7. "This is the rectory where you and the other novices will find your beds if you follow that hall." 8. She points toward the southeast corner of the room, to her right. 9. "Here you will find a warm meal at noon and any time between sixth and seventh bells. 10. The food and water are free, of course, in thanks to the service that you provide to the basilica, but stronger drink will cost you a silver." 11. She points out the High Lord's chamber doors in the east wall and tells you that Dawnlord Menges has temporarily taken them over. 12. Her pursed lips show clearly how she feels about that. 13. Until recently, Menges had a room just at the end of the novice quarters. 14. On the positive side, now that he's no longer using that room, the novices are allowed to pass through there to use the bathing facilities. 15. She asks if you will be working "hospitality" tomorrow with her as your daily task, because, "For a man who cares so much about his appearance, Lord Menges certainly leaves his room a disgrace." 16. Esvaris just barely misses the catch and fumbles the quarterstaff for a moment, but the dwarf girl only gets one quick hit in before he recovers and is ready to make his next move.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The halfling surprised to find a customer this late, and a little overwhelmed, tells her that it'll be 5 copper for that big ol' turnip, adding once he gets his bearings about him, " Floon the loon? 2. Can't say I know anything about him, but uh, if you're headed down that way I'd be careful if I were you. 3. Gang activity sure is rife these days, I tell ya." 4. He'll take the payment and continue on his way. 5. Thetransition from the pleasant neighborhoods of the Castle Ward into the Dock Ward, the difference becomes apparent quickly enough. 6. Street lamps have been shattered the candles stolen, leaving most streets dark, and the densely packed buildings leave little room for moonlight to break through. 7. A cold sea breeze fills the air smelling of salt water and excrement. 8. As Snail street curves away from Fish Street , there's a flurry of activity and light as people with lanterns and light spells are gathered. 9. The entrance to Shrimp Alley is blocked and roped off and several uniformed officers of the Watch move about their duties. 10. Siobhan , you know well that this is a crime scene, and you can see several unmoving figures on the ground, as can Roger . 11. Dolar you notice that the Watch have three people covered in blood in manacles and a dwarf with a notepad and a light spell on her pen as she scribbles away. 12. A pair of sergeants questions a pair of gnomes, and a group of constables keeps the onlookers at bay. 13. As Dolar gets close to the scene a constable steps forward, blocking his path. 14. "Sir, please move along. 15. This is a crime scene."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ignoring his bumps and bruises well, Kestrell shakes the mud from his clothing and body. 2. As the injured sorcerer summons his spectral hand and sends it across the lagoon, he is dismayed to see his conjuration vanish some distance from the far bank. 3. Casting the spell and making the attempt again, the puzzled half-elf's efforts are met with similarly dissapointing results. 4. Still facing the far bank, Kestrell notices the top of something smooth and green begin to emerge from the water close to the nearby bank, as a five and a half foot tall frog like huminoid covered in pond slime and crude clothing formed from still living lilly pads and flowers pulls itself from the lagoon to stand ten feet from the wary sorcerer. 5. At its vine belt, the yellow-eyed creature wears a primitive stone knife, while in its left webbed hand it clutches a dripping net of natural fibres. 6. Facing each other in a brief momentary stand-off, the perceptive half-elfs sharp hearing detects a melodic *hehehehehe* sound of light twittering laughter from the trees and brush behind him.' 7. [OOC] All PCs see Kestrell sail across the lagoon and crash into the far bank. 8. All PCs see the strange frog like creature emerge from the lagoon to stand five feet from Kestrell on the far bank, about fifty feet away from all of you (except Cinder 30 feet and Alwin 40 feet to the creature).

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gerrard is able to fetch a functional light crossbow from the ship, together with an ugly set of leather armor, which Oceanus was requesting. 2. The pirates' bodies have been removed, but their gear sits in a heap on the deck. 3. Winston hadn't forgotten about the request for a sitting with a local portrait painter. 4. During the downtime, Gerrardsatfor four hours for an old woman who livesin the back of a squalid tenement on the water, across from the Mariners' Guildhall. 5. It costs him 2 gold. 6. Miniature portraitpainting check:7 It's aquestionable likeness, and the colors are a bit bright and gaudy, but it fits in the locket and is a passing representation. 7. Gerrard and Peri will return to the ship and check the bilge. 8. (I'll set that up shortly.) 9. Oceanus will come along also. 10. Dwal, however, is holing up. 11. Qivys also? 12. There's plenty of work to be had for a teenaged sailor at the docks. 13. The Owland family runs a reputable fishing fleet. 14. Eda Owland, whom some of you met at the last Council meeting, is gruff and crusty, butshe and her familyare known for taking in fishermen who have fallen on hard times. 15. Dwal's new companion can understand Draconic and Common, but cannot express language (only telepathic images.) 16. If the lizardfolk had a name for it, that knowledge is lost for now. 17. It is healing quickly from its wound. 18. Dwal'slittle dragonoid seems indifferent to names in general, but will respond to "Bjorn" as well as any,when addressed.The winged creatureenjoys hunting and feasting upon both crabs and bats, both of which are plentiful at Crabbers Cove. 19. It has fully bonded with Dwal. 20. One very useful trait is its ability to stealthily transmit images and ideas to Dwal telepathically from above, even in complete darkness - a very effective scout.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Kuo Toa begin to cheer in agreement at Thodek’s words and begin to raise their spear, chanting. 2. However, another sound begins to rise above the burbling cries of the kuo-toa. 3. The dark surface of the water about 500 feet away starts to bubble and begins to foam. 4. A thick, oily tentacle bursts forth, followed by another. 5. Then two monstrous heads break the surface, both resembling hideous, angry baboons with wickedly curved tusks. 6. Both heads are attached to a single torso, and the monster’s red eyes burn with bloodlust and madness. 7. The creature rising from the Darklake must stand thirty feet tall or more, with water cascading down its back and shoulders. 8. Upon reaching its full height, the great demon throws back both its heads and roars! 9. The Demogorgon is in the Darklake! 10. All the Kuo Toa around you begin to fall into some sort of a trance, standing deathly still, eerily chanting “Leemooggoogoon! 11. Leemooggoogoon!” Ploopploopeen stands, his mouth gaping hanging open. 12. “Wh... what is this? 13. Run!” he yells “to the boats!” But it is to no avail. 14. All except Glooglugogg stand rigidly incapacitated. 15. Everyone please make a DC 13 Charisma Saving Throw to avoid a bout of short term madness at the sight of the demon prince. 16. Other than that, what would you like to do? 17. Syvis (3)Nicholas (98) Both of you begin to feel a creeping sensation at the back of your neck. 18. Syvis, you find yourself overcome by fear, and are unable to move— paralyzed in fear. 19. Nicholas, oddly, you begin to feel an overpowering urge to eat something. 20. You look down at the severed head of Bloppblippodd, and know that you must consume it! 21. NPC Saves (Cailean:7) (Rian:17) (Derendil:4) (Jimjar:16) Madness (Cailean:93) (Rian: 92) (Derendil:26) Both Rian and Derendil stand rigidly still like the Kuo Toa, stunned at the sight of this demonic entity. 22. Cailean the wolf begins to whine before dashing back towards Sloobludop, obviously frightened. 23. Jimjar begins to dash after the fleeing wolf. 24. “Go, grab a boat! 25. I’ll get Cailean, and find the others. 26. Meet me at the docks near the safe house.” He yells before disappearing into the narrow alleyways of Sloobludop. 27. This bout of madness will last for5 minutes. 28. What would everyone like to do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Nodding along to everything that's said he replies "Yes, that's been our experience as well. 2. They show signs of disease but it's nothing we're familiar with. 3. We've also not been able to link it to any known magics. 4. It's very troubling and it seems it's spreading, or at least more widespread than we thought. 5. This does not bode well for your travels. 6. You'll have to be very careful!" 7. He starts making himself more comfortable. 8. "I think it's best that I stay here with you tonight but I must report back to my people in the morning. 9. I hope your teachers are still in Wayport. 10. I know they travel in by ship when they come to visit you, so maybe they are still there. 11. I would like to know what they think of all this"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gia seems to have sobered up just a little, your dance has had him occupied sense the last big swig, nearly 40 minutes ago. 2. Your escapade went on longer than you thought (although there seems to be no complaints since almost everyone still has there attention directed towards you) . 3. You on the other hand are one sip away from being hammered, smashed, or in other terms, totally wasted *lol*. 4. (Perk){Adverse Drinker} - Your insatiable desire and capability to drink makes you less intoxicated. 5. *Character Trait* Your knowledge of alcoholic beverages is vast. 6. However, your character notices something she has never experienced with this tonic. 7. It intensifies even after consumption, it evens out and distributes the alcohol evenly over a longer period of time. 8. Your words to the bard are understandable to say the least and he guides you toward the back of the tavern. 9. The crowd starts dissipating back to there usual besides a group or two that stand in front of the stage.They still talk loudly( mostly of your performance) and sipp on there drinks. 10. The bard stands 2 or 3 feet in front of what would seem like the back door, he motions his hands up a flight of steps for you and Gia to ascend. 11. At the end of the stairs is a very short hallway where, from the bottom, you can see a door to what you guess is a room. 12. The bard holds his hand out waiting for accommodations. 13. Gia reaches past you gently brushing your hip in an attempt to stimulate your senses as he puts 20 silver pieces in the bards hand. 14. Gia grabs you suprisingly and lifts you onto his rock hard body. 15. (The bard has slipped away, back into the bar area) Your too drunk to resist his uncontrollable lust for you and let him lift you into his arms where he kisses you intensely, biting your lip and rubbing his massive, hard. 16. . . Sausage XD against your already wet taco. 17. Gia whispers in your ear "now i have a challenge for you. 18. . . 19. Lets see how long you can last before completely giving in to your natural instincts" he then bites your neck, just hard enough for it to feel insatiable before continuing to kiss you vigorously and passionately.

Now with Trex standing next to you, you see that hecarries a threadbare satchel and wears a fake pair of dragon wings made of thin wood and tattered white cloth. 2. „I do not know what warrants this hostility dwarf but I let you know, they are not meant to fly, but a symbol of my leadership.“ With this he starts to completely ignore Gilgin. 3. Towards the rest of your group he replies: „You were asking if we have furs to travel outside and yes we do, but the last year has taught us to only travel during twilight hours. 4. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The armored man pulls his sword and you all feel something deep down. 2. Something that terrifies you. 3. As you'd look to the man, his form would shift. 4. Gasp, you start to see the same man who cuffed you with this ruby. 5. And he is disappointed to see you again. 6. He raises his blade, "Once a thief, always a thief." 7. Hatt, you see your father. 8. But he looked bloody and beaten, his face a mess of tears and bruises, "You...you just left us! 9. Now look what you did! 10. Your mother and your sister, dead! 11. And who knows how many more...You could've stayed and help me protect them!" 12. Ashley, you see a soldier. 13. He's bleeding out and is clutching his wound, but he furiously looks to you, "You could have saved me, all you had to do was kill the enemy! 14. This is war, and we don't need pacifists in it to let us die in front of them! 15. I don't give a shit about your ideals, your ideals costed my life." 16. Aurelia, you see a Triton, a woman paladin like yourself. 17. She reminds you of your mother, as your grandmother would talk of her, "She was a beacon of hope. 18. Ready to defend any who would need her and willing to strike down the evil. 19. She's probably even better than me!" 20. As what your grandmother would say of her, as this Triton pointed her sword at you. 21. Crispy, you see your father, drunken with bottle still in hand, "You know, always thought you couldn't do anything right. 22. You can't even kill me right! 23. I'm just some beat ass drunk and you couldn't kill me! 24. But I'm sure you remember what I can do." 25. Bennett, you see your captain, dirtied and grinning, "Do you think you can just walk away from this life? 26. What, did you think you were better than us just because you felt bad? 27. You followed orders too, don't think they don't know that? 28. Now come on, you know what happen to deserters." 29. (Everyone except Karra makes a Wisdom saving throw, feel free to describe how you respond to it. 30. No one except yourselves can hear them.) 31. (Ah my bad, was looking for the save throw thing below the chart. 32. And Crispy you have to roll for wisdom saving throw.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Nate, you are able to approach to within thirty feet of the troll and drakes; the area of effect of your spell is perhaps forty feet back through the forest. 2. None of the enemies notice you; they are focused on the rest of the party, or so it seems. 3. A drake bursts from the trees running straight for Jalt. 4. Readied attacks from both Nub and Soar trigger, and both the javelin and the cold magic slam into it.Two more drakes race towards Soar and Nub, ready to attack on their next turn.Nub and Jalt are up.The three drakes are clearly visible; you do not see the troll though you know there is something big approaching. 5. Drake 3 DEX save:5Troll DEX save:17Soar. 6. you see a blast of ice come from the trees and shatter against the two enemies you face; you recognise this as a favoured attack from Nate, though you do not see the druid yet.Drake 1 attacks Jalt:Attack: 9 Damage: 7The teeth closes on part of your armour around the hand, and the teeth leave a small dent that will need repair, but the bite does not penetrate.Drake 2 attacks Nub:Attack: 18 Damage: 7Nub, the creature bites into an exposed arm, drawing blood.Drake 3 attacks Soar, and seems to draw confidence from the troll nearby and attacks with advantage:Attack: 9 Damage: 4Confidence is not the same as skill; you push the creature back effortlessly with your shield. 7. First attack hits the troll, and you feel the effects of Jalt's Bless guiding your hand. 8. The sword digs deep and draws greenish blood. 9. Soar's second attack misses, glancing off the troll's thick hide. 10. RoundFourNateDrake 3Nub and JaltTrollSoarNate is up.

"We do have something comparable though," he replies going to a barrel behind the bar and pulling a tap to fill a tankard. 3. Blitz as you leave the bar and go to the barrier you can not not seem to find the origin points of the spell but you are certain it's an illusion. 4. Odd but it makes sense that it's not too obvious to find. 5. Hykie sees your curiosity as he puts the tankard on the bar of what he calls Stoneheart stout. 6. "You'll never find it," the gnome chuckles delighted. 7. "But here," he says snapping his fingers and the sounds of voices hit you all at once as if the illusion's volume was turned up to normal before he snaps his finger and turns it off again. 8. The sound of just the fire, just the snoring dog comes back the voices muted one more. 9. "The illusions my mother's magic but it helps me to control the volume when I'm reading," he explains moving back to his book. 10. Zeek do you leave the inn behind Kriz? 11. Kriz you leave to find Gareth and he's waiting outside The Willows like you told him too. 12. He looks totally astonished you came back and relieved he will be joining you. 13. He also mentions he's VERY hungry and if dinner is soon he'll be happier still. 14. Do you go back to the Hearty Haversack?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "Oh, I think I could buy at most... 50 coins! 2. Why? 3. How many do you have?" 4. Muireach sees two options. 5. He could potentially butt into the bird bard's bit and steal their spot, maybe get them involved. 6. Or... 7. There is a statue in the center of the martketplace. 8. Merrick knows this to be a statue dedicated to Shepherd's Crossing's namesake, Mariona Shepherd. 9. To Muireach it might seem more like a statue of a random, knightly woman. 10. It's carved from stone and is uniformly gray. 11. The statue's base, also stone, has a few open corners to it... you could stand on each side? 12. As Muireach and Merrick play their songs, a crowd starts to form around them. 13. Soon, other bards are providing the two adventurers with back-up acoustics, drumming, or just dancing to the song. 14. The square seems to be turning into a regular party! 15. "Erm, quite," Ivsaar nods. 16. He pulls out a small chest and counts out the gold in stacks of 20 until he has 300 gold coins on his desk. 17. "There you are." 18. Once you have counted and split up your coins, Ivsaar will escort you back to the front of the building. 19. He smiles. 20. "Please let me know if you find any other sacred shrines or any other artifacts. 21. Or if you'd like to embark on an expedition! 22. Thank you kindly, good sirs."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Shepherd looks up, as he snacks on some foul smelling bird meat. 2. ”Lady Orta is a witch. 3. My Father’s Father may have domesticated her, but I do not trust her.” He spits on the ground after speaking her name. 4. In the same manor that she spoke about him. 5. “Always a bad deal. 6. A unspoken price.” Sim, you definitely feel that he’s telling the truth. 7. He has a soft spot for the tribe you’re on the way to. 8. And a deep mistrust of Lady Orta. 9. “Never met her sister, but I do not trust the blood line of witches.” He wipes a few bits of food off of his face. 10. “And I’ve never been to the temple,” he says as he looks out to where you believe the temple to be. 11. “Too high up. 12. Not good for my flock.” He takes a few more bites in silence, before the bird caws. 13. “Yes, but Yeth is dead.” Another caw. 14. “There are stories of a man who came and brought joy. 15. And joy turned to sorrow. 16. And sorrow turned to suffering. 17. My grandfather, Yeth, and the first Hn’tistopped the suffering. 18. Or so the stories go.” He keeps a long pause, thinking it over. 19. “But, I do not know the stories well. 20. And all stories are more fiction than fact.” He begins to lick his fingers, before wiping them on his robes. 21. “The Hn’ti are wary of outsiders. 22. And very, very few speak our tongue.” He stands, looking over at his goats. 23. “I don’t know if they’ve ever been up there. 24. Maybe. 25. But I spent my time being with them, not asking about who they were.”

Amasu's shot is not powerful enough and is only a glancing shot on the figure's should armor. 6. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. ( Short version: I'll wait until Wed. for the next encounter. 2. You have some time to discuss the swamp fight, do some role-playing, figure out who gets the magic items, and discuss plans for the group's future. 3. Everyone is 2nd level. 4. Use the fixed HP option (do not roll). 5. Give yourself 300 XP. 6. Give yourself 10 GP , which is your share of the jewelry that was found inside the dire wolf.) 7. ( Long version: ) The caravan moves as quickly as possible to get out of the swamp. 8. The troubles are less, but the threat of evil is still out there. 9. Jupiter has moved to a different wagon group. 10. Besides being a monk, he is a gifted wood-worker. 11. He has a chance to learn from the craftspeople in a different part of the caravan. 12. He was happy to fight with your group, and hopes to see you again in the future. 13. At the end of the 4th day of travel, the caravan stops at a large village. 14. It will stay there on the 5th day, for wagon repairs and more trading. 15. During that fifth day, the scouts want to repay you for what you did in the swamp. 16. They help you train your skills and learn spells (ie. 17. advance to 2nd level). 18. The scout leader also draws a map in the dirt. 19. (There are better maps than what he drew.) 20. The caravan assembled near Argali Lake. 21. The "X" is the village you stayed during the 2nd night. 22. The wagons skirted the west edge of Silvanus Swamp. 23. The village you are in right now is "Y". 24. The plan is to head north, winding around to visit small villages, until you reach Primus Road. 25. Then you'll stay on that road (with a few detours for stops at other villages), ending at Nunkreet.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. During the remainder of the day, Khoraj sees no sign of any intelligent creatures. 2. Birds, rabbits, deer, and rodents are seen, but, no trace of any two-legged creatures. 3. Budeim and Tin made the call to stop for camp about a half hour or so before the overturned wagon would be spotted. 4. Max's familiar, now a hawk, does spot the wagon. 5. It appears to be an overturned wagon, similar to the one used by the party, rather than a carriage. 6. The wagon is turned partially on its side in a ditch on the side of the road. 7. Someone has piled a mound of dirt on the side of it, with a crude banner flying over the wagon/dirt pile. 8. There are two rectangular holes cut in the bottom of the wagon. 9. But, the hawk is unable to see any sign of life. 10. While the rest of the party sets up camp, Khorag, Quiller and Max depart to check out the wagon. 11. (Could the three of you make stealth roles). 12. OOC Please describe how the camp is being set up. 13. We'll use this as a standard set-up from here on out. 14. While the other party members are setting up camp, Quiller, Moshet, and Khoraj moved down the road, using the bushes for cover adjacent to the road. 15. Rounding a bend in the road, they could see the wagon, appearing to lean against a large pile of dirt. 16. A makeshift flag hangs over the construction, with the flag consisting of blood dripping from a green fist. 17. As they move closer for a better look, Moshet steps on a dry branch creating a loud crack that seems unnaturally loud in the quiet of the early evening. 18. The wagon is located neara drainage flowing down from the mountains, with a small hill present in the direction the party is approaching from. 19. There is no sign of any life around this makeshift construction. 20. A small ditch partially encompasses the mound of dirt and wagon. 21. It is possible the individuals who constructed it were planning on it functioning as a moat, although from the smell, it appears to be functioning as a makeshift latrene.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "Please do not try to mislead me," the telepathic voice seems angrier now, and the eyestalks of the creature begin to glow, each a separate color. " 2. The mine has been operating at peak capacity for hundreds of years. 3. My duty is of defense here, at the Forge of Spells. 4. I cannot accompany you elsewhere." 5. The creature spins to stare at Thulgrim. 6. "The magic of the brazier will not wane under my watch," it speaks into your minds. 7. "I have many abilities, but not those that you claim," the floating creature answers Finna . 8. "I doubt not that you believe what you speak, but I assure you it is not true. 9. My duty has not waned, and the mine is operating quite efficiently. 10. What you have seen must be unfinished tunnels, of which there are plenty." 11. The creature's again rests its gaze upon Thulgrim , but this time, its large eye glows a fierce red color to join the array of glowing eyestalks. 12. "I would not lie to me any more if I were you. 13. You are keeping me from my duty. 14. Please move along," its voice resounds telepathically. 15. The flames inside of the brazier do not seem particularly spectacular, but as Thulgrim passes his axe over them, they lick hungrily at the blade, wrapping around the metal for a brief moment before dissipating once the weapon leaves their reach.

You all merely wish to be of some help? 7. I am loathed to put more into harm's way, but there may be something you can do..." (Thordain, I am going to -gasp- ignore the post as you have it right now! 8. I think you missed something - Castellan is a dwarf who is in his mid-900s, which is normal in Eberron (or all of fantasy really?). 9. He took you to Mayor Nighthill and then left. 10. Mayor Nighthill is a human whose age hasn't been formally announced. 11. Please post anew if you would like to do anything before Mayor Nighthill starts rattling off a quest or two! 12. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Conversations continue to move around, momentary flashes of the usual going-ons of town. 2. Some of the Wrecker crews boasting of tales from the sea in their usual game of one-upmanship while trying not to sound too ridiculous. 3. Given a few more hours, their stories will be fighting of Leviathans with their hands from the sails. 4. Some talks of seeing outsiders in town, but, the usual banter of the early evening along with the strong sounds of a guitar drowning out any details. 5. ( Perception roll to possibly hear more) Yorvalor continues to perform as the night (feel free to make a performance check if you want for fun), but the table that Isabella normally sits... she's sometimes late but... this is... late. 6. There's always a bit of someone coming in after a song or two, but not three. 7. Not her at least. 8. As Cade , Emund , and Elric sit together at the bar, one of the barmaids passes by. 9. A thread of red ribbon leaving her shirt and floating through the air. 10. It lands on the tip of Emund's glass, before being caught in the smallest gust of wind. 11. Following it, it seems to move past people in the crowd, swirling across the room until it lands on a man who enters the room. 12. Dock-workers hat, vest that's missing a few buttons, with a shirt that has the sleeves rolled up. 13. Set of pants that have some minor repair work done, but his skin is a a reddish gold. 14. A tiefling - or some other kind of ' old world touched' as they're called. 15. Not rare to see in a port city, but, definitely stands out. 16. The figure moves out of the doorway, after he looks around. 17. Hearing the music, he takes Isabella's regular seat, placing a order with one of the barmaids he flags down. 18. (( Yorvalor - give me a INT/ History roll for Blackscales.)) 19. Cade : You continue to focus on the drinks. 20. Mostly a weaker variety tonight, or perhaps the barmaid is trying to make sure you keep your wits about you. 21. You overhear some of the general gossip, but nothing quite catching. 22. ( Elric , let me know what you're doing for this segment of gossip and listening to music as everyone gets together. 23. Keegan , feel free to post your own entering the scene and what you're up to)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You land near the sapling and your suspicions were confirmed, the two men made an easy trail to follow but are out of sight. 2. You're fairly certain thatthey made a mess of things the whole way to where they were going. 3. Should you decide to track them later, it shouldn't be very difficult as long as you do it in the next few days. 4. As you approach the man, the first thing you notice, as I said, was the arrow with the broken shaft protruding from his eye. 5. If one had to guess, that would likely be the cause of death. 6. However, the wound on his arm is also pretty gnarly. 7. Assuming Liet is nearby, you can both deduce that the shape of the wound on the forearm is somehow in the same shape of that iron band that was around Albert's own forearm. 8. On closer inspection, you notice his 'not pierced' eye is sunken and has dark circles around it, also much like Albert after he changed. 9. The man's skin has a pale appearance and his skin seems to sag off his bones. 10. The poor bastard was NOT in good health. 11. Nalla/Ruhkis, for doing your rounds please roll perception, then please roll survival for firewood. 12. Liet: seems like a basic supply shipment. 13. Nothing of particular value. 14. Odds and ends, mostly iron ingots and some furs, a few barrels of ale. 15. McFuddy. 16. The only thing of note that you see is that the wagon itself left tracks indicating it had come from the direction of CB. 17. You all manage to settle in and get a long rest without being bothered. 18. Your weariness is gone, and night approaches. 19. Regain any lost hp and hit dice. 20. @McFuddy - I count keeping watch (without doing rounds) as light activity, so this counts as rest. 21. You don't have exhaustion either. 22. The sun is setting down the road to the west over Luthaan Anchorage, and a cool spring wind blows through the mountains. 23. What do you do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Finding no other way in, you enter the temple through the main doors.Inside the ten-foot-thick outer walls, the temple’s central space is a study in conveying celestial majesty. 2. Lined with a double row of squared-off pillars, its northwest end is dominated by a vaulted dome set with stained glass showing depictions of Madriel’s valor and mercy during the Divine War. 3. These skylight windows suffuse the whole of the sanctuary with tinted light throughout the day, but particularly in the late afternoon before the sun reaches the horizon. 4. At the far end, a dais holds a wide stone altar, behind which stands a 30-foot-tall statue of Madriel with wings unfurled, depicted with flowing robes draped over her armor. 5. She holds her spear in one hand, with the other outstretched in welcoming mercy, and her face shows the sorrow of the Redeemer for the lives she was forced to take during the Divine War. 6. The temple’s two wings are behind interior stone walls on either side of the sanctuary, each set with a large, heavily carved wooden door. 7. Chikra Perception 14 1 Hallanann Perception 14 16 Krusk Perception 8 12 Lia Perception 12 15 Newa Perception 7 19 Vor Perception 17 3 17 Although the area, and the outside of the temple looks like it has been abandoned for decades, it appears that someone has been cleaning up inside the temple. 8. Things are in place, and there is very little dust on surfaces. 9. The temple’s southeast wing houses a library of sacred and historic texts dating from many centuries before the Divine War. 10. The interior walls are lined with six tall bookcases holding this small but well-preserved collection. 11. The center of the room holds three long tables and a scattering of chairs that once served as a scriptorium and study space for visiting scholars and copyists. 12. During the day, this room is filled with natural light from the three tall, peaked windows in the outer wall. 13. When the characters arrive, there is a stack of books and scrolls on the central table, next to an oil lamp that shows the signs of being recently dusted off and lit. 14. The volumes here were consulted by someone a few days ago. 15. Books are still out on the tables.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You see 2-foot-tall mushrooms that are growing atop two small islands in the middle of this 3-foot-deep pool. 2. The islands are perpetually shrouded in mist from the waterfall up ahead. 3. They seem to be growing abnormally large in size for a cave mushroom. 4. How peculiar.The mushrooms are in three colors. 5. Red, green, and Purple. 6. There is a large loud waterfall up ahead. 7. The waterfall plunges 60 feet, its mist lightly obscuring a 35-foot-long rope bridge firmly anchored to 20-foot-high ledges. 8. Itsags so that its midpoint is only 15 feet above the water. 9. A gnome guard, if he could even be called that, calls out from the left side of the bridge by the waterwall. 10. "Excuse me! 11. Are you all here to slay the gross tentacle monster???" 12. he shrieks out, trying to be loud and get your attention. 13. He seems afraid and desperate.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gib Persuasion:25 Gib's flattery seems to have found a receptive audience in the Baron, and he relaxes visibly towards the end of the tiefling's spiel. 2. He firmly plants his fork down, dabs his face (smearing some blood across his face) and then points at Gib and nods vigorously. 3. "You flatter me, sir. 4. Of course, everything you say happens to be true. 5. I particularly appreciate your..."He licks his lips. 6. "Good taste in furnishing. 7. I have found that those who crave leadership desire to have those as their leaders who demonstrate an understanding of the finer things in our life. 8. "He takes another bite of his food. 9. "Now as to Captain Sufocan, I am surprised as you areremarkably well-informed. 10. I have a relationship with the Captain's patrons, one that is based upon shared interests. 11. "He looks at you all, slowly one by one. 12. "The arrangement has been fruitful for me. 13. That doesn't mean I am unwilling to consider the request. 14. I just need to be assured you will win. 15. I never back losers.. You may start to convince me, by sharing you sent you on this errand, and authorized you to speak on behalf of, as Mr. Gib has said,those who control trade in this part of the world and have the ear of the king. 16. I have my suspicions, but it is always better to hear it from the source." 17. Wist, as you look around the room, you are above all deeply impressed by the surroundings. 18. Even the garish Primewater mansion, which wears its ostentatiousness on its sleeve with gaudiness everywhere looks cheap in comparison to the finely decorated and tasteful setting you now find yourself in. 19. Most of the books on the shelves are in languages you do not recognize, but the ones you DO recognize are very rate books, almost all dealing with arcane subjects -- the study of magic, monographs about the natures of fiends, books about ancient sources of power in Oerth; all and all, its a very esoteric library, and almost uniformly old and valuable. 20. As you try to get a sense of what the Baron is eating, the smell of raw meat hits your nostrils. 21. Whatever the food is he's been eating, it has not been cooked.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. That's a great roll, Bron.This does put us all in a strange predicament. 2. Last round (round 11), Bron rolled a 20 and awoke. 3. He now gets a turn (still, round 11, the previous round). 4. Before Blue didn't do anything and before Einar dropped the wolf. 5. Bron needs to decide what he did in round 11 (aside from waking up), which may affect how Blue and Einar acted at the end of round 11. 6. So, what did you do, Bron? 7. Don't forget that standing uses half your movement, which means you can then move another 10 feet (because you round down from 12.5). 8. Bron's turn on round 11: uses hexblade's curse on bugbear, misses the bugbear Blue attempts to hit Bron: 23 , Damage: 7 Bron goes down (again) Nif fails his saving throw Einar kills the wolf and stays put Round 12 Karl saves his saving throw Vondal shoots Einar a half-hearted glare. 9. "Oh great. 10. If he wasn't mad at us before, he's certainly mad at us now." 11. The noble monklets out a pained chuckle before his face hardens into a stone mask.He steps forward over the fallen wolf to stand before the goblin (W11). 12. "Sorry, sonny, but you picked the wrong dwarves today!" 13. he says as he smacks the (blue) goblin upside the head with Clever Severe. 14. As the goblin is dropping to the ground, Vondal uses his remaining momentum in a roundhouse kick aimed at the bugbear, but the beast is able to knock his leg away. 15. The bugbeardisengages and heads west (T12) and looks to be preparing to climb down. 16. Bron, I need a death saving throw. 17. Nif, I need a death saving throw. 18. Einar, you can go. 19. Then round 13.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. DM Screen: 13 6 1 2 7 12 15 True to his word, Toblen Stonehill puts you up in the Stonehill Inn free of charge for the night. 2. The day of catching up and revelry gives way to the grim reality of the situation. 3. It has been nearly a tenday since you last saw Gundren Rockseeker, and your best idea of Cragmaw Castle's location is "in the woods north of Phandalin". 4. Thesun is out and weather is pleasant, however, and the most eventful sight during your three day trek to Thundertree is a caravan along the High Road heading from Neverwinter to Leilon. 5. The High Road branches off onto a small trail heading northeast, and the next afternoon, the trail gradually becomes an old, overgrown lane winding between dilapidated buildings choked in vines and brush. 6. Ahead of you, in the middle of the settlement, rises a steep hill, upon which stands a stone tower with a partially collapsed roof and an adjoining cottage. 7. A dirt road hugs the base of the hill and wends its way between old stone houses, many of which are roofless ruins with interiors open to the weather. 8. Other buildings appear more or less intact. 9. The whole place is eerily silent. 10. A wooden sign is nailed to a post nearby. 11. It reads: Tracking: The trail forks to the south, leading to two crumbling structures. 12. The trail forks to the north, leading to an intact building with a closed wooden door. 13. The trail continues further into the ruins.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Morton struggles, but cannot detain Hymnal. 2. The goblin can do nothing but watch helplessly as his friend and the lights disappear into the forest, lost in the pounding rain. 3. As soon as he can no longer see the lights, Damn snaps out of his trance, feeling like he has just woken up from a vivid dream. 4. (At this point Hymnal is fully entranced) Anyone may roll a Survival check to track Hymnal. 5. Damn manages to pick up the trail, and you follow it for several minutes until you emerge in a small clearing in the forest. 6. Hymnal stands on a cobblestone path which leads to a thatched cottage, looking around him in sleepy confusion. 7. Neither the humanoid toads nor the lanterns they carried are anywhere to be seen. 8. The rain has stopped, though you do not recall noticing the transition, and the forest is eerily quiet. 9. The cottage stands silhouetted in the light of the pale moon, to all appearances abandoned. 10. (Yes, you’re free.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Xenruth You fail your Wisdom save and feel the warlock pushing into your mind. 2. You do not appreciate such an intrusion and are shaken but take no damage becoming wary of the old half-elven man. 3. How do you react? 4. Also the half-flings surprise is in fact genuine. 5. He did not expect visitors in his shop, let alone strangers! 6. Elly, Shadow, Kohl You all are unaffected by the professor intrusion but are aware the half-elf doesn't seem to want to or might be unable to speak with his mouth, how do you react? 7. Gauldring Roll a wisdom save when you can! 8. Everyone You decidedly notice the shop, although clean, is in disrepair. 9. The half-fling seems to be on his own and although his clothes are worn they are well-cared for. 10. He scurries forward away from the short counter to introduce himself without waiting for anyone asking "I amThall Borg," he says clutching acollection of protective charms and talismans of Azuth. 11. "It's a...a fine day is it not," he seems to add nervously looking over the party. 12. "Have you...travelled far my friends," the half-fling asks his eyes falling on Elly because they are the only ones in the room, besides Gauldring, that can make eye contact without straining! 13. Addressing Elly specifically "Business? 14. Business is slow seeing you are the first people to come into the shop in...nearly a year," he then says smoothing his wildly kept silver hair with a smile.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. For all of you except Ruhvon, it would be easy to overlook such a detail as you pass, but at the side of the sodden mud road near the Pantry, Laza, Brayton and Ruhvon notice that there is a large metal manhole cover that serves as an entrance to the sewer network that runs beneath the streets. 2. It's large enough that you could enter it if you chose to. 3. Laza, you also notices that the shop next to the Pantry is a stationer's which has a number of items on display including several caligraphy sets. 4. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rey easily breaks through the old door. 2. You enter into another chamber.This fifty-foot-square chamber is hewn out of rock. 3. The floor is rough but flat, the walls show the chisel-marks of the original builders, and the ceiling is about ten feet high. 4. Identical stone doors with iron pull-ring handles stand in the middle of the north and west walls. 5. In the center of the room stands a life-sized and lifelike statue of a dwarf warrior wearing a chain shirt, helm, and big boots. 6. He carries a shield on his left arm and a battleaxe in his right hand. 7. The statue has clearly been broken into, roughly, the head and upper torso, lower torso, and legs. 8. These pieces have been reassembled and held together and upright in a stout wooden frame. 9. A dagger along with several coins and gems lie on the floor in front of the statue, surrounded by an ring of fine gravel.A small lantern hangs from a hook in the wall next to the door that you just burst out of. 10. Sitting on a wooden stool by the lantern is a balding, beardless old male human in patched and faded work trousers and a matching tunic. 11. He is idly whittling a stick. 12. He starts as he sees you, throws himself to the floor and begs for mercy. 13. "Please, don't kill me! 14. Do not bring the wrath of the delvers! 15. Please, go!" 16. Larrakh is nowhere to be seen.

Once everyone, including the massive Gris, have squeezed their way through the narrow bars,you find yourselves in a dusty guardhouse, complete withrotting mugs on the floor and rusty weapons on the walls. 3. The door at the back wall is sealed solidly and exhibits no sign of doorknob, handle, or hinge. 4. The drums grow louder as you travel farther northward, and the sounde unsettles you more than a little. 5. A table, empty barrel, and two small chairs are the only items of furniture. 6. Dwinkle bends over and retrieves an odd contraption, like a large key with several loose cogs and arrows upon it. 7. He spins one of the arrows and smiles as it rests upon an area of the key painted red. 8. "Caggs and Swivels. 9. Classic dwarven game of chance." 10. He explains. 11. "We are indeed in Bhailenteine."

Besides the occasional owl hoot and distant wolf howl, the fire keeps any animals from intruding during the night. 3. At dawn, there is definitely the autumn-winter chill in the air. 4. There is a moderate fog, which should be gone by the time the sun is above the horizon. 5. Each of you is reluctant to crawl out from your bedroll & blankets, except Froskan, who is sprawled out comfortably, bare-chested, blankets tossed off during the night. 6. Reverie was last watch, toasty in the magical warmth of her stylish fur boots. 7. She stokes up the fire a bit and puts on a pot of coffee, to entice the rest of you to get up. 8. (Edit: I had asked for 3 Tracking rolls, changed that to 3 Survival rolls, which is the skill used for tracking.) 9. (By all means, the conversation can continue from the night before. 10. This PBP now continues with the party entering the town of Orax, which lies upon the Plains of Sarthaal. 7. You look about the town, the wall having been covered with ice and scorch marks. 8. Burned out houses and streets lie before you, as you enter the town through the shell of what once was the town gate, you can see faint fire flickering. 9. Some have sprinkles on them, others have what seems like, oh no it couldn't be, chocolate frosting!? 6. One seems filled with berry-filling, and another is twisted in a pastry braid. 7. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Spoiler for Lorys: As you investigate the pressure plate, you realize you have a couple of options. 2. The plate is about 2 inches off the ground, so you could probably jam some rocks or something to keep the plate from pressing down. 3. You could disable the trap, but that would probably take some tinkering underneath. 4. Triggering it from a safe distance might be an option, but Gerard has come out with some pretty compelling reasons not to do that. 5. Or you could maybe block the slit up on the roof with an arrow or something. 6. (The bridge is 100 feet, the plate is right in the middle, right at the 50 foot mark.) 7. DM's Note: It kind of depends what choice you make. 8. If you try to disarm it with tools and such, it would be a Dexterity check. 9. Certain choices wouldn't really need a roll. 10. (There’s plenty of different size rocks along the cliff. 11. You find several you think will work, block off the plate. 12. It now looks like it won’t move. 13. Now that you’re not worried about the trap, you all look at the cliff on the other side. 14. It looks like it’s similar from where you came from, with a similar door that you can see is cracked slightly open.) 15. DM note: Give me a Perception check for when you get to the door.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Anders and Alexander - You hear a muffled yell from upstairs. 2. and see the old woman look upwards with a scowl, " Well if you're not here to buy it would be best if you left then. 3. Go on! 4. Git!" 5. Vaalu - Ismark is no match for your strength and is easily held in front of you, face to face. 6. "Of course I'm afraid, you would be too if you'd lived under the thumb of Strahd your entire life. 7. My sister is the only family I have left, you think I would just abandon her? 8. She means more to me then anything. 9. Any distance I can put between us and him is better then nothing. 10. I would have left sooner if she would have come with me but she wouldn't leave father, and father wouldn't leave that cursed town!" 11. Anders and Alexander - "Can't an old woman keep on eye on the comings and going of a few people without some thugs barging in her home and yelling at her? 12. What business is it of yours? 13. She calls upstairs, "Girls! 14. Come down here a minute" . 15. And you see one of the two girls that you saw earlier come down the stairs and whisper something to the old woman. 16. Dario and Incantis, you made extremely short work of these undead - combat is now over. 3. As silence comes over the crypt, you do suddenly hear a noise - coming from the door on the east side of the north part of the room. 4. It sounds as though someone is locking the door, and then immediately, you seem to hear a bar being dropped in place. 5. What would you like to do? 6. An ability check is when you attempt to do something, rather than reacting and trying to save against someone else's actions. 7. An example would be an enemy that attempts to grapple you and would therefore need to make an athletics check. 8. You could use Hex to give disadvantage on Strength checks, which would affect the enemy's athletics check. 9. Dario, the sarcophagi mostly contain dust, as the corpses that were previously inside seem to have been your enemies in this battle. 10. In the one belonging to the sword-wielding skeleton, you find a signet ring made of platinum; you estimate it is worth a fair amount, but don't know for sure. 11. No need to roll again, no.

Ace: When you raise your firearm and fire it off, it does get some people into motion, but it gets the ire of some of the crew, since it shoots into the floor above, potentially harming someone. 2. The tell Ace to stow that weapon less the boatswain come and feed the dragon turtle a naughty sailor. 3. (Failure, DC was 13) Tahia manages to swiftly and dextrously attach the parcels together, making sure not to make them too bulky, but with the ropes correctly knotted to ensure they don't fall out of place during transport. 4. (Success) Those of you headed below to the hull breach , there is water being taken in fast, three large penetration points, each about two feet wide, are gushing into the lower deck. 5. The crew are attempting tobring spare lumber and equipment over and fight the suddenly arriving tide within the room to get there. 6. (If you want to get to one of the points, it is a DC 12 Strength ( Athletics ) check to get there by foot. 7. Climbing over crates etc. 8. would be a DC 15 Dexterity ( Acrobatics ) check in order to walk the top route to them. 9. Once you're there, explain how you're helping) Several members of the group stride forward, making it to the breaches. 10. "Wait for it!" 11. One of the sailors calls. 12. "Aaaand, NOW!" 13. With that some of the crew in the room begin to gesture magics with their hands, Shaping the Water between them, attempting to hold it at the point of penetration. 14. "Quick, bung the holes now!" 15. He says, getting the group and some others to start repairing the gaps whilst the casters concentrate hard on the immediate water at the gap. 16. (If you are mending the ship, make me an Intelligence ( Investigation ) check to basically co-ordinate the fixes with the labourers. 17. Labourers, please make a Strength (Carpenter'sTools) check to quickly board up what you can.) 18. Above deck, the looming silhouette in the early evening waters reveals the glistening form of an enormous Dragon Turtle harrassing the ship. 19. "Steady!" 20. The boatswain calls to the others, holding a large barrel himself. 21. "We just need the right moment to give tribute. 22. Get ready to push in five... four..." He commands those atop the ship.

You travel for two days before Hendrix leaves you, and the Zhentarim scouts pick up their trail again to lead to Mantol-Derith. 4. As you get to the end of your 26th day in the Underdark, you find another one of those strange demonic warning signs. 5. Familiar with what this means, you pass the area cautiously, and try to find a place to camp. 6. Belleres notices two paths forward at the far end of the cave. 6. One seems well-worn and smooth, cut artificially out of the rock. 7. The other is a twisty natural hole covered in cobwebs. 8. Leon: You hear a faint giggling sound coming from behind you, and when you turn to look at it, you watch as what looks like a small person with wings turns invisible. 5. Zoya: Make a Wisdom saving throw. 6. Zoya only: You feel a strange tingling all over your body, which turns into applied pressure. 7. You feel yourself being squeezed into a smaller form. 8. You let out a yelp before the transformation is complete. 9. When you open your eyes, you see yourself surrounded by what appears to be large feet. 10. Before you can say anything, you feel your intelligence being drained away slowly. 11. Your stats are being modified now, and you can’t speak or cast spells. 12. I will send you a stat block in our private pm. 13. You all hear a yelp and realize that the half-elf you knew as Zoya is nowhere to be seen. 14. If you wish to search for her, make a perception check, DC10. 15. (Zoya doesn’t do this) If you pass, read the following: You hear a ribbit , and when you look down to the source of the sound, you find a small green frog with black markings on its back. 16. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Like with Saros' provocation a moment earlier, Ghee's questions receive no direct answer. 2. To some of the group, including Darrik and his unrhythmic whistling, the lack of a verbal confirmation seems a bit contradictory to the fact that the front door remains open. 3. To others, such as Khan and Ang, the open door is enough confirmation. 4. The two grung begin to walk forward cautiously. 5. Khannotices a few interesting things with the help of her peripheral view (passive). 6. Darrik notices these too. 7. @Khan & @Darrik: There are cellar doors on one of the manor's outer side walls. 8. They are kept shut with the help of a padlock. 9. Windows to various rooms can be seen on the mansion. 10. Most of them are protected with iron grates, whichare attached directly into the iron window frame and would certainly be nearly impossible to be removedwithout the use of specialized tools. 11. That said, theiron grates on one window on the third floor are bent open. 12. Ang makes sure to blend into the surrounding environment perfectly before completely entering the manor. 13. She peeks inside and see what can only be described as a foyer.The foyer is ornately decorated with a large painting of a lordly and wizardly figurelooking off to the side, hand raised, beginning to cast a spell. 14. Around him are white daisies and bunny rabbits. 15. The floor is an abstract mosaic pattern made of gray and orange stones. 16. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Velda Continuing to climb the remaining 15 ft to the ledge you clamber onto the ledge you saw earlier. 2. Seeing two stalagmites ahead of you. 3. You take cover behind the closer of the two and take a look around the room. 4. On your right (south side of the room), you see sacks and crates of looted provisions piled up, giving you the impression that the goblins have been raiding people from this location for quite some time. 5. Continuing to look around the room, you see a fire with two goblins currently cooking some type of meat. 6. One is seated on the west side, while the other is seated on the south side. 7. Directing your attention to the north side of the cave you see an opening at the top of what appears to be roughhewn stone steps. 8. Please roll a stealth check with disadvantage. 9. If Velda douses the torch upon seeing the goblins, let me know otherwise I’ll assume it is still lit. 10. Fionn Looking around the floor of the kennel you see little here besides bones with bite marks on them and the pile of debris leading the fissure that Velda and Gert have gone in. 11. Cadence Pine gets your message and flies around the hill/cave that you all currently find yourself in. 12. Looking for any other way in or out the cave and sees only the entrance that you used to enter. 13. After conveying all of this to you says, “I’ll keep an eye on the entrance and let you know if any goblins should return”. 14. Velda is at the top of the chimney and Gert is at the bottom of it. 15. Apologies for how I blocked out line of sight, but there is a stalagmite directly in front of Velda to the east. 16. After a failed first attempt to find a good route to follow Velda. 17. You manage to reach the ledge that Velda did about 15 ft off the ground on your second attempt rather easily. 18. Roll another athletics to either continue climbing or to descend back down to the ground. 19. If Velda happens to lower a rope to help you do so with advantage.

Without a doubt, Virgil know of the statement she said, she lied about one thing, but told the truth about the other. 6. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Zing is able to sneak into the doorway and closing it behind him. 2. Due to the larger than normal amount of people hanging out by the door though another priest comes closer. 3. A young female elf with green hair and eyes. 4. “ Hello you three, is there anything I can do to assist Brother Zand’ayl with your visit today?” (No one has noticed Zing sneaking behind the locked door, but some general suspicion has been raised.) 5. Zand’ayl walks back with Matteo “ ahh, Sister Rondyll. 6. Is there anything we can help you with?” Looking around the group. 7. “ I’m sorry, wasn’t there another member with us?” Zing : Walking into the chamber, looks to be a long tunnel of stone stairs leading down into darkness pass your dark vision. 8. Two torches remain lit right at the entrance. 9. A door is to your right, a plaque that says “High Priestess Balinda” the air is dry and dusty. 10. There isn’t any way to tell how far the steps go down. 11. The door locks itself behind you. 12. You can hear an extra muddled voice behind you, but no one seems to be panicking. 13. Taking in all the questions Zand’ayl begins to respond much as a museum tour guide would. 14. “ Well, the temple was built 638 years ago give or take a couple of months. 15. A Cleric Cadderly Bonaduce built it as a temple to Denier hoping for all good aligned faiths to be able to congregate and worship. 16. I don’t know why this mountain in particular, but he was one of Deneir’s chosen. 17. The only weapon I know of him using was his crossbows with bolts tipped with a vial filled with oil of impact. 18. Legends has that he resides in Shadowfell to this day standing Vanguard against Hepheastus. 19. I don’t know what evil you speak of, I’m sorry. 20. But there’s always answers to be found here in our libraries. 21. If you’re willing to take the time to find them. 22. I hope you enjoy your time here.”

On a 5+, you would know, Camiela, The Daughter is part of the family of new gods that's gained popularity among the more civilized residents of the region. 3. Camiela is known as the Daughter and as the Defender. 4. Her following is the smallest among the new gods and there are no large shrines in her honor. 5. On a 10+, you would know, Camiela, The Daughter is part of the family of new gods that's gained popularity among the more civilized residents of the region. 6. Camiela is known as the Daughter and as the Defender. 7. Her following is the smallest among the new gods and there are no large shrines in her honor. 8. She lacks the acolytes that her mother has so there really isn't much of a presence of her followers that mostly consists of guards and people that find themselves responsible for protecting others. 9. On a 15+, you would know, Camiela, The Daughter is part of the family of new gods that's gained popularity among the more civilized residents of the region. 10. Camiela is known as the Daughter and as the Defender. 11. Her following is the smallest among the new gods and there are no large shrines in her honor. 12. She lacks the acolytes that her mother has so there really isn't much of a presence of her followers that mostly consists of guards and people that find themselves responsible for protecting others. 13. Her imagery always shows her wearing a large suit of armor like a noble knight would wear. 14. She wears a giant shield and rarely has her face uncovered. 15. All of these details make you wonder if she could have been one of Lugh's Sentinels. 16. It seems very likely but you're unsure how she went from being a soldier to a god.

Rhaucred hits skeleton 5 with his cleaver and is able to finish it off before running into the room and jumping into the portal. 4. As Rhaucred jumps into the portal more skeletons start to enter the room and Rhaucred can see the cabinet in the corner open with a robed figure emerging. 5. He hears a voice say "Nobody will interrupt the master's plans of ...." when the portal closes with a quick beep. 6. The crew passesforward through the weak portal. 7. They're immediately met by a disconcerting world inside what appears to be some sort of cavern. 8. The ground beneath their feet is cracked and dry and the air is hot and dusty. 9. You can feel your skin begin to sweat and your lungs burn with each breath. 10. Their immediate instinct is to seek shelter, to find some form of relief from this atmosphere.Regardless of the horrible conditions they don't feel like you're in danger. 11. This world is definitely gentle, but it's a danger you can handle. 12. Far off to the left you hear growls and grunts of odd looking creatures to say the least. 13. Even though they seem harmless and curious, the time to take risks is definitely not now. 14. It's clear there are muscular creatures, thin creatures, and what you think might be gliding creatures of some sort. 15. Combat is over for now. 16. Please award you characters 150 xp

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The poetry heard from across the street is reduced to a mumble while inside the tavern, but Zan e can decipher the words "Stoke the fire" and "Sweet oblivion" in the poetry being recited while Hox approaches with a crude carving of a panther. 2. ____________________ Ignoring Killian 's context clues, the pale man grabs her bottle and begins to flip it in the air, catching it before anything spills. 3. "Amove I learned while studying with the Yellow Rose," he explains. 4. "As a seasoned adventurer, I can tell you when a cult pops up in your city they need to be investigated; and I don't like them in my city." 5. The man shouts to grab the attention of the other adventurers in the room. 6. "I have 50 gold pieces for whoever stops the machinations of the Poetry Society. 7. As bad as their poetry is, I can only imagine what they have lurking behind their doors!" 8. "Proof of wrongdoing?" 9. the man asks, itching the back of his head. 10. "Listen to them for more than a couple of hours and I'm sure you'll find all the proof you need. 11. You can trust me, as I mentioned I'm a seasoned adventurer who has spent some time with the Yellow Rose, and I have nothing to hide; and I know a cult when I see one!" 12. He starts to flip the bottle again to show off the move, but sheepishly replaces it on the table when Killian insists. 13. He takes a few steps back from Gruun before answering, "My name is Elric. 14. I came here delivering a shipment from Red Larch and now that the Stone Shields are arresting anyone trying to leave the city I find myself stuck here with the rest of you."

However you do manage to find feint evidence of the Bullywugs path as they rushed back from their raid. 7. So far you've managed to stay on their trail. 8. The sun moves across the sky as you spend hours trekking through deep muddy water and vegetation. 9. So far you've been lucky enough not to run into anything deadly, not yet anyway. 10. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. LYSANDEROTH ( @Palfatreos : I'll resolve your portent die as part of this post). 2. Lot looks up satisfied that he dodged Nox 's death ray, just to then feel a bit lighter as he raises his shoulder again. 3. He slowly turns his head to realize a chunk of his shoulder is missing. 4. "NO! 5. not like this..." he raises his healthy arm towards the central crystal, letting his scythe fall to the ground and disappear. 6. As the disintegrate effect expands from his right shoulder to the rest of his body, Lot... no, Lysanderoth collects the magical force surrounding the crystal and brings his hand into a fist. 7. You can all hear the sound of glass breaking (the Forcecage effect protecting the crystal is gone). 8. Lysanderoth draws power from the swirling colors within the gem and begin to cast Wish . 9. A narrow ditch filled with water. 7. As you move at a quarter pace holding this giant man overhead. 8. You struggle to move under the water as the current pushes against you. 9. If you try to set him down on the side to catch your breath the man starts crawling back to his original spot. 10. You have to make your way in one go. 11. You trudge forward. 12. One minute goes by, and another, and another’s. 13. Your lungs begin to burn within your chest. 14. Your eyes stinging and shoulders aching. 15. Another minute goes by. 16. The remaining seconds of your breath linger as you draw close to the end. 17. Anything you would like to do as your vision begins to darken?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Unfortunately , there is no other way to cross the bridges to get to the rooms. 2. Zeli runs downstairs to where Pheral lies and grimaces at your body. 3. "Oh, my." 4. She winces, "I didn't know humanoids bent that way. 5. I'm confused, Azrael told me you had some "nice moves". 6. Guess it didn't apply to traversing sketchy broken bridges. 7. Tsk Tsk. 8. Here." 9. She puts her hands on your legs and heals them. 10. You're good as new. 11. She looks up at everyone on the second floor and gives a gleeful thumbs up. 12. BEAN BAG TOSS LYTHRIL AND BEAN BAG: Lythril tosses the rabid forest animal AKA Astrid, faster than she can protest, with the rope attached to her with some amazing athletics on Lythril's part. 13. Astrid thumps gently against the door, squeaking like a stuffed animal as she hits it, and lands on the other side of the bridge in front of the door. 14. (If you look at the map, you're in front of the door to the room northmost). 15. The door is, surprisingly, unlocked, but bears dwarven make. 16. PHERAL: Zeli helps you up easily, grateful you're ok and can walk again. 17. She smells like a gentle seabreeze as she leans in a gets close to help you, and the color of her eyes and her perfect bronze skin are so beautiful it makes you sick to your stomach with envy, but only momentarily. 18. She looks at the potion you pulled out and gives you a very approving smile and nod.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You continue through the valley, and the sun overhead feels incredible. 2. The wind has died down, so while it's still bitterly cold, your winter clothes and the warming rays make it bearable...almost pleasant. 3. By late afternoon, you'repicking your way over the boulders of a slope. 4. You reach the crest and look out over the other side. 5. In the distance - another few miles, perhaps - you see something that catches your eye. 6. Straight lines stand out in the natural world, and amongst the jagged peaks and rounded boulders of the mountains, you see a horizontal line running across one of the distant mountain faces. 7. A stone wall! 8. Scanning upward, you find an intricately built castle in the side of the mountain beyond the wall, dotting an enormous area of the landscape with stairs and doorways and windows. 9. It's hard to imagine how this was even built, and how long it might have taken, but it's breath-taking. 10. On the near side of the wall, apair of stone statues stand guard on either side of the gargantuan wooden doors. 11. Worn and weathered from the wind and ice of centuries, they're still impressive in both size and detail. 12. Everyoneis silent for a moment as you take in the spectacle of Whitehold.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You're of course welcomed to spend the night again. 2. You all sleep extremely well after last night's fight and an evening filled with drinking and eating. 3. Things seem a bit lighter when you wake. 4. The sun is just starting to appear over the shortest mountain peaks, bringing warm golden light into the home. 5. Bacon, potatoes, and some kind of honeyed bread are served. 6. At this point you all know there are a few ways to continue heading west. 7. Through the mountains, which you've opted out of. 8. Over the mountain pass just a bit to the north, which still requires climbing through some of the moderately high peaks. 9. And finally, moving south along the edge of the range until you get closer to the southern coast, then taking that west around the range. 10. That will take a bit longer.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Chad has put the ship on autopilot and joined the goblins in the lower quarters. 2. ”To tell you the trust, I don’t know where the deck is. 3. Yet! 4. I am working on that. 5. I will get you the location of the deck when I know. 6. I will communicate with you with the sending stones.” Chad shows the goblins his sending stone. 7. “I do know it is in the sea ward of the city.” Chad points out the sea ward in the north west corner of the city. 8. “ You get the other magic items while I work on getting you a location of the deck. 9. Once you have the deck, you have to get out of the city.” Chad points out three points of exit from the city. 10. “As far as your escape, there are three possible options. 11. The first would be to charter a ship in the dock ward. 12. It's going to cost you and you better be rather persuasive. 13. Sea captains are not known for their manners or haste to leave port. 14. The second is through a hole in the city wall. 15. The issue with that is the hole in the wall is in the City of the Dead. 16. As the name implies, the city is filled with undead guardians. 17. It will be a fight to get through. 18. The third involves a cart. 19. One you're going to have to steal and a fast one would be best. 20. After the operation starts, the city gates are going to be locked down. 21. Now, this doesn't mean you can't break through, but you best be moving quickly if you're going to do so. 22. The north gate is wider than the south gate. 23. I would assume exiting through the north would be easiest to get through. 24. You do not have to decide now and you may come up with your own plan to escape, but none are going to be easy.”

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Lia: make a History check. 2. Oh yes, seeing the Count drink your blood was quite the highlight so far, rumbles Applecross, licking his lips. 3. A conversation with you would be most welcome. 4. I would like to hear every detail of what that was like. 5. But for now, your friend is fine. 6. Please enter and see for yourself. 7. Applecross stands aside, allowing Hatch and Lok to not only see Lia more clearly but also Bentley the halfling standing in the room. 8. His face brightens when he sees them and he gives a friendly wave. 9. The room is otherwise unremarkable. 10. Barok brushes Lia's comment aside with a small laugh, saying: Oh, I've been known by different names. 11. That's not really important. 12. I'm glad to see you are unharmed. 13. As Hatch and Lok check on Lia and Bentley, Applecross returns to sitting on the edge of the bed. 14. Replying to Lia he says: Yes, that's right! 15. Well, actually no. 16. She didn't send me exactly. 17. But I always know just what she wants, and I just do it without her even asking. 18. I'm her favorite, you see. 19. She says I'm the MOST in- incontinent? 20. no that's not it ... in- incompetent? 21. yes, the MOST incompetent of ALL her servants. 22. She's always giving me important jobs that take me far away for a long time. 23. (What's your spell save DC, Hatch?) 24. CHA saves: Barok: 18 Applecross: 25 Yeah, both had good CHA stats. 25. Barok's modifier is epic, in fact ... Hatch, while you're at it, make an insight check. 26. (DM's secret roll: 27 ) -- oof! 27. I can't lose.
