Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Withertoe's pockets contain a bubbly metallic potion, but something -- perhaps a morbid curiosity? 2. -- compelled Yahg to take off the heavy metal boot. 3. A terrible smell wafts out, like rotting flesh, and true to his name, gangrene has turned the toes into a black and yellow crust. 4. But inside the boot, tucked into a sock waxy with fungus, Yahg sees a gold piece. 5. Then another! 6. Until somehow, Yahg had pulled 50 GP from the socks in just the moment before Yurk carries the body behind the rock. 7. Each party member gets 10 GP, and the potion (2 charges) goes into Tomp inventory. 8. No need for a strength check -- Yurk's strong enough to carry the body. 9. After Yurk dumps the body behind the rock and starts toward the deer path, Og takes a moment to point Tomp at Withertoe. 10. Tomp hisses, baring his teeth. 11. While the mimic's interior certainly seems big enough, he seems neither willing nor able to fit a hobgoblin through his mouth. 12. He'll eat small, relatively clean, willing creatures only, it seems. 13. Darksniffer spots signs that someone — most likely the goblins — cut straight up the mountainside, away from the deer trail. 14. The goblin path seems a couple days old.

Clipclop with disadvantage because he is poisoned. 10. Assuming Dreel stayed outside the cave while trying to keep a distance from everyone?]

The boat is sinking, it will sink within the next hour if you do not move quickly you will go down with it. 4. There is still time to investigate the deck. 5. You did not when you came up only to find the wheel. 6. It accommodates twelve. 7. You do know how to lower the boat into the water with your party members on board. 8. First however you've got to get aboard and swing the boat over the side. 9. It will take two people STR check DC 12. 10. The boat is tossing in the waves on rough seas, once in the water I'll need a survival check with advantage from Keth to make it ashore. 11. Keth you do find the source of incoming water, a large break in the haul as if the ship had run aground then was broken free by the storm. 12. There is NO way to repair it. 13. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. DMs note: Hope everyone had good Holidays! 2. Walton, Since you didn't specify which Goblin, I'm going to assume it's the already injured one in front of you. 3. Goblin Dex Save: 5 (The hurt Goblin starts to try to dodge out of the way, but is way too slow and is consumed by the Cleric's Sacred Flame!) 4. Erhorn, you're up. 5. (Xanlanann improvises without his Rapier and pulls out his other dagger. 6. The Serious Goblin seems to be distracted by both the Erhorn's mind games and Walton's mere presence, and does not see the Dagger until it is too late. 7. Pank, son of Morg, draws his last breath and dies.) 8. Fredrick, you're up. 9. There is only 1 goblin left, but it is unhurt. 10. (Emboldened by the group's fight, Frederick aims his arrow and finishes the job as the final Goblin is slain with ruthless efficiency. 11. As you all get your bearings, you look around the dark room. 12. There's the hallway behind you from where you came, the Northern wall, where there seems to be some carvings on the wall, the Southern wall that looks plain, and the Eastern wall which looks to be covered in vines. 13. The brazier is on a platform and is giving off some faint light.) 14. What do you do? 15. DMs note: If you want to look at something, please specify what and roll Perception or Investigation.

Strix, you search the unconscious goblin, and find a few sticks of incense, but nothing more. 6. However, as you are searching, your eye is suddenly caught by a glint of light off the golden items on top of the altar, and you move over to investigate them. 7. They are human-made, and quite beautifully too, from gold. 8. It will be a challenge to find a buyer outside a large city, but the chalice is worth 150 gold pieces, the knife 60 gold pieces, and the censer 120 gold pieces. 9. You hear the sound of a door slam in the room to the south, as presumably the fleeing goblins have made their escape. 10. Dekhan, make a Perception check as you try to hear through the door. 11. Strix, as the goblin is unconscious, you are able to put the manacles on with no problem. 12. The goblin is unconscious and badly wounded; without magical healing, it will awake in 1 hours.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. 'Eamon smiles at Kay's wonder when he mentions famed Waterdeep far to the South,' "My dear, you have no idea at just how magnificent the City of Splendours really is. 2. I myself am a proud and loyal son of Fireshear, the greatest city of the Shore, better than that rat warren Luskan and the rival of fair Neverwinter itself... but Waterdeep!" 3. 'The older man, twinkling eyes watching Kay's every excited response to his description, continues,' "Of course, I have been there more than once, to see to personal matters and also as an emissary of the Ducess herself. 4. People call her the City of Lights, The City of Songs and The City that never Sleeps, and she is all those things and more. 5. Truly dear, Kay, you really must see its wonders to be able to envisage and appreciate them! 6. Of course, it's an expensive trip and the city itself is not always kind to the uninitiated or those lacking in coin. 7. Yes, as magical a trip as it would surely prove, it is one that a young lady new to the wide world would be best making at the side of someone wealthy and more...worldly." 8. [OOC] 'Try as she might, albeit subtley, Kay fails to steer the man back towards discussion of his work for the Daskas, their businesses or anything further to do with the Ducess.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Together Retiog and Alici open the doors into a massive chamber. 2. It's cooler here. 3. The air having a distinctive decaying smell of earth and rot. 4. "This...this is most definitely the tricky bit. 8. It's in a family tomb meaning multiple generations but I don't know which," the half-elf confesses putting away the map now. 9. "It's a royal member of the Vaandree Dynasty. 10. I...I don't suppose any of you have heard of them," he asks next. 11. History check. 12. Theres space enough for shoulder to shoulder or even three people to walk through the large doors but the room is impossibly dark. 13. First merchant’s check: 10 Second merchant’s check: 12 The bartender, a jovial man who introduces himself as Garlen, snatches up Tangle’s silver. 4. “I’m sure we could procure something.” He says. 5. Garlen stomps upstairs and you hear the soundsof yelling and commotion. 6. A minute later, five men march sullenly down to the taproom and take up residence at an unoccupied table. 7. Garlen returns and bows to Tangle. 8. “The upper lounge is at your disposal.” The half-orc woman stares at Sparks for a second, and then bursts out into raucous laughter. 9. “Aye, now I’ve seen it all.” She slurs, lifting the kenku clear off the floor and stuffing him into a chair. 10. “Drinks are on me!”

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Brask, you have very little success hunting. 2. You try to sneak up on a few frogs to have some fun, but they jump away from your clanging armor before you can get within a few feet. 3. You don't seem to mind terribly, though. 4. It's nice during this part of the day and the dappled sunlight along the stream is undeniably relaxing. 5. Effort, as you start to think about things, you feel something welling up in you. 6. It's not anger or sadness or any identifiable emotion. 7. You feel it coursing through your veins all the same. 8. Some darker clouds start to roll in as you rest by the stream. 9. They don't bring a lot of rain - some drizzling now and again - but Cadmael has a tough time scouting as high as he's used to. 10. He doesn't find anything unusual. 11. Effort's camp isn't much more than a nice patch of moss next to the stream. 12. She tries to lay a few branches across a crook in a tree to give them some cover from the rain, but they keep sliding and falling into the stream below. 13. Frustrated, she gives up after a few minutes. 14. The clouds move through quickly, thankfully, and you're left with a few hours of daylight. 15. You can stay here for the night, or push further upriver before nightfall. 16. Brask, despite using a weapon clearly not designed for fishing, is able to hack and slash some fish in the stream. 17. He ends up catching 3 ( each time you or someone else consumes a fish, gain a point of inspiration ).

Ogun slumps in his chair thinking then says. 4. N o wonder the glaive shattered to piecesbut the damage done to the glaive was done by a blade much heavier then this one of the same material the Glaive I am finishingup would shatter as well to this sword most metal weapons made by the most finest blacksmiths would. 5. This blade had to of taken the individual many years with special equipmenteven I don't have anything of that caliberto craft; And they just gave you such a magnificent piece this is priceless? 6. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Having said the above, perhaps a more worrying progression choice is Warlock. 2. If Midian wereto take this path, it would likely bring him into direct conflict with the organisation he is currently working for—and possibly be at odds with being a cleric whose powers are god-given—because of the supernaturalconnection between a Warlock and their patron. 3. Also, this relationship is something that would need to be developed in play. 4. For example, Midian might find a book that might get him into contact with a Warlock patron from this campaign world (e.g., Killrellian). 5. I'm not saying that your idealised character progressioncan't be done, just pointing out that it will be difficult to do in this campaign because of the setting. 6. Also, with the limitation on cleric, what would be your proposed second level advancement be?] 7. [In that case, what I'd like to propose is that I change Midian's Innate Sorcery feat to Magic Initiate (Bard) with the spells See the Arcane (which he already has), another cantrip of your choice and a 1st level spell of your choice (with the choices not being ones that might have affected previous events). 8. This is to represent his previous training in the arcane that he would have been undergoing as an apprentice Seeker. 9. At second level, you can then multiclass to Bard to get access to the full Bard capabilities. 10. If you want, you can also nominate a musical instrument for him to become proficient in. 11. Though I don't considered that a necessary aspect of a Bard, as can be seen with my Tyrus character.]

Be careful, sweet one. 6. I may just want to keep you when this is all said and done." 7. He feels a being lean over his shoulder and it whispers in his ear, the voice going from playful to grim. 8. "I don't have much right now,but I think I can help you. 9. It will come at a price. 10. A favor for a favor. 11. Will you accept?" 12. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The Drendars silently listen to Maglath's words. 2. The utter horror of the situation was not due to the realization that the father was dead, but to see him in such a mutilated state. 3. They wordlessly begin dragging him out of the crevasse, and leave the hideout from the exit tunnel. 4. Examining the cavern again, Maglath notes two doorways across the crevasse bridge, with staircases leading downwards. 5. Other than the secret door in the storeroom, there also appears to be a second hallway on this side of the crevasse. 6. As Lyre listens in on the left door, he hears several gruff voices speaking Goblin. 7. Luckily, they switch back and forth into a broken Common, so he's able to catch snippets of their conversation. 8. "Lick the floor!" 9. "Roll like a dog!" 10. (Lyre, please make aInsight check with advantage) On the right door, he hears the rattling sound again, followed by a shouts and groans a flurry of voices as wagers are announced and paid out. 11. There seems to be a gambling game going on inside... 12. The longsword Talon's hilt worked into the shape of a bird of prey with outstretched wings. 13. Even an untrained eye could tell that the sword is masterfully crafted. 14. (Maglath, smith tools/insight won't be of much help, but you can do a history check to remember lore about the sword, or if you're willing to wield it and experiment with it, an arcana check will work.)

So here they are going to the Steward to complain about their problems. 6. Most days are like this. 7. Merchants and craftsmen complaining about suppliers not making it to the city, Refugees from the northern towns fleeing orc raiders. 8. I'm not sure but i think there has been a few farmers complaining about the centuar tribes, No shortage of problems here in Emberhorn. 9. Thankfully thats all above my pay grade as a guardsman. 10. I heard a member of the Crown's Guardians was suppose to look into the problems around the city, but clearly nothings come of that." 11. person in line: (to Misty) "I haven't gotten any supplies in over a week. 12. how am i suppose to sell wares when i don't have what my customers want? 13. The Steward is gonna hear about it. 14. The Kingdom is suppose to protect and take care of its people. 15. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Darvin finds a lovely corner alongside the wall, directly in the path Skiaceq had been flying along, but hidden amongst the rocks from the rest of the camp. 2. It doesn't take too long before the Valji catches sight of him, managing to find Darvin through his Gnomish glee. 3. Make a group stealth check at advantage to attempt to hide in the rocks until night. 4. It would be hypocritical of me to call you out for being busy... Methinks you're good. 5. Lol There is a flurry of activity following dinner, cultists gathering bits of the camp together, apparently readying to leave for some unknown location, but leaving tents and bedrolls out for a good nights sleep. 6. Kobolds bring various odds and ends out of the cavern, taking them in wheelbarrows further into the camp. 7. Skiaceq remembers having seen horses and wagons in the direction. 8. After a couple hours, dusk gives way to night, and the sounds if the camp seem to die down. 9. Sounds of snoring waft over from the tents, the only motion in the camp coming from the night guard around the command tent and the various guard posts closer to the entrance of the camp. 10. As the group approaches the cave entrance, they spot a dragonclaw (cultist) around 30 ft into the interior of the cave, keeping vigil over the entrance. 11. In one hand he clutches a torch, and another light source seems to be coming from just outside the view of the entrance.

He warily approaches Iork and Nik, and feels that no treachery is planned. 4. When he gets to Nik, however, a quick examination reveals that Nik is pretty bad off. 5. Please make a medicine check for examining Nik before you decide to cast a heal spell on him. 6. Erevan sees that each man is armed with a short curved sword or scimitar and a dagger, but the well-dressed man has no weapons other than the staff which, on close inspection, is smooth and highly polished wood. 7. The purses of the 3 sleepers (not Nik) contain a total of 21 silver coins and as many copper. 8. If Iork is bothered by your actions, he doesn't show it. 9. His worried eyes are focused on Nik, and Olwer's ministrations to him. 10. Olwer can tell that Iork is fudging parts of his story. 11. He obviously is worried about Nik, that part is true. 12. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rosa, make your first Death Saving throw while someone climbs down to grab you. 2. The rope would absolutely give you advantage on the climb, making it an easy descent into the pit where you can restore eight hit points to Rosa, negating the need for any Death Saves. 3. Rosa, as you blink your eyes open, you see Grythek near you, and the now-blood coated spikes all around you. 4. With the set up you all have, it would be either an advantaged Athletics check from you and Grythek or an advantaged strength check from Muirdan while you hold on to get you two up. 5. Muirdan easily hauls both Rosa and Grythek up out of the pit. 6. As you look at the situation, anyone would be able to clear the pit with a simple running jump (no Athletics required even), it's only 5 feet across. 7. There isn't really a good lip to sneak around on, however. 8. (Let's go ahead with a Perception and a Stealth roll.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Ando leans forward to peer down the well, he hears another painful cry behind him...although this voice is not the one he heard before, and it is clearly not coming from inside the structure of the house. 2. He wheels around to see Connak quickly backpedaling away from a massive orc with an elven arrow protruding from his right eye. 3. The hulking brute stops just short of Connak and reaches up to grasp the arrow shaft. 4. “For the glory of Gruumshh! 5. !” he bellows at the top of his lungs as he snatches the arrow - and his right eye - out of his ocular cavity. 6. “And now, you die for Gruumshh, weakling! 7. !” The orc drops the large pliers and pulls forth his greataxe as he resumes the pursuit of the meddling elf. 8. URZUL THE FLESH RIPPER: (Movement) - 30 feet towards Connak (Bonus Action) - Aggressive: the orc can move up toits speed toward a hostile creature that it can see (moves an additional 5 feet to reach Connak). 9. (Action) Greataxe: 18 vs. AC 15 (Connak), dealing 5 slashing damage on a hit. 10. Ando watches as the orc brings his axe down upon Connak...the fierce blow sends the elf to the ground in a bloody, broken heap.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. OCC... Eurim is sharing his luck. 2. Map on campaign board. 3. Opening the double doors, you are presented with once was, a luxurious antechamber for the King. 4. Now filled with broken furniture, ripped cushions, and rotting carpet and tapestries. 5. A window on the opposite side of the room lets in just enough light from the dark, overcast sky for you to be able to see. 6. A door on your left, hangs open on broken hinges, while a door on your right remains closed though battered. 7. Keestake follows you in, weeping angrily and muttering about defilement and protecting Himself (the King). 8. Denethir, the glow seems to be coming from the next room on the left. 9. Keestake makes an angry move to Denethir, then stops. " 10. No, never have seen them. 11. But the must belong to himself. 12. I guess now we must take them to keep them away from the likes of him, " he says pointing at Ruki. " 13. Yes, yes, they'll be safe from his ilk soon enough. "

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Six cracked marble pillars line the walls of this hall, at the north end of which stands a nine-foot-tall statue of a dwarf seated on a throne, a mighty stone warhammer across his lap. 2. Large emeralds gleam in the statue’s eyes.The dust and debris covering the floor has been swept to one side, and a campsite of sorts now spreads in front of the statue. 3. Half a dozen bedrolls and packs are neatly arranged around a rough-built fire pit. 4. A wooden table stands on the west side of the room between two pillars. 5. Two bugbears stand by the table, flanking a dark elf dressed in black leather armor and robes. 6. He clutches a black staff with a carved spider at the top and frowns as he sees you. 7. “It seems that I must deal with you myself. 8. A pity it must end this way.” Roll initiative please. 9. Enemies: 8 You guys are all around the star, if you roll higher initiative than your enemies go ahead and take your turn. 10. Remember you can talk or roll perception, or whatever else that might count as a free action as part of your turn. 11. The bless spell cast by Silas is still in effect on all of you. 12. I should clarify, you are at the yellow star, the black one is part of the map it indicates the statue mentioned above.

Now while they weren’t totally on board for all the pillaging and piracy, they have been known to partake in some smuggling now and again. 4. “ Word is you supposed to be a dead man walking? 5. Nine-Toes hung you out to dry an’ everything. 6. So you and your lot lookin for passage? 7. We should be able to suffice. 8. We be leaving port by next Tuesday (today is Wednesday) heading on down around to the south side of Cyrodil... long ways from here. 9. You can work you can have your way for free, just need a, how do you call it? 10. A deposit. 11. ” They both chuckle a bit as they finish up. 12. Hallie and Stone: Outside it looks like the fight Stonetooth told you about where the two other families eliminated eachother. 13. Weeks old blood hard to come by any other clues. 14. Making your way into the cellar. 15. You find a couple casks of Ale and wine in the corner. 16. Various silverwares and furniture covered in blankets. 17. A small roll away bed folded up in another corner. 18. It’s dark and cobwebs have begun to form. 19. What would you like to do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. They are ALL magical. 2. "I was sent for the stone and nothing else," Gimble replies. 3. "I got this map from a friend who knew I was taking only the stone," he explains looking at the sarcophagi then the party. 4. "Anyhow Alici right," he adds next looking around. 5. "We best not linger. 6. Let's close these up and get moving," he urges next. 7. "The stone was stolen by the Dynasty if you must know so...let's say we're returning it to its proper place," Gimble replies. 8. The party then closes the sarcophagi back heading back out through the hive out of the tomb. 9. "Shall we close the doors too," Gimble then replies standing in the threshold of the tomb. 10. Moving out of the tomb Gimble allows the party to close the doors and he returns to the rope. 11. Gimble secures all his gear and then begins the climb up. 12. His nimble frame moves quickly but midway up the party hears a rumbling from the darken abyss that drops off from the stair landing and themassive doors. 13. Gimble then moves more quickly up the rope and the party watches as he climbs to the top pulling himself up onto the atrium level. 14. "Quickly now," Gimble says in hushed but urgent tones. 15. "I....I don't like the sound of that," he adds next as his voice echoes around the party some 75ft down.

If you are attacking, go ahead and roll initiative and take a turn, you will have a surprise round. 5. Assume you can get to a kobold from where you are if you want to get into melee. 6. I'll make a map and post it with everyone's positions once you've all posted. 7. 15- Kobolds (surprised) 8-Lyria 5-Place' 4-Kod Potato Hordkhen Delirious Potato 15 lol yours is funnier. 8. Hordkhen 10 Potato waits until Place' gets close to one then cuts it down in a ride-by slashing. 9. Hordkhen rushes to one across the stream and misses with his longsword. 10. Delirious kills one outright with an arrow center mass. 11. Lyria was headed to where she could get 2 in a radiant blast. 12. CON Saves: 0 / 17 One takes nearly fatal damage, the other is unaffected. 13. Place' mauls one of them to death, simple shreds it. 14. Kod runs next to Lyria and cuts down the one that was unscathed. 15. After the initial attack, the kobolds attempt to flee. 16. They try to get Northwest across the stream, using disengage when necessary or dashing if they are not next to you. 17. For instance, there's a pile of gold and silver that looks like it was once held by a small box but the wood has rotted and formed a moldy kind of sludge around it. 4. There are scraps of what look like leather armor and several rusty weapons. 5. There is a staff with a craved snake head that has somehow remained in good shape. 6. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Fingolin’s words are inspiring enough to bring courage to the rest of the group, as they take a deep breath and calm themselves. 2. You regroup in a tight formation. 3. Arell, Solomon, and Fouder standing on the front line with Tennanaz and Fingolin standing behind. 4. A golden glow begins to coat the wolf pack, making them brighter and easier to target. 5. Arell unleashes his flurry of blows in a fury of weapons and fists. 6. He realizes that only the necrotic damage is being effective from his strikes. 7. The werewolf is immune to non magical and non silvered weapons. 8. In his moment of realization a shred of fear overcomes him, until three darts shoot pass his ear and slam into the werewolf’s chest. 9. He gets rocked for a moment before refocusing from Tennanaz’s spell. 10. Fouder lands it’s blow on wolf B with his weapon, followed by summoning his spiritual weapon, slaying wolf A. Solomon swings towards the remaining wolf (B), as the beast tries to jump out of the way of his strike. 11. But he’s too slow against cold steel. 12. Though it is dark, the time is still twilight and not fully into night time. 13. Fingolin cautiously sneaks up towards the door as he looks around the courtyard. 14. Not being able to sense any danger, he walks up to the door. 15. Large scorch marks in a circle with blood stains splatter the stonework beneath his feet. 16. (At this time he remembers that Kolyyt has sent his team as well to Blackstaff tower, your party looks to have arrived after they have) The door is slightly ajar and not locked. 17. The rest of the group staying back for a moment watched Fingolin sneak pass the courtyard and seemingly missing to see the (flock?) 18. of stirge s in the tree along the path of the courtyard. 19. The parasitic creatures haven’t seemed to notice Fingolin as of yet. 20. (Following Fingolin would require everyone to make a stealth check, Fingolin would also have to make a stealth check after being told to come back.... somehow without raising your voices.). 21. What would you like to do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The group is now about 5ft away from the edge of the forest; you have walked past the stumps. 2. Zoya You can sense Cornelius’s presence about 70ft into the forest. 3. A few moments later, you hear a disembodied voice. 4. Zoya only: “Nobody. 5. Bright sparkles.” Orin As you continue forward, you hear a faint rustling. 6. You see a small vole dart out of a bush towards a little hole near the roots of a tree. 7. Amaya flies forward with open talons, but ( 9 ) the vole slips out of her grasp as she goes to scout ahead. 8. She makes a shrilling on top of a tree branch about 30ft away. 9. Zoya You close your eyes and focus on Cornelius. 10. You open your eyes and see yourself gliding over and under tree branches. 11. Cornelius looks at both sides, and you catch a glimpse of what appears to be a wing hide behind a tree. 12. The wing doesn’t seem to be made of feathers, but rather something sparkly and semi-transparent. 13. Not exactly. 14. Cornelius was about 70ft away when he saw the wing, but that’s basically all you have to go on. 15. It’s somewhere in that area. 16. You can maybe have him look for it. 17. Zoya The area where Cornelius saw the wing was about 70ft away and past a lot of trees. 18. You wouldn’t be able to see it any way.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Crossing the Bridge & in the Village Square 1) The agreed party order, not without some remonstrations from that arch show-off Beedo who now doubt wanted to demonstrate his mastery of acrobatics, is as follows: Vark, Toruun, Meiva, Devin, Torem, Kaelen, Beedo and Jaylen. 2. 2) All of the party including the Guards [Torem's attempt (DC 5 - 12 ) & Kaelen's attempt (DC 5 - 11 )] make it across safely, it is difficult to say who was the most stylish but eventually the judges award the victory to Jaylen for her stylish dismount. 3. 3) The party make their way down the straight avenue towards the Village Square and as they approach the square they seeseven humanoids of various races (Dwarf, Goliath, Halfling, Half-Orc;2 x Humans and a Tiefling), wearing black leather and all mounted on black horses, or ponies as appropriate, accompanied by Kella (accompanied by Blik and Flik) who is in deep conversation with one of the humans, obviously the leader, approach the Livery Stable where Vark had said D.O.R.K. 4. was hiding. 5. 4) The party sees one of the largest of the humanoids - a Goliath dismount from his horse (if such a large beast can be called a horse) - and march up and bang on the door. 6. At the same time the group leader yells out "Wonder Woman or whatever your name is - I suggest you come out as we want to talk to you." 7. 5) From within the stable the party hears back - albeit somewhat muffled - "Clarification. 8. I am a Designated Operative of the Red Knight. 9. But you may call me D.O.R.K. 10. State your name and business first, and your request shall be considered. 11. Do not, and you will be treated as hostile."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. THE JOURNEY BEGINS Unfortunately, this unremarkable town is so unremarkable, it has no means of faster transportation than walking. 2. A perfect chance, it seems, to take time to get acquainted. 3. You all follow Orilo and begin the walk west to this place you've never heard of called Barovia. 4. As you walk west, rolling thunderclouds cast a gray pall over the land. 5. It is evening time. 6. Pardon my crappy lettering lol. 7. A. 8. The Old Svalich Road Black pools of water stand like dark mirrors in and around the muddy roadway. 9. Giant trees loom on both sides of the road, their branches clawing atthe mist. 10. As you all walk westward, you notice a thick fog following you, as if guiding you, and limiting your direction of travel. 11. While not threatening, it always looms behind you, like a herder guiding his flock. 12. It took about 5 hours walking from the unremarkable inn to reach AREA B. 13. B. 14. The Gates Of Barovia The fog spills out of the forest to swallow up the road behind you. 15. Ahead, jutting from the impenetrable woods on both sides of the road, are high stone buttresses looming gray in the fog. 16. Huge iron gates hang on the stonework. 17. Dew clings with cold tenacity to the rusted bars. 18. Two headless statues of armed guardians flank the gate, their heads now lying among the weeds at their feet. 19. They greet you only withsilence. 20. As you approach, the gates swing open, screeching as the hinges move. 21. Points Of Interest: As I take you all on this journey, I like to provide a littleindependent explorationwhen I can, or when appropriate. 22. This adventure, as it unfolds, will allow you all to explore the world you're visiting at your own pace if you want. 23. From this location, you can explore two points of interest: THE WOODS that surround you, or THE IVLIS RIVER, which is south on the map.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. She looks a little blankly at you, as if she knows you're lying on some level but trying to decide how much, and if she cares. 2. After a couple of seconds she shrugs "Well the enemy of my enemy is my friend, as they say". 3. She chuckles and slaps her large hand on your shoulder. 4. "Now I believe you left a half filled bottle on the bar in there! 5. Can't have that go to waste can we?! 6. Come on, you can regale me with your tales of fighting Xanathar scum!" 7. She pull open the door to the tavern and practically shoves you inside in front of her. 8. It's maybe mid-afternoon at this point but that doesn't seem to bother her. 9. You make your way back to the bar and she refills your glasses .. like all the way to the top this time. 10. She holds up her glass "You first lizard man, then you can tell me about this .. encounter. 11. And I want DETAILS - tell me all of it!!". 12. She laughs loudly drawing a little bit of attention from those around you. 13. You can see some of the other patrons whispering as they watch the interaction between the two of you. 14. You also seen Durnan kind of just leaning back on his bar a few feet away with a grin on his face. 15. You also notice he's already got another bottle out and ready to replace this one when it's empty.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As the room falls completely silent ALL eyes are on the both of you, Zeek and Kriz. 2. Having come into the room and Zeek's balant failed display of belonging you find that Tobias is not alone. 3. In fact you see he's risen from the table holding a glass as if to toast at the farest end of the room from the door. 4. Seated at a long table before him are twelve guests of varying ages which Tobas had taken his place at the head of the interesting laid table. 5. The food you notice seems to be served on two very nude women with a myriad of interesting looking people, all human, seated around the table with their glasses raised too. 6. Most of Tobias' guests are men but there are some women too. 7. They all seem to be dining when you entered quiet unannounced but shockingly most of all you see Nasser seated at the table as well just at Tobias' right hand. 8. Stunned by Zeek's brilliant failure however the half-elf, who met you in the hallway, appears behind you apologizes profusely for your interruption of Tobias' party but doesn't immediately usher you out. 9. "Mylord are these...as these your guests," the half-elf asks anxiously looking at you both before looking at Tobias. 10. Nasser says nothing, he hasn't even made eye contact with you. 11. He sits in his seat like the other guests looking annoyed at your interruption. 12. "I've never seen either of them in my life," Tobias announces with a wave of his bejeweled hand towards the door. 13. "Throw them out," he exclaims next before giving returning to his toast as the half-elf seems to focus for a moment before you hear footsteps coming down the hallway behind you.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Noted! 2. Once you put your hand through the mirage of flooring slats, it vanishes. 3. Now revealed is a small metal safe with runic markings on the door and no typical dial and handle as you expected. 4. Give me an insight check. 5. The lift is flush with the second floor so there's no gap in the floor. 6. It only goes down to the first floor if the rope is lowered from the second level. 7. Just an FYI. 8. Jallmur and Skeekbad, give me a perception check. 9. Yeah. 10. Sorry about that. 11. Skeekbadand Jallmurare locked out of the manager's office. 12. You guys are in the hall or can go into the storeroom. 13. The stairwell begins to fill with a magical fog. 14. The safe is "built" into the floor and cannot be removed. 15. Sweet talking the safe does not seem to work out so well. 16. The runes begin to slowly glow redder and redder...... You're not sure what that means, but it most likely is not a good thing. 17. Less than stellar is more appropriate. 18. Skeekbadtrysher best to hide in the storeroom. 19. She jumps in a crate and wears the lid for a hat. 20. The box is not tall enough so most of her goblin head is visible.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Madame Freona was very happy to see you all, and she says so. 2. To Neya, she responds: "I hope to see you bientôtas well." 3. Leaving the Tea Kettle with their to-go bags, CRAPers go back to their respective beds, be them either at the Laughing Goblin or at the House of the Hand. 4. They each have a pleasant and safe night, waking up ready for the day's mission. 5. The fresh food Madame Freona sent you home with doesn't necessarily keep well like rations would, so you all decide independently that it is best to enjoy it as your breakfast this morning. 6. After some minor preparations, you all meet in front of the House of the Hand and walk together to the northern edge of town, where you can see the treeline that announces the Quivering Forest. 7. The trees rise up before you but look unwell; the shadows seem too deep; the colors too pale; the forest sounds too muffled (nature checks welcomed.) 8. This is very different from what Neya recalls from her last visit to these woods. 9. CRAP is several minutes early, such that only the nobles (Lord Valero Brokengulf and Lady Dala Silmerhelve), their advisors (Senitir and Olisara Lightsong), and their respective retinues are present. 10. There are dozens of lightly armored soldiers here, some emblazoned with the castle-on-the-mountain emblem of House Brokengulf, and others with the armored-jousting-training-dummy of House Silmerhelve. 11. Slowly but surely, all other members of the hunting party arrive from within Phlan. 12. The exception is Seranolla the Whisperer, who approaches from within the forest itself. 13. Lord Valero shouts: "You all know your teams and your missions. 14. Stick to the agreed strategies. 15. Dark times have come to the Quivering Forest. 16. May gods and heroes end the corruption on this day!" 17. He pauses to hear the cheers thrown at him, mostly from the nobles' retinues. 18. He then concludes: "Any questions before we separate into our tactical teams?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Dwaye: 15 Necromancer: 14 Kierro: 12 Erik: 12 Asmodai: 10 Heia: 7 Soar: 6 Dwaye catches up with the necromancer; his first swing of his warhammer misses, but the second makes contact; the necromancer manages to redirect some of the force with a parry from his staff, but still is hurt a bit by the impact. 2. "Get away from me you lout! 3. ", screams the necromancer; he counters with a vampric touch. 4. (Attack: 14 Damage: 13 ) The necromancer doesn't manage to lay a hand on Dwaye's flesh, however, as most of it is covered in armor. 5. Kierro meanwhile says a prayer, blessing the attacks of Soar, Asmodai and Dwaye. 6. (Erik is up next.) 7. The necromancer ducks Erik's bullet. 8. Asmodai fires off an arrow, but misses. 9. Heia unleashes a flurry of blows, striking the necromancer once. 10. Soar strikes the necromancer hard, knocking him back. 11. After catching his breath: "You have no right to judge me!" 12. (It is Dwaye's turn again, then the necromancer's.) 13. (Dwaye is indeed knocked unconscious.) 14. An arrow comes out of the darkness, striking the necromancer! 15. Heia then runs up, finishing him off with a powerful punch to the face! 16. (Combat over.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Cade : It takes a solid hour of going back and forth on the text of the two sheets of paper. 2. Needing them together to figure out exactly what the words are, then comparing them to other texts. 3. Overall it's a rather tricky cypher to break - but not impossible. 4. Of course, knowing celestial does help the letter come to fruition. 5. Once you figure it out, the actual message becomes clear: The Deciphered Message Favors and Crime do not go unnoticed. 6. But we require you to strike out at the local taverns. 7. Protections are down. 8. Should be easy. 9. And for our help, transgressions released and assistance aided on your behalf. 10. More to come. 11. The military scrolls are mostly letters from soldiers writing about what they saw. 12. Dying soldiers last wishes written down by priests to be recorded and not forgotten to time. 13. But, it's this one scroll that he brought over that catches your eye. 14. It's dated from the second year of the war of the Kingdom. 15. Handwritten in a dialect of elf that, while readable, feels older. 16. Some of the accents on the words slightly different. 17. A letter changed here and there. 18. Sasha, I think they were right.The Salais and the ruler of the Noctis are to deep in this war. 19. Pawns trading for now. 20. Yet to see a Rook or a Knight. 21. Took a Bishop. 22. Wasn't worth it. 23. Found something though. 24. In a pawn. 25. Rainmaker. 26. Expect more later. 27. ~Your Obedient Servant~

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Insight A, -1 Insight B 17 ) The quaggoth leveled his gaze at the warlock, not so much intimidated by him as feeling equal, the Lizardman, however, shot raw, adrenaline fueled fear into him. 2. The prince, otherwise would have been too enraged to care, now cowered in the corner, actively avoiding Immo like a dog that had been abused day in and day out by him. 3. The quaggoths left foreleg quaking in pain from the warlocks spell, favoring it heavily. 4. His senses returning, fully cowed, he would say in a quaking, fear filled voice, with dull tones [Elvish] " I.. 5. I'm sorry, I.. whenever I hear someone doubts my heritage, the curse.. takes over, and.. she was so convincing... 6. I thought that.... " for those who could see, a tear would slide down his cheek as his body shook. 7. He said no more. 8. ------ You now find yourself in the very sanctum of the head preistess, and leader of this outpost. 9. What do you do now? 10. There is roughly 45 minutes before the guard post changes. 11. Time is running short.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You finally have everything packed up, have said your goodbyes to Sam and the rest of the folk at the church, and head out of Lovilra. 2. Walking down the main avenue, the city is bustling with life, as people walk hurriedly up-and-down the street. 3. Some carrying sacks of grain, some pulling horses or donkeys behind them, some holding the hands of loved ones. 4. You take in the low hum of city life as you exit through the western gates, knowing you'll be apart from civilization on this scale for quite some time. 5. The gates fade behind you as you walk east. 6. The sun is still low in the sky, but the road out of the the city is mostly wooded once you get a few minutes outside the city wall. 7. Flecks of sunlight hit you as you pass beneath the trees, a welcome bit of warmth on an otherwise chilly morning. 8. Cadmael cruises just above the tree line, scanning the horizons on all sides and taking the occasional break on a high branch and waiting for everyone to catch up. 9. There are initially plenty of people on the road. 10. Traders, farmers, some city guards. 11. Little settlements dot the landscape outside of Lovilra, all of them interconnected with the economy of the city. 12. After a few hours of walking, though, you start seeing fewer and fewer people on the road. 13. An old man rides by on his horse and nods politely, and a few squirrels scurry across the road. 14. Then, you're by yourselves. 15. You find yourselves enjoying the travel, actually. 16. The afternoon wears on, and you exit the woods onto a somewhat less impressive portion of the road. 17. Here it's mostly dirt, but the sun is now at your back and warming you as you trudge on. 18. Eventually you find a few large tree trunks set up in a circle next to a stream. 19. It seems like the perfect stop to break for a bit, eat some of the fresh fruit and bread that Sam gifted you, and rest your feet. 20. Everyone, roll perception checks (including Cadmael). 21. Encounter check: 1

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The human blinks, clearly confused in his stupor, “I’m... sorry? 2. I was just saying you reminded me of him, not like you were him.” From what you can tell, there is only one exit, which is where Ashe came in from. 3. There are quite a few people in there, probably 30 or so. 4. You can see the ceiling, dangling from it are lamps that keep the room lit. 5. You swap your vision a moment too early and slam your knee against the bar. 6. Everyone seems to notice you. 7. However, you can get a good look over the room. 8. What are you looking for? 9. Looking over the room, you don’t see anyone matching that description, nor do you see the cloaks. 10. However, Dahme’dre, you do spot something just for a moment. 11. A tiefling woman over at what looks to be a betting table caught a quick glance at Ashe and looked away quickly with wide eyes. 12. The dwarf nods, “Aye, just keep going past it, there’s another down the hall.”

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Usul isn't able to hide from the guards in his attempt to overhear the conversations, but both he and Sen are able to get some information. 2. Sen would notice that it appears that the guards are giving a hard look to anyone who might be suspicious - anyone who has any hint of being a bandit or mercenary is being questioned about their intentions outside of the city and if they intend to return. 3. They aren't frisking everyone, but they're asking some people about their bags and if they might look inside real quick, all while making smalltalk about their lives in Waterdeep. 4. Usul would notice that the guards are looking for something specific, some kind of information someone might have on their person, a book or a map of some sort. 5. The guards monitoring the side where people are coming into the city have confiscated a number of weapons and magical scrolls, a lot of alchemist's fire, and have mentioned something about rebels several times. 6. (Very good. 7. I imagine him like someone who doesn't want to go through TSA because they're worried about something accidentally getting them pulled aside, but being pushed ahead by the momentum of the line behind them. 8. Like he would be thinking about taking his shoes off the belt and then the TSA agent pushes them through and he has to decide between going through the metal detector or driving home barefoot.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ellis finds a ring of keys attached of Liss'ard's belt. 2. Judging by how many of them there are, and how similar they look, Ellis thinks that they most likely are used to unlock the manacles of the other prisoners. 3. As Darion begins his interrogationand reveals his magic, he intuits the clear thought from Liss'ard, "so you aren't a regular guy at all!" 4. Darion goes through his list: In the sealed room: Weapons, armor... lots! 5. How to get in: Magic lock; impenetrable...password... Don't think it don't think it... agh! 6. "White Feather." 7. (You can tell that he is holding something back here). 8. Beyond the entrance door: Trap doors on the floor to snake pits. 9. Booby-trapped the whole way. 10. Many yuan-ti. 11. Escape? 12. Hah! 13. Underground river: Dangerous! 14. To the south. 15. Secret. 16. Stop thinking Liss'ard!!! 17. (Here again you can tell he is relenting) Teleportation circle: He thinks of the same locations that you have heard of before, but adds one- Slithotep's personal chamber. 18. Liss'ard is always so nervous he will arrive unannounced. 19. When you mention sigil sequence, even though it is technical nuanced magical know-how, he surprisingly knows one... unsurprisingly it is the one that leads directly to the harem. 20. He traces it in his mind and you now know the sequence yourself. 21. He makes his WIS save for the questions he tries to hold back on: 11 right? 22. Daner doesn’t know too much about this device, but the concept of switching on and off makes sense to him. 23. It is currently turned “off” as the Abjuration device is surprising itself. 24. The other option would be to switch all of the beads to the off position, allowing Abjuration magic to be used again. 25. Alternatively, Daner supposes that they could target a specific school of magic in this room if they wanted. 26. He knows that many Yuan-ti have some innate magical abilities, but Daner specifically doesn’t know much about this school or that. 27. He supposes he could simply smash it, but who knows what side-effects that could have?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Lord Holderhek - “Thank you, Rowland. 2. As I said before, he’s tasked with being your guide to the surface. 3. Im trusting you to treat him well. 4. My son when through great lengths to earn the favor required to bring this person to you. 5. I’m sure you’ll find some way to repay him, won’t you?” He asks somewhat rhetorically, believing he already knows this answer. 6. “Moriska, won’t you introduce yourself?” Looking at the middle-aged female Dwarf, resembling nobility and an undeniable inner strength. 7. Moriska Malkin - “ Morista Malkin. 8. I’m a scout and a member of the Emerald Enclave. 9. I come on behalf of King Bruenor. 10. Battlehammer” And she finishes at that. 11. Lord Holderhek - “Thank you, Morista. 12. Ghuldur, please.” And he looks to the aged Duergar for words. 13. Ghuldur Flagonfist - “Ghuldur Flagonfist. 14. Merchant here in the great city of Gracklstugh. 15. Also representative of Mantol-Derith.” Lord Holderhek - “Chief Dormo, my honorable friend.” Looking to the Deep Gnome with sincere friendship. 16. Chief Dormo Diggermattock - “If you are who we think you are, then it is an honor to meet you.” He looks to the adventurers and something within his words stirs you. 17. Lord Holderhek - “Now that we’re all acquainted, tell me...how would you all feel about participating in our first annual Gracklstugh Underdark Brewery Contest? 18. It only involves drinking more than your competition.” Jen looks around waiting for their responses.
Input.Player_Name: Player:Rowland (male unknown race ranger) [ranger is generally good at some of the following skill actions: Animal Handling, Athletics, Insight, Investigation, Nature, Perception, Stealth, and Survival ]

Erevan's spell flies at the last cultist and removes one of his legs at the hip. 7. The smell of charred flesh fills the area as the cultist falls unconscious. 8. WIS (15) saves: Dog : 17 Rhino: 16 Friend Jr.: 20 Bulwark : 11 ( Bulwark has an additional +5 on his save.) 7. Gash's spell is cast with a muffled verbal component and it is cast with a little less power than he intended. 8. Thus, even the rhinoceros is able to resist the magic as it pulses across all of the combatants. 9. ( Tock is up!) 10. Tock's bolt smashes into the fire elemental, piercing it in it's right ear, if it has one. 11. (Martin is up!) 12. Bulwark's eyes lock with a woman standing in the shadows in the hallway he ran through from the kitchen. 13. Seeing Bulwark notice her, she steps into the light. 14. "I should have trusted my initial prediction," she says. 15. "I could have had my meal at home." 16. The woman, Garielle as Martin recognizes her, raises her hands and calls as to the heavens, "Come my children! 17. Feast with me!" 18. DM shield: Bat swarms inbound: 4 Arriving in 3 rounds. 19. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Moving down the tree after a hearty meal as the sunsets the party leaves with the group lead by the tortle, Abraham 'Abe' Seagreen. 2. There are four other tortles, two half-elves, and the party working together. 3. At a large oak disappearing into the thick canopy above them Abe pauses. 4. "At any point we get separated return to the temple on the other side. 5. They will hide you until I can bring you back," he says motioning for all to move together through the shimmering glow emanating from the tree trunk! 6. On the other side the party enters in a nearly silent sanctuary of the temple of Meiliki. 7. Candles illuminate a massive tree that a stone building has been built around. 8. Abe moves through the temple then through a kitchen area where working together he and the three other tortles remove a heavy grate in the floor. 9. "Everyone below and to the right," Abe explains, "quickly now," he ushers the team ahead. 10. Stealth and perception please. 11. There are orbs of light being lit that dance ahead and behind thw party in the sewer.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Renee you are given the medallion that Moop gave the party in the Swordsman before he was killed by the Smoking Mirror. 2. You do not recognize the language written on the rim of the medallion, Modron says the lettering reads "This is the Herald's Key. 3. It opens the door to the Shunned City of Hearth". 4. It looks ancient and the slotted holes seem random and may not be from age, as it hasn't deteriorated the rest of the medallion. 5. Brazzak and Mackenzie, after helping clear some of the bigger rubble ( Both Mackenzie and Brazzak take a point of inspiration! 6. ), head to Arrow Diamond's bedroom. 7. It is a simple bedroom with a large portrait of Mr. Diamond hanging on the wall, a bed, and a night stand. 8. There is a single fur line reading chair, but no books in sight. 9. It is possible Arrow Diamond did not spend much time in this room. 10. On the nightstand sits a small book. 11. You open the book and on the inside reads Arrow Diamonds Book of Contacts: Property of Arrow Diamond and is signed with the large signature of Arrow Diamond...you get the idea he really likes to sign his autograph. 12. Modronexplains what happened that morning with Moop. 13. Roze looks stunned, frozen in place. 14. A few moments pass before she even looks Modron in the eye. 15. "Moop is....gone? 16. I.....I.....if you all don't have any other questions for me at the moment, I would like a few minutes to gather....Moop.....oh, poor Moop...." Roze steps away for a moment to try and compose herself.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Nemeia is very familiar with firearms, as there are many specialized firearms crafters in Crystalhaven especially. 2. They are highly valued as they can be extremely deadly and effective weapons despite not using any magic whatsoever. 3. They are more powerful and have a farther range compared to equivalently sized crossbows. 4. However they are not in common use for two main reason. 5. One is that they require much more expensive ammunition, notonly the metal shot that it uses butalso the explosive powder used to fire it. 6. Two is that they are much more unreliable. 7. The black powder used tends to be unpredictable, even on large scale cannons. 8. On smaller handguns they can backfire easily, potentially breaking the gun itself, sometimes harming the person who fired it. 9. But there is one other thing Nemeia is familiar with. 10. The pirate ship named Iblis. 11. Though you have no first hand accounts, you've heard numerous stories, particularly from some of the merchants that traveled up from Shysari, about the dreaded pirate ship. 12. Depending on what stories you believe, it was said to be the Scourge of the Umbral Gulf, constantly assaulting merchant ship across the Pirate Isles. 13. They are very fanciful stories, so it's hard to know how much of it is true. 14. Everybody roll Perception checks as you move deeper into unfriendly swamp land.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. They all learn that the Durst children were locked up in their bedroom by their parents, meeting their fate via starvation. 2. As they go to exit the room, everyone hears a frail voice shout " Wait! " 3. When everyone turns around to see who uttered this, they found themselves staring at two ghosts. 4. The ghosts of Rose and Thorn Durst hovering over their dead bodies. " 5. You will not abandon us like Mommy and Daddy did! " 6. Rose shouts timidly. 7. With that being said, everyone feels a gust of wind brushing through as the door to the bedroom slams shut. 8. Everyone was in the room except for Urgog. 9. Thorn, the little boy, continues to stare down at his feet as his sister gets abrasive with the party. 10. Rose appears agitated while Thorn stands quiet, lifting his hand to point a finger at the dollhouse. 11. "They locked us in here because they didn't want the monster in the basement to get us. 12. We were hungry and had no food... We died." 13. Rose says with sorrow in her voice. 14. Urgog can make a Sleight of Hand check to see if he can open the door. 15. Thorn eventually pulls his hand down from pointing at the dollhouse and stares at the adventurers. 16. Rose glances at Thorn with a nod. 17. She averts her attention back to the party. 18. "We won't stay here!" 19. Rose shouts. 20. With that being said, Rose and Thorn's body hovers roughly an inch off the floor, and they begin to soar toward the party. 21. Cinna, Eldon, and Kestrell can make a Dexterity Saving Throw. 22. Urgog can make a Strength check to see if he can pry the door open. 23. Xavice doesn't notice anything peculiar about these deck of cards, as they appear to be standard playing cards.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "Bug-a-boo, eh?" 2. The viashino searches his memories, but shakes his head. 3. "Don't think I seen this Simic-y Golgari." 4. Several others at the campfire nod along. 5. They don't seem to remember seeing such a person. 6. Before Klox becomes disheartened, a young human child squeaks, "Yucky bug man! 7. I saw yucky bug man and a beautiful lady..." she wrinkles her nose, "I think she was Boros? 8. Anyway, I saw them go into an old building." 9. She gives you a description of where, but it's more of a landmark based directions instead of concrete ones. 10. "Really? 11. You saw them there, young'un?" 12. The viashino looks grim, "Thinking of it, I seen Golgari-types over there. 13. They doing something sneaky. 14. Feel sad for our brothers, cousin, they don't know bravery like us." 15. Anyone who sees Roya staring at the wall, please feel free to roll Arcana. 16. If you hit a 10 or better, you notice the same.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Barreling into the town gates, Kyros is first to reach Greenest just as night falls. 2. The only light is now from the half moon in the night sky and the fires burning about the parts of town. 3. The combination casts a dim, flickering glow about the scattered remnants of belongings strewn across the streets. 4. Cries can be heard in the distance, seemingly from all directions as theyecho off the stone walls. 5. The great shape of the dragon still soars overhead, its roar threatening various rooftops. 6. There are other things in the streets as well... townsfolk scurry about, carrying prized possessions and bedrolls. 7. A human child runs, wailing, up the Main Street dragging a straw doll. 8. And other things, just as quick, but not running in fear... Town Map (red line is your entrance path): The keep looms above the center of town, and people can be seen filing into it frantically. 9. Please roll insight checks and/or describe your entrance into the town and how you plan to approach!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Estellen, Doc, Jartrin are about 15 minutes away from the camp. 2. Violet is near an entrance on the North side of the camp. 3. Tailine is North-West to West of the camp, trying to get a look in, but with no luck. 4. Quilqwen is somewhere in the camp. 5. The Stone circle is towards the North/North-West of the camp, but not next to the outer wall. 6. After a minute of walking towards the camp from the overlook,all sound is sucked from the air. 7. A force, like a wind but different, veryslightly pulls everyone and everything towards the stone circle. 8. (easily resisted by you, but trees, grass, small stones all get visibly pulled a little) This 'anti-sound wind' persists for ashort while, causing your ears to hurt a little the longer it goes on for. 9. Suddenly it stops, but still no sound is heard and you're unable to make sound. 10. With a massive boom, a massive, constant bolt of lightning strikes the circle. 11. It leaves after-images of cruelty, pain, violence. 12. The images seem to bypass your eyes, causing those feelings to go directly into your brain. 13. The crackling of the lightning is the only sound you hear. 14. After a few moments it's gone, but still no sound. 15. Another few moments go by and the large central stone explodes with another boom, it's fragmentsoutlining an archway which fills up with a blacknessdarker than anything you've seen before. 16. (Estellen, Doc this is familiar...) Sound slowly creeps back, taking a little under a minute to fully return, although there are no longer any sounds of wildlife. 17. Whatever magic that's being used here is far beyond your understanding. 18. Now that most of the camp now stands motionless around the stone circle, the movement of an increasing number of bodies towards the south is now visible. 19. The sound of weapons thumping on the ground begins to fill the air. 20. In time with the thumping, a chant begins "Furtan-Magath". 21. (Estellen, doc, jartrin are about 5 mins away from violet now. 22. Who is next to an entrance on the north side. 23. If you want tailine you will have had time to rejoin with violet.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Mordekai approaches the three. 2. Two are women, one is a man. 3. One of the women looks up at your query, "Pay your tabs promptly and there will be no trouble." 4. She looks back to the other two, dismissing Mordekai. 5. This place is literally NO FUN AT ALL. 6. Kane returns back to Ismark to accept his deal. 7. In continued hush tones he says, "Excellent, then let us be away. 8. The burgomaster of the town was named Kolyan. 9. His daughter, Ireena, is there, I will take you. 10. Come." 11. With a last few sips of the wine, the group leaves the thoroughly disappointing tavern. 12. Ismark is silent as he leads the group down a familiar looking side street and passed the burned out husk of the house the group nearly died in. 13. He leads further down to a weary looking mansion that squats behind a rusting iron fence. 14. The iron gates are twisted and torn. 15. The right gate lies cast aside, while the left sings lazily in the wind. 16. The stuttering squeal and clang of the gate repeats in mindless precision. 17. Weeds choke the grounds and press with menace upon the house itself. 18. Yet, against the walls, the growth has been tramped down to create a path all about the domain. 19. Heavy claw markings have stripped once beautiful finish off the walls. 20. Great black marks tell of fires that have assailed the mansion. 21. Not a pane nor a shard of glass stands in any window. 22. All the windows are barred with planks, each one marked with stains of evil omen. 23. Ismark strides to the front door, knocking on the door, then whispering, "Ireena, it's Ismark, let me in." 24. A quiet voice inside, "Ismark?" 25. The door clicks open and Ismark strides in, holding the door for you. 26. The interior of the mansion is well furnished, yet the fixtures show signs of great wear. 27. Noticeable oddities are the boarded-up windows, and the presence of holy symbols in every room. 28. The burgomaster is in a side drawing room on the floor--lying in a simple wooden coffin surrounded by wilting flowers and a faint odor of decay. 29. Once rushed inside, Ismark closes the door and turns to Ireena, "Ireena, grab some things, we're going to Vallaki. 30. These....kind folk...have offered to escort you there in exchange for information." 31. She looks to the group, curiously pausing on Meepo, and then looks longingly back at her father in the coffin.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Hordkhen vents the last of the life out of the cultist on the ground while making direct eye contact with the other one hiding behind the pillar. 2. Kod, seeing the cultist scum die, rushes the other but misses. 3. The cultist, prepared to attack the dangerous elk but now only engaged with Kod, swings his scimitar at him, twice. 4. He yells loudly toward the interior of the cave.Attack: 12 Damage: 9 MissAttack:22 Damage: 5 Hit, HP adjusted. 5. Then Kamagnicks him with his greataxe. 6. Delirious, Lyria, and Place' are up. 7. Remember, Delirious cannot see the cultist from where he is. 8. 19 Hordkhen16 Kod14 Dragonclaw 1 (Dead)Dragonclaw 2 (Taken 5 damage)13 Kamag11 Delirious9 Lyria6 Place' Delirious is able to angle to a place where he can see the cultist and plants an arrow in his side. 9. Lyria hits with Chill Touch (Which is neither Cold damage, nor a touch attack, go figure) and the cultist starts to wither and look ill. Place' rams into the lone cultist, who does in fact fall prone, not because he failed his save, but because he is dead. 10. COMBAT OVER. 11. All of you wait to see if his yell brought any reinforcements, but it seems to have fallen on deaf ears. 12. The cavern goes much deeper, and the soundsyou hear aredripping water, scratching rodents, scrabbling lizards, and wind moaning across the entrance.The fighting and yellingseems to have goneunnoticed. 13. The ceilings in this natural cavern are 15' high, and natural light pours in. 14. It is the only light source, there are no torches or lanterns that you can see farther in, and it gets dimmer as you go. 15. Map incoming. 16. The area that's revealed is bright light.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Melisana, awake and refreshed, considers Lusith's remark, " In the Moonshaes, further south, torcs are usually the sign of nobility or their druid priests. 2. They aren't used very much in these isles. " 3. OCC: Updated 1st floor map Keestake leads the group out through the back way. 4. Outside, is what once would have been a beautiful garden, but after six decades of neglect has become a jungle of trees, bushes, and flowers. 5. The stone pathway has become buckled by tree roots and vines, making the terrain difficult to navigate. 6. Off to the side is an old well, and over the years Keestake has worn a path from the manor to the well for water. 7. You notice two plants that have similar leaves. 8. The first seems to be a ball like growth with light green, shiney leaves with sharp points. 9. More of a growth in the tree than the tree itself. 10. The second are tall and wide shrubs which seem to have taken over a good portion of the garden. 11. Its leaves are similar in shape and size, but are a deep, dark green.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (We are missing Salem's roll, but in the interest of time I'm going to move us forward.) 2. 4 Your group makes their way quietly through the forest thanks to Daisy's spell. 3. You arrive at the edge of the woods once more and the village looks much how it did when you say it yesterday evening. 4. Even at a distance you can see the figures of creatures patrolling the wall. 5. A huge flock of ravens has settled onto the field, picking at the bodies of the defenders that have been left out to rot. 6. Daisy and Kraerd, the two of you spot what looks like small boat drifting out in the bay. 7. You could easily use the woods as cover to move to a place upstream and out of sight to cross the river if you still want to scout the other side. 8. Kraerd you think you could get the boat without being spotted. 9. If you want to swim for it I'll need an Athletics check. 10. (You aren't too far off from where you heard the song last night)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Matteo/Risha: make their way to the second floor where a copper bartop stands out against dark wooden furniture. 2. Large casts of ale line the wall behind the bar as two bartenders tend to the taps. 3. You see middle class, but older folk enjoying beers as they sit next to a fireplace, or in rocking chairs on the balcony. 4. An eleven bard sits in the corner finger plucking a bass for a relaxed jazz feel. 5. Drax/ Petmorn: You travel up to the third floor where a man in a white coat stands at a podium, “Hello sirs, how many will we be seating tonight?” Once told he brings you to a table in the middle of the room. 6. Room enough for 18-20 tables you see very well dressed couples casually talking and sipping at their drinks. 7. No bar, but waiters come out for each table. 8. The air is filled with the smoke of fine cigars. 9. Aether - you follow Anders and Korven throughout the city as it seems pockets of people seem to move out of the way at the sight of Korven. 10. You walk into a book store, pacing quickly through the store they walk into the back as stairs descend down into a basement leading to an underground establishment. 11. Iron torches line the walls and keep the rooms red and orange. 12. Tapestries line the walls as the walkways branch out over the waterways the run beneath the city. 13. Immediately a flock of people rush towards Korven. 14. He grabs the first and throws the human into the water, grabbing another he forces the person into a back room. 15. Anders turns to you, “ Well I guess he is happy to be home, he will see someone to rid his mouth of the device and be out shortly. 16. Feel free to look around, I’m here if you have any questions.” Anders begins speaking to others in the compound. 17. Looking around it seems like an underground guild hall, hallways stretch outward to who knows what lengths. 18. Men and women walking about, all busy, and purposeful. 19. Given that you’d know there’s things like fences for wares, library, kitchen, practice grounds, etc.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Connak notices the tracks of a large body of orcs, he estimates about forty, moving along the Triboar Trail in the same direction as the party. 2. Once inside Conybery, the tracks seem to diverge with half continuing on in the direction of Butterskull Ranch and the other half veering southward along the trail that exits the town to the southeast towards the shrine of Savras. 3. Connak also notices the tracks of a couple of larger creatures, perhaps hill giants, ogres or half-ogres that also follow the southeast trail towards the shrine. 4. The orc tracks are well over a tenday old. 5. The giantkin tracks are a little fresher, perhaps 7-8 days old. 6. Connak also notices the tracks of several very large rodents, larger even than giant rats. 7. These tracks indicate the group of creatures came up the trail heading away from the shrine of Savras, then continued on the trail leading into the Neverwinter Wood. 8. These tracks are at least a tenday old, and also contain traces of blood that would suggest several members of this group were badly injured. 9. With no dissenting opinions to Barric's recommendation, the party makes camp for the night in the ruins of Conyberry. 10. RANDOM ENCOUNTER CHECK: 4 The next morning, sun breaks over Sword Mountains at 7am.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Krom takes the time to identify the two items found. 2. The small cat's head is aStone of Good Luck (added to Chill's sheet). 3. The sword is a fine piece of workmanship and is a Flame Tongue Greatsword (added to Rekuburk's sheet) Rekuburk: You may choose a command word of your own. 4. I had a bit of fun using Google translate and came up with Vlam (Dutch for Flame) orK'aaba' (Yucatec Maya for flame) but you can create your own if you wish. 5. As if the small stone was destined to be for Chill he feels the power of the item as he takes it his his hands and examines it after Krom lets him know what it is. 6. The black agate stone matches his perfectly. 7. The sword also fits Rekuburk's hands nicely as he lifts it up and gives it a few test swings, the command word for the blade echoes in his mind as he knows precisely how to activate its power. 8. Kazri, meanwhile, is looking out the eastern arrow slits and at first the blowing snow and wind and occasional rain makes it hard to see, but eventually she makes out the shape of the dragon curled up out in the open top of the roof. 9. It looks to be sleeping, the howling wind covering up your sounds within the room. 10. The rooftop is enclosed by a 3-foot-high battlement, except in the corners where the wall has collapsed. 11. Cylindrical stone chimneys jut 5 feet above the rooftop but are too narrow for even Small characters to squeeze through. 12. So I need to know what Aid spells or extra HP is set for each of you so I have HP correct. 13. Right now I only show Krom down 6 hp (unless he healed somewhere and I missed it.) 14. And Rhogar has a morning routine but I forgot what HP gain it gets him. 15. You get advantage on the roll

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The prisoner grimaces sardonically. 2. "I suppose I am hard to recognize in this state," he says. 3. "Yes, I am Sildar," he accepts the handaxes gratefully. 4. "There are likely to be more goblins, though I am not sure exactly how many. 5. But Klarg and his wolf are the biggest threats. 6. Take them out and the others will likely flee or surrender." 7. "I don't know who he is, exactly, other than a thief and a bandit. 8. As for what, he is a bugbear," Sildar says grimly. 9. At Ajax's words, Wagner steps up and sings a soft song with a lilting melody as their hand lays on Ajax's arm. 10. Healing Word : 4 "I am not much use myself," says Sildar. 11. "I will try to watch your backs - Klarg's cavern is deeper into cave system, but he knows you're here, so be careful." 12. ((What is the party doing? 13. Heading for Klarg? 14. Heading outside? 15. Back towards Phandelin? 16. If you are going after Klarg, I need a marching order, please. 17. Sildar will be at the back with Wagner.)) 18. ((Seems like the consensus is after Klarg. 19. Marching order - Ajax/Mulligan, Kai, Wagner, Sildar, Odo.)) 20. Following Sildar's instructions, the party leaves the smelly cavern (6) and heads back down the tunnel. 21. It curves off to the right and leads to a rickety wooden bridge (5). 22. "Klarg's cave is just after the bridge, I think," Sildar whispers. 23. Are you stealthing? 24. If yes, checks, please.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The round so far: Vandar steps forward through the doorway and sinks the tip of his yklwa into the side of the man trying to close the door then quickly lands a kick right on the fresh wound. 2. The man releases the door and doubles over in pain. 3. he is horribly wounded and bleeding quite a bit, he is also left prone for the moment but still alive. 4. Lothar steps forward and brings his massive foot down on the wounded thug. 5. Unarmed attack: 9 (I thought for sure that would finish him however the thug managed to squirm out of the way of Lothar's foot just in time.) 6. With his path cleared of anyone who might take an attack of opportunity, Silas Sprints in between Vandar's legs and taps the unmoving woman with the staff releasing another of it's charges. 7. The woman appears to start breathing again but is still bleeding profusely from her eye. 8. Silas being fully in the room now can see the children still in cages, one on either end of the room. 9. Both children look absolutely horrified by the events unfolding before them. 10. He also sees the remaining Redbrand who has moved into the cage on the south end of the room but has not had time to close the door behind him. 11. The wounded thug is in the spot just north of Vandar. 12. I expected him to be dead when I made the map. 13. Round 2 so far: Silas finds that the woman is unconscious. 14. (To tend to her eye I need a medicine check.) 15. While Tibern's appearance and demeanor are certainly intimidating his voice is drowned out by the children's screams, and the thug seems too distracted by the girl screaming as loud as she can right next to his ear to pay much attention to Tibern.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Sora - Once you recall - or have someone remind you - of the differences between nobles and royalty you'll realize that while "Duke" is a royal title, Hakon himself is not royalty, but a noble instead. 2. You realize that title is probably self applied which tells you a lot about his aspirations. 3. Even so he must have enough pull somewhere to the point that the Royal Quartermaster (who is not a royal themselves but works directly for royalty) still opted to use his preferred - though inaccurate - title. 4. All that aside, he is very genuine about wanting to offer the party a job. 5. And from your personal experiences you're pretty sure that it's not going to be asking for anything illegal. 6. However, despite what he might claim you are absolutely certain whatever this job is will be for his primary benefit. 7. Though that's to be expected whenever a noble hires out a band of adventurers randomly like this.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Despite Adray's (and collective) best effort, there is not much to tell. 2. First two "shadows" are comparably well dressed - it's not even robes in general means of the term, but light armour, completed with full dress a grown humanoid (in this case both were humans) needs and a long cape with a deep hood, hiding the face. 3. All black - the darkest hue that could be managed, except bright red handkerchief they carried in the pockets. 4. The weapon they carried - an assassin weapon: long wavy blades widening at a steeper angle from the edge, designed to leave most painful and bloodiest cuts possible. 5. Both men were again younger then one would expect, as if "guard duty" was the the job for neophytes. 6. The one Adray fought (whose body was floating in the pool now) had the least teared outfit (though, wet). 7. Ordrag was less merciful to his assassin and attacker's outfit is in the bad shape (though cape is fine, if only reasonably soaked in blood). 8. No money, no written instruction - unlike "mage", they were not supposed to entertain themselves in any way on the duty. 9. The secret door in the massage room (not that secret anymore) is unlocked and Polly can not hear a thing through it - just silence. 10. In a bright light, still coming off Choir's shield, you can see that there are no torches around, but quite a lot of aromatic candles and several oil lamps with coloured glass (probably for creating romantic atmosphere). 11. That greenish light that you saw from outside in massage room is not there anymore, well could be the spell of now deceased cultist.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Progress and Fera carefully move towards the tiger, now lowered to the ground. 2. They cut the knots allowing the tiger to get onto its feet. 3. It growls and begins to flee back into the forest. 4. Progress then collects the pieces of rope back together to be mending later. 5. The leader of these fish folk gestures with their trident, speaking again in the Aquan tongue. 6. "There is a number from your group missing. 7. We see by the tracks in the sand. 8. Identify what you are and prove you are no threat to our kingdom." 9. In the meantime, Elyza lets out a relaxing blow of smoke, content with her collected samples of some of the local flora. 10. There are some interesting plants that seem to be similar strands to Evadillian genus, but have varying initial traits most likely due to this world being heavily oceanic. 11. As she is contemplating this, there are heavy footfalls as she sees the green tiger beast rush right past where she was taking a break, barrelling into the undergrowth. 12. Elyza stands up and checks down the way the tiger creature came from. 13. There is just about enough cover from the beach to not get a perfect view, but there is definitely more figures on the beach than the exploration group she came with. 14. The fishlike people, upon seeing the weapons thrown to the ground, seemingly are less on edge, but keep their tridents readied in case it is a double bluff. 15. The spokesman of the group speaks again in the Aquan tongue. 16. "Strange creatures, you will come with us. 17. Our captain will decide what to do with you. 18. Should you resist, we will class it as an act of treason, punishable by death." 19. As Elyza steps out from the treeline, her unique garb billowing smoke from the sides, the figures on the beach grip their tridents stiffly as they point them forward again. 20. Elyza, if you would like to make that Intimidation check, feel free.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Tonk - you run up to the dwarf, give his watch chain a quick yank and it comes unclipped from his coat with ease. 2. You use your forward momentum to throw your weight into him and give him a hard shove. 3. He's a sturdy fellow though and it feels like running into aTree trunk. 4. He looks down and sees his watch floating in the air for a moment before a small goblin man materializes in the space beside him, holding the watch. 5. Tonk - The man the dwarf was talking to sees what happens in front of him and quickly makes himself scarce. 6. The Dwarf man looks at you and smiles, and says in a deep voice. " 7. Hello there little fellow, that my watch you've got there? " 8. Gairlick - you dont know which direction Tonk went, and he hasnt caused enough of a commotion for you to hear him. 9. If you got up on something high you could look around, but as far as you know he's still invisible, its only been a minute or so Chandra, by the time the apples are all cleaned up you feel the Invisibility spell end "Psstt" you hear Ashlee up on the ship trying to get your attention. 10. Tonk are you going back to the group?
