Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Blackport: Leshanna: "Oh! 2. My humble apologies, you have my full attention." 3. He stands up in his chair. 4. "What are you looking for eh? 5. What kind of work do you do- or hey, just throw me an adjective and I'll find something to match your tastes. 6. If I can't find it, I can make it!" 7. There are all sorts of guns, each one unique. 8. There are wide selection of flintlock pistols, the usual weapon for folks around here, but there are just as many weapons you've never seen: long ones, big ones, short ones, really tiny ones. 9. There's a few that look like you could use the as a prosthetic limb, a couple disguised as boots, and quite a bit with sharp implements attached. 10. Rabbit Warren: Orina & Jogs: Hainsley and Beau take you a hole dug into the ground. 11. "This is the most direct path." 12. says Beau. 13. The hole is probably just large enough that a child might be able to squeeze through, probably around 1 foot in diameter. 14. "if you can get through here, even barely, you should be able to go through the dungeon with no trouble." 15. As you shoot him a glance Hainsley says. 16. "Hey, the main reason we can't forage as much is because of the people going through here all the time, so that should solve both problems. 17. Although, I might steal every now and again, I don't know if I could help it; it's way more profitable, and I find it quite thrilling. 18. That won't really matter though, right, since I'll be coming along with you after this, right? 19. The Rosebed: Zacharias: "Precisely, silver is a holy metal, and they detest the stuff. 20. So whoever is making them do this can force the demons to do so, they cannot be controlled through the casting of the spell alone. 21. I don't know if it's to test himself, or if he actually needs the silver for something, but we need to take that into account. 22. Now, anyway, how we meet this man is quite simple. 23. Here are the condtions that must be met: Zachrias;" he pulls out a green figure; "I will need you to get a prize chicken from the market, do you think you can do that?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ok. Lucento, make a Wisdom save (this is commonly called a "Concentration check") to make sure you can keep up the Bless effect, now that you've taken damage. 2. I'll tell you that, because the damage was slight, the DC (target number) of this check is a 10. 3. You do manage to hit him, Kif, with your 14. 4. You've all been rolling so well, you might be under the misconception that they are easy to hit. 5. Which they sort of are, but it's not a gimme. 6. Anyway, you hit, and splinter another one. 7. The door is open, and you are at the entrance of a 10' wide by 5' deep mudroom. 8. There are a few odds and ends in it, and directly across from you is the exterior door, also hanging open. 9. You see nothing outside the door in the gathering darkness, other than, at the far end of the 30' (or so) lawn, the vineyard. 10. Roll a Perception check. 11. On a 15 or higher, read this: You do hear noises outside the winery, as if perhaps something is coming from outside your field of view. 12. It failed its Dex save & its dead. 13. Heaven forbid I roll a number with double digits. 14. :( You can keep moving if you want, to the end of your max. 15. Is there something you want from me?

Even though ideas were discussed, it still seemed no concise consensus about whether the festival will be happening tomorrow. 3. As you all get up, you are greeted by smells of breakfast being cooked downstairs. 4. Betty has resumed her station at the bar. 5. Slag as you make your way back to the smith, you are greeted by Neb. 6. "Well hi there Mr. Slag, what can I do for you this morning, heard you offered to trekthrough the woods and take care rest of those nasty Ice Wolves." 7. Roll for persuasion with advantage

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ismark more drops than loads his pack in the wagon and quickly makes way with Allen to the ornate tent. 2. In transit, he worriedly states, "Then we must make haste. 3. I fear the worst at the very mention of his name." 4. Ben as you wake up, you see Rumble reviewing the map and in discussion with a sleepy Ireena and hungry Graeme. 5. As if on cue, Allen and Ismark hurriedly make way inside the tent. 6. In a state, Ismark rushes to Ireena. 7. With a hand on her shoulder, he asks in concern, "Are you alright? 8. Sir Allen said He was here! 9. We need to go, now. 10. Let's get our belongings together and be to Vallaki before dark." 11. Ireena is instantly awake at the mention of Strahd. 12. With a bolt upright, Ireena looks about nearly confused at the sudden energy and news. 13. Stricken for a moment, she then asks quietly and quickly, "Allen, please. 14. What happened? 15. Where is he? 16. What's going on?" 17. Her eyes lightly watery, she looks to the blue tiefling.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Elmar freezes "Master Gundren..." he spins suddenly and hurriedly shuffles over to your wagon, unties the leather carp covering the goods and begins sifting through the goods, all the while mumbling to himself. 2. He pulls out a wound parchment, unrolls it and stares for a few moments "No, no, no..." he mumbles, shuffling aimlessly further into the storeroom and stopping before a makeshift desk built into the wall with a wooden stool. 3. He turns and sits on the stool and now that he is facing you all, you can see he appears quite distraught. 4. "I should have known.. " he says to no one in particular shaking his head. 5. Elizar you watch him as he sits slumped in his chair, apparently the name Gundren appears to have upset him, with one hand he still holds the parchment before him while his free hand hangs at his side... 6. Suddenly he springs back to his feet, a small loaded crossbow in his free hand, pointed at Elizar's chest. 7. "How is it you came across this cart hmm?" 8. he swings the crossbow towards Cit'rine "i knew from the moment i saw you Darzan that you were no legitimate business man, did you really think i wouldn't recognise this sign?" 9. he angrily shakes the parchment still in his hand towards you and you all see Gundren's insignia scribbled at the bottom of the page. 10. "Well? 11. Out with it! 12. Who are you and why is ityou have this Cart?" 13. he turns back to Elizar "Where is Gundren?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. 3 days. 2. It's been 3 days since you last spoke with Boss Bennet and he gave you your instructions to find the missing cattle and find the rustlers and the ride has been a bit boring, hot and long. 3. You've had to stop several times to stretch your legs, let the horses rest, eat and just move around as to not develop "Saddle Sores" on your hind parts. 4. The mornings have a slight chill to them but the days get a heat about them that you sweat a bit while riding. 5. The nights are dark in the grasslands. 6. Cool breezes cascade across the grassland that cause an almost constant sound of grass rustling that can be a bit unnerving at times. 7. The party has little encounters as they make their way following the tracks of the missing herd. 8. A hawk here and there during the day and mostly crickets at night, though a couple times the howls of a wolf pack can be heard in the distance. 9. It the evening of the 3rd day that you come across the ravine. 10. its about a 14 ft. drop from where you are riding. 11. There is a small faint stream that run the length of the ravine and small juniper trees dot the landscape. 12. You find a way down, your horses eager to get a drink of water when you hear:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J0HgEEY2jtssome 40 yards ahead. 13. Visibility is blocked by underbrush and a couple juniper trees.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. DMs note: I won't make you roll for basic things like carving up a boar, no biggie. 2. (The party rests and enjoys their flame grilled meal of Boar meat.Taking turns on the watch and being generally helpful of one another, the night passes uneventfully. 3. In the morning, everyone awakens bright and early, refreshed and ready to continue their quest. 4. They make their preparations for the day. 5. You are all able to pick up the trail and continue following it without much trouble. 6. The party keeps tracking the goblins for several hours, until they come very close to a clearing a little after noon. 7. Idalie, being a little more nimble than the rest of you, scouts ahead a little and comes back to report what she sees.) 8. (You're all still far enough away from the Goblins where you don't really need to be too stealthy. 9. From the edge of the forest to the Goblins is about 150 feet. 10. From that upper forest to the Goblins it's about 70 feet. 11. I'll say you can get to the edge of the forest unnoticed without having to roll stealth, but if you want to sneak past the edge you're going to have to roll for stealth. ) 12. DMs note: Sorry for borrowing one of your characters, it's just the fastest way to get to the more interesting point of the story. 13. You all are where the word "Party" is on the drawing.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Karl, you've been feeling uneasy since entering the Neverwinter Wood. 2. You didn't think much of it, but now that you've been ambushed, your mind keeps playing out scenarios full of more deceptions and unseen eyes watching you from the shadows. 3. Nif, yourthoughts keep wandering back to the memory you were trapped in back at the fake glade. 4. It was almost as if you were back there in your younger years. 5. The party marches through the forest until it is almost completely dark. 6. The party begins to talk about needing to stop before someone falls in a hole or something when Karl notices a very large dark shape against a slightly lighter dark sky not far ahead and to the right. 7. It looks to be about 100 feet away. 8. Nif stealth:26 DM rollz:2 The party — some very quiet and some not so much — creep closer to the structure. 9. As they get closer, they can see acouple of vertical slits of low light like candles peeking through door cracks and then one larger semi-lit area. 10. Approaching from the west-southwest, and seeing it closer with their darkvision, they see an structure consisting of overlapping towers inwhat appears to be a crumbling state. 11. Adrom studies the lit areas and decides the two verticalareas must be arrow slits and the larger area appears to be some kind of entrance. 12. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Arophanis, while you do convince him that you just want to drink and talk, Frankie is now extremely uncomfortable. 2. He is very clearly unsure of why you want to speak with him so badly and, as far as you know, he has no idea who any of you are. 3. He continues to try and walk away, refusing politely, but sternly insisting he must go. 4. Torke, you kneel down to the man and notice three huge puncture wounds, the size of a hand in width. 5. You attempt to locate the deepest wound... ...and you manage to bring the man out of unconsciousness by pressing on it. 6. The pain revives him for a moment, but the sudden shock quickens his heartbeat and the other stab marks begin to bleed. 7. He grabs your hand, pressing it deeper into the wound and grits his teeth. 8. In between his clenched jaws he utters, "Police. 9. Contest. 10. W-" He then begins to shutter, pushing your hand to the side, opening his jacket andgrabbing something in a pocket on the inside, closing his fist around it tightly. 11. He is unable to remove the item. 12. His entire body begins to shake, and the light fades from his eyes. 13. The man is now dead. 14. A pool of blood is slowly forming around his body, and you are covered in it. 15. The door remains closed.

Triboar Trails runs to the east and to the west from Phandalin, to the west is where you encountered the goblin ambush, before clearing out the caves north of the ambush. 4. It was here that you interrogated a goblin that Cragmaw Castle was to the north east. 5. However, today you are already starting out east of that point. 6. To the north you can see the woods known as Neverwinter Woods. 7. So far you kept away from those woods since leaving Neverwinter several days ago. 8. Although, it is possible that you will have to enter into those woods today. 9. Triboar Trail and Neverwinter Woods run along side each other to the east towards the direction of Wyvern Tor. 10. Knowing all this, you head north from the trail towards Neverwinter Woods. 11. As you continue you, Damain hears voices from somewhere nearby. 12. The guildhall is busy with people and Vanessa seems in her usual rankled spirits! 3. "You four," Vanessa shouts to the party: Harok, Elijah, Milo, and Feldspar. 4. "Ready to work again or are you still nursing your wounds," she teases with a fanged grin. 5. "Yes," Murtin says grinning too. 6. "We have plenty of hopefuls for you to drag through the hills and city to keep alive long enough to join," the halfling asks with a curious expression and steepled fingers. 7. "Are these your friends," Vanessa asks looking over Randall and Oubliette curiously. 8. "Not necessarily. 9. What your party doesn't take simply gets met out to another guild member," Murtin replies. 10. "Yes. 11. Margret and Zurzg, you do realise that the body of King Groll is not there anymore. 11. Nobody, Otrov hands you the whole bag he found, including the coins and all the potions. 12. (Inside the bagyou find 3 small red potions, 1 pale green potion, a scroll, a map, 220 silver and 160 electrum pieces) You are fairly certain that the red potions are healing potions. 13. Margret, Gramm was the hobgoblin leader, he was the one you striped for the armor. 14. Otrov, i assume the room west you are talking about is the one where you found Gundren in. 15. Long rest: while Gundren is in dire need of one, you are not. 16. You can only benefit from a long rest once every 24 hours. 17. It is only around midday at the moment. 18. If you want to search more, roll me an investigation check.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Roux, you silently open the well-oiled northeastern door and beyond it you see a well-made dining room.The centerpiece of this wood-paneled dining room is a carved mahogany table surrounded by eight high-backed chairs with sculpted armrests and cushioned seats. 2. A crystal chandelier hangs above the table, which is covered with resplendent silverware and crystalware polished to a dazzling shine. 3. Mounted above the unlit, marble fireplace is a mahogany-framed painting of an alpine vale. 4. The wall paneling is carved with elegant images of deer among the trees. 5. Red silk drapes cover the windows, and a tapestry depicting hunting dogs and horse-mounted aristocrats chasing after a wolf hangs from an iron rod bolted to the south wall. 6. Aka, beyond the door on the western wall is anoak-paneled room that looks like a hunter’s den. 7. Mounted above the fireplace is a stag’s head, and positioned around the outskirts of the room are three stuffed wolves. 8. Two padded chairs draped in animal furs face the unlit hearth, with an oak table between them supporting a cask of wine, two carved wooden goblets, a pipe rack, and a candelabrum. 9. A chandelier hangs above a cloth-covered table surrounded by four chairs. 10. Two cabinets stand against the walls as well. 11. (The double doors or the single door on the right?)

"Looks like our new monk friend was right." 4. The rest of the party follows suit, putting out their torches and dispelling their magic. 5. Carefully making their way down the stairs, Burik and Effort lead the way with their darkvision. 6. It's still incredibly dark, and the stairs only present themselves in shades of dark gray and black. 7. Still, you all make it to the bottom safely, refinding Kurama and Cadmael at the bottom. 8. Burik quickly casts light again on his hammer. 9. You all look around for a moment. 10. You're in another stone room at the bottom of the stairs. 11. This one looks even less refined in its work and carvings. 12. There is a very basic archway above the doorway to the stairs, and at the opposite end the room slowly widens until it splits into two halls. 13. You can see, even from here, that each leads to a room not far down. 14. Kurama reveals that there's a faint musty smell coming from the room to the left. 15. He hasn't picked up anything coming from the right. 16. No sounds and no movement in either direction.

[Note: I’m only going to ask “HDYWTDT?” for major enemies (and for the first PC kill of the game), though if people would prefer to narrate this for regular enemies as well, let me know in the group chat.] 5. Maltake’s eldritch blast goes wide. 6. Creature S5 attacks Cuhnus (Mi3) who is hurt (so it has advantage on both attacks) bite Attack: 13 , Damage: 3 and spear Attack: 17 , Damage: 4 Cuhnus is down. 7. Strenvon ( Mi1 ) moves up to creature S4 and swings his sword with two hands on the creature: Attack: 5 , Damage: 5 Miss At the top of the next round, you all feel an aftershock rock the village. 8. Anyone who wants can make a DC10 perception check. 9. The accommodation part of the Riptide Inn and Tavern starts to crumble further and the roof of the tavern part shifts. 10. Ervalin makes a DEX save 14 Ervalin remains standing AND on the roof. 11. The crowd has totally dissipated, with people having either run for the assumed safety of the square; having run for the bridge to the north of the island or having run to the docks to try to escape the island on the one of the twocaravels or two skiffs. 12. Laire and Oden are up. 13. I’ll post a map in a bit, though Laire only has line of site on S7, Oden could shift 5ft into the water to have line of site on S1. 14. There are also non-combat options.

(I actually don't know if anyone searched steve lol. 3. We're well equipped." 9. The room contains every item from Chapter 5 of the Player's Handbook weighing 70 pounds or less, armor of varying sizes, instruments, tool kits. 10. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Combat Order: Nixco... throws a stone imbued with magical energy at the frog, hitting and dealing 10 damage. 2. Kane... casts Fire Bolt , hurling a more of fire at the frog, dealing four damage. 3. Giant Frog... As the giant frog climbs out of the pool, it is instantly met with a rock and fire, and looks extremely hurt as both attacks land. 4. The frog very quickly turns around and dives back into the pool. 5. It is in no shape to continue fighting, so it retreats. 6. Cade... make your action, although if you wish to end combat, you can do so. 7. Cade, you successfully convince the frogs to not attack you. 8. The rest of you can now safely cross the pool - how do you do so? 9. (As a reminder, the room you are in features a frigid pool and a 25-foot long wooden beam that is resting against the western side of the cave wall. 10. There isn't much else inside, save for a few rocks.) 11. You all make your way safely over the beam, and onto the other side of the pool. 12. Those of you with darkvision (I don't believe anyone has a light source, which will hinder you moving on), you see the cave splits into two rooms - on the left, the cavern reeks, and smells of bat guano; on the right, you see a long hallway leading into a bigger cavern.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Merric... You pick up a book from a shelf. 2. ....is that a hand on your shoulder? 3. Something deep in your instinct for survival tells you not to turn around. 4. Lia walks over and moves into the spot behind Merric, waving her hand through the area. 5. "Nothing is there." 6. She tells Merric. 7. The feeling of a hand stays on Merric's shoulder for a long few more moments, then gives him a squeeze before moving away. 8. Kale, you spot a small rat sitting on a bookshelf, the rat nods to you and points directly at you. 9. It stays like that for a long moment, then scurries away. 10. It looks very much like the rat who did that to you previously.

"When the Arch Witch returns, all the hags and fey will benefit. 4. She will bring us power, knowledge, and domination over the lesser beings. 5. You could be one of us. 6. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You all quicken your pace a little bit. 2. Velfrim, we'll say you're riding in the wagon for this. 3. Velfrim's raven Huggin leaps from his shoulder and shoots up into the sky! 4. Heading eastward towards the town. 5. You all see Velfrim's eyes go blank as his senses are transferred to that of Huggin's. 6. Huggin flying about 20' off the ground knows to stay within range of Velfrim. 7. Velfrim, what you and Huggin see, now that you're all a little closer to town. 8. The town is actually just over the next hill rise and you see smoke coming from inside the town proper. 9. There is no sign of anything in the sky as of right now, so you're not sure what Mopham saw exactly, but one things for sure the town looks to be in distress! 10. last post from me tonight... Flynn and Sevrn leave Velfrim and Mopham behind with the cart. 11. Using the smokey haze and the darkness of night they're both able to creep right into the outskirts of the village along the stream. 12. As you both get closer, using a thick set of bushes along the river, the vague "dots" you all saw running around turn out to be Humanoid creatures dressed in robes followed by Kobolds! 13. Some look to be trying to start more fires while others seem to be entering and exiting homes. 14. When they exit their hands are full of items that look to be of some value. 15. Huggin fly's in towards the scouting party members. 16. Huggin catches a glint from Sevrn's raised sword and swoops down towards him, landing on one of the bushes near him and Flynn. 17. About how long did you two observe the "goings on" in town Sevrn and Flynn?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Back in the necromancer's lair, Tafod recovered his axe and Bram found all of his bolts. 2. Tafod has three black dragon fangs. 3. The group decides to spend the night so they can fully recover from their wounds. 4. You leave early in the morning, retracing your steps back towards Albridge. 5. When you pass through Marl, the yeastlike scavengers you met before are no longer there. 6. You're a few hours from Albridgewhen the galloping hoof beats of a lone rider echo from the road ahead of you. 7. A moment later, a young halfling woman on a small riding horse comes into view and reins in nearby. 8. “There you are!” she says. 9. “Dar Gremath said you might be around here somewhere. 10. I’ve got an important message for you: The Iron Circle’s army is getting ready to march against Albridge! 11. Nazin Redthorn’s called in all his raiding parties, and he’s going to try to stomp us out once and for all. 12. Dar Gremath’s sent word for all the loyal Harkenwolders to come to Albridge and stand up to the Iron Circle. 13. There’s going to be a big battle! 14. He asks you to hurry back to Albridge to help out, as quick as you can!” Each one of the group helps with the preparations in their own ways. 15. Mostly they're successful, but neither Tanisar nor Quyst can bring themselves to be particularly intimidating. 16. (9/10 successes, 2/3 failures so far.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Valor & Finn "Then it's up to the Madam Borathys!" 2. Edelina rearranges some things on the desk haphazardly, then clears her throat and performs the same tapping she did earlier. 3. Once again, a ball of crystal flickers into existence, floating between her, and Valor this time. 4. "Just think of the hero you dream to be, Valor Borathys. 5. Keep a hold of her in your mind, and then press your palm to the crystal, whenever you're ready!" 6. Finn , you see that the line is getting closer to an end. 7. The Green Robes are each busy with the next applicants, including a halfling who looks about ready to come your way, and another half-elf man wearing cleric's vestments. 8. Beyond those you can tell that the line is long enough to perhaps be another hour of wait time, but surely not much longer than that. 9. Finn ,you are currently free to explore the library, observe your surroundings, or interact with your fellow player-characters. 10. Choose: > Roll an Investigation check to explore. 11. > Roll a Perception check to observe. 12. > Post freely to socialize. 13. Gallias The Green Robe chuffs at your statement and shakes his head somewhat as he fills in a bit more on the parchment. 14. "We should hope not-- But I can't say there's no chance at all. 15. Hero work is dangerous work after all." 16. The man shrugs somewhat, "Just filling in some blanks." 17. The man scruffs his beard a little, smoothing it down as he thinks, "Guess that'd be the last of it. 18. You can head on down to Winfield, now. 19. She's the older broad with the goose-hair, down at the end. 20. You can head over now and get in the next line... 'Less you have any questions, that is." 21. Up ahead you see the woman the Green Robe is speaking of. 22. A half-elf with a lute stands near the desk she's at, as well as a tall and well-muscled human woman.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Above the water, Graeme and Allen approach the beastial man. 2. Allen calls out, catching the man's attention further. 3. The man's wolf-like eyes shine as he barks a response that's part animal and part common, "Leave now. 4. I do the spirit's work. 5. None for you." 6. The man kicks up a vicious looking spear before spinning it around in a warrior's flourish. 7. The bladed tip serrated, the back of which splitting off into three metal prongs. 8. The spear's haft adorned with a long chain that falls back into the boat with plenty extra length to spare. 9. Graeme, being familiar with the sea, and those that frequent it, you know the weapon is a harpoon. 10. This weapon is designed to impale it's prey, where the prongs latch on like hooks in the victim's flesh. 11. The wolfman declines to answer Allen, standing at the ready should the need arise. 12. Meanwhile, under the water's surface, Rumble deftly slices open the sack to reveal a young girl with raven black hair and contrasting porcelain skin. 13. Aside from the simple rags she is wearing, there's an opulent coloured bandana tied in her hair to create a ponytail. 14. She's struggling and flailing fast, clutching at the monk with wild hands and wide eyes. 15. Her weighing you down takes a bit of effort, but it's nothing you can't handle. 16. As you break the surface, she coughs hard repeatedly in attempt to clear her lungs. 17. Not far away stands the man on the nearby boat. 18. Of which, Rumble, you can now discern is a beast man. 19. The man howls loudly again; a sound so loud you can feel it reverberate in the water around you. 20. Everyone, let's roll initiative.Allen, if you'd like to cast your spell, I will allow before initiative since you had it in mind before things got started.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ed, doing his best to figure out what's in the river takes a few solid minutes tilting his head this way and that but he can't discern what it is. 2. He's met with limited success as it's still a ways upriver (maybe 200') and the light is fading fast. 3. It's oddly shaped, almost like a big pointed boulder with some trees stuck on it but it looks wrong for that. 4. The shape doesn't look natural. 5. As everyone closes in towards the river to search for clues Viscous takes up a guard position and Esmee melds into the surroundings on high alert. 6. Eikis trying her best to solve the mystery is rewarded with finding some clues on the river bank wedged up against some of the rocks. 7. There's a chunk of flat wood about 2' long and 10' wide that's squared off on one end and broken on the other, and a section of rope hung up on a boulder with the rest trailing away downstream. 8. As Esmee continues her prowl she notices some sounds barely reaching her over the sound of the water coming from the structure. 9. It's faint but she hears some squeaking hisses. 10. It sounds like mice or rats but for her to hear it from this distance there would have to be a whole lot of them or they would be the biggest mice or rats she's ever heard. 11. Eikis, one side of the rope comes up easily, it's about 20' of it. 12. The other side is difficult to pull. 13. It's stuck or there's something attached to it. 14. Give me a strength check.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gruk hesitates, looking to B'ark to see what she recons, since this is primarily a tactical decision. 2. She slowly shakes her head, knowing that time is running short and that once arrows were flying, it would be too late. 3. Putting on a determined visage, the Professor parts the leaves in front of him and steps confidently towards the camp, making sure to be loud and obvious, and outstretching both his hands. 4. You know from your studies that lizardfolk are cold hard survivors, that only gather in communities because of the added chances of survival given greater strength in numbers. 5. Approaching so confidently would give most of them pause, since they would assume he held some secret power that protected him. 6. The Professor can't help but notice a little trembling in his voice at first, but quickly forces the fear back inside. 7. Lizardfolk can smell adrenaline, and it would tell them that he was in fact unarmed and afraid. 8. As soon as he started speaking however, he saw a section of the thatched roof on two of the flanking houses lift up, and a lizardman with a loaded crossbow and a female lizardfolk with a half-drawn bow motioning him to stop. 9. Even through the arcane comprehension, you can make out the typical clicks and whirrs of the draconic language, though their version has a different lilt to it. 10. ""Hold there, Meat with Glasses! 11. Why do you come to this village?" 12. --------------------------------- Berrus, as you approach the statue, you can tell that it is made from a different, likely volcanic rock, meaning its contours have been preserved far better than the nearby rockface.You're quickly removing the lichen and moss that has covered about two thirds of the statue, to reveal a small statue of a crouching humanoid figurine with a beard, decorative headgear fitted with plumes, and large earrings. 13. Roll a history check, if you want to find out more. 14. "Why does Meat with Glasses care for Lizardfolk? 15. We have tough skin and sharp teeth, your flesh is soft, and your nails brittle. 16. We can take care of ourselves, even as hatchlings. 17. What news are these?" 18. The questions come from the female lizarfolk, while the male is keeping you in his sights. 19. You spot two more roof sections being raised, with the guards carefully scanning the nearby foliage for any other creatures nearby.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Elwin and Sir Banith pass each other without a hit once more. 2. Turning, Sir Banith waits for the signal, and charges again. 3. Sir Banith's attack: Initiative: 6 ] Attack: 5 ] Save, if needed: 16 (Everyone is pretty much having three opponents to defeat, so one more after this guy, if you win.) 4. _____________________________ Raven's fierce secret attack is so devastating that the Duchess (within 4 HP of her life) instantly yields. 5. She gives Raven a sour look as the healers patch her up and pyrotechnics shoot up over the area. 6. The announcer calls out, "Raven Blackblade eliminates the Duchess Mellivanda! 7. RAVEN BLACKBLADE WINS THE MELEE FREE-FOR-ALL!" 8. ---------------------------------------------- The gravity-battered druid succumbs to the spray of acid. 9. Heck, he was in such bad shape that Henry could probably have taken him out with a feathery head-butt. 10. As Billy Weston falls face-first to the flagstones, Quentin finds himself de-whaled. 11. He still has a strange craving for fish, though. 12. The ritualists take you away to restore your spellcasting energies, as the healers pump Weston full of healing. 13. In time, you are led back to the arena. 14. Your final opponent is there, a figure swathed in a loose black cloak, so that you can have no idea of their true appearance or form, arms crossed over its chest and foot tapping impatiently. 15. You hear the wizard announcer call out, "For the championship: Lord Quentin Adiyodi of Ellantar vs Stormshade the Tempestuous!" 16. Stormshade is preparing a spell practically before the announcement is finished. 17. Roll initiative! 18. Stormshade: 9 Dex save vs Henry: 9 Shrugging off the damage, your opponent rushes toward you. 19. When fifteen feet from you, the air around the hooded figure erupts into a huge explosion of flame! 20. FIREBALL! 21. for 36 Dex save vs DC16 to take half damage. 22. Henry, fortunately, was not following the enemy closely enough to be caught up in the flames...this time. 23. The cloaked figure at the center of the blast seems untouched by the flame. 24. (BTW, we never discussed dimensions of the playing field, I think? 25. It's a 100 foot wide circle, the two of you started 50 ft apart, 25 feet from the center, 25 feet from the wall. 26. Unless I said something different before that I've forgotten in all the crazy tournamenting.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Nemean Perception: 12 Sildar assists Tochi in carrying the slumped, bound form of the dark elf toward the cavern to the east. 2. The ropes are still attached to the lip of the rift, and Nemean climbs down with ease. 3. However, he finds nothing of interest in the hour that he searches and digs through the rubble in the massive rift. 4. Through it all, the dark elf remains unconscious. 5. "Any luck, Nemean?" 6. Sildar calls down. 7. Roland Perception: 20 Taking the light source from Tochi (leaving him and Sildar in the darkness of the cavern above), Roland is able to cover more ground with Nemean below. 8. Near the end of the first hour, the rogue finally discovers something other than water and stone; a crushed skeleton of a dwarf, hidden from view by a pile of sediment near the northern end of the rift. 9. Though it ordinarily might not be noteworthy, a reflection from something buried with it gleams from the lantern light, and Roland digs out the rest of the skeleton to find it still wearing a pair of gauntlets that have survived the ages. 10. The gauntlets are dusty, but still look flawless in their crafting. 11. If nobody claims the gauntlets, they will be left here in the rift.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (I moved to a different city so I don't have my computer with me right now, I won't be able to provide an image of the hallways and the...basement... Area, but I'll do my best to describe it thoroughly) You can walk 10 ft before you reach a wall that only goes north (10 ft) and south (25 ft). 2. Bukowyr would be able to see that following the north path the East wall has an opening (entrance without a door to another area) and two entrances on the south (one to the east and one to the west) if you decide to walk all the 25 ft to the south you'll reach an open area and to the north a corner that extends the hallway to the west. 3. The whole area is unlit The tunnels are 4 feet wide by 7 feet high with timber braces at 5-foot intervals. 4. Rooms are 8 feet tall and supported by thick wooden posts with crossbeams. 5. As you move through this place , you'll foosee human footprints in the earthen floor leading everywhich way. 6. (everyone, go ahead and take an inspiration!)

(Sorry for the long silence, the 999th level of the abyss known as "Restaurant Week" has come to my town) The caravan leaders looked concerned over the news of the farmsteads. 2. It seems your path is taking you east and deeper into the forest. 5. As promised, the provisions you requested plus some items you might need on the mountain." 6. There are 3 sets of climbing kits. 7. Beyond the burning vale of the farmsteads, the mountain known as Stone tooth rises up. 8. This is the general layout of the approaches to the mountain where the orc are coming from. 9. I am pretty much looking for the "How do you want to do this?" 10. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Despite the best efforts of the dragonborn, there is nothing to see that wasn't already apparent in the main forge. 2. The area was damaged immensely from the creatures attacks, though it seemed to have avoided damaging the area directly behind where it had been before. 3. As Root goes into the door where Fallan had peeked in before, on a table higher than the halflings head, Root spots as he continues to look around, he see's a Mace lying on the table, next to what appear to be blue-prints or plans, or some other similar sort of paperwork. 4. The mace had a head shaped like a sunburst, tiny spikes in the shape of a drawn-sun in jagged edges. 5. It is made of solid brass, and the entirety of the weapon appears like the rising orange of the early morning sun. 6. On the sheet though much of it was faded, the words "Lightbringer" were written in bold at the top in both Common and Dwarvish. 7. Next to it, though layered in dust, is an intricate Breastplate, a gold-dragons head features prominently, in the act of using its breath weapon, surrounded by blackened leather. 8. It left many parts of the body exposed but looked easy to move in. 9. Its sheet said "Dragonguard." 10. Though neither of the items descriptions remained legible enough to read as it was all small scribbles, though an attempt could be made to glean enough to piece it together. 11. There seemed to be other similar sheets but they had faded and rotted away, it seemed these were the last two items made before the mine fell into ruin.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. With ease and finesse, Zakon is able to unlock the door. 2. Stepping in, it feels a little underwhelming after everything else you've seen so far. 3. A couple of small wooden desks line the walls of this dusty chamber, with blank paper neatly stacked to one side. 4. In one corner of the room sits a small ironbound chest. 5. There is another door at the other end of the room. 6. The door in the back of the room is unlocked. 7. Since you know that this door and the other two on this floor are unlocked, the only logical conclusion is that it must go to something upstairs. 8. In the meantime, peeking into the next room, you see a set of rotten couches and meditation stools arranged haphazardly around this room, while light streams through the dirty windows.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The little boy holds the necklace protectively, “I was planning to give it to ma Ma, as a gift,” he says nervously, clutching the necklace. 2. As the noble woman is touched on the shoulder she looks down towards Mairi and says “You touch me again, I’ll have you fined for assaulting a noble, hmm,” the figure says. 3. She looks away with a sharp turn of the head, looking down her nose but not in your direction anymore. 4. The Guard Tyrus approaches says “I’m not the sergeant, his on his way. 5. I am constable Peters, and the sarge will want to know that - he’ll also have questions for any of the witnesses. 6. Is this your tavern?” he asks Tyrus, pointing to the Abandoned Dragons tavern. 7. The child nods and takes the gold, offering the necklace in exchange. 8. "You have offended me, and I will tell the watch, unless you have a badge, I do not need to speak to you," the noblewoman says after turning around to address you as you ask the question, and continues walking away from Mairi as she gets called over by the rest of the group.

Demons naturally come from the Nine Hells, but some of the creatures conjured... appearedto have undead qualities and were... shrouded in darkness, perhaps some came from Shadowfell. 8. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Khan and Scab continue forward to the unnatural grove, leaving Fallion, Slurb, and Limine to talk. 2. Khan tries his best to creep forward along the river bed, but accidentally steps into a patch of sticky mud. 3. As he tries to pull his foot out, with great effort he also unearths a decomposed skull! 4. Khan realizes thatsunken beneaththe silt are a number of bodies- there must be a reason that few dare approach this location. 5. (Khan gains 1 Stress.) 6. Scab ignores the sense of dread in the air and sneaks into the grove. 7. As he does so, he takes a closer look at the twisted trees that form the clawed hand. 8. During his in the Corrupted Forest, Scab's seen a few areas like this. 9. These were places to avoid, containing terrible things and surrounded in rumor. 10. He outpaces Khan and enters the grove alone. 11. Inside, the trees form a small clearing. 12. He sees five grave-stones, covered in moss and rot. 13. The kobold realizes the neatly carved names of the grave stones have been wildly scratched out and replaced. 14. In fact, the graves seem to have been shoved into the ground. 15. Five names are gouged in the stones: (Left to Right) Father, Mother, Me, Husband, Lisa A chill is in the air as the sun finally sets- a full moon rises in the sky. 16. Fallion and Khan are still able to see with the light spell. 17. Far away in the direction of town, a shrill scream can be heard. 18. A terrible, tormenting din filled with pain and longing, the sound seems to strike deep into one's soul, despite the distance from it's origin. 19. (Since no-one has actually said they had put on ear-plugs, Everyone please make a DC15 WIS Save or take 1 Stress.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Liet extends his hand, an arm finds its way around his neck, and pulls him to his feet. 2. The grip on the arm choking Liet is tight, cutting off any airflow. 3. The man in front of Liet, Albert, jumps to his feet, simultaneously pulling out a dagger that was hidden in his clothes. 4. Albert looks Liet in the eyes. 5. "I don't want your life," The man snarls. 6. "Just your mon.... just your... money..." The man's eyes roll back into his head, his eyes flutter, and he takes a knee. 7. "Al!" 8. The man holding Liet calls. 9. Deafeningly loud in his ear. 10. "Get up!" 11. 16 Con save against passing out. 12. Albert shakes his head, and when he does something odd happens before Liet's eyes. 13. The man's entire appearance changed. 14. Face, hair, and even his clothes are now different. 15. What once appeared to be a normally healthy average traveling man, now appeared to be a malnourished, pale, sallow skin, sunken eyed shell of a man. 16. The man has armor on that is two sizes too big in some places and two sizes too small in others. 17. Blood trickles down his mouth, eyes, and ears, but just a little. 18. His eyes, previously stern for his intent, are now wild with panic. 19. "I told you it was a bad idea Al! 20. I told you!" 21. The man screams. 22. 18 . 23. ((The group can hear the shouting)) "We just needed..." Albert stands on shaky legs. 24. "Just needed a little... more time." 25. 19 ((If the group sprints, we'll say they can make it to the camp in 30 seconds.)) 26. Despite all odds, Liet struggles against his assailant, and manages a few gasps of air and maintains consciousness. 27. Roll perception again Kev. 28. Also, what do you do? 29. What is everyone else doing now that they've heard shouting?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Looking rather affronted, "I'm sorry you feel that way sir. 2. All of my books are 25 gold. 3. And every bookstore in town charges the same, the prices are set by the guild. 4. Some books may be higher if there's something special about them but 25 gold is the minimum allowed by the guild. 5. Perhaps you've never scribed a book before. 6. It's quite labor intensive." 7. When you inquire about books on Drow Urza lets you know that she has is a children's book warning of the dangers of Drow and a book about the adventures of Drizzt Do'Urden. 8. In regards to the Undermountain she tells you that she has multiple books about the history of the Undermountain. 9. When asked, she claims that, to her knowledge, there's no complete guide or map to the Undermountain as the knowledge is too valuable for anyone to want to share but that she has heard that some folks have taken to selling maps to small sections. 10. And, again, the books are 25 gold each or 5 for 100 gold.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Toonary) No Strength Check required. 2. The Party makes it through the opening, and thanks to Seethe'sWater Walkingspell, you shoot to the surface. 3. Quickly, you put some distance between The Emperor of The Waves, and the Kraken ripping it to shreds. 4. Spotting the row boat from the Soul of Winter you shout to get the sailors attention. 5. Twenty minutes later you stand on the Deck of The Soul of Winter wrapped in a warm blanket, watching as the Kraken drags The Emperor of The Waves to a watery grave. 6. After iboth Ship and Monster have disappeared , there is a few moments of silence. 7. Then Captain Windrune begins to shout commands at his dwarven crew, and soon The Soul of Winter is underway back to Saltmarsh, and your Patron, Lord Aubreck. 8. Epilogue: Lord Aubreck is so overjoyed at the return of his property that not only does he pay the 10,000 gold piece fee, he also uses his influence among his fellow merchants, to grant a 15% discount on goods and services in Saltmarsh. 9. DM: Each Character gains 1 level. 10. Each Character has 180 days of Downtime. 11. (Use XGTE for Downtime. 12. Remember a week on Faerun is 10 days.) 13. Once Downtime is finished we'll continue the adventure. 14. Thanks for sticking with me.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. So, things might not have been clear from the map, but Kalmar and Ringo/Fluttercloak started combat ~30-40 feet from each other, Kalmar at the loading door, and Ringo/Fluttercloak at the front door/window. 2. Here's where things stand prior to Ringo's turn: Kalmar and Ringo, now that you've burst into the warehouse, you see the one lazily hid Kenku, figuring the others made it further into the corners of the room. 3. Now that you're fully in the warehouse, you both see that there are around a dozen corpses strewn against the walls, their rapiers and daggers lying nearby. 4. On the north side of the room, stairs rise to the second level. 5. Seeing the assailants enter the warehouse, the one kenku you can see rushes forward, trying to slash at Ringo with its shortsword. 6. Attack: 18 Damage: 9 Fluttercloak ducks under the arrow, while Kalmar shrugs the meager blow off with his armor. 7. Ringo and Kalmar are up! 8. Kalmar, you hear a screech, not from the kenku you just slew, but from his two fellows as the witness how fast he was cut down. 9. Feel free to describe the fatality. 10. Kalmar, your throat itches, as does your bloodlust. 11. Ringo is up! 12. Ringo and Kalmar are back up, but we're gonna transition out of initiative for now.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rosli walks in on the scene. 2. (Feel free to come in and join) Ren looks down shamefully at the blankets which she has bunched up in her fists. 3. "I don't have the answers you seek. 4. My name is Ren. 5. I come from a fishing village up north on the coast. 6. One day my travels led me too far in to the forest when I lost track of time and night time caught me in the woods. 7. I was lost and became trapped by giant spider's webs when a Bugbear tracker came across me. 8. The spiders were no match for him and he took me. 9. I thought of him as a saviour until I realised that I was his slave. 10. He kept me and brought me here. 11. To the guild. 12. He traded the silk for his stay and then he came. 13. A stranger who said he came from the desert. 14. He begun stirring up trouble and recruiting the more questionable hunters in the guild. 15. He took one look at me with his cold, scheming eye. 16. That eye... His other had a patch over it. 17. They took me. 18. They took me to a hide out they have constructed not far from here. 19. From what I can tell, their plan was to overthrow the Guild- until they got word that you had arrived. 20. They threatened my life. 21. They made me work for them as an informant and- and I just want to get out. 22. I want to get home, but I-- I can't. 23. I don't know anything about you and i didn't trash your room personally. 24. I didn't mean for it to happen. 25. They know about you, Cora. 26. I don't know how." 27. The following words trigger something very uneasy inside of you. 28. "He said his name was Aerik."

The one who is almost dead tries to flee at full speed provoking an opportunity attack from Mystwaen. 10. (Roll for another attack on him as he flees since he didn't disengage) One of the fresh bandits attacks Myst with it's scimitar - Attack: 14 Damage: 5 One squares off with Edith -Attack: 12 Damage: 5 The last moves up to Charisma andAttack: 10 Damage: 4 (They all rolled like crap. 11. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Banjo man finally collapses, and the shadow melts away. 2. A ghost arises from the corpse; the real Banjo Man. 3. "My very existence was stolen by a fiend seeking the death of my friend Grigor. 4. Before I ascend into the afterlife, I must tell you that Elroy the Janitor still lives; he hides somewhere on the isle of dread beyond this portal. 5. By killing the demon wearing my skin, you have halted the corruption of this place; but you have not fully cleansed it. 6. Even before Grigor's disappearance, this place was invaded by demons and such. 7. As a final tip, any of you with bardic talents, please take my banjo." 8. His spirit wisps away, looking at ease. 9. all 1st level characters are now level 2. 10. You earned this. 11. Level 3 characters don't gain any levels yet. 12. The banjo lays upon the ground, awaiting it's next master.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Quillary watches Jorin climb, then smiles, amused but not mean, as Drusk attempts and stumbles. 2. "Here, I have an idea." 3. She doffs her small pack, unties the 50' of silk rope she has, and tosses it to Hildigrim. 4. "Hold on to that, then climb on me, I'll carry you and we'll go up in 50' stages, and use the rope to help any of the others up. 5. But hold on a moment." 6. She stands up, puts her pack back on, and closes her eyes, then she crouches, and makes a growling sound that gets deeper as the black spores and gray ash that follow her around gather, begin to pulse and make a cloud around her. 7. The growl reaches a deep bass level, and then crouched Quillary grows, in pulses, her feathers and flowers becoming spikier, darker, her body burgeoning outward, like her cloak is being pushed out, andthen, the large dark mass uncurls, and a six-foot tall black bear stands there on all fours, swaying a little. 8. The black bear looks at Hildi, and winks, then shuffles towards him, lowering a shoulder for him to climb on. 9. Action: Use Wild Shape to turn into a black bear, which has a climbing speed of 30'. 10. OOC > Bear not dextrous... Quillary-bear will roar and charge the boar woman who is charging! 11. She will bite and claw at her! 12. Move: Close with the boar woman! 13. Action: Attack boar woman with two attacks, bite and claw! 14. Bite with Advantage from Hildi's yell: 20 to hit, for 6 non-magical piercing damage Claws: 19 to hit, for 8 non-magical slashing damage Dex Save: 13 Init if needed (as bear, alas): 7 Extra die roll! 15. 19

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The group spends the next 20 minutes walking back to the Yawning Portal (It'd take closer to 30 if Sim was not so familiar with the Dock Ward). 2. It is late morning now, and the tavern floor is not as crowded as it was the night before. 3. Sure enough, Yagra is sitting in a table by herself looking bored. 4. She feels like one of the regulars, as she is always here when you come by for your friendly nights out. 5. She nods at you as you enter, as does Durnan, the proprietor and bartender. 6. Bonnie comes over: "Well, hello ladies. 7. I take it your visit to the Skewered Dragon was less than satisfactory? 8. I warned you that place was a dump. 9. Now now, should I get you a table by the stage? 10. Threestrings came in early today. 11. He'll start playing any minute now." 12. LORE BOX (THE WATCHFUL ORDER OF MAGISTS AND PROTECTORS) Visitors to Waterdeep: expect to be questioned at the gate, or when you register with a magister, regarding your ability to cast arcane magic. 13. Wizards, sorcerers, and other arcane spellcasters who intend to stay in Waterdeep for any length of time are required to register with the city, and will be strongly encouraged to join the Watchful Order of Magists and Protectors, headed by the Blackstaff. 14. Members of the Watchful Order are expected to render service to the city when called upon, acting as temporary members of the City Watch or City Guard. 15. Their expertise often helps investigators determine whether magic was used to commit a crime in the city. 16. Members can also expect to be tapped for assistance during and after fires, natural events that cause multiple casualties, or other nonmagical disasters. 17. Members of the Watchful Order form a more or less sociable association in the city, working together to keep an eye on any spellcasters who opt not to join their guild. 18. Any havoc caused by a spellcaster in Waterdeep risks drawing the wrath of the Lords of Waterdeep — so it behooves the Watchful Order to watch all its members.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You leave the cow tied up and continue down the road. 2. Butterskull Ranch occupies a large plot of land on the north side of the Triboar Trail, nestled between two hills. 3. Beyond a ramshackle wooden fence stand corn fields, an apple orchard, gardens, and pasture land. 4. A path breaks off from the trail to lead to a two-story farmhouse next to a pond. 5. West of the farmhouse are the charred remains of a barn and smithy that have been burned to the ground. 6. Pigs harmlessly wander the fields, gardens, and orchard. 7. Between the farmhouse and the gutted barn lie the scattered corpses of two orcs and five humans swarming with flies.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Sekkar managed to convince Dawnbringer to talk all right, but he soon wished he hadn't. 2. The response that comes back is loud, shrill and highly spiteful. 3. Oh, talkative now are we? 4. I thought you wanted me to SHUT UP! 5. Well since I don't have a mouth, I guess I'll have to just SHUT UP! 6. No matter what Sekkar tries after this, Dawnbringer is silent and refuses even to produce her blade. 7. The myconids take their leave from the group, but as they do Stool grips Rhayna's hand one more time and looks up at her. 8. Through its spores it says that although it would like to travel with her again, it feels like it should stay with Rasharoo and the others and help in their cause. 9. With one last flood of emotion for its 'softer' friend, Stool the spore-who-is-growing-up turns and trots to catch up with the Circle of Explorers. 10. The voyage through the tunnels continues, but this time the group follow Sekkar and Kaylyn who have the most skill at following maps, even mental ones. 11. As always the shadows move hauntingly, although they are even deeper now with the lack of Dawnbringer's light. 12. The group stop after several more hours for a long-overdue rest, and pass the hours unmolested. 13. Resuming their journey again, the directions of the myconids prove most effective, and the group is able to avoid some almost-invisible sinkholes, tocircumvent a large field of steam vents, and to bypass a nest of gricks. 14. Still the shadows spook them, and as the hours pass the group can't help but feel as though dark figures are moving swiftly in their peripheral vision, racing to flank them from behind or gliding overhead to attack from above. 15. Everyone gets the benefits of a long rest. 16. Everyone please make a Perception check Rhayna: Please make a CON save

It takes a second or two, but the barbarian is eventually able to single out a slow,rhythmic mumbling. 3. It is too low for Graxx to make out the words, but whoever is muttering them seems to be repeating them ad nauseam . 4. Marfaen stays in the corner, observing and putting the pieces together as to fully understand what his new companions dragged him into. 5. Rag approaches the southern door and remains quiet. 6. The halfling is a master at hiding and is pretty sure his presence here has gone unnoticed by the begging prisoners. 7. In his silence, the rogue begins to hear louder noises coming from the other side of the door next to him. 8. Itis a mix of metal clanging, chairs moving, and some huffing and puffing. 9. Utar recalls seeing another person wearing similar clothes. 10. Indeed, that person disappeared after relaying a message to one of those fishmen ( Kuo-Toa ). 11. The half-orc can't be entirely sure but he thinks he remembers that person also wearing a mask under his dark hood, before disappearing. 12. That would explain this prisoner's facial tan marks. 13. If any pair of people ever looked like dragon cultists to Utar, these two would probably be it.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Yed comes to just as Doc, standing above him, is pierced by two arrows. 2. Standing up, he sees all his allies strewn across the battlefield. 3. Enraged and ready for violence, Yed bears down on Klarg with the intensity of a madman. 4. With two brutal strikes, he turns the tide of battle. 5. The first impacts the bugbear's right arm, knocking the morningstar away. 6. Unable to react in time, Klarg howls as the second blow shatters his rib-cage and goes right through, trailing a bloody mess. 7. Klarg falls to the forest floor in a pool of his own blood, his eyes frozen in shock and pain. 8. Yed hears a rustling in the underbrush, and when he looks up he sees the two goblin archers running away, in the opposite direction from the cave. 9. Calming down after the rush of adrenaline, Yed spots Doc's healing kit next to his unconscious body. 10. Although he is not as skilled as Doc, he is still able to stabilize his companions before they bleed out. 11. They come around 3 hours later, sore but alive. 12. (Everyone except Yed has 1 HP.)

This is the Restless Falcon, the finest tavern in the Southwestern quarter of the city of StarPort!" 3. Cee then hands Shressh a pint of ale and says, "What are you doing hiding your face, Green Dragonborn are not too uncommon in StarPort, or at least not as uncommon as an Aarakocra like me." 4. She then waits for you to hand over the gold. 5. OOC- Now can everyone give me a history check OOC- History- Everyone but Minatarsis will know this. 6. So, Star Port Wraps all the way around Star Isle, like a circle within a circle, it is one mile wide, and the city is separated into four sections, the Northeastern, Southeastern, Southwestern, and Northwestern. 7. Each quadrant is basically a different amount of wealth for the citizens, Northeastern is where all of the richest people live, Southeastern homes the upper- middle class, Southwestern, lower middle class(Where you are), and Northwestern, where all the poorest people live(Including Shressh)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You're a giant jockstrap. 2. PART A - As you head towards AREA B, i'll describe the first hallway. 3. The walls of this hallwayclimb 15 feet, then angle inward to create a peaked, 30-foot-high ceiling. 4. The sloped upper walls have red glowing crystals set into them. 5. These crystals fill the hall with dim light.The lower walls were once lined with carvings depicting dwarves pushing mine carts toward the west, but these works have been defaced and, in some cases, replaced with stony tentacles that protrude from the walls. 6. They almost appear to be..moving? 7. A 20-foot-tall double door stands closed at the west end of the hall. 8. Carved into the walls flanking the double door stand armored dwarves, their stony beards flowing out of great helms that conceal their facial features. 9. PART B -The 30-foot-high vaulted ceiling of this room is supported every 20 feet or so by thick stone arches.Standing in the hall are the skeletons of four Huge dragons, their bones held together by wire and cement. 10. A few pieces of each dragon have broken off and fallen to the floor. 11. A fifth dragon skeleton in a similar state of disrepair fills an alcove to the south.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. For Gavin: Any gear or supplies you can see look to have been either thoroughly picked over or are far too ruined to be of use to anyone anymore. 2. Honestly, what is most odd is what you don't see. 3. While it is very likely that the rescue party fished out some of the bodies of the travelers and brought them back to town for burial, it would be nearly impossible and extremely unlikely that they'd try to dig out the horses as well and drag those corpses down the mountain, yet here you have a smashed cart with no horses and more than enough blood stained snow in the area to give the impression that the cart-team didn't just break free and run off into the night or something. 4. For Peren: It's pretty quiet up here on this abandoned trail, but nothing really dangerous seems to be within eye-shot of you. 5. ((For those who wish it, Investigation, Perception, and/or Survival rolls would be helpful, though I'd gladly entertain other skills you may want to use as well.))

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Akiko INT: 22 Akiko smiles sweetly, sharing a knowing look at Simeon . 2. The old woman places a hand over her chest. 3. "Well then...I certainly hope you will not take offense to my open display of cheating," she says with a mischievous grin. 4. Following similar mannerisms to Simeon, she casts a spell upon herself as well. 5. "Let us begin, shall we?" 6. The first moves upon the board are fast, and it seems as if the game will pass quickly, but as a few pieces to each side fall, and possibilities expand like a flower in bloom, play slows down. 7. Well over an hour passes, Abraxas and Akiko each baiting each other and falling for each others' traps on numerous occasions, before finally, Abraxas takes the last piece. 8. Akiko stares at the game board. 9. Moments pass before her gaze slowly rises to look upon the victor. 10. "Isn't that a surprise? 11. Old Akiko, soundly beaten. 12. I commend your intelligence, you are quite the bright young man. 13. Although it was never truly a battle of our wits, was it? 14. We each had magical assistance in the matter, therefore it would not be fair to abide by our original terms. 15. Shall we call it a draw? 16. You may pass through, but I will keep the reward. 17. In return, I will refrain from slaking my hunger today," she states. 18. Abraxas examines the door, seeing no sign of danger. 19. Like the doors before it, this one doesn't seem to contain any wires, arcane writing, or other common signs of traps. 20. The green bricks inside of the room rise to a ceiling 30 feet above the ground, and the ozone smell is masked by heavy incense from within. 21. This room is not as well decorated as Akiko's, but is still quite colorful with a few carpets and tapestries. 22. Three women are seated within, in the midst of a discussion; a human, a half-elf, and an elf that radiate beauty, drawing a noise of intrigue from Mro Jus Bir. 23. "Oh...it is not often that any make it beyond Akiko. 24. Hello, travelers. 25. For what have you come here seeking?" 26. the elf woman asks. 27. There is one other door in this room, along the left wall.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You take some extra time in the morning to allow Dain to completely recover from last nights interruption (full rest for Dain) With a small delay he break camp and got on the way. 2. Otrov seams to have a much better hand in choosing a path then Margret yesterday and the sun is much gentler compared to yesterday, allowing you to make a much better pace then yesterday. 3. Margret, Dain and their familiars keep their eyes open. 4. In the early afternoon Margret hears the sound of a creek nearby and you take a quick break to refresh with the cold clear water. 5. It stays a quite march. 6. Even Zurzg menages to concentrate a bit more today, and he even is able to shoot a small quail that gets spooked by you ( Zurzg, add 1 ration to your Character sheet). 7. Maybe just before sunset you come across tracks of five or six goblins. 8. According to the map and your assumed position, it is very likely that those tracks will lead you to the Castle. 9. Otrov thinks that it is no more then one hour from here. 10. What do you want to do? 11. Is everyone else staying here or do you follow Otrov in some distance? 12. As for Otrov, choose two out of those three: survival/perception/stealth (I will assume Otrov goes by himself and everyone else stays where they are. 13. What do you do while Otrov scouts ahead?) 14. Otrov and Sebastian follow the tracks into the forrest. 15. For the most parts the tracks are easy to follow, but twice you loose them and have to spend a few minutes to find them again. 16. You are careful not to be seen and after a little bit over an hour, you reach a large clearing. 17. It starts to get dark, but in the twilight, you see a big building. 18. The building consists of several crumbling towers of different sizes and heights, but the upper stories are all in varying states of collapse. 19. You don‘t see any entrance or any lights from your point of view.

As the Forest Giant leaps from underneath the surface, soaring through the air. 9. Leaving a trail of water raining down behind him. 10. An almost thunderous smack can be hear as he lands about 70 feet in front of the part. 11. And mud sprays to meet the water in the air. 12. It turns to the party. 13. Suddenly a tether of black energy can be seen attaching itself to the Giant from somewhere under the surface before it get yanked back with tremendous force. 14. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Once you're all behind the bushes and trees you four silently, make sure each of you are good to go and then Flynn begins to lead them back to the tunnel entrance. 2. Sevrn, you stand at the front as Flynn begins to move, motioning each person towards him as they begin to file out being as quiet as they can. 3. The priest is standing on the other side of the column of people seemingly doing the same with you, trying to reassure his flock, that everything will be alright. 4. As each person passes you, you make sure to brush against them or lean in to make sure they see you make the "SHHH" sign with your mouth and finger. 5. One man who's holding on to what you think is his wife's hand passes you and nods, as you pat his shoulder a foul odor fills your nostrils for a brief moment. 6. Its nothing strong almost like a bit too ripe body odor. 7. As the couple passes you look after them and see the young man look back towards another pretty girl about the same age as him and his wife. 8. He quickly grabs her hand with his other and then lets go of it as his wife pulls him along. 9. The line continues to move as you brush this off. 10. Mopham is bringing up the rear with an elder gentleman slung over his shoulder and a young child, with a broken leg, in his other arm. 11. In front of Mopham come two people with their arms in slings. 12. One man with a slight limp walks by not making eye contact, you place your hand on his back to motion him along when a strong smell enters your nose, this one way more potent then the "lovers triangle". 13. Upon a closer look at the man you see he is wearing armor.....a chain shirt.....far different than that of what the town guards/militia were wearing, that's for sure.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ban: The iron chest unlocks, but is still under the bed so you're unable to open it. 2. Xander: Krunchy hears you calling for help from the Truths tenacity and he follows you down below on the pirate ship. 3. "Oh, sir Xander, what do you need me to do??" 4. Grol: the pirates do not have much of value on them, just their weapons. 5. You find: 6 daggers, 2 rapiers, 2 longbows, 2 light crossbows, 2 scimitars, and 10 gold, 21 silver, and 36 copper pieces. 6. You also hear Raphael announcing he found prisoners as well as Xander and Ban calling for help. 7. You see Xander running across the deck to your ship with a metal container then back below deck on the pirate ship. 8. Krunchy follows behind him. 9. Milo: You hear Xander calling for help and the pattering of footsteps from the deck while you're down below. 10. Ban and Raphael: You hear banging from the pirate ship galley growing louder. 11. Everyone on the pirate ship feels the ship tilting slightly. 12. What do you all do? 13. Xander: Krunchy grabs the cannonballs and powder and returns them to Truth's Tenacity. 14. Ban: With Xander's help I will rule that you both grab it and make your way on the pirate deck with it. 15. With two people it can be moved easily. 16. Raphael: The prisoners stay where they are and give you a strange look for leaving them, but they just sit down. 17. Krunchy sees you running to the galley so he will watch them for you until you return. 18. In the galley, you see a gigantic, muscular half-orc with a loincloth and greataxe. 19. He is not too much smaller than a short Goliath. 20. He is busy eating all the food in the galley and sees you walk in. 21. He walks over to you and you discover the sound of the banging—it's his forehead smacking the crossbeams on the ceiling. 22. Bang! 23. Thud! 24. Bong! 25. are the sounds you hear when he walks over to you, bashing his head the whole way. 26. He says, "HI!!! 27. ME OG!!!" 28. "OG EAT! 29. What you doin here?? 30. Big boat stop?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Burik, still recovering from his brush with death, has a hard time remembering anything. 2. He knows, at least, none of the locales are anywhere near his mountain home. 3. Brask and Effort, you both recall the name Xandar...it was the high priest who you interacted with while you were in Lovilra. 4. The one who was attacked and almost killed by the cultists. 5. Yelhorn and Murmur don't mean anything to you, though. 6. Burdan doesn't recognize any of the names, but starts to look over the maps. " 7. Yeah...some of these markings correspond to the places on the list ," he runs a finger from your location back to Lovilra, then southwest to Redguard, then up and all the way to the northeast to Gorta. " 8. Redguard is the high elf city on the western shore. 9. On the edge of the red sands. 10. And seems you all know about the other two spots." 11. Everyone, roll me a history check to see what you know about the eastern side of the continent. 12. Effort, you may do so with advantage.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. At Saros' request, Darrik ties the end of a rope to a loose rock he picks up from the ground and tosses it over the bridge. 2. Ghee picks it up and ties that same end around his waist. 3. Saros yells some tips as the albino dwarf build up courage and hopes for the best. 4. Thankfully, the monk part of Ghee is the one leading the way at the moment, not the drunkard. 5. He swiftly crosses the bridge as Darrik braces for the worst. 6. Not a single extra plank is dislodged and Ghee arrives at the other side safely. 7. Not one to wait for too long, Khan has already tied her own length of rope around her waist, with Bleep's help. 8. A few extra lengths are needed to pull this off, but thankfully, most everyone carries some rope with them. 9. Some even brought silken rope, which should make the whole ordeal even easier. 10. With everyone's assistant, Khan is lowered back into the pit after detaching Blip from her back. 11. She uses her natural climbing skills to guide herself along the wall and approach the exact spot she was aiming for. 12. Once close enough to the green grung's body, Khan recognizes him as B'Lahp, another one of her charges. 13. There is a large wound on his head, which she could not have seen from her earlier angle.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Haize and Randaler, seeing that the cave appears unlit, take out a torch and light them, giving them a limited field of vision from the light source. 2. Just beyond the cave mouth, a few uneven stone steps lead up to a small, dank chamber on the east side of the passage. 3. The cave narrows to a steep fissure at the far end, and is filled with the stench of animals. 4. Savage snarls and the sounds of rattling chains greet your ears where three wolves are chained up just inside the opening. 5. Each wolf’s chain leads to an iron rod driven into the base of a stalagmite. 6. The awake wolf evades most of the attacks, only Randaler and Chad making contact with theirstrikes. 7. The fire bolt knocks the wolf to the ground, killing it (Realgâr does not need his attack). 8. The other two wolves will still be asleep for a short while (9 rounds), sowe'll keep in initiative order for now, starting round 2. 9. INITIATIVE: ROUND 2 Randalar Realgar Kres Chad Haize Wolves (1 dead, 2 asleep (uninjured)) Mary Randaler leaves a day's worth of rations on the ground for the two sleeping wolves before backing away from them and going back to the cave path. 10. The area ahead is pitch black without the aid of the torches The main passage from the cave mouth climbs steeply upward, the stream plunging and splashing down its west side. 11. In the shadows, a side passage leads west across the other side of the stream.In the shadows of the ceiling to the north, you can just make out the dim shape of a rickety bridge of wood and rope crossing over the passage ahead of you. 12. Another passage intersects this one, twenty feet above the floor.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Isobi's Persuasion: 12 The gnome guard draws her gaze over to others and gives a slight shrug. 2. "Alright, just don't touch anything and don't get near any materials. 3. I'm sure gaffer is still here, working his ass off." 4. The smell only gets stronger as you all enter the building. 5. Even more so as the guard leads you to a black haired gnome tolling over an table filled with tools and powders. 6. The guard taps his shoulder, "What?" 7. , the man asks, not giving a glance back. 8. "Boss, you got visitors." 9. "Tell them to go away." 10. "Boss, city watch visitors." 11. With a groan he turns back, lifting his magnifiers up. 12. The gnome is old, the black in his hair actually ash along with dark circles around his eyes. 13. He looks annoyed as he grumbles to himself, "And what the hell does the Bram want with me? 14. I'm trying to double my quota for this month so I don't need any distractions." 15. "When you've seen one explosion, you've seen them all, only difference is the size of it. 16. We ain't able to look back in time to see what kind of bomb or who made it. 17. All we'd be able to tell is what kind of bomb it was and how big the explosion was. 18. I can guarantee you it is a mix of blasting powder and I can also guarantee you that it didn't come from here. 19. Proof being the ledger and having about already twenty of them double checking the records for me while I check them for the tenth time for today. 20. And if you suspect any of my boys pitying that goliath, then you're dead wrong. 21. Only thing I'd give her is a bomb and a torch down her throat. 22. Best to rid her now rather than wait for crownguard to decide what to do with her." 23. He grumbles. 24. He looks to the guard once more, "Send a squad of your men, I want to be sure Nima is safe." 25. The guard opens her mouth to say something only to be cut off, "I ain't paying for your opinion! 26. Send a squad and check on Nima!"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (No worries, it happens.) 2. Aryn & Mucor- Daisy is mortified, her face losing its color. 3. She immediately opens her mouth but nothing but a hushed mumble comes out. 4. She tries to compose herself and gets out , "I'm sorry I don't know what you're talking about mister." 5. and begins to move slowly away from your table all the while her eyes are locked on Mucor and Aryn until for a brief second they flit over to a table in the corner where a hooded figure sits. 6. While Mucor speaks she shakes her head mumbling, "this isn't happening..." and looks again towards the figure. 7. Roll Initiative! 8. Mucor- though you don't recognize the figure in the corner from his clothes, you do recognize the hand crossbow slung on his belt and the ornate leather boots on his feet. 9. That is Quentin Caruso, the man who aided in the defense of Riverwood thenfled the town with the sheriff's daughter. 10. Aryn- You catch the quickened breathing and side glance to the figure in the corner. 11. You can see that she is contemplating in her mind whether to scream for help or to run. 12. As Mucor explains to Aryn you watch Daisy's face turn almost white as the recollection hits her. 13. She take in a large gasp of air then looks at you andmakes a move towards the door. 14. "No, no no no no." 15. she says breaking into a sprint. 16. Gaelin & Jinara- After you finish your meal you set out some candles and clear a space in the dining hall. 17. Jinara, Iris, Valeera and Torq all gather around Gaelin as he begin the ritual and create a translucent orb of arcane energy. 18. Jinara mutters an incantation connecting to Gaelin's subconscious as Gaelin stares intothe orb and his vision goes white as he istransported across the world. 19. Both of you make a perception check!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You all partake in a simple meal, and within half an hour, have packed up your things, stretched out your limbs and are setting off. 2. Although you've spent more than two weeks in the jungle already, it feels strange to leave the rustic village behind, since for the last few days you had enjoyed the benefits of civilization again. 3. Soon though, you were reminded of the terrain, as swarms of mosquitoes harass you along your path through the marshy terrain by the lakeside. 4. Even though, you make good time, and you march about ten miles before midday. 5. As the sun starts beating down though, you notice that there is little to no shade around for miles, and your pace drops considerably. 6. Fang shows you all that you can prevent sunburn and ease the heat by rubbing some mud on the skin, and a few of the caravan do so, but for those in heavier armour, or with bandaged wounds, this seems less practical. 7. Staggering forwards, you eventually reach the tree line after three exhausting hours in the heat and the sun, and as you are about to settle down for half an hour of rest before continuing on, you spot a large lumbering figure about five hundred yards away, seemingly trying to fish in a murky pool of largely stagnant water. 8. It hasn't noticed you yet.

The slide bolt is now free to move. 7. Commotion can still be heard from inside.
