Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Dozens and dozens of ravens circle and dive, taking turns pecking around the dragons eyes and at its existing wounds. 2. The dragon roars, flapping its wings. 3. "Who are you? 4. What manner of creatures defy ME?!" 5. The dragon breathes a long, wide plume of green, poisonous gas directly at Stones and all the way to Tock (but noooot quite reaching Sweet Apple Cider's head), snagging 1 of the swarms of ravens in its blast. 6. Poison Breath (Recharge 5–6). 7. The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 60-foot cone. 8. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 16d6 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. 9. Everyone in the poison takes the full brunt of the poisonous breath. 10. A dozen ravens drop from the sky around Stones , who also falls down, unconscious. 11. Tock remains seated on Sweet Apple Cider. 12. Everyone may take their round 4 action in any order. 13. At the end of this devastating attack, it is hard to say who is winning. 14. The dragon looks bloodied, broken-scaled, and is favoring its right leg. 15. In rapid succession, the raven swarms, Tock , Gash , and Bulwark assault the dragon. 16. It proves to be too much and the beast. 17. Straining against the constant barrage of blows, it tries to lift off but flops to the ground. 18. Green tinted blood seeps out from beneath its scales as it releases a last poisonous breath. 19. (Combat has ended.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "Something can speak!" 2. mimics Chiirk. 3. "We proceed cautiously," says Azaka quietly, steering the canoe past the point of the bank ahead. 4. The river opens wide off to the right, the eastern side of the river, where a marshy area has formed almost like an oxbow lake off the river. 5. Roughly 150 feet from you, still on the reed-infested bank and surrounded by algae and lily pads, rests a rowboat; ripples emanated from it as a lone figure struggles to move two other inert figures around the boat. 6. The figure falls into the water next to the boat with a weak yell, and drags itself back over the side. 7. Seeing you, the figure yells out, "Hail! 8. Help! 9. Please! 10. I beg you!" 11. Azaka slows the canoe but does not make a move to turn it toward or away. 12. "Travellers," she asks quietly, "we stay? 13. We go?" 14. What do you do?

"...shut it." 5. The Fish-Monster.... 6. Attempts a slam on Morgan, as she exits it's threat range. 7. Morgan Club Attack: 25 Damage: 15 (Initiative 4) It continues to thrash, but seems to leave Abigail alone for the moment. 8. One spear launching over at Lafetha, while a slam tentacle and a spear tentacle attempt to squish and stab Sim. 9. Lafetha Club Attack: 15 Damage: 13 Sim SpearAttack: 14 Damage: 8 Sim ClubAttack: 17 Damage: 11 Sim : If Hit, make a DC 13 CON Save vs Poison. 10. Fail take 8 poison damage, and the poison condition. 11. Save, no condition and half damage. 12. Sim & Lafetha : If Hit, make a DC 13 STR Save. 13. If fail, you are pulled into the creatures mouth and swallowed. 14. Round 3 (End) Sim lets loose a arrow, it striking into the creature (20). 15. Lafetha takes a swing, the vines lashing out but only managing to graze the beast with no effect. 16. A splash in the water follows the crack of a gun, Wilson's shot going wide. 17. One also splashing into the water before the other strikes the creature (15). 20. The fish then brings three tentacles into the air. 21. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gib Persuasion:25 Gib's flattery seems to have found a receptive audience in the Baron, and he relaxes visibly towards the end of the tiefling's spiel. 2. He firmly plants his fork down, dabs his face (smearing some blood across his face) and then points at Gib and nods vigorously. 3. "You flatter me, sir. 4. Of course, everything you say happens to be true. 5. I particularly appreciate your..."He licks his lips. 6. "Good taste in furnishing. 7. I have found that those who crave leadership desire to have those as their leaders who demonstrate an understanding of the finer things in our life. 8. "He takes another bite of his food. 9. "Now as to Captain Sufocan, I am surprised as you areremarkably well-informed. 10. I have a relationship with the Captain's patrons, one that is based upon shared interests. 11. "He looks at you all, slowly one by one. 12. "The arrangement has been fruitful for me. 13. That doesn't mean I am unwilling to consider the request. 14. I just need to be assured you will win. 15. I never back losers.. You may start to convince me, by sharing you sent you on this errand, and authorized you to speak on behalf of, as Mr. Gib has said,those who control trade in this part of the world and have the ear of the king. 16. I have my suspicions, but it is always better to hear it from the source." 17. Wist, as you look around the room, you are above all deeply impressed by the surroundings. 18. Even the garish Primewater mansion, which wears its ostentatiousness on its sleeve with gaudiness everywhere looks cheap in comparison to the finely decorated and tasteful setting you now find yourself in. 19. Most of the books on the shelves are in languages you do not recognize, but the ones you DO recognize are very rate books, almost all dealing with arcane subjects -- the study of magic, monographs about the natures of fiends, books about ancient sources of power in Oerth; all and all, its a very esoteric library, and almost uniformly old and valuable. 20. As you try to get a sense of what the Baron is eating, the smell of raw meat hits your nostrils. 21. Whatever the food is he's been eating, it has not been cooked.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Whatever gods Ordrag begged for a fight - they heard him. 2. Owimp first reported a sharp yet very wide turn to the right opening the dark chamber full of hellish flies buzzing there. 3. And just a few feet further the main corridor (the one you were moving in) past that turn little familiar spotted troubles: ten small, snarling demons covered in matted gray fur clawed and bit a hole into the hard, scabby floor. 4. A demon made of shadow flies over the smaller fiends, screamed at them in Abyssal. 5. It was unclear what they were digging for but most likely the creatures would not be too happy with intruders. 6. With Choir lighting path for those without nightvision and less-than-perfectly-silent Brutus it would be unlikely to sneak up on the group but in the worst case, you could always go around. 7. ((You are at S2, flies are at S7, demons - S9 and your goal is S14. 8. However, the map - is a flattened cylinder, so, technically any corridor leading down can bring you to the entrance)) Flies did not react at all. 9. Polly can not see the working brigade yet but can hear the yelling now. 10. Seems like the demons can soon finish the job and dig up that mysterious "pet".

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. 'As youall follow Virt's Westward movements from the site of the stone pillar, you are forced to slow your pace lest you trip, as the ground rises and falls in undulating waves of soil, rock, moss and tree-root. 2. The spider coated trunks and branches thicken about you, almost seeming to form a narrow tunnel through the shadow mantled wood... an arboreal tunnel that eventually terminates before a yawning opening in the largest mound you have yet seen. 3. The cave mouth of jagged stone stretches back into darkness, the already scant light within the wood barely penetrating at all into the uninviting aperture. 4. Virt stands before the opening, the tall lean man hugging himself as he shakes his head, as though clearing it from the remnants of sleep or a bad dream. 5. Worms, spying a crawling centipede atop the mound overhanging the cave opening, flies up with a *CAWWW* to perch and make a snack of the doomed insect. 6. The yellow-eyed stare of your avian guide seems to watch you all as it eats, the *clacking* of its beak the only sound in this otherwise dead silent part of the wood.' 7. [OOC] You may make eithera perception OR nature checks and read the below spoiler if you get a score of 15 or move: DC 15: 'The cave opening stretches away into darkness, but there is just enough light here at the entrance to notice your breath steaming on the suddenly cooler air. 8. You make out slivers of webbing extending back into the cave, as well as a few white-yellow sticks and rocks about the opening... which you quickly realise are weathered bones and skull fragments. 9. Disturbances in the morbid debris and a few recent scuff marks near the entrance's stone floor seem to indicate that something has entered the cave recently.'

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Cimeri feels an invigorating thrill as Taman lightly touches her shoulder; her senses clear and a spring is added to her step. 2. She moves quietly into the room, followed by Flynn, whose cantrip silently pushes pebbles and detritus from his path. 3. The Genasi's ability to silence the earth under them creates an eerie effect; footsteps and Flynn's cantrip make no sound, and the ground reforms to its original state after Scoria moves over it. 4. Taman adjusts his hold on his mace as all four move into the cavern; the lit stone, in his shield-arm hand, illuminates the area. 5. Cimeri stands at the bottom of the stairs in front of the skull door, peering up at it. 6. "I don't sense anything else here... which way to go?" 7. asks Cimeri. 8. The four look at one another and try to decide whether to take the stairs to the west, around the natural stone column, or the stairs in front of Cimeri leading to the skull door, to the north, or to climb the five foot high ledge between the column and the skull door, that's about 20 feet wide. 9. Taman's light doesn't penetrate the far shadows past the ledge or the column. 10. [7:02 PM] [Note: As Cimeri has already 'perceived' nothing, it will require 'Investigation' to further inspect the door, which will also require touching it unless otherwise noted; I'd say Disadvantage on the test if it's not touched] Taman searches the stairs before the door and finds no evidence of traps. 11. He takes a long look before reaching out to touch it. 12. Purple light blasts forth from the door; Taman feels the strength of his life essence scoured from his muscles as the beam tears through him, barely missing those behind him. 13. [pls make a CON save throw Taman. 14. Post inspection you may have an idea about disabling the trap: make an arcana check]

The professor scurries in on your coat tales, thanking you for the magic that you have applied to her. 5. "Oh... my... thank you, my friend. 6. "The professor will have the benefits of the spell for 10 minutes or as long as you hold concentration of the spell in your mind. 7. Ralf, when you enter the temple,the stench of death and blood hangs in the air as thickly as fog. 8. There are rows of columns to your left and right, with a main altar at the front. 9. There are two arches on the left and right which lead into dark side-chambers. 10. You also now also hear the sounds of the wet bitingcoming from thearchway on the left. 11. There are some boxes and crates on the right side of the main chamber. 12. Lastly, there is a body on the ground which looks like the others at the lodge: half eaten. 13. Landy says "Lord almighty save his soul. 14. Alas, this man is not part of the dig team either." 15. Roll Investigation or Perception to find a spot on the city for meditation. 4. Either that, or you can settle for meditating out of the city on the more peaceful forest. 5. Grungle: (Well, what are you looking for? 6. There aren't any challenges to meet whatever merchant, you want to find, they're all over the place. 7. I just need to know what you'd like to buy.) 8. Cederick: Due to the influx of people coming to your temple because of the death curse, it's surprisingly difficult to find peace and quiet for your prayings, you at least get enough hours of solitude for you to feel like you succesfully paid the due to respect to your faith. 9. Others: (If any of you have any other plans, or if you want to decide who you're following, it would be good to hear from you. 10. Unless stated otherwise, I'll take at my liberty to assume you were following Grungle, the only one who wasn't specifically searching to be left alone.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Grimnir, you notice the goblins packs and belts contain plenty of weapons, ropes, shackles, and other gear. 2. And the gear looks used. 3. You see the stain of blood on an axe edge that wasn't property cleaned and maintained. 4. A few of them look nervously around, trying to hide their bags from your direct line of sight, but you do manage to see one, and it is laden down with treasure. 5. You catch the glint of gems under the flap of a pocket, and gold in another. 6. These goblins have a lot of loot in their possession, and seem to have recently used their weapons. 7. And they don't want you to know that, judging by their body language. 8. As Oorr sets the last goblin down, the boss turns to him and says, "Well, my feathered friend. 9. Thanks for the lift! 10. Ha! 11. Literally. 12. Here, for your trouble." 13. The goblin reaches in a pocket and pulls out a handful of platinum pieces (10 PP total), and tosses them to Oorr. 14. He tips an imaginary hat, and then quickly turns and heads back the way you came, motioning for his companions to follow, which they do. 15. (OOG Anyone who wants to can roll a history check on Mantol-Derith, otherwise, let me know what you want to do with the goblins, or if you just want to continue on.) 16. This sparks a conversation among yourselves and your companions in which you realize you all experienced the same exact memory/vision.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Valintine continues not to involve herself in this fight, backing up closer towards the spires. 2. The Chaos Chimera has its eyes look around at the group. 3. Its limbs raise up off of the ground as the two little wings somehow hold it aloft, the body spins as the legs flail around, blasts of energy being hurled out from its body. 4. (Note: it hasn't left threat range, so no opportunity attacks. 5. These are ranged, so the attacks have disadvantage.) 6. Acid Blast vs. Mordecai: DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 acid damage and blinded until the start of Chaos Chimera's next turn on a failure. 7. Flame Strike vs. Keegik: 23 vs. AC. 8. Hit: 5 fire damage, and grant advantage on next attack roll before Chaos' Chimera's next turn. 9. Poison Cloud vs. Vax: DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 2 poison damage, and poisoned until the start of the Chaos Chimera's next turn on a failure. 10. Thunder Blast vs. Jooor: DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 3 thunder damage andpushed 10 feet on a failure. 11. Party's Turn! 12. 23.Chaos Chimera (6 damage). 13. 18: Coseris (7/14 HP) 17: Jooor (9/16 HP) 15: Mordecai (14/18 HP) 14: Vax (10/14 HP) 14: Warx (6/16 HP) 14: Yolov (12/12 HP, Mage Armor active) 11: Valentine (10/10 HP) 9: Keegik (14/14 HP, Mage Armor active) Coseris raises his crossbow and launches a bolt at the creature, striking into its main body as some elemental ooze squeezes out of the wound. 14. (Chaos Chimera: 21 damage.) 15. Jooor is knocked back by the thunder blast (Jooor: 6/16 HP) , but charges straight back in, strikingat the beast with his greatsword. 16. However, the tempered hot limb manages to parry the blade away. 17. Mordercai brings another swing down with his large hammer, striking into the side of the monster's body. 18. The monster looks badly injured. 19. (Chaos Chimera: 31 damage.) 20. Vax shapes the evocation energies around Warx, letting him access his innate healing. 21. Warx: you may use your reaction to spend a hit die and regain additional hit points equal to 2 + your constitution modifier. 22. Warx releases three jets of white energy that soar over into the Chimera, striking the eyes as they ooze out with an unearthly screech as the wings stop it hovering as it collapses, the form going innate as it seems to revert to a primordial ooze of some sort, bubbling and disintegrating away... (Chaos Chimera: Defeated!)

', she sighs at her attempted sneakiness and follows behind Thrash. 6. Coming around the corner you two see a young girl and an even younger boy, who is clutching a small stuffed toy. 7. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Lia: make a History check. 2. Oh yes, seeing the Count drink your blood was quite the highlight so far, rumbles Applecross, licking his lips. 3. A conversation with you would be most welcome. 4. I would like to hear every detail of what that was like. 5. But for now, your friend is fine. 6. Please enter and see for yourself. 7. Applecross stands aside, allowing Hatch and Lok to not only see Lia more clearly but also Bentley the halfling standing in the room. 8. His face brightens when he sees them and he gives a friendly wave. 9. The room is otherwise unremarkable. 10. Barok brushes Lia's comment aside with a small laugh, saying: Oh, I've been known by different names. 11. That's not really important. 12. I'm glad to see you are unharmed. 13. As Hatch and Lok check on Lia and Bentley, Applecross returns to sitting on the edge of the bed. 14. Replying to Lia he says: Yes, that's right! 15. Well, actually no. 16. She didn't send me exactly. 17. But I always know just what she wants, and I just do it without her even asking. 18. I'm her favorite, you see. 19. She says I'm the MOST in- incontinent? 20. no that's not it ... in- incompetent? 21. yes, the MOST incompetent of ALL her servants. 22. She's always giving me important jobs that take me far away for a long time. 23. Yes, Lia has heard that name before, but can't remember where. 24. It does ring a bell as a historical name though. 25. Barok seems a little annoyed at Lok's persistence with the issue, and he retorts with a dismissive wave of his hand: What of it? 26. I'm an old dwarf, I've been around for a few hundred years. 27. Don't you think I might have been called a few things in that time? 28. The usually talkative Applecross stops short in his latest babble to stare in shock at Barok's outburst. 29. Stammering, he says after a moment: Er... like I was telling Lia here, this dwarf, Barok, is one of the most honest humanoids you will ever meet. 30. Right, Lia?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Round 2 (Begin) Situation: ((All. 2. DC 13 CON Save or be Paralyzed until Sorrow's next action. 3. Morgan gets bonus for being near Tarak)Abigail is hidden and in the clear. 4. There are 6 different spots she can search through (Perception or Investigation. 5. (The old egg Clusters, A, B, C, D, E - closest is A and furthest is E. As well as herNEST itself.. although you doubt the gnome was good enough to hide something under the beast. 6. Check result under 11 breaks stealth. 7. Stealth DC if not engaged with enemy is 16) Morgan and Tarak have flanking positions on Sorrow, but can also search any of the egg deposits as well (reverse order is closest, E, D, C, B, A). 8. Wilson and Lafetha are trapped in the tunnel entryway with Sorrow. 9. The tunnel is wide enough for her to slink down after you. 10. Her face and claws right in front of you both. 11. (Acrobatics to attempt to get out of the entryway and towards others; counts as 1/2 movement. 12. DC 16) Round 2 (End) Summary: Morgan and Abigail find themselves lock in their own bodies. 13. Paralized by that low bass pulse. 14. The surge of energy in their muscles contracting to keep them still. 15. Wilson fires off a shot, (10), but it unable to move the massive creature. 16. With Sorrow still in his and Lafetha's face; her hand tosses out. 17. A cloud of poison gas forming across her face (20). 18. Sorrow reels back, letting out the sound of gagging for a moment. 19. Tarak casts; his bone arm vibrating for a moment as the sounds of Sorrow's crying kids fill the end of the room. 20. Her attention turns quickly, turning into mist and reappearing before moving over to the edge. 21. Her head twisting around a bit, before exiting the chamber. 22. Round 3 (Begin) Situation: The crew is in the nesting chamber. 23. Sorrow is down somewhere in the tunnel (by 20). 24. Due to the minor illusion, she'll like turn back around (on initiative 10) and return. 25. A series of old egg casings line the walls. 26. It's about a move to reach one, or her current nest. 27. (Investigate or Perception)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The orb glows translucent and Varian's eyes glaze over similar to Jinara's as he stares into the orb. 2. "He's in the streets of Zago and seems to be making his way towards the temple. 3. He has two mages accompanying him." 4. Varian calls out, his body unmoving and focused on the orb. 5. "At this pace he will reach the temple in a few minutes. 6. Perhaps we should pay him a visit?" 7. Varian ends the spell and gathers you all around him. 8. With a twirl of his wrist you see a flash of light and hear Varian's voice suddenly in your head. 9. "Everyone remain calm. 10. I'm going to teleport us to thetemple. 11. Once there I will conceal myself so that you can question him. 12. Do not give away my presenceor make any rash decisions...our goal is to gather information and prevent as much bloodshed as possible." 13. he says looking directly at Jinara. 14. Arcane glyphs appear on Varian's hand as he casts his spell and teleports you all to a large open garden surrounded by walls. 15. Various statues of Davara stand amongst the well groomed shrubs and flowers. 16. A large stone fountain glistens beneath the water as the rays of sun hit it. 17. You see no signs of people and hear Varian say, "Jinara, lead them to the front entrance. 18. I will observe and make my presence known when the time is right." 19. it is only then that you notice Varian is no where to be seen. 20. Jinara - make a DC13 history check to try and remember the path. 21. (If you succeed) Jinara guides the group towards the front entrance without incident and bows to the acolytes who stand at the door somewhat confused to see new faces emerge from within the temple but bow in return. 22. (If you fail) Jinara seems confident but you quickly realize after he takes you down the same corridor a third time that he is lost. 23. Your constant presence disrupts the focus of a group of young acolytes, one turns to the others and whispers something causing two of them to walk away. 24. The other three walk over and one young female asks, " Greetings. 25. You seem to have lost your way. 26. Could I be of some service."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Okay, current Mandate Plan is as follows: 4 Citizen Points = 1 Building Housing [costs 2 Industry], 2 Hunting and 1 Woodworking (Regarding the festival, I worded it weird sorry. 2. You are allowed to roll for entertainment, how pretty the decorations you set up are, how well you want to give a speech, etc. 3. without it counting towards your free time points. 4. You are not allowed to try to gather extra food/any extraneous activities for the festival.) 5. The elders clear their throats, and bid you all rest on these matters for a few days before committing to anything more than mandates. 6. It's only been a few hours since the attacks and they believe everyone needs to rest up, especially since you all went straight from the fight into relief efforts. 7. Shepard concludes the meeting saying he will notify the town that you all will give a speech tomorrow morning, introducing yourselves to the town people and giving people their jobs. 8. By the time you exit the building, the town is almost completely asleep, especially without any tavern or nightlife. 9. You all know what tents have been given to you from earlier today, so once you've finished whatever needs to be done, you fall asleep. 10. The next morning is a flurry of activity. 11. People are awake early, and milling about waiting for something to do. 12. Some of them are looking at various members of your group for direction. 13. It seems that Shepard stayed true to his word, and somehow most of the town already knows that there will be a gathering at about 8 in the morning. 14. A small wooden platform has been erected near the well, and many people are laying down blankets on the ground to sit on. 15. (Your next posts should be yourself introducing yourself in character to the town's people. 16. What your doing, what you hope to achieve personally for the town in your position. 17. Keep it short and sweet please. 18. After that, you should give one of your free time points for the week, and after all the free points have been addressed by me, we can do the festival and then after the festival you can give your second free point of the week.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Roya's examination reveals that there is actually a mechanism of a sort attached to the wall. 2. It's a low-level arcane lock of sorts that desires mana - black, blue, or green to be precise. 3. Focusing the energy from a cantrip spell ought to open this 'gate,' though you ponder which spell would be able to open said door. 4. (I actually can't find your sheet randomly, but just about any cantrip you have would probably open the door. 5. It just wants to eat the cantrip energy, so you don't actually cast the spell. 6. I hope this makes sense???) 7. Anyone who sees Roya staring at the wall, please feel free to roll Arcana. 8. If you hit a 10 or better, you notice the same. 9. The black puff of smoke swirls and becomes darker in shade - true black in color. 10. It becomes a substance that is not quite solid, gas, liquid or plasma - it transcends matter entirely and the beauty of it fills the heart of the Izzets watching that have studied mana for quite some time. 11. The black mana is absorbed by the gate just as quickly as it is formed. 12. Satisfied, the warped wooden pikes withdraw into the earth allowing you access to a small yard. 13. There is, again, a door, a garage door, and a single window for the building. 14. The door and garage door are essentially side-by-side in front of you while the window is perpendicular to the doors. 15. It is like so: ________________W____ | | | You are here GD. 16. GD. 17. | D

"There was a flash of light and something appeared grabbing Bridda first and pulled into into a void tyatbjust appeared. 3. I tried to save her as did Baltus but he was pulled it as well," she adds her tone frustrated. 4. "Then a....a thing...a woman with a head of snakes emerged. 5. She only gazed at me at first and when I tried striking her with my sword I did no damage! 6. She then struck me with a spear that seemed to appear in her hand in my side," she added. 7. "I think....I think I've been poisoned," she adds staggering forward then falling to her knees. 8. "Maybe we should return to...to the stronghold," she adds as swear begins pouring from her brow. 9. Pyra you're now no longer paralyzed! 10. Having buried the bodies and helping Soren, who's still very injured, on to the cart you head out. 11. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. It is a fell time for the dragonborn clans ofTymantherand the varied racesand cultures in the area surroundingtheCrippled Mountain.An empire of undead fire giants has risen from beneath the Crippled Mountain to wage war on the dragonborn and their allies, and red ruin and death stalk the land.Anala,the desperate matriarch ofClan Verthisathurgiesh, has requested resources and warriors to combat the fire giant threat,and you have answered her call. 2. The pale summer moon illuminates the ruins of Arush Vayem, a small settlement on the fringes of the nation of Tymanther. 3. The village has been burned to the ground, and smoldering stone and charred skeletons are scattered throughout the wreckage. 4. Thick black smoke obscures the stars. 5. Fire, the gret devourer of all things, has claimed yet another city for it's own. 6. Six solemn adventurers stand amidst the wreckage, each lost in private musings. 7. Whether for honor, personal advancement, or love of coin, they have sworn service to Matriarch Anala and the Tymantheran alliance. 8. Blood and plunder are theirs for the reaping. 9. Welcome to Hell, giantslayers.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Kestrell ties the rope around Zed's bleeding, impaled body. 2. Urgog, Eldon, and Cinna are firmly grasping the rope and begin pulling simultaneously. 3. Kestrell reaches down to assist hoisting Zed's body out of the spikes. 4. Zed's body is now being pulled out of the wooden spikes, and blood continues to gush from his body. 5. Zed now needs to make another Death Save to see if he can survive being pulled from the spikes. 6. ( OOC ): MyInfernum messaged me and asked me to make the Death Save on his behalf. 7. Zed's Death Save : 17 The party work in unison to pull Zed's body out from his impalement from the wooden spikes. 8. Once Zed's body is cleared from the spikes, Eldon allows Cinna and Urgog to pull the rope to focus on casting Spare the Dying as Zed gets hauled up. 9. The blood that was gushing is now being magically sealed, as of a force-field has generated to prevent any further bleeding. 10. Kestrell continues to push Zed up from underneath until he's out of reach. 11. After several tugs, the three on top yank Zed out of the pit. 12. Eldon casts Cure Wounds to seal the punctures throughout Zed's body and the blood that Zed had lost is now restored. 13. After a few moments, Zed wakes from his slumber, and Kestrell is still down in the spiky pit.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. To Macawi Tarina says, “Cards on the table. 2. I may 'ave taken more than me share o' the booty one time. 3. That ain't a forgivable offence t' these sort. 4. Took 'em nearly two years to find me.” Tarina fervently shakes her head at Filvendor, “No way am I leaving. 5. This Tavern be me best bet at anythin' near a fair fight. 6. Half th' scallywags in here rather punch ye than look at ye 'n me old shipmates, Dead-eye and his crew, are known fer rubbing people the wrong way. 7. As fer Alan, gold fixes anythin' wit' 'im, as long as ye keep yer hands off his employees that be.” ((Sometimes turning the phone sideways makes the dice rolling icon appear. 8. I am also happy to have you roll an IRL d20 and just tell us what you got. 9. I trust you. 10. ;) )) Tarina looks at Macawi with disdain, “I looted more than 650 gold from the crew o' the Uncivil Serpent 'n spent it all. 11. Now Dead Eye is the cap'n o' that vessel. 12. Killing me is about more than doubloons, it’s about consolidating power. 13. My death will earn him the crew’s respect. 14. I reckon my death be worth far more t' Dead Eye than what I looted.” With a droll smile she adds, “ But, sure. 15. Ye could try t’ offer him a thousand gold or more for my life. 16. Of course, my choice would be to kill this evil slime and pay the 10 gold that a grumpy Alan might charge ye for clean up.”

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. I’m dropping the 4 since there are only five of you. 2. Norak heals to 41hp (make sure you check your sheet in case my math is wrong), Kotog is full on health, Tarth heals to 30hp, Radar to 31, and Tanwar to 33. 3. You can take some time to decide your next move. 4. Kotog As the spirit goes around to heal your companions, your eyes glaze over again, completely white, and you have a blank stare. 5. Unlike your previous vision, you don’t see a series of flashing images. 6. Instead, you see several orcs moving around their camp, carrying a variety of supplies, like wood and stone, as well as a few dead animals. 7. You feel like you’re watching this from the eyes of someone or something else. 8. Your vision pans down and you see paws and very long claws. 9. It’s extremely vivid, as you take in the scents this creature is sensing. 10. You can pick up on the smell of smoke, as if a huge campfire is burning. 11. Once you get settled in the vision, the creature you’re seeing through begins making a sound like some kind of warped barking. 12. Your vision starts fading and as your eyes begin returning to normal, the last things you see are a few orcs and a very large and fierce-looking wolf.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. About an hour later, you stand looking at a large building fairly full of grain, with some boards covering a large hole. 2. At your side, Deret Misle the farm overseer stands with you. 3. Great big hole, he says. 4. We fixed it up. 5. Took some grain. 6. Not much. 7. He shrugs - since you arrived that's the most he's said unprompted. 8. Go look. 9. It's still morning, though the day is cooler than the last few, and the sky is cloudy though not threatening to rain. 10. It looks like the harvest has mostly been collected from the fields, and much of the wealth of the Husseldorfs must lie in silos such as this. 11. Around you, various farm hands see to their work; the farmer herself, Mistress Corta Odenel, is in the town today but expected back this evening.

Please you have to help me get out of here. 4. Myself and a friend of mine were both accosted by some Zhent thugs the other night and brought here and bound and gagged. 5. The just tonight this location was raided by these Kenku. 6. I was able to slip free of my bonds in the confusion and hide in this closet." 7. Renaer looks to Karugur at his description, " You're looking for Floon? 8. I saw him get taken by some other Kenku. 9. It's all my fault, him being involved.The Zhentarim thinks that my father embezzled a large amount of gold while he was Open Lord, and that he hid the dragons somewhere in the city. 10. They think they can find it by using an artifact called the Stone of Gallorrwhich was in the hands of the Xanathar Guild until recently. 11. Apparently, someone stole it. 12. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rixton senses no immediate danger as he carefully steps into the feast hall. 2. So, he makes his way around the first granite table and nears the northern stone slab which allows him to see that Thrym's giant axe is leaning against the southern stone slab just beyond the basin of fire. 3. From his new vantage point, Rixton can also clearly see the entirety of the alcove to the east--an alcove that contains a remorhaz . 4. Initiative: Andor: 21 | Carrow 14 | Ladrian 22 | Rixton 22 | Vigan 7 | Remorhaz 9 The monstrosity rises to its full height as Rixton comes into view. 5. ( Andor, Carrow, Ladrian, and Rixton may take their round 1 actions. 6. The remorhaz will follow. 7. Vigan and Harshnag will conclude the round) (Rixton's Insightful Fighting attempt is an automatic success; the remorhaz can neither tie nor beat his roll of 24 ) Rixton creeps forward, shortening the distance between the remorhaz and himself. 8. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. VELIMA "Ahh, err," Jakob paused and stuttered, as if trying to think of something to say. 2. "Perhaps ye best be leavin' the chief alone. 3. 'Tis an important time, you know!" 4. Suddenly the man's eyes widened and his face grew pale. 5. He hurriedly picked up his barrow and began briskly pacing away from Velima, uttering not a single word more. 6. JUBILANT Before you dive into your shopping, you check the carved, painted wooden idols that are on display. 7. One of them depicts three handsome sylvan spirits, howling at a whole lunar gaze. 8. The particularly most well-carved idol is that of a woman with long hair, and two wolves by her side - though you cannot tell what religion might utilize any idol like these. 9. Maybe it has something to do with the tapestry in the tavern? 10. You do not manage to find any warm clothing or camping supplies, though you are easily able to find a few sweets to your liking. 11. As our split party entered the shop, Jubilant began immediately on a frenzied spree. 12. Following behind, Strife and Niner were able to get a better look at the store - though it looked cramped and cluttered from the outside, it was tall and sprawling on the inside. 13. Rows of two-story shelves lined the walls, and fine tables - with crystal cases that self-illuminated as if by magic - held the more lustrous and valuable wares. 14. A meek, elderly voice raised up from behind one of the smaller shelves in the back of the shop. 15. "Hello, dearies, what can Gram Belmont help you younglings with?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. For clarity, we're talking about the toad that fled from Fluin. 2. (The other fleeing toad is actually a little farther.) 3. You can't see it or any of the toads in the dense wood because it's a heavily obscured area which blocks vision entirely, so when trying to see something (e.g. 4. a toad) in that area you effectively suffer from the blinded condition. 5. I'm sorry if this hasn't been clear enough from my descriptions, but since it seems we keep having to go over this, maybe this more explicitly rules-based description might help us get on the same page. 6. The only toad you can see is the one Tarek just stabbed because it has leaped out of the wood into the open marshy field where it is visible. 7. Even though you can't see them, you know where two of the remaining three living toads in the wood are (the one fighting with Torrent and the one trying to eat Ulben) mostly because of the noises they are making and can target them directly. 8. The location of Fluin's toad, however, is unknown to you. 9. As I related in post #701, it moved farther into the wood and became quiet, dropping from your awareness (as well as everyone else's). 10. When this happened, it was at the location I described, 35 feet away from you. 11. You can't be sure where it is now, but you can infer what you will from its last known position and target whatever location in which you think it is. 12. So, to answer your second question, no, there is no position from which you can see it, but you are free to change your location to improve your chances of detecting it (by hearing), or you can guess its location and target that if you wish. 13. No worries. 14. Tarek's toad is the only one that has gone out into the open. 15. You have advantage on your attack, so you can roll again (one die only) to see if you crit.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Dm @ Gotemash You enter the crypt silently and between your dark vision and the subtle lighting coming from deeper within, you can clearly see the foyer of this crypt. 2. There is a marble statue of a knight using a two-handed sword to shield a group of woman and children from some attack. 3. The inscription on the base in written in a strange dialect of common. 4. You can make out the words Sir William Marshall and Flower of chivalry. 5. The other words would require hours of study to discern their meaning. 6. There are some placards in bronze along the wall with other names, likely family and ancestors of this Sir William. 7. There is a stairway to the left which leads into darkness and one to the right where the light is emanating from. 8. The crypt is surprisingly clean. 9. No dust nor cobwebs of any kind. 10. DM @ Gotemash, Daishi and Pete here is the sword that Daishi is carrying and is depicted by the statue. 11. DM @ Gotemash, Pete and Daishi Daishi remarks how he didn't see this room the first time around and that he assumes the light is coming from the room he was in previously where the sarcophagus of Sir William Marshall lays. 12. He tells you about the oil lamps that seem to be perpetually lit and wonders if there is a caretaker of some sort Dm As sleepy Pete searches the crevices and relief sculptures for hidden secrets he comes across a peculiar part of one basic reliefs depicting a knight on horseback charging into battle, yet his lance is pointed upwards and ot towards the enemy. 13. It also seems to be raised a slight bit higher then the surrounding carvings.

They exchanged confused looks and then returned their gaze to her. 8. One hobgoblin stepped forward and gestured to the land behind the gate. 9. "I suppose Blurg may ask for a healer, but we aren't the obstacle here. 10. It's the mushroom folk. 11. They won't allow any aid to come to Blurg's army while we are still in conflict." 12. The guards stepped aside and opened the gate. 13. "Watch out for an imp, Quintus, he whispers things into Blurg's ear. 14. Since they Blurg has become more...erratic. 15. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. His eyes having adjusted to the dimness, Midian sees that as well as this large general area full of tables where the music and dancing is occurring, the establishment has a bar and kitchen area on the side facing the river. 2. It also seems to have another area accessible to patrons at the end opposite to where the minstrels are playing. 3. Midian watches as one of the serving girls leads one of the patrons away in that general direction and is about to discount that as just the intimate service area when another door opens revealing a room with some people sitting around a table gambling.However, immoral or not, there appears to benothing actually against the king's lawgoing on in this establishment. 4. His attention is suddenly brought backto the patrons close by as he distinctly hears the word 'Aieda' over the general noise of the minstrel's music. 5. It seems that one of the boys from the School said the word and, despite the almost naked woman in front of them, these two seem to bedeep in conversation. 6. Midianmoves closer to the two students and hears them talking about some sort of incident that occurred in the School's refectory earlier in the day.From the way they are talking, it seems they are rehashing a conversation they had earlier, andit would seem they have come to this place so that one of them can prove to the other that he is not a cradle snatcher and that the incident that happened earlier had something to do with a young girl. 7. Uncertain as to the nature of the parts of the conversation he has missed, Midian is interrupted in his speculations by the arrival of his food and drink; the serving woman putting them down and then quickly moving away. 8. [Make a Deception check at Advantage. ]

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You’re all paid up with the Durnans, and it’s a matter of moments to get everyone settled in the winch’s sling as the crowd cheers and jeers at the prospect of another descent. 2. It’s 140 feet down to the base of the well, and takes a full minute to descend. 3. The noise of the crowd fades out, far more quickly than you would expect - you’re barely 30 feet down before it’s absolutely silent, with just the noise of your breathing and the creak of the sling. 4. You touch down on a dirty sand floor, in a room that’s 40ft on a side. 5. The walls are lined with battered and rusty shields, and it appears that, aside from climbing back up the well, the only exit is through a tunnel to the south. 6. What would you like to do? 7. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Bones, disguised to look like Sandrick, approaches the manor of the Strattons he sees the guards look briefly in his direction before letting him through the gates. 2. One of them escorts you up the walkway, crossing the grounds where the dogs roam freely, toward the manor. 3. Kaltent, also disguised, but as the new guard, observes as Sandrick is allowed passage to the manor. 4. Zack & Jianyu have taken up posts a short distance from the main gates, Zack at ground level and Jianyu from his perch atop the cafe-style shop. 5. Both can smell the sweet aroma of fresh brewed kambucha in the air. 6. Jah'nun & Trust are possibly entering under cover of an Invisibility spell? 7. Watl is able to nimbly scamper over the wall and take momentary cover behind some bushes. 8. It all seems too easy until you remember that the reason there are not enough guards to watch over the large estate is that dogs roam freely on the grounds, and the longer you stay hidden from sight behind these bushes the greater the chance of discovery from the dogs sniffing you out. 9. (Anyone wishing to do anything else inside or outside the grounds?) 10. (please don't mistake that for one of those DM things where I am hinting that something is going to happen if you don't, I just wanted to allow for anything extra inbetween gaining access to the grounds and the mansion.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The mason explains that there was in fact a much more complex pattern suggested for said floor plan. 2. Curiously so because he did not imagine that the Innkeeper was any kind of astrologist, but he insisted that the new Chimney would have its back facing North with its front facing South. 3. He also requested that the windows would be the same but in the East and West with respect to right and left. 4. The cellar is gone, and the fireplace will be extraordinarily large at the South back of the room, with the bar taking up the entire right\East side. 5. The left\west side has been left entirely open, probably for tables to come later, and there is to be a single door way at the South Entrance. 6. Finally, to the right of the door, a ladder to two rooms on the second floor, will behind the end of the bar. 7. "There is also a shed to be built in the back, of which the door will be iron. 8. It is to be blessed, and have several hidden locking mechanisms." 9. The men are laying the bricks for the general tavern now, and he explains that the shed is to be constructed when a priest is more readily available. 10. He has been paid a great amount of money to wait for such time, which is why there is a hurry to buildhis lodgings for the week or so it will probably take for such a priest to arrive.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Adair, the hostess, smiles and welcomes Kogu in. 2. "Here we mostly just watch." 3. She winks and points toward the scrying mirror hung over the bar. 4. An image there shows two groups of fighters moving through a forest. 5. One uses a spark of magic to summon a wild boar to charge his opponents. 6. They direct all of their attentions onto the charging beast. 7. "If you're interested in joining the fight, we'll get you set up." 8. She hands you a sheet of paper from her desk by the entrance and points to another woman in a blue dress. 9. "Just fill out this form and give it to that woman there."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Cora, upon arriving at the outskirts of Rest, removes her mask. 2. The illusion of goblin fading and returning to her dirty robed halfling look. 3. She gives a bit of a nod to Abigail, as all except for Sim head off to Rest. 4. "You say a group of armed people showing up after sunset is rude? 5. Odd. 6. Who would've thought that." 7. she shakes her head with a bit of a eyeroll. 8. Once you begin to pass the tavern, Cora breaks off. 9. "It's late, and I'm going to make sure I have a room. 10. Not being part of your Blackmire team, there's not a spot for me in that camp." 11. She gives a small nod before reaching down to grab a few coin from a purse on her side, and heading into the Inn. 12. At Orta's... 13. The thunder continues to roll and echo. 14. The sounds of shouting coming from the home. 15. Lafetha, you hear the voices, shouting in Sylvan . 16. Orta: "...alf-breed. 17. Letting her roam. 18. What is wrong with you!" 19. Alul: "We could use her. 20. She's good and kind. 21. Perfect for what we need." 22. Orta: "We? 23. There is no we. 24. There is I. 25. You were ourtool. 26. Our Enforcer. 27. Don't forget your place. 28. And who made you." 29. Alul & Orta: [unintelligible due to the rain and thunder] At Camp... Sim you approach. 30. Everyone seems to be up and walking around, in some kind of hurry. 31. A dismembered horseis scattered out in one of the fields. 32. Mr. Jacobsen lays in a tent, covered in blood, deep injuries still bleeding. 33. Eshe is trying to stop the bleeding, but he too is bloodied and looking worse for ware. 34. Sora, Ironsides, and Mama all talk under the extended awning of one of the wagons. 35. Yaalin (Day 1, noon) You head out. 36. Passing along the outskirts of the Hn'ti village as you make your way. 37. It's been a few hours before you see 15 Hn'ti coming around a bend. 38. They don't seem to have noticed you yet, but will walk directly your way. 39. What do you do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Even though it is now light outside, within the cave, darkness is everywhere this deep in, though from the bridge, light can be seen at the entrance. 2. But even if not for the darkness, the rocks and walls at D-21 block the view as the rock wall is at e-25 and F-24. 3. The only likely spots to hit it are at D-20, though it would put the attacker at slight risk of being swept away too. 4. Pr anywhere within a square of F-21. 5. Though this all, you see that Plan A is applicable. 6. but the bridge itself is 20 feet above the floor below, meaning someone will either need to be 'on' the bridge to cut it, or will have to make one hell of an athletics check + an attack on the bridge or be on the edge of where the bridge is to break it. 7. The bridge has an AC of 10, and HP of 5 to break. 8. If someone is 'jumping' the Athletic DC is 16 followed with an attack to beat the above AC/HP. 9. If someone is 'on' the bridge, they will need to make a DC 15 Dex Save or fall with Klarg. 10. And then there still remains: How are you getting him 'out' of his 'throne room'

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Round 5 (End / Drop Initiative) The Ogre takes the bite from Lizard Lafetha, and the crack from Yaalin. 2. It making a few sounds as it stumbles, and slumps over into a wall. 3. A few exasperated breaths before dying, leaving you all in the hallway. 4. Down the hall, you can hear the growing buzzing of insects. 5. Up in the main chamber, the bird caws its responses to Abigail. 6. The pool still lit up and bubbling with the twisted root basket containing your friend. 7. What do you do? 8. Lafetha, Diadochi, Yaalin - you see Sim coming back up the hallway stuck in a cloud of bugs. 9. What do you all do? 10. Abigail - the main chamber room goes dark, except what little light is coming from the remaining sunlight outside the cave. 11. The bird ceases cawing, as you notice the basket has returned to the top. 12. The water it was in now having solidified into a light colored rock that does not fit with the rest of the cave. 13. The bugs continue to bite and sting. 14. The swarm flooding off of Sim and on to Diadochi; swarming him. 15. Attack: 12 Damage: 14 (Lafetha or Yaalin can roll Athletics of Acrobatics DC 11)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (My bad, missed a post) Mara launches a bolt of eldritch energy at the halfling that Darnell is retrieving his dagger from. 2. It blasts into its chest, leaving a nasty wound. 3. The halfling is still standing, but looks very injured. 4. (Pikeman 1: 13 damage) The Masked Halfling sees the sudden set of reinforcements. 5. He holds the piece of grass to his lips again and blows on it, the petals in his other hand seem to react to the magic he is using, as a sleep spell is cast over the area , covering Darnell and Rumble. 6. (He's aimed it so his fellow halflings aren't in it, meaning that Killian isn't in it either since he's between the two of them) Sleep Hp affected: 18 Rumble and Darnell fall to the ground again, unconscious . 7. (If people want to work out why they collapsed, it'd be a DC 11 Arcana check. 8. Otherwise you see them fall over from this halfling's weird grasswhistle) STILL TO GO Killian INITIATIVE: ROUND 2 Darnell (11/18HP) ( unconscious , 9 more rounds) Simmeat (10/21 HP) Leojym (8/15 HP) Rumble (6/21 HP) ( unconscious , 9 more rounds) (Shadow) Halfling Pikemen 2 (3 damage) Mara (21/21 HP) Darkwing (11/18 HP) Masked Halfling (4 damage) Killian (3/18 HP) SCENARIO: Darnell is asleep at the feet of the dead halfling. 9. Simmeat is about 10 feet behind the halflings, while Killian is 15 feet in front of them (beside Rumble). 10. The others can get close this turn to do things (Dark is 30 feet in the air away, the others are about 15 feet away from Killian/Rumble) Simmeat rushes forward and with a flurry of blows, he strikes at the masked halfling. 11. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The Eladrin doesn't particularly feel very talkative, after all, he is incredibly hurt: "You ask too many questions. 2. Suffice it to say that I am your future. 3. It may not be an Aboleth, but something will keep you here forever. 4. Trials? 5. That's a joke! 6. I would describe it as an eternal struggle, a type of limbo. 7. I hope you like the Daylight effect on the grassy room. 8. That is likely to be the last type of sun light you will ever see..." The Eladrin lies motion less on the floor, regardless of no longer being pinned down by Jury: "Now go. 9. Leave me be in my sorrow." 10. ( @Ori : Alright, I won't reveal the DCs for these before hand but fair warning, this will be pretty hard. 11. I need an arcana check, a medicine check, and a nature check. 12. Verdict's help can aid you in either the medicine or the nature checks, your choice. 13. You can use the Guidance die in all three, as usual, assuming you recast thecantrip periodically. 14. A second person casting the same spell does not stack bonuses.) 15. The Eladrin responds to Charles: "Only if you choose to, but if you are a trialist as I once was,death should mean little to you, right?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Melkias - you begin to make your way over to the door, tripping over a small vial that had fallen unnoticed to the floor. 2. Once at the door, you lean and listen, but you can't hear anything beyond the door. 3. Delg - you glance over the books, but most seem to be written in an arcane language you don't understand. 4. Raya - you search through the various vials and find a few that look interesting - a green one, one that looks like powdered nightshade, and a silver one that is probably mercury. 5. Delg shoves the unconscious man at Ajax, leaves and then returns with the other one you had left tied up. 6. He is now conscious and very angry. 7. He struggles against his bonds and Delg, yelling, but growing quiet as he sees his dead friends. 8. As they enter the lab, his eyes grow wide. 9. "Wha - what do you want?" 10. he whispers.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You spend a few minutes to hide the wagon and take care of Betsy. 2. Once you are satisfied with your effort you return to the road and the goblin trail. 3. After some deliberation you settle on Moss and Maltake takeing the lead, Nobody and Ostran in the middle and Leona, Kai and Hazel bring up the rear. 4. You walk in this formation for around 15 minutes when Maltake suddenly raises his hand to signal everyone to stop. 5. Maltake and Moss, you see a snare hiddenon the trail. 6. You continue your chase, one person tracking and another one looking for danger. 7. After 10 more minutes you start catching glimpses of a small creek east of you, to your right. 8. A few more minutes and you reach a clearing. 9. The clearing is around 100 feet long and 30 feet wide. 10. The creek runs on the eastern side of it and seams to come from inside the hill in front of you. 11. On the other two sides of the clearing and behind the stream, your view gets obscured by the surrounding forest.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (@Ori: There is plenty of food. 2. Saving some for Taters should be easy enough, even if you are seen doing so.) 3. @Doozey: Villonah is actually busy talking to Caah at the moment. 4. She seems interested in knowing how the half-orc came to meet CRAP. 5. You overhear Caah saying that it was at this very tavern, though she is being shady with the details and trying to change the subject. 6. You inadvertently help her out when you briefly interrupt the conversation to ask Villonah about her request to you. 7. Villonah simply asks you to come to her aid if you see the other half-orc, Zern Xerktill, approaching her. 8. You look over your shoulder and notice that he is instead talking to the elegant elf lady, Olisara Lightsong, on the other side of the table, so you should have some time to spare. 9. When you ask about Dornal, she nods in agreement that you should probably talk to the dwarf. 10. Nonetheless, when you find yourself walking towards another guest to start a casual conversation, curiosity gets the best of you and you are suddenly offering meats to the owl-man instead. 11. He accepts the kind gesture and replies in a somewhat accented Common. 12. Owl-man to Doozey: "Phank you for phe offering. 13. I reckon you are not one of Madame Freona's daughters, phough it seems you cannot escape your race's hospitality. 14. I am Senitir, advisor to Lord Valero Brankengulf. 15. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Soar, you spend some time looking around the area. 2. The water gets too deep for your elk to walk, but they are quite happy to swim, even with the crates of gold. 3. You use speak with animals to interact with a few lizards, larger frogs and birds in the lcoal area. 4. What you learn is that there is danger everywhere, many predators of all kinds, and most creatures keep very quiet and still in the Mere unless they have to hunt. 5. The bird and frog both speak of creatures that are almost certainly the lizardfolk, coming up and down the same trail you have been following. 6. The birds talks of giant spiders, giant lizards that crawl instead of walking, and little balls of light that smell of death. 7. None are nearby, but they are never far in the Mere. 8. Divine sense does not get any results. 9. No, but each canoe has three paddles and is large enough to hold up to five people if not too heavily laden. 10. With Jalt and Soar's armour, perhaps four would be the maximum. 11. (If you would like Nub to have read Drizzt books and be a fan, that's absolutely fine in canon. 12. He's famous!)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Royan cautiously crosses the room, staying close to the centre, but he can't seem to keep his eyes off the glowing globe, and he stop only when he smacks into the wall on the other side. 2. Rhayna enters next, and curious as ever, she crosses to the north side of the room and investigates the dark globes. 3. Her conclusion of this room is that it was originally some form of gallery, with each globe displaying a different quality. 4. It is likely that to experience each globe, the viewer would need to approach each separately, upon which it would activate its quality (kind of like going through a dark art gallery, and a light switching on above each painting as you stand in front of it). 5. Kaylyn enters next, and also crosses to the centre of the room. 6. Weaving a brief spell with her celestial powers, she senses magic only from the glowing globe. 7. Focusing on it directly, she detects an aura of enchantment magic, although she can't determine whether it is beneficial or not. 8. Kastix, Ireniana and Erky remain for now outside the globe room, with Kastix peering cautiously inside, Erky adjusting his new armour, and Ireniana guarding the rear.

As they head off, Taman spots a couple of the guards in the southwest tower climb down the ladder attached, heads peeking back in your direction, before entering the bottom of that tower partway. 7. Their heads poke back at you before a new head pops out scrutinizing you. 8. That head is half-elven, pointy bearded and eared. 9. "Ahhhh," snarls Ord. 10. "I'm with ye and my lass as well. 11. Old grabs a great axe nearby in his tent, tosses it onto his shoulder. 15. "Let's go lad." 16. Bryn pads her way easily along the mud-crusted walls in shadow, to a point where she can dart through a hole in torch coverage and bolt slippedy-pawed under the canvas of the tent. 17. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Angie and Healer seem to have sufficently convinced Thokein that the party should take the path to the left. 2. The path takes you north for roughly twenty minutes, before coming to a fork. 3. The middle of this fork appears to be marked with some sort of totem consisting of stacked rocks and wood. 4. On top of the stack is an animal skull which appears to have belonged to some sort of small deer judging by the antlers protruding from the top of the skull. 5. Hanging from the antlers are tattered cloth ribbons. 6. The ribbons on the left are dyed blue while the ribbons on the right are dyed red. 7. Once again the fog prevents you from seeing very far down either path , but from what you can tell both paths appear to continue north. 8. Which path do you take? 9. Ten more minutes of walking brings you to another totem complete with a deer skull. 10. The left antler is broken off this skull, while blue ribbons hang from the right antler which is pointing to the northeast. 11. Continuing down the path for roughly half an hour brings you to a small clearing. 12. The fog seems slightly less dense here, but the daylight seems to be waning quickly. 13. DM Note: Someone please makea perception check.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Moss creates a small flame in her hand Ostran gets a torch going and Kai casts light on hershield, befor you follow the narrow dry path along the stream into the cave. 2. Just inside the cave mouth, a few uneven stone steps lead up to a small, dank chamber on the east side of the passage. 3. The cave narrows to a steep fissure at the far end, and is filled with the stench of animals. 4. Savage snarls and the sounds of rattling chains greet your ears where three wolves are chained up just past the opening next to a stalagmite. 5. Each wolf‘s chain leads to an iron rod driven into the ground near the fissure. 6. Next to each chain a goblin is standing, each one with a nasty grin on there faces. 7. Some of you recognize the goblin in the middle, wearing a good leather armor, a longbow and a burned left arm. 8. It is the goblin you chased after the ambush. 9. He is the first to react and he releases one of the wolf‘schains from the rod, setting the beast free. 10. It is your turn, what do you do? 11. Trying combat without initiative, just post your turns in whatever order you like. 12. First post gets resolved first. 13. I will post results as you go along. 14. My goal is to streamline combat a bit by removing some of the waiting time. 15. The Cave itself and the doorways are around 10 feet wide. 16. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Lander: Khubic says "When it comes to alibis, don't get too focused on the details. 2. Vague generalities are harder to fact check than specifics. 3. With the refugee crisis in the area, you all look like refugees to the locals. 4. As for being seen with me, well, nobody knows the face I currently wear." 5. As if to explain, he passes his hand over his face and you see in but a hand's breadth it has changed. 6. The haughty countenance of a high-born elven noble now looks down it's nose upon you. 7. With another pass of his hand, the bearded Dwarf is back. 8. "The area between here and my contact's area of operation is rather mundane according to my information. 9. A few rural homes cling to the outskirts of the town, but beyond them it's mostly farmsteads and some of those have been abandoned for years. 10. Stick to the roads and open areas when possible, our enemies prefer to work in secret." 11. Riona: Your familiar gives a small hoot as you stroke the top of it's head. 12. It closes it's large eyes and leans into your pets, then as you open your hand and extend it outward, the small owl takes flight. 13. Itdoes a few laps around the common room before perching atop one of the bedposts at the foot of your bed. 14. It's large eyes scan the room as it's head turns 360 degrees, this way and that. 15. The moon through the window reflecting in it's eyes as it flutters and preens itself while you sleep. 16. The night passes for you without incident. 17. Lander: You come downstairs to find the bar area empty save for the barkeep. 18. He stands behind the bar, wiping glasses and organizing bottles. 19. He hasn't noticed you yet. 20. All: The night passes for each of you without incident. 21. For those in the common rooms, your night wasn't as peaceful as those with their own rooms. 22. The snores, flatulence, and fidgeting of the other patrons are a constant presence, though you still manage to get sleep and feel rested in the morning. 23. What is everyone doing now that the morning has come?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Jimjar happily accepts Selune's blessing from Rhayna, and accompanied by the two half-elves he approaches the duergar traders, calling out to them in Undercommon:Agurrak, Laduguerren alde. 2. Jende grisak zer albiste? 3. The five grey-skinned dwarves stop and turn as one, their dark eyes boring into Jimjar and flicking quickly between him, Zeno and Kaylyn. 4. One of them speaks gruffly back: Zer nahi duzu, ipotxak. 5. Eta zein da zure negozioa gainazaleko biztanleekin? 6. Then, gesturing back to his two companions Jimjar cheerily replies: Ai, hauek dira nire bi esklaboak. 7. Laku iluna aldera bidaiatzen ari gara. 8. Erakutsi al zenieke arrainen herriari bidea? 9. Eta agian gurekin merkataritza? 10. Jimjar Deception: 11Duergar Insight: 6 Kaylyn, who doesn't speak Undercommon, can only guess at the gnome's conversation, but Zeno whispers to her that Jimjar is pretending they are both his slaves, probably to gain favour with the sullen and suspicious duergar. 11. In Zeno's opinion, Jimjar did a rather poor job of it, but it seems to have been enough to fool the traders, and they visibly relax, drop their guard and their packs, and speak freely with the gnome, explaining the best route to take to Sloopludop. 12. Kaylyn & Zeno, you can nominate any goods you wish to trade for/with. 13. The duergar seem to have a few weapons, including handaxes, hammers and a couple of longswords, as well as light crossbows. 14. They have one set of leather armour pieces and a shield made of zurkwood. 15. They also have a range of general goods, such as backpacks, bedrolls, a healer's kit, some rope, lanterns and waterskins, and some rations that look promising compared to the fungus you've been eating so far. 16. Stool look up at Rhyana, then lets out a puff of spores, which again helps those still hidden to communicate telepathically, but it is clear the spores effect is only local, and the thoughts of Zeno, Jimjar and Kaylyn are out of reach. 17. Rhayna and Sekkar can only hope that Kaylyn and Zeno recall the conversations they have no doubt had with their companions in the past several days about what equipment they lack, and what preferences each has for weapons. 18. Certainly Sekkar has previously expressed his desire for a longsword.

Korhil and Rilvar section: (OCC: if you bought something make sure to take off the appropriate gold amount) Elmar Barthen: (to Rilvar) "That will be 10 gold for 10 rations and a healers kit." 2. After the transaction Rilvar leaves and heads to the Sleeping Giant Tap House. 3. Elmar Barthen takes the three gold pieces from Korhil and hands Korhil his rations. 4. Gimble, Misty, and Finnian section: Put your spoiler here.Narth: (to the person he is talking to) "I heardSister Garaele, that elf cleric who works at the Shrine of Luck, recently left the city for a few days. 5. A bit strange no? 6. Considering everything going on around here.” Narth's Friend: (to Narth) "Thats not that strange is it?" 7. Elsa: (to one of the patrons) "I heard thatDaran Edermath, the orchard keeper, is a former adventurer. 8. Maybe they should get him to go deal with the goblins or the bandits." 9. Lanar: (to his buddy) "Orcs have been raiding the towns north of the city, the ones in and around the Triboar Trail. 10. I actually heard the steward is looking to hire someone to go deal with them. 11. Who would be foolish enough to go deal with some Orc Raiders?" 12. Toblen Stonehill: (to Gimble) "Couldn't say for sure why the bandits started getting worse. 13. Perhaps its cause they know how little we are protected outside the city walls. 14. The Great War is why there isn't much infrastructure outside the major cities. 15. The Peace Treaty hurt our kingdom more so than the others. 16. The knights of the kingdom are too few. 17. Supposedly there should be a member of the Crown's guardians handling the situation, but i haven't heard anything about it. 18. For sure most merchants and business here in the city aren't doing too well. 19. If suppliers are getting hit people start to run out of things to sell.... 20. So, can i help you with anything other than chatter?" 21. Misty goes over to the bar where Gimble and Toblen are chatting. 22. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Mokrai hits hard and precise. 2. He is sure to put an end to this measly little kobold in front of him. 3. But after the massive sword almost cuts the kobold in half - it is still standing in front of the barbarian, grinning up at his face with rotting teeth. 4. Winged Kobold Spy SilverTongue (17/17) Kobold-Scout-1 (5) Kobold-Scout-2 (13) Oleksi (15/15) Lily (15/15) Mokrai (21/25) Blake (5+1/16) Lily, Blake, you can go in any order you wish. 5. After about an hour of reading, Oleksi realises that this 'Tholm' was an adventurer from Neverwinter. 6. He is writing about how he thinks, he has discovered an unknown entrance into Khundrukar. 7. There is also a simple map, with a big X drawn on the Stone Tooth's eastern side. 8. It seems this location is one day's travel away - while Blasingdell is still two days away at best. 9. The night passes without any other interruptions. 10. You all slept reasonably well, but you do feel the first chill of the year in your bones and the cold just doesn't want to leave in the morning. 11. But your mood lifts when you all think about the revelations you found out the night before. 12. You pack up your camp and walk towards that big mysterious X that you found in Tholm's journal. 13. You realise it lies on the other side of a dark forest - and you decide to walk around it, rather than cutting through an overgrown forest. 14. Early afternoon you're able to spot the waters edge of what is labeled on the hand-drawn map with 'the dark mere'.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Yeah, another 38 points of damage will do it.) 2. Trim uses textbook technique to do another 7 damage arrow shot. 3. Reverie strikes with her scimitar (5 damage) and dagger (3 damage). 4. Bommie is distracted, allowing Isk to get a massive blow with the glaive (11 slashing, 12 necrotic). 5. "Bommie" is sent sprawling to the ground. 6. Isk uses healing hands on Reverie (now at 12/36 hp). 7. Before your eyes, the form flows and morphs. 8. The skin, armor, and clothes all become a blue-grey rubbery hide. 9. The face is almost featureless. 10. On the ground is the lifeless body of a doppelganger . 11. (It had a lot more HP than average, to up its challenge rating.) 12. At its side is a pouch (of coins), a scabbard, and a rapier. 13. (That figure in the sky is still approaching, but it is far enough away that it won't be able to see what is going on in the dim lighting. 14. Your group has a short time to prepare and discuss plans. 15. You could get into a battle formation. 16. You could try to stealth behind obstacles on the training field, like the trees and target dummies. 17. You could go inside the dojo, and prepare for ranged attacks behind cover... You won't have enough time for anything elaborate, like digging a trench.) 18. (Okay, everyone is in the dojo, behind cover. 19. The doppelganger was carried in and put where it wouldn't be seen from the outside.) 20. After a few seconds of silence, a medium-sized figure lands in the middle of the training grounds. 21. The fiery glow when it was flyingearlierearlier has been suppressed. 22. It is wearing blackscale armor, and has an empty quiver on its back (worn low, like a fanny pack). 23. It has bat wings, and appears humanoid. 24. It is looking around the yard, and after a few moments it heads to where you fought the doppelganger. 25. It reaches down to touch some of the pools of blood (your party) and ichor (dopple) from your earlier fight. 26. It continues turning its head, looking for something (or someone). 27. (Low lighting from a distance. 28. Everyone make a Perception roll , to see more . 29. And roll either Arcana or Religion , to identify the monster . )

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Alright, a plan has been established. 2. In the short moments that you take to form a plan, Sarai discusses a locale that she had learned of from some birds toward the start of your... vacation in Jerusalem. 3. Given Allison Margrave’s apparent penchant for necromancy and other forms of magic, then it is possible that there may be a connection between the two. 4. If there is, then perhaps you’ll even find Archer and put an end to him. 5. Oz clicks an imaginary key fob in his hand as his car gives a sharp honk and pulls in front of you all. 6. He turns and, with all the coolness he can muster, “Well, lets get going. 7. I ain’t afraid of no ghosts.” He then hops in the driver’s seat, “Caster, you and Assassin should be able to keep up with us, follow behind and make sure that nothing gets near us.” With that, it is safe to assume you all bunch in. 8. The shotgun seat will of course be decided by combat. 9. No? 10. Alright then. 11. With no time to lose, the Feyrrai peels out and speeds down the evening streets, under the watchful eye of who knows what. 12. You have about thirty minutes to plan and prepare. 13. The team splits up at that point, with Sarai being a good distance away from the house. 14. Through her scope and enhanced night vision, However, the house is still beyond her 60 foot night vision, so things are still a bit hard to make out. 15. Meanwhile, the rest of the team continues to drive forward, ready and anticipating an opening barrage from whatever is in there. 16. However... nothing seems to happen. 17. There’s no opening salvo, no massive counterattack. 18. The car simply pulls up to an eerily quiet home. 19. Yet, as you pull up to the house, Assassin speaks up, “Master, I think something saw us... it was on the roof, but moved before we got here.” Sarai also saw something, but she’s 200 feet away and you wouldn’t know that.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. To be fair, the group could be called a "complete strangers" no more than a carpenter or a smith someone hires to do a specific job. 2. There was a reason Sir Tristan did not hire first group of ragtags from nearby Athkatla, but bothered to contact a guild all the way to Waterdeep. 3. Paper rules the world - signed contracts and all the information the guild had about it's employees guaranteed safety of client's investments. 4. The "turn to the mountains" was not that far away - half a mile, may be - and the scenery was so beautiful, even Cinder should have stop to regret the need for a walk. 5. Anyone, dreaming about pastoral lifestyle or simply appreciative of peace and quiet would think himself to be in a paradise: late morning of the late spring, when sun is not too hot yet, birds singing loudly, the trees are covered with flowers of all shades of red - from pink to deep purpure, the light sweet smell of those flowers, the mountains against the clear blue sky, that looked like they were drown... People along the road were smiley and friendly - clearly this was the place where no one ever locked his door or expected anything malicious from a neighbour. 6. It was difficult to believe anything evil could originate anywhere near the place. 7. And yet, it was. 8. Closer to the mountains you came across the broken trees. 9. The trail here is cold - attack happened days ago, but the sight is unpleasant. 10. A couple farmers were still clearing out the place and someone who looked like a priest was talking with workers. 11. Far ahead you could see where gardens were ending and ground slowly rising up forming the base of the mountains. 12. May be it's a bight sun affecting owl's perception, but the bird could not report anything out of order around.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Two things you surmise from your tracking. 2. One, the winter wind is blowing harshly, thus moving new snow rapidly across the ground. 3. If there were any tracks there once the wererat escape, they have been covered up hours ago. 4. Two, it is possible that she didn't leave any humanoid tracks, even if there were any, as wererats have been known to assume giant rat form and scurry away. 5. Ah, here it is, you see on the town map.Glarth’s house is by the Seafishers’ Docks, the gathering place for the folk who fish around the coasts of Ice Peak Island. 6. It's very cold today. 7. Jasun would definitely not be comfortable inthis place, too.High Captain Amathria Rolsk, in the town’s longhouse, comes out as you finish looking at the directory to say hello. 8. "Welcome. 9. Sorry about the cold, eh? 10. Let me know if you need any help. 11. Good to see you guys." 12. she then leaves to go back inside and you all make your way to Glarth. 13. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Beads of sweat form on Allister's brow as he avoids many a broken bottle nearest the log wall. 2. The narrow strip of land between the cliff and the water is closed off by a 15-foot-high wall made of thick palm logs lashed together with stout vines. 3. Their bottoms are set into the ground, and the whole wall leaves a two foot gap at the top of spiked logs before the top of the cave mouth.The gates are roughly made but reinforced with iron bands and backed by two heavy wooden bars. 4. Curling around to the second cave entrance, Allister curses to himself to find a wall similar to the first sans any gate. 5. Peeping inside reveals much activity even for this time of day. 6. Allister takes special note of a pair of pirates near the gate playing cards on a table beside a curling animal horn fashioned to be a loud noise making thing.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. DM: There is no response to Bob's brave exclamation. 2. The chanting continues.The chanting appears to be coming from everywhere, echoing throughout the tunnels. 3. Actions? 4. Gillain, Toi, and Dimitr witness Bob's transformation. 5. What was once a dwarf standing before them now stands a large wolf. 6. Bob-Wolf sniffs the air. 7. At first, Bob-Wolf smells the earth around him. 8. The scent is not that of freshly dug earth but earth that is old and stale in scent. 9. Then Bob-Wolf's senses are overwhelmed with the scent of death and decay. 10. It permeates the entire tunnel, coming from everywhere. 11. However, Bob-Wolf does catch the sent of insects close by. 12. Bob-Wolf's sense of earing is more focused as well. 13. The chanting, though it seems to come from everywhere when Bob-Wolf was in his dwarven form, now seems to have a direct location, gauging from the sound. 14. With the heightened senses of Bob's wolf form, the chanting is more unnerving. 15. Dmitri has a torch-lit so there is some light. 16. (Post #644)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Midian can hear the sounds of a fewpeople moving around inside and speaking with each other in normal tones, but it would seem the main entrance is still barred from the preceding night. 2. He could start looking around the premises for another means of entrance, or perhaps he could just knock. 3. After about half a minute, Midian's knocking at the door brings results as a man, who appears to be in his thirties, opens the door after removing whatever was keeping it closed. 4. "Blessed day, young sir," says the man politely after looking Midian up and down, his attention being initially caught by the rapier at Midian's side and then the Donai patch on the breast of his uniform. 5. "How might I and my establishment be of use to you on this fine morning?" 6. The man frowns at Midian's words and makes no move to open the door further. 7. "Certainly," he says, "I am more than happy to cooperate, but I am a little confused. 8. Seeker Lomani and others of your Temple have already been here. 9. They have taken away most everything from that room and asked me many, many questions already. 10. What more is there to know, and who might be asking?"
