Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Mobile- {poor Ashanti} From behind you you hear the creaking and rattling of an approaching wagon. 2. On the driver’s bench are a young couple you recognise from their performance at the tavern the night before. 3. “Ho there travellers! 4. If you're heading east, might as well hop in. 5. There’s beasts about, or so therumour goes.” Says the half-orc actor. 6. The back of the covered wagon is full of the belongings of a travelling performer- elaborately painted backdrops, costumes, props and so on. 7. Lounging on a trunk in the corner you see a shadowed figure... (enter inkedwolves! 8. Woo!) 9. Several miles later, the farms begin to give way to more and more uncultivated land. 10. Eventually the young actress, Rilla, shouts back to you all. 11. “We’ll be at my mother’s farm in just a few minutes. 12. Glad you agreed to track those creatures Six- I assume you lot are on the same quest?”

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Willi , you launch the lasso straight up, which seems to be timed perfectly. 2. You just float the rotating loop through the air, up and over the bridge, and down upon the goblin like a hula hoop that immediately tightens around the goblins body. 3. It is now restrained . 4. However, you won't be able to attempt to take that next action and pull the goblin down from the bridge until initiative order is determined. 5. The goblin is going to be surprised in the first round of combat though, since Zene and you were hiding, and it wasn't actively looking for anyone. 6. And it can't even see Naltic and Taraven . 7. So you'll likelyget a first attempt at pulling it off the bridge. 8. It will require a check though. 9. Everyone, please roll for initiative! 10. Goblin: 17 (surprised round 1) Round 1: Taraven > Naltic > Goblin (surprised) > Zene > Willi Taraven and Naltic are up! 11. Remember, the goblins in the west cavern are not currently involved/engaged in this encounter. 12. Also, if either of you go back down the steep embankment, you'll have to roll a check again to climb back up. 13. The goblin will not make an action on this turn. 14. Zene , you can go ahead and make an Intimidation check, with advantage because the goblin is currently trapped in Willi's lasso. 15. And it's tight. 16. Willi , I imagine your action will depend on the result of Zene's check, but feel free to queue up what Willi wants to do and I will process it in order!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Xander Off in the distance on the horizon, you see a ship moving away from you about 20° off your bow. 2. Since you're the navigator, you see it's heading is directly for Isle of Despair, same direction as yourselves, but slightly faster. 3. Since it's the late afternoon and the sun is behind you - it's easy to see it appears to be black and smaller than Truth's Tenacity. 4. Ban you swing from rope to rope from the mast, tying down new ones and removing the old ones. 5. The Brody's deck crew give you glances of curiosity and downright amazement since they slowly climb ropes or use the metallic bars on the mast to work their way up. 6. The deck crew removes the partially damaged sail that Raphael worked on for now and puts it below deck with the new one obtained from the pirate ship. 7. Repairs can still be made to it when you have time. 8. Grol and Xander, you both can only see the torchlights in the distance. 9. Anyone else may roll perception if you wish. 10. Where would you all like to go?

By the temperature and consistency of the waste, you can infer that it is still relatively fresh. 3. You continue down the tunnel for another several hours and emerge into a titanic cave. 4. Stalactites jut from the ceiling like rotting teeth, and in the center of the cavern floor is located a gaping black hole from which emanates a foul odor. 5. The sides of the hole are relatively smooth, and the bottom of the hole, if there is a bottom, is lost in shadow.

The mummy moves toward Raishan this time. 7. (10ft.) 8. Tarkin detects nothing dangerous on the door before Leshanna opens it. 9. A short flight of stairs leads to a large room. 10. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. From your experience, anyone "talking" mentally can be heard by everyone in the vicinity. 2. Extrapolating from what Ebokk said initially, you assume it's the second spore cloud that enveloped you. 3. You have not heard any mental communication from Thrakk, and he was a little ways away from the rest of you when the second spore cloud erupted, so you could assume he wasn't affected. 4. Whether the flumph is benefiting from the same spore cloud, you're not sure, but Erric knows that flumphs are known to be telepathic themselves. 5. "Greetings, Erric. 6. I'm afraid I cannot identify myself to you, as my race has a different way of doing that to each other. 7. If I tried, it wouldn't be pleasant. 8. I am also sorry to say that I am going to be wholly unhelpful where the rest of these caverns are concerned. 9. I am no explorer and have been very happy to live here above these myconids for many years. 10. I witnessed the derro and grimlocks fighting each other and was pleased when the myconids were able to put a stop to their battle. 11. As for the orc ... 12. I don't know what to tell you except to be wary. 13. The alien mind may prove benign or malignant." 14. The creature pauses. 15. "What is asong, and how do you play one?" 16. Thrakk looks at Erric and then Maldorn. 17. "I am taking you to the Grimlocks," he says. 18. "As for a mysterious artifact ... 19. I don't know of one." 20. "Yes, I knew they were here," Thrakk answers Erric. 21. "They stopped the grimlocks and derro from fighting. 22. They are no threat to us, so, no, I didn't feel any warning was necessary. 23. And, as far as I know, there is nothing else between us and the grimlocks if we go through there," he motions toward the northeast passage. 24. As Anafrey vocalizes her frustrations, the orc continues to look at the bard. 25. Thrakk gives a quick glance at Maldorn before turning back to look at Erric. 26. "We should go through here, first. 27. The grimlocks could escape the caves while we are in other tunnels looking for this artifact. 28. How would they know to ambush us? 29. If we are quiet, they shouldn't know we're coming. 30. And, yes, I have met the derro."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Thinking to yourself quietly as you walk back through the town, you recognise the elvish woman apparently standing guard outside the Marsh Oak as being of moonelf heritage. 2. Walking past with your companions on your way to the fletchers, you are unable to come up with much more about the decapitated orc's scars. 3. [OOC] Spoiler for Alwin: The only thing that you can think of relating to suchmarkings is a vague recollection that one of your tutors onceleft you with when referring to "lesser races" that sometimes disfigured and scarred themselves in deplorable arcane or divine rituals, though such you were taught was strictly forbidden by elvish law. 4. "Am I sitting at that table in front of you? 5. No? 6. Well then I can't bloody well be THERE, can I!?! 7. Anyway, who the hell is asking? 8. Because you sure aren't a local to be hollering at me like this." 9. The shack's door opens just a sliver, with an older (but not frail) woman's voice emerging from within.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Zorgar: Your coins whistle through the air and begin to bombard the black knight repeatedly. 2. Some of them bounce of the thick armor and a few get deflected by his shield, but several make it past, hammering the weaker points, causing dents and cracks. 3. Your guiding bolt thuds into the undead pinned to the ground and it begins to glow slightly, highlighting the wounds it has already taken. 4. Undead caster saving throw: 3 Lia/Emma: Lia's ghostly skeletal hand materializes next to the knight and grasps at it, but he bashes it with his shield and it dissipates into nothing as Emma fires a ray at the knight who dodges out of the way just in time. 5. Hrothgar: As you attack with your sword, the knight brings up it's shield knocking the first one to the side, then the second slicing it along the neckline sliding through the thinner armor causing the helmet to come slightly loose and come off before it brings up it's sword and knocks your last attack away harshly. 6. Hastings: Your dagger glances off the knight's armor but you bring your Rapier in hard, exploiting the weakness in the armor you already made, stabbing your rapier straight though again as the knight roars in agony. 7. Aerdeth: Your arrows flit through the air at the knight, but he brings his shield up at the last moment and deflects them. 8. Everyone: As the other heroes come rushing in to fight alongside you, the Death Knight drops it's sword and it's hands glow with light and darkness at the same time and it calls shrieks in the gruff voice of something from the grave, "The master will complete his ceremony, I will not let you all intervene." 9. Hellfire Orb Damage - Fire: 26 + Necromantic: 34 DC 18 Dex Save roll. 10. A combination of fire and dark energy washes over a 20 foot area, affecting anyone in melee combat.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Assumed marching order: Ryder, Vishal, Taran, Liira, Druhdaar, Caelius, Tiem, River The eight of you enter the special prisoners dungeons, a brightly lit set of hallways where lavender crystal lights eliminate any chance of concealing shadows. 2. Before you set out for the Kintam, Ryder explained that there would likely be no guards within the complex itself, as prolonged contact with prisoners is discouraged so that prisoners cannot corrupt guards. 3. Thus, guards are usually in the complex itself if they are fulfilling errands like delivering food or guarding Inspired. 4. The complex is comprised of the following: All doors are locked. 5. Ryder does not have a key, only the Inspired do. 6. All doors except the one to the relaxation room are solid crysteel. 7. The relaxation room has a door of stone with a crystal window cut in it. 8. Picking the lock on a cell door requires a DC 20 thieves tools check. 9. Someone proficient with thieves tools can Help with the check. 10. Picking the lock on a non-cell door requires a DC 15thieves tools check. 11. Someone proficient with thieves tools can Help with the check. 12. The door between you and the guards is solid crysteel, and the guards told you to shout if you need help. 13. However, they cannot see you and you cannot see them, and as long as you don't knock anything over/make another really loud noise, you can move around more or less freely. 14. The walls of thecomplex are not stone, so mold earth will not help here. 15. Lore: Crysteel is a psionic creation the Inspired are fond of. 16. Crystal is taken and psionically melded with strong metal to make a half-luminescent material much tougher than either alone. 17. Crysteel can range from delicate translucent colors like that used in the Inspired's headpieces, to the opaque, silvery metal that makes up these doors. 18. Liira and Tiem shake their heads. " 19. No way of knowing who's in where, " Liira says with a shrug. " 20. Other than just straight up telling them to shout. " 21. Vishal is almost overwhelmed by how much magic is in the complex. 22. The questioning rooms and cells all radiate powerful abjuration magic, as does the rest of the complex to a lesser degree. 23. Divination magic is quietly powerful from the questioning rooms, and transmutation magic suffuses the cell walls.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Kasaaptu points up in anger, and one of the shadows is consumed in dark flames, screeching loudly in pain and anger. 2. (Save: 13 , Damage: 2 ) She then summons her dark energy once more, unleashing a blast up into the shadows where another heavy "thud" is heard and another shriek in pain. 3. Badger, crouching by a stump summons blue sparkling energy into a ball in his hand and then throws it into the leaves above where it explodes with the sound of shattering glass across one of the dark shadows which hisses loudly. 4. Sir Darak barks his commands in anger, wondering why the foolish Sedrik hadn't been trying harder to get out of the way, he launches the javelin into the air and a shriek issues, several gobs of bright red blood fly down from above and splatter across the ground. 5. Sickle holds his hand out, a blade of ice forming there, and throws it into the air towards two targets that are close together. 6. The dagger explodes with a concussive bang and two creatures shriek. 7. (Dex save: 6 . 8. Dex save: 21 .). 9. He throws another, the ice blade hitting something with a wet thud before again exploding. 10. (Dex save: 4 . 11. Dex save: 4 .). 12. Azaka fires another arrow:Attack: 7 Damage: 10 Azaka looks up from turning her roasting lizard. 13. "Sure. 14. As you can see, they're roughly ten feet tall, with twenty foot wingspans. 15. They give birth to live young. 16. It was said that once long ago they could assume other forms, but it's believed those rights are lost to them. 17. Forms such as wingless lizard folk or flying dinosaurs. 18. Their typical attack pattern is to either soften up prey and test them with an assault from above, or to swoop down and steal both people or goods away in a quick attack before fleeing. 19. They're native to Chult. 20. Generally they're isolationists, and view most other creatures as their enemies. 21. And as mentioned, the ones that home in Fire Finger stole something from me that's part of my family. 22. An ancient mask. 23. As for fire finger, it's a naturally formed spire of rock about three hundred feet tall that a clan of Pterafolk roost on. 24. It's dotted with small caves and a fire burns atop it, though I've never discovered why."

He takes 2 bludgeoning damage as he is whisked away to the entrance of the cave again, falling prone . 4. Haize , thanks to the forewarning of the others, manages to deftly dash over the trickle of the stream before the rest comes gushing down and is in the western side passage, the rocky ground feeling a little uneasy beneath the feet. 5. Kres leaps into the air, his wings holding him aloft out of the way of theoverflowing river. 6. Mary follows Haize into the side passage, managing to keep her footing and avoiding the flow of the stream. 7. Randaler , seeing the waves ahead, manages to grab onto a rocky outcrop and hold on as the water bashes against him, he manages to keep his ground. 8. Realgâr is swept up into the stream as he attempts to use his javelin to hold on. 9. He jams it into some rocks, but his grip slips as he is also washed to the entrance of the cave, taking 3 bludgeoning damage and falling prone . 10. If Chad, Randaler, orRealgâr were holding any lit torches, they have now gone out as they are drenched. 11. (Just a note, it would be an Athletics check to climb up the side to attempt to get to the bridge)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "Aye, that she does man of Akros. 2. Somewhere in the city. 3. Now we need to find her." 4. Captain Argon answers. 5. Youmake landfall in the harbor area, using available facilities and find an area serviceable enough to dock at. 6. Up close you realize that the harbor area and the entire city are devoid of life. 7. Clams and seaweed cover walls and streets; water still trickles from many door frames and windows. 8. Captain Argon joins you as you disembark, Spyro stays with the ship and the crew. 9. The crew had seen much sailing with a returned, but the sight of Arixmethes left them in wonder. 10. Spyro, however, had a knowing grin on his face as he watched you leave. 11. As you make your way down the docks and onto shore dozens, if not hundreds of crabs and lobsters emerge from the houses and shadows. 12. They form a path, standing left and right of the street. 13. With their heads and claws, they all point onwards. 14. Tisto Not much is known of this fabled place. 15. The name seems to be interchangeable with the city and the kraken that the city rests on. 16. Thought to be an island, but really a titanic kraken, generations of unaware humans had constructed a city on Arixmethes, though when the kraken woke, the city was demolished and the residents were killed.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Brythel, you do not find any thin that even remotely resembles a key in this weapons room. 2. You do find a couple rusty nails. 3. Torla, make a perception check. 4. Imras the blade has a fine sheen to the metal, the grip is some kind of leather-like material. 5. The guard is what interests you the most, carved in painstaking detail you can see runes and what looks like words in Elvish. 6. It reads. 7. "Forever shall my edge stay sharp, Thoroughly I will rend flesh from bone. 8. I am the reckoning to those who would starve the light." 9. There is a Makers mark at the end of the Inscription. 10. 2 letters in Elvish which would translate to. 11. U.Q

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Final Initiative Count: Rider, Ceasar, Krag, Gnolls, Nuur. 2. The rider flies past the three of you and Captain Amakiir. 3. As they pass, you see several cuts on the hind legs of the horse they've been riding, likely made by the gnolls' makeshift weapons. 4. Captain Amakiir calls the caravan of troops to order, and as the gnolls continue forward, the war party rushes to meet them. 5. Gnolls will reach your position at initiative count 6 of the next round, so you all can really take your actions in any order this round. 6. Once that's done, you move in order, starting with Ceasar. 7. [@Nuur make an attack roll first, then roll damage. 8. They're about 90 feet away and will be using their action to dash and cover most of the distance to you all.] 9. Cesar notes that this detachment is relatively small, with only about 10 gnolls total, followed by 3 hyenas. 10. The war caravan has formed a line about level with Nuur and Krag, and the gnolls are eyeing certain parts of the line with glee. 11. One gnoll in particular is wielding two short blades and has locked eyes with Captain Amakiir. 12. The strange rider has dismounted and taken their place beside the captain, angling a longsword in both hands towards the gnoll forces. 13. Gnolls will reach your position in 1 round! 14. Your last set of actions out of reach of their blades occur now!

Around this time Urokris returns to the cave tunnel. 5. "It seems to be as the dwarf said. 6. Heads straight to the stream. 7. That seems new," he adds, looking into the hole. 8. "I don't know if I could even fit in there!" 9. Perception : 10

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The bugbear doesn’t even acknowledge Yed this time, answering only after Doc speaks. 2. ”I’m sure you believe that you will defeat the Black Spider, but even if you do, it will be too late for me. 3. The Black Spider is never merciful.” The group leaves Orlane, travelling along the Triboar trail. 4. Eventually, they come to the ruins of Conyberry. 5. The buildings are torn down and not little is left of the town. 6. An old trail leads northwest, towards the Neverwinter Woods.The forest grows dark and still as the trail winds deeper into the trees. 7. Heavy vines and thick layers of moss drape the branches, and the air is noticeably colder than it was in the ruined village. 8. Rounding a bend in the trail, you see a screen made from the warped branches of trees standing close together, woven into a domelike shelter in the shadows. 9. A low doorway leads inside.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Vostaria tries to bandage Dorstaer, but the stench of the creature lying next to him is foul and rotten, putting you off as that bandage doesn't hold. 2. The blood from Dorstaer is now seeping through the floorboards, and Jebben can see a pool being created in the ceiling above. 3. The rear Guard walks down the staircase, eyes on Jebben as he goes toward the bar. 4. He speaks to the bar-man in hushed tones, looking over to Jebben. 5. The other two Guards lower their manacles. 6. "I think this is above our pay grade. 7. Will you come with us to the Bailiff? 8. He will probably want to speak to you as this involves a noble and some quite serious charges. 9. If you don't, i'm afraid we will have to issue a warrant for your arrest... and there are some nasty bounty hunters in this city." 10. Jebben searches the room, although his rambling has put him at some disadvantage. 11. Distracted, you all notice that he is only searching the top of the surfaces, and fails to look inside any draws, cupboards or chests. 12. The corpse of Zackary is also somewhat distracting, and the smell is filling the corridor as well as the room now. 13. You all hear a loud knock on the door from downstairs and a muffled voice. 14. "Hurry up you lot." 15. Jebben On searching the room, you find some creams and lotions on the sides, but not much else which could point you to the suspect of the abduction, or any clues as to where Annie has disappeared to.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Duc it's a big organization. 2. You remember tge dragonborn and the elf but no one else. 3. You do not even see Gimble yet! 4. Retiog and Nat both notice none of the honor gaurd appear to be drinking as well as some members of the Order while others are eating and drinking without a thought. 5. Drake notices nothing off about the food or the drinks. 6. The vendor shrugs and mumbles "the look like all of you but better cloaks," he says moving on rhe man is hard to read. 7. Duc notices the dragonborn, Xander, and the elf, Lux, give you an odd look as you hover close by. 8. "You need something blue eyes," Lux asks grinning as he takes a deep drink if his cup. 9. The honor gaurd remain by the exits and there seems to be at least a hundred of them now as the crowd is concentrated now near the center of the four stands while the stragglers are being moved down towards thw thick of the crowd. 10. Up by Retiog, Nat, and Drake a hobgoblin and a fire gensia apporach in honor guard cloak. 11. "Move down join the crowd," the half-orc says hand on the hilt of a greatsword as the fire gensia's aura just radiates intimidatingly. 12. The dwarf and elf get up as well as the others around you three. 13. Looking out more honor gaurd are moving people down towards the center areas.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Nezznar, the Black Spider, seems to have something to say, but only blood comes from his mouth as his insides are carved up by Dekhan's sword. 2. The body sags, crumpling slowly to the ground, an easy kill for a party now feeling the power it can bring to bear. 3. The panicking bugbear yelps as Strix strikes him, but has the strength to continue on. 4. Strix, you now have your full turn to take, as do Varinth and Scupper. 5. Dekhan, you have a clear view of the room from above. 6. You see the statue with emerald eyes; it seems to be of a dwarven god. 7. You can make a Religion check to identify it if you wish. 8. You see the body of Nezznar, two bugbears, and four spiders, though many of these are charred almost completely away. 9. The table has what looks like maps, though you would have to get closer to be sure, and you see a black sack lying next to the table as well. 10. Scupper, you stick a tool in to try to pry the emerald out, and you push, and push some more, and the jewel... moves a fraction before sticking in place. 11. As the emerald moves, even very slightly, there is a rumbling from the ceiling above. 12. Dekhan, you hear this very clearly, and from your vantage point you notice the pillars on the right side of the room trembling a little, but the noise subsides after a moment. 13. You can see that dust from the floor and walls was stirred up by... whatever that was... and takes several seconds to settle again

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Puddin, you creep past a few houses, going up to windows and slinking near doorways. 2. You get the sense that some of these houses might be occupied, and some probably are not. 3. Some smell of death and decay, and you think it's likely they are not occupied. 4. Though that doesn't necessarily mean they're empty . 5. Do you want to press further into the village, or act on that information? 6. You are still in view of Kif and Barnaby, as Barnaby explains a number of theories for how the Needle Blights might be animated by a sufficiently powerful wizard. 7. You can press on, if you want, but I wanted to offer this opportunity to do something first. 8. Talk to them; don't talk to them. 9. Whatever you want. 10. You've passed a few houses. 11. You can go north or continue east. 12. Both have houses on both sides of the street, though you would guess that east is the main road through town. 13. Or you can act based on what you've already learned about the houses you've passed. 14. Kif, you suspect that some of these houses, at least, are genuinely unoccupied. 15. You've only walked a couple of blocks so far, and there may be a tavern somewhere in town. 16. You can't tell from where you are. 17. I paused you guys at this intersection, while you're still in sight of each other and you (and Puddin) have gathered a bit more information, before you decide which way to go, or whetheryou want to try to take shelter in a house you're already near. 18. You here shuffling, and a pause. 19. Then a stage whisper: Go away! 20. Please!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Continuing on your journey towards Madam Eva, you continue following the road to the north, traveling with the rest of the Vistani. 2. About half hour after your meeting with the revenant, the road begins to gradually disappear and is eventually replaced by a twisted, muddy path through the trees. 3. Deep ruts in the earth are evidence of the comings and goings of the wagons that use this trail. 4. The canopy of mist and branches that you've been witnessing since you left the village suddenly gives way to black clouds boiling far above. 5. There is a clearing here, next to a river that widens to form a small lake several hundred feet across. 6. There are five colorful round tents, each measuring ten feet in diameter, that are pitched outside a ring of four barrel-topped wagons. 7. Standing near the shore of the lake is a much larger tent, its stagging form lit from within. 8. Near the large tent, there are eight unbridled horses that are drinking from the river. 9. As you approach, you hear the mournful strains of an accordion that clashes with the singing of several brightly clad figures around a bonfire. 10. A footpath continues beyond this encampment, meandering north between the river and the forest's edge.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Mopham you easily stab down at one of the kobolds making sure he never wakes again. 2. Velfrim runs in helping Mopham with the cultist, then they head over to help Sevrn clear the brush away from the door. 3. Sevrn go ahead and roll an Athletics check with Advantage please. 4. The wood and brush that the kobold's had burning was very, very green. 5. It was easily moved out of your way with the help of Velfrim and Mopham. 6. There was one giant log that looked like an actual tree had been cut down and placed there, you all were actually wondering to yourselves how the tiny Kobolds even got it to this spot! 7. Once that mess was out of the way a little light shoving got the doors opened into the temple. 8. The occupants have been clearing the door of their barricade and making ready to depart. 9. The young priest you saw at the window leading them and helping the more panicked of the group. 10. He says to you Sevrn, with a bit timid of a voice as if he is still a bit scared from your earlier shouting, "We're ready to move. 11. There's a few injured over here that may need some help along the way. 12. How are we making our way to the keep?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Jalt, you (and any of the party who wish to accompany you) are taken down into the rooms beneath the keep, and along to what is obviously a dungeon. 2. It's not particularly pleasant or unpleasant; you get the sense that it's not much used. 3. You stand before a wooden door with a window with bars; you see Tored through them, sitting on the floor, looking up at a narrow slit that admits light. 4. He turns around and look at you, standing up. 5. The jailor, an elderly gnome, barks an order: Stand back from the door, boy. 6. Tored complies, standing at the furthest part of the room as the jailor swings the door open. 7. He's not been any trouble so far, but there's some folks would gladly give him a beating. 8. Luckily, he's got me to protect him. 9. She laughs, and motions you to enter if you want. 10. Tored shakes his head. 11. Suicide. 12. Maybe fifty of the fanciest bloody knights in the land might make it in, though some of the leaders would put up a fight. 13. He shakes his head. 14. Unless you've troops from Waterdeep or Iriaebor, don't go trying to seize the camp. 15. Jalt, you can make an Insight check if you wish.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Hegar replies to Serit: "Well I know there is a beast. 2. People have seen glimplses in the shadow. 3. Others have seen what looked like a cloaked goblin not long after a beast passed. 4. That's why I opened my shop to give some enouragement to others." 5. Replies to Moxo "You will need to wait a little as I seach my back room for a rapier. 6. I think there may be one." 7. Do you have more questions for him, or you want him to go and search for a rapier now? 8. Serit, you pull so hard you bend the handle slightly and the door creaks, but holds. 9. You notice a very solid-looking steel lock at the door. 10. Hegar shouts from the back room where he went "Dear, oh me! 11. I must have locked it out of instinct. 12. I will be back out momentarily." 13. Moxo , roll Constitution. 14. Gara , roll Investigation. 15. Gara, as you investigate, you seem to find no sign of Nassar or Gathrick. 16. Last time they were seen was going into Hegar's shop. 17. Moxo, FYI Hegar is not fleeing. 18. He went to the back room after you asked for a rapier. 19. Anyway, you are beginning to feel sleepy and drowsy. 20. Your fingertips are growing cold. 21. Nasaar: 18 Bulpo: 19 Nasaar and Bulpo seem completely fine. 22. Moxo: Hegar shrugs and says: "maybe you drank too much?" . 23. He then pick up a pile of keys and slowly walks to the door where he slowly begins looking to the right key. 24. Serit, Moxo, what do you want to do? 25. Gara, hold on a bit. 26. You are somewhat ahead of time, with regards to the inside group, so I update with what you see a bit later.

[Only Clipclop does not make the save] As the cave lights up with flames, Rutah, Ignus and Jaylen manage to step away from the the areas covered int the dark substance. 2. However, Clipclop is too slow to react. 3. Flames, suddenly rising from the tainted ground, surround him for a moment, before he can move out of them to a safe spot. 4. [Clipclop suffers 3 points of fire damage] The flames, covering the floor, only burn for a short moment, before dying down. 5. The dog's corpse, however, is still aflame. 6. While the first part of the cave looks like a natural cavern in the cliffside of the mountain, the large tunnel that continues from it looks to have been dug by something long ago. 7. The passage is rounded, its walls covered in mosses. 8. There are a few loose stones here and there as far as Rutah can see, and the tunnel seems to continue straight with a slight decline. 9. The faint blood trail he had noticed in the cave continues along the tunnel.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Serit is extremely stealthy and is ahead of the others, but does not see very much ahead. 2. Moxo: a rat has 1 hp, so doing 7 damage obliterates into a mushy mess. 3. Of course Moxo isn't competely covered by the rat remains, but enough for it to be noticeable. 4. You get to the bottom of the staircase, and it's completely dark. 5. Serit and Moxo have darkvision (though Moxo is well behind Serit) and can see the pale outlines of the large room and very barely the altar ahead. 6. Gara and Rohdin, you need a source of light or darkvision, or you will not see anything. 7. Serit sees nothing, but Gara hears some shuffling noises and what sounds like a hushed snarl after Moxo shoots his sling at the floor and walls. 8. Moxo looks around.There is nothing within his 60ft darkvision range but he is sure he was some movement beyond the altar, a hunched shadow or maybe more. 9. Also looking around both of you notice that some of the enemy bodies near the door are definitely not as you left them. 10. You used slings, crosbows and blades, but these looks like they were ripped apart, and one seems to have been reduced to a pile of bones.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Tenrok and Liam wake in the prize room a short time later. 2. Each earns a purse of 240 gold and the wisdom drawn from the defeat for 2500 xp Rothander and Nykkan are taken to the prize room. 3. Each gains 3800 xp and 600 gold. 4. Inside the prize room... 5. Tier 1: "Take any one item. 6. We're well equipped." 7. The room contains every item from Chapter 5 of the Player's Handbook weighing 70 pounds or less, armor of varying sizes, instruments, tool kits. 8. There are also spell scrolls, every first level spell is present (as well as spell scrolls of a level for which a magic user of the characters new level would have slots for), and an encyclopedia of knowledge. 9. Reading these books will grant you proficiency with any one of tool kit or any one language, depending which book you choose. 10. The books are magically infused to allow easy retention, but the magic is lost once used. 11. Upper Tier: The victor may choose instead, an item from a magically infused chest that summons 10 randomly selected magic items to choose from (rarity determined by level). 12. Alternatively they may exchange a magic item for another item of their choosing of the same rarity or lower, if the administrator has the requested item in his extensive collection. 13. "You name it, we've probably got one somewhere." 14. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The lizardfolk shout and gesture. 2. Gerrard and Dwal: The lizardfolk seem to be egging on the lizards, the Draconic equivalent of "Git 'em! 3. Sic 'em! 4. "Then they start making odd hissing noises, and it takes a moment for you to realize that they are laughing quite hard at Gerrard,as he emerges from the belly of their giant lizard, dripping with foul liquids.Hearing Gerrard's plea, they respond with"Lay down your weapons!" 5. Gerrard is a mess– his clothing is half-dissolved, his hair is curled, and he smells sharply ofgastric juices. 6. Dwal may act next. 7. Peri races forward and skewers the first lizard– killing it – then dives between Dwal and Oceanus to level a solid (and lucky) kick to the skull. 8. The secondone remains up. 9. The thrashing, wounded lizard snaps blindly back at Peri -10.Piercing damage:6 It catches only air. 10. The lizardfolk call out a command and the remaining lizard stops its attack and begins to retreat back into the muddy cave. 11. They call out, in Draconic: "Drop your weapons!" 12. Gerrard and Dwal may act next. 13. The remaining giant lizard's hide is too tough for Dwal's swing, as it tries to retreat into the mucky cave. 14. One of the three lizardmen runs disappears into the gloom of the southeast part of the cavern. 15. Any sign of humor now gone, theremaining pair continue to shout threateningly, in Draconic: Leave, drop your weapons, or prepare to die. 16. If you have a message, speak it.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (It's not so much overdosing as just smoking so much that you're shot. 2. I know anyone in real life anyone could moderate any drug but I have to make it fit into the variable nature of D&D. 3. Otherwise you could just say you're smoking a joint and it has no effect so why mention it. 4. And lets be real. 5. After smoking out all day anyone isn't a little sluggish and hungry? 6. I mean unless you're smoking CBD heavy and THC low but legal weed is new to this area :) I don't think it's that specialized yet! 7. lol) Zen joins you in the wagon. 8. His horse hitched to the back. 9. Anyone halfway paying attention can see he's got half an eye on Mimzy at all times. 10. Stumpy declines the offer to ride and keeps a watchful eye as you head down the road. 11. Once on your way Zen hands Halleck a bag of shrooms "I believe you were looking for these. 12. I'm happy to say some found there way to me before I left" He turns to the party "So what was that nasty business I heard of with your friend being killed? 13. I'm terribly sorry. 14. Just dreadful. 15. You will still be able to perform?" 16. Dox, he's on the level. 17. Mimzy, Stumpy doesn't even seem to see you. 18. He's all business. 19. So are we back on the road? 20. Any talks or anything until sundown? 21. Yeah. 22. Stumpy is pretty much mount Rushmore. 23. Zaz is happy to talk the day away about fights breaking out over grain sack tossing and cart race bets though. 24. To Halleck "Of course. 25. Leafs a fine way to ease your way down. 26. Always have plenty."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The loud man jumps slightly at the voice behind him, clearly unaware of your party's approach. 2. As he turns around, you see a relatively young man, in his late twenties perhaps, with a grizzled dark brown beard. 3. The other man, who has his long black hair pulled into a ponytail, does not turn around, continuing to fiddle with the rear axle of the wagon. 4. "Blast! 5. Scared the jeebies out of me. " 6. The man takes a second to look over your party, unable to hide the look of surprise on his face as Warble launches into the air. 7. "I uh-Yeah. 8. Axle is broken. 9. We've been trying to fix it since midday." 10. For a moment, his gaze tries to follow the aarakocra before looking back down at your group. 11. "Don't have the tools to fix it, or the know-how really. 12. D'you have a spare?" 13. Kasrin has pulled up with his own wagon now, shaking his head. 14. "Afraid not friend. 15. Though I know how to fix one if er can track down a tree to get some decent wood from." 16. Warble As you rise into the air, you aren't able to spot much nearby. 17. The area is relatively bare - save for the occasional shrub or lone tree, and the ever present rolling hills of the Greenfields. 18. However, off to the distant north - perhaps four or five miles out, you do see what appears to be the beginnings campfire. 19. It is not noticeable from the ground, as the hills interrupt line of sight.

Short swordAttack: 17 Damage: 3 Short swordAttack: 16 Damage: 6 Goblin3 and Goblin5 try to tackle Lythril: 8 14 beat those two numbers with ATHLETICS OR ACROBATICS Yek disengages and runs for his life, through the crowd, past the newcomers, and towards the stairs to level 1. 6. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. 4 | 12 | 11 Vigan, Rixton , and Ladrian choose their steps very carefully while Carrow and Andor stroll comfortably along beside them. 2. The cavern narrows a bit as they make their way toward the inclines that will lead them to the upper level where the altar and gong are located. 3. The icy walls on either side are approximately 70' tall and have several cave openings. 4. The silence of the cavern is broken when a lone barbarian suddenly emerges from a cave approximately 80' in front of the group (square 43). 5. The barbarian's surprise is obvious as he says something unintelligible in Bothii and turns around to dart back into the cave. 6. Anyone who beats the barbarian's initiative roll of 2 can act before the barbarian is able to disappear into the cave. 7. Initiative: Andor 9 | Carrow 17 | Ladrian 20 | Rixton 23 | Vigan 8 Carrow reaches out mentally, searching the surrounding area for any indication thataberrations, celestials, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, or undead might be present. 8. He is certain that no such creatures are nearby. 9. The barbarian's slow reactiongives Rixton, Ladrian, and Andor the opportunity to attack from distance, and all three of them make the most of their chance. 10. Knowing he is overmatched by the five intruders, the barbarian dashes into the cave from which he just came.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (So the group has split slightly into two, one which stays behind the current cover and those approaching the walls.) 2. Approaching the Walls The group heads forward, led by Thursday, towards the large stone walls. 3. As the group gets within about 500 feet of the walls, the figures on the wall seem to react almost in unison. 4. Their bows are raised with an arrow notched, trained on the group that steps forward. 5. They do not fire, but the threat of a long range artillary is there. 6. A voice calls out over the low background noise of the potential city beyond the walls. 7. "Outsiders! 8. State you reason for approaching our sacred home!" 9. The voice calls out, which sounds like a slightly hoarse man's tone. 10. Behind the Cover The twins seem thankful that Killian offered them a drink, taking a quick but shallow gulp. 11. They give the waterskin back to Killian before he leaves. 12. Though they are probably the best armoured at this point, they seem to not be fairing well from the sudden change in climate from what they are used to, their fair skin showing the first signs of sunburn. 13. The voice calls out again. 14. It is difficult to narrow down which one is speaking due to their faces being obscured. 15. "If you wish to enter our sacred home you should show a sign of your faith, as well as your levy!"

As we continue it will be assumed that's way everyone is arranged unless someone specifies differently)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Lenlieth, you cannot recall anything historically about any orbs that fit the nature of this particular item, but you do recall a bit of info you heard once from a travelling scholar about how magical beings could imbue ordinary items with some of their essence to act as a key of sorts. 2. As you guys reach the edge of town, you see what appeared to be a store, the front of the building now mostly burnt away, so only three walls really remain standing. 3. You can see that there is still furniture and containers inside, and no one seems to be around. 4. The dog is pointing past the building, but it does seem to be following orders as much as it is leading the group. 5. //Lenlieth and Lanea, you both said that you grabbed the orb and put it into a pouch. 6. It doesn't matter to me who holds it, I just wanted to make sure that just one person has it, to avoid future confusion// Boo, as you're searching through the store you find an unburnt cabinet in the back of the building, stocked full of different types of food. 7. Cheeses, meats, assorted fruits. 8. In the bottom of the cabinet are a couple bottles of wine and a small container of ale. 9. You also find a small box of 4 gemstones, each probable worth about 15 gp. 10. You also find underneath what appears to be the burnt remains of a counter a small metal chest with a rather large lock on it.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. While Astrid snoops around, Floon explains that the Orc was interrogating him thinking Floon was Raenar - asking him questions about the location of the Stone of Galor, which originally belonged to Raenar's father. 2. When the Orc realized that Floon was not Raenar, he decided to kill Floon regardless to impress the Mind Flayer. 3. Looks like the Zhents made a mistake and brought in the wrong man in. 4. Raenar managed to hide in the warehouse and was saved by you all. 5. From what the Orc was saying, The Xanathar guild was in possession of the Stone of Galor, the only item that can find the whereabouts of Raenar's father's Dragon horde, until it was stolen by someone. 6. Xanathar thinks it was the Zhents, but from what the Orc was saying, it's not true. 7. They didn't do it. 8. "The Mind Flayer didn't speak, but I have a feeling this is a deeper problem than we think. 9. That's why there's all of this gang fighting on the streets." 10. Floon says. 11. He turns to FC. 12. "Good to see you, FC. 13. Thanks for saving my ass." 14. CHAPTER ONE - A FRIEND IN NEED PART FIVE - THE GUILD HIDEOUT WHAT'S BEHIND DOOR NUMBER 11? 15. PHERAL: In the middle of this otherwise empty room is a stone pillar carved with a small symbol: a perfect circle with ten equidistant spokes radiating outward from its circumference. 16. In the middle of this circle is a smaller circular indentation that bears a passing resemblance to a lidless eye. 17. FC: This is where your detect magic is leading you to. 18. It clearly appears to be a teleporter, but a "key" of some sort that is required to activate it is missing.

Roondar excuses the kings absence, saying that they have much work to do now that a dragon is known to be in the area. 7. The air feels colder than yesterday, but there are no clouds over the mountains. 8. You walk back to Umbrage Hill, where Adabra lives in the old windmill, trying to spot more mistletoe for her. 9. Two large wooden tables with plain benches stand in the middle of the room, and a brass brazier full of glowing coals is tucked into one corner. 4. Dirty dishes, half-full stewpots, moldy heels of bread, and gnawed bones cover the tables. 5. Seven goblins are there to assist one big fat goblin in the cooking responsibilities for the castle. 6. Only the fat one is armed. 7. With all of the surprise from Ian, three of the goblins slip and fall to the ground. 8. Ian misses all attacks. 9. Initiative 1st round... Boghadair, arafiel, Thagakh, Tyrus.... goblins.... Johnson will need to wait one round to enter the room.... too crowded. 10. Four out of six remaining perish from Ian's flurry of blades. 11. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. [I probably should have given this info sooner.] 2. There are 8 wagons total in the caravan. 3. 3 of which belong to the cult. 4. You only know this because you saw them purchasing the wagons and can recognize some of the travelers. 5. Their wagons never travel next to each other during the day, and they don't camp together at night. 6. The wagon Rex is with tends to travel toward the middle of the pack. 7. While being hired as a guards for different wagons, there are built in moments for downtime during the trip. 8. Interacting with one another wouldn't be seen as particularly odd, unless you only spent time with each other during downtime and didn't interact with other members of the caravan. 9. Getting messages back and forth is rather simple (no roll required), but you are certainly welcome to communicate through Hatchling if you wish. 10. Arliden, make whatever Intelligence roll you feel would be most relevant to what you're looking for (along with why you feel that skill would work). 11. Fjordix, you can absolutely join the hunt if you wish. 12. By the time anything is organized, the deer have disappeared into the nearby woods. 13. You'll have to track it down. 14. Rex, your strong and silent ruse is mostly working, save for a vocal and physical tic that seems to happen roughly every hour. 15. Sometimes, sooner, but never longer than an hour. 16. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The door is unlocked. 2. As Jack and Theren quietly open the door, the Bandit bursts through. 3. He goes towards the corner, where two of the floor boards were pulled up. 4. A hole was dug in the ground, large enough for a full sack or two, but empty now. 5. The Bandit is kneeling besides the hole, feverishly digging at the dirt, but finding nothing. 6. The fireplace (several rough stones put together) has a few smoking embers. 7. A small table and chair were broken into kindling and tossed in. 8. The stones are still warm, but not hot. 9. (There was definitely a fire last night.) 10. The room is rather bare, only a foot stool and the frame of a cot. 11. Even with what was tossed into the fireplace, the scuffs and dust on the floor would make you think that there used to be more furniture in the room. 12. The place reeks of stale beer, spoiled meat, and moldy bread. 13. The floor boards are stained with the remains of past meals, but you don't find any food in the room. 14. There is incredibly bad lingering B.O., even by bandit standards, which you are guessing is ogreish in nature. 15. (Stale, not fresh.) 16. (A hole, not a tunnel. 17. Hole in the ground under pulled up floor boards = a low-tech safe.) 18. (Hint: They left this morning before you guys showed up. 19. That was the price of taking a long rest; it gave the bad guys time to escape the cabin... A thousand pound humanoid was around this cabin recently. 20. What sort of clues might she leave behind?)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Norak You attempt to get the scorpion’s attention with some food from your pouch. 2. The food seems to glow purple to match the magic that enhanced this scorpion. 3. It seems slightly overwhelmed by the smell of the magic-imbued meal. 4. 4 The scorpion shrieks again, refusing to be defeated. 5. The purple essence around the food seems to float towards it, however, and in just a few moments, the scorpion stops thrashing. 6. It looks at the food in your hand with interest. 7. As for your surge effect, you can see anything that is invisible as long as its in your line of sight. 8. Nothing here is invisible and the effect wears off after a minute, so it’s not very useful. 9. The party has just tamed a giant scorpion. 10. What will you all do now? 11. Keep in mind that some of you are in really bad shape. 12. 15 The healing spirit forms from thin air, but as it does so, everyone within 10ft of Norak feels like the spirit’s magic is twisting their minds. 13. Scorpion: 3 Norak: 27 Tanwar: 8 The scorpion and Tanwar suddenly look confused. 14. They are unable to distinguish friend from foe. 15. 9 7 The scorpion shakes its head and seems to snap out of it: 17 Tanwar swings his flail at a nearby enemy ( 1 ) Kurg. 16. Attack: 11 Damage: 6 Tanwar misses: 10 and he is still confused. 17. 1 - 4 He begins moving west, going around the scorpion and Radar, and stops when he’s 30ft away: 25 Tanwar finally snaps out of the magical effect. 18. Feel free to chat or rp through any of this, I just wanted to get the mechanics out of the way. 19. ((The plant effect would end during Tanwar’s confusion. 20. Levitate lasts 10 minutes, but you can always lower yourself to the ground.)) 21. If you guys want to rp out whatever you do during Tanwar’s confusion, go right ahead. 22. If not, we can skip it.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gargoyle WIS save: 16 Soar, you attempt to open the door, but it appears to be locked now. 2. The Watch guard walks a little closer, confused and hesitant. 3. Traveller, you cannot simply make an inspection of someone else's goods. 4. Do you have reason to believe there is something unlawful in the wagon? 5. (Soar can respond out of turn, if you wish.) 6. Elspeth is up. 7. Guidance has a somatic component, so it wouldn't just be patting Soar on the shoulder; it would be very obviously casting a spell, tracing symbols in the air as well as speaking the verbal component. 8. The guard reacts to it with some alarm: Hey, no magic. 9. Stop that! 10. I will take the first roll as a Persuasion attempt on the guard, and that's a natural one, so... Stop her! 11. the guard (apparently the commander) calls. 12. Two other guards come up, hands on their weapons. 13. They don't actually draw, but they do surround Elspeth and give her warning looks. 14. Carlon hangs back, unwilling to get involved and uncertain what is happening. 15. The gargoyle seems about to take a swing at Soar, but Lasfelro shouts out. 16. Halt! 17. It seems to obey his command. 18. Lasfelro then shouts out: Guards, please,stop that woman. 19. She's gone mad. 20. I am simply a merchant, transporting my goods for sale. 21. Everything is very tense. 22. It seems as though violence could break out at any moment, but everyone is holding back from making the first move. 23. Jalt is up.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Johan nods to you Manfred with a half smile on his face. 2. He and Leon and the Archdruid all move towards the door, with Johan staying back with the rest of you, beginning to tell you all about his run in with said Amazons. 3. You'd do well not to underestimate them as i did. 4. They are well trained warriors and excel at ambushing their prey. 5. Dont be caught flat footed by them, and more importantly, be preparred for their poisoned arrows. 6. If it had not been for those blasted things im sure I could have won. 7. They had a spellcaster with them as well, near as I could tell, some sort of witch. 8. If i recall correctly they had a campsite not far from Riverton, though by now they may have moved on. 9. Might be best to ask any local patrols if they have seen any strange tracks out near the roads. 10. If they were continuing further into the Empire, they wont be far away i imagine. 11. Do any of you have any specific questions for me? 12. I dont know much about them but I'll do what I can. 13. ((Also anyone can make a history check to see what they may have heard.)) 14. Leon starts back after a moment, looking to Dain. 15. Forgive me if I was confusing, but I ment the tome from this black pudding. 16. I hope you do not mind, but i believe whomever created these creatures may have penned this spellbook, and perhaps that will give us a lead to their whereabouts.

Henri wait for the group to do a final check about the hall before moving on. 5. Down one corridor, after meticulous investigation, it leads to the front fort's entrance. 6. A large double dear, reinforced with bolts and iron lining, along with an iron bar to bar the door. 7. The bar is down and the dust shows no sign of usage in a long while. 8. Opposite of it, is a stairway leading down and besides it is a thinner door than you saw from the others. 9. Henri hops over to it, peering inside before fully opening it. 10. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rhazor, Serzor, and Brue all look over in shock at the children being carried into the plaza. 2. After Xarrut steps forward and promises to kill the offending humans, the look of shock changes to one of horror. 3. After a pause, Serzor steps forward and bows low before saying “Most wise King of the Swamp and all wet lands, we have no clue who these men are that use the docks to hunt your frogs. 4. We remind the villagers regularly about our agreement with you. 5. We can hunt mammals in the swamp, we can fish in the river, and within 20 leaps of the river. 6. We can hunt reptiles within come onto our side of the river, or are present within 20 leaps of the river, but, we cannot hunt amphibians on this side of the river. 7. We have honored this agreement. 8. We do not know who these men are that do not honor the agreement.” The king spits on the ground before using his tongue to capture a fly that was buzzing around his head. 9. “You lie. 10. We have followed these men back to a boat at the landing. 11. The boat went downriver, and headed south of the town to the let the hunters off before returning to your docks. 12. Why do you bring people into our swamps to hunt our frogs? 13. We found Rex’s brother (at this point, the king pats one of the giant frogs on the head), killed and cut open with some of his organs taken from him. 14. That is barbaric and we will not allow that practice to continue.” At this point, the two children are set down in front of the king, who then motions for two of the bullywug guards standing near the throne to come forward. 15. Bayard has a difficult time reading the bullywug’s body language, but, near as he can tell, all the individuals involved are telling the truth, or what they believe is the truth.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Sky walks into a three story, white brick establishment. 2. Two guards stand outside at the entry. 3. On the inside it’s filled with fine dark oak wooden furniture accentuated by deep purple and gold tapestries, rug, and furnishings. 4. It’s sctually pretty empty inside. 5. There is a half orc behind the bar. 6. Well manicured beard and slicked back hair. 7. His two tusks protruding with gold. 8. There is a small corner booth seated with two gnomes. 9. Another human sitting at the bar with a goblet of red wine... three empty goblets sitting on the bar in front of him. 10. He is bald, clean shaven, wearing quite the expensive robes. 11. The bartender speaks up “ how may I help you miss?” Just pass the bar is a staircase going upstairs.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Hymir charges a fiery Kamehameha wave, blasting a hole right through the middle of the thing. 2. It is still moving and trying to repair itself, but it is definitely very hurt. 3. Absinthe throws an uncharacteristically boring dart. 4. It hits but dissolves shortly after. 5. As Dustfinger moves away to cast Hex and Eldritch Blast on the one that's falling apart, the other one lashes out a pseudopod arm at himAttack: 16 Damage: 9 Acid. 6. The pseudopod slap burns his skin, but he gets his attack on the other one, holding a concentrated stream on it until it starts melting. 7. Its form dissipates and there is nothing left but a clear puddle. 8. Dirk swings with two weapons which cut through easily but seem to have little stopping power. 9. He insults the thing, but doesn't even know if it can hear him, and instead uses Mantle of Inspiration to help himself and some of the adjacent people to clear away from the adventurer-eating block of goo. 10. He targets himself, Az Emberi, Fjolnir, and Dustfinger . 11. All of you get 5 temp HP and can use your reaction to move up to your speed before the Cube's turn. 12. Dirk slips away and moves North along the West wall. 13. Round 1: Da Cubes! 14. 25- Hymir 22- Absinthe 18- Dustfinger 16- Dirk NW Cube:Dead NE Cube: Taken 6 damage 10- Fjolnir 6- Az Emberi Az Emberi and Fjolnir both move away from the transparent cube. 15. The cube then rushes straight against the West wall, trying to engulf Hymir. 16. 12 Who narrowly dodges to the North. 17. Absinthe is next on the menu. 18. 13 He barely gets out of the way, too. 19. The creature swings an acidic arm at AbsintheAttack: 12 Damage: 13 It misses. 20. Fjolnir and Az Emberi are up. 21. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Moving through the chamber the heroes' footsteps echo around the party as Kellen's flickering of lantern light advances from behind the wee ones. 2. Around the party in the distance those with [sense]darkvision[/snese] can see it's a meeting hall, a gathering place, of some kind. 3. There's still no end to the sides of the chamber it seems endless as they advance through. 4. The party moves 100ft, 200ft, and another 500ft until they find the source of the water sounds! 5. A broken part of the ceiling has caved into the chamber and above the break has allowed a river to crash down from the forest floor above! 6. The water has carved out the area and disappears down into what looks like another stairwell that leads down but now is a torrent of water! 7. Behind the waterfall, they find the first signs of life as the drag marks continue! 8. The faintest flicker of the small blue magic flame above flanking the stairwell are found in torches lining a hallway similar to the one they entered through 500 ft behind them!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Alright, so as Navek leads the way downstairs, the glow emanating from his shield lights up a large room. 2. The spider webs that covered everything upstairs seem to disappear once you finish making your way out of the spiral staircase. 3. Once downstairs there are doors to both the left and the right.What you can see at a glance is that the main area of the basement that you walked into is a large brewery. 4. Huge casks of ale and beer line the back walls and the shelves lining the walls are full of sacks marked wheat, sugar, corn, grain.. and other ingredients used in the brew beer. 5. You also notice that one of the very large barrels of beer was apparently knocked over and is laying on its side at the end of the room. 6. Everyone in the basement can hear scratching and squeaking. 7. Roll me a perception check please, everyone going into the basement.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. With their immediate business concluded, and ready to head out of Duskrock in search of potential cures, Thia, Brandt and Corti head out of the church and to the Forge, to check in with the strikers. 2. Brandt, are there any preparations you still need to make, or are you headed straight for the inn? 3. As you reach the factory yard, you see only the banner and three of the workers sitting there. 4. Corti doesn’t recognise any of them by name, though she knows she’s seen them around. 5. One of them approaches Corti, Thia and Brandt. 6. “Corti, nice to see you, what are ye doin’ here? 7. Oh, ‘pologies. 8. I’m Screw, that’s Cog, and the large one over there is Manfred.” Following the goblins introductions, she made a note of the two others, before returning her attention to Screw. 9. ”Most o’ the others are down at the Gear, they said sumthin’ ‘bout a slammer bout or sumthin’. 10. Heard that Quill an’ Reichenplatz were gunna match up. 11. I likes ta lissen to ‘em, but sumbody needs ta be ‘ere after all...” and in a quieter voice, he adds “ ... and t’ be honest, I dun always git what they mean. 12. I prefer ta hear the others tellin me, so I kno what they meant.” Louder, he adds: “Yer welcome ta join us here, but ye look like ye have somewhere ta be. 13. If ya wanna speek wit the foreworkers, I think they’re all down at the Gear.”

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Badger turns and heads down the passage to the left. 2. It seems too far and in the wrong direction to link up, but you pass the various statues of the nine trickster gods in their alcoves and recall searching this hallway well. 3. Alcoves run the length of the narrow tunnel, each one featuring a the trickster god statuesstanding or squatting above a basin of oil. 4. As before you note four on each side, standing in opposition, with Unkh missing. 5. As you reach the end the hallway, you note a thin amount of light and hear the sound of a flame roaring to life. 6. Examining the end, you press accidentally on a small stone and the end of the hallway opens up, revealing a hidden alcove. 7. This alcove to reveal a statue of Unkh over a basin of oil which is burning brightly. 8. You look down at the Unkh cube still in your hand. 9. It seems this fire lit when you came near to it this time. 10. Mal and Badger look around in the passage for a short time....while Grenk, Sickle and Boris try to get leverage under the door. 11. It seems to have slid into a small indent though so getting under it to get some lift seems next to impossible. 12. That said, only a minute after it shut, the door begins to grind upwards. 13. Boris drops to the ground to peer intothe growing opening. 14. "Guys, you ok? 15. Guys?" 16. A plume of yellowish caustic gas pours out into his face and he rolls away coughing. 17. Sickle and Grenk move back as the poison gas seeps out of the passage as the door fully opens with a shuddering thud. 18. The vines and plants around the entrance turn black and curl up in death as the gas, a mix of acid and potent poison slowly clears the room. 19. Looking into through the poison and down the hallway, there is no sign of either Mandra or Silas. 20. No body. 21. No gear on the ground, no writing on the wall. 22. Just....gone. 23. At the end of the passage the 8 cubes are laying on the ground, having fallen out of their positions in the door.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As you finish your conversations you make your towards the door at the back of the Goblin Pantry. 2. You turn the iron handle and find it is unlocked. 3. You open the door and are immediately greeted with greasy hazy smoke. 4. Peering through the doorway you can see the haze is coming from s everal torches mounted in crude sconces burning fitfully around this chamber. 5. The haze makes it hard to see to the far end of the room, but the smoke is not building to suffocating levels, thanks to natural ventilation. 6. From your vantage point in the pantry you can see the beginning of a double row of marble columns carved with entwining dragons about ten feet ahead. 7. You guess that they probably run the length of the hall as they did in the Hall of Dragons (Area 19). 8. You do not see, nor hear anycreaturesin the immediate area, but the room does feel inhabited where others in the Citadel have felt disused. 9. DM Note: Everyone please make a stealth check [DC 9]. 10. Also need to know what your new marching order iswith the addition/removal of PCs/NPCs, before you enter the room.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. OOC - That's it ... OOC - I'm giving the killing blow to Farnakess, since he posted first ... Farnakees strikes the stirge with his longsword ... actually, poked it is more accurate. 2. That little pinprick causes the stirge to explode in a mess of blood and guts all over Rastaris's face. 3. Some of it probably got into his mouth ... hope he didn't swallow ... After this excitement with the stirges, the party's rest by the side of the road is uneventful. 4. OOC - Press the long rest button on your character sheets. 5. OOC - What did you do to the stirges? 6. Is the party going to do something gross like cook them for breakfast? 7. Everyone seems refreshed this morning ... except for Lathalas. 8. The elf wakes up with a chill in his bones and struggles to crawl out of his bedroll. 9. It is clear to everyone in the party that he is suffering some sort of ailment. 10. OOC - Lathalas has one level of exhaustion, and did not regain any hit points from the long rest. 11. He seems to be suffering from some kind of disease. 12. OOC - The Lay on Hands will remove the exhaustion, but Lathalas still wasn't able to regain hit points during the long rest. 13. The party should reach Gnomengarde sometime in the early afternoon. 14. About twenty meters up the trail, the party comes upon the body of an exsanguinated orc -- its body full of needle-like holes. 15. A broken greataxe lies next to the corpse. 16. OOC - We'll continue the adventure tomorrow. 17. Did you guys eat the stirges?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Apparently, you can't use an opportunity attack too make a grapple attempt: https://www.sageadvice.eu/2015/08/28/grapple-or-shove-opportunity/ Breena will take her opportunity attack with a shortsword:Attack: 23 Damage: 4 The blade hits, and the guy staggers from the force of it; he doesn't seem particularly strong, and another good hit would probably bring him down. 2. Breena now takes her turn proper, making another attack: Attack: 14 Damage: 5 The poor guy hits the dirt, dead, with Breena's shortsword sticking through his heart. 3. You are in a busy camp, though in an area with nobody passing through at this moment (though people will no doubt come by very soon.) 4. There is a dead body of a cultist on the floor, and Breena is holding a bloody shortsword. 5. Elspeth is still a spider. 6. There are tents nearby. 7. Breena looks panicked, and looks to Soar for guidance on what to do. 8. What would you like to do? 9. Jalt, you hear footsteps nearby. 10. 10 And then they pass on, heading away from the camp. 11. After a while, Okkie sits up and looks in the direction they went. 12. Patrol, he whispers. 13. Two guards, both human. 14. They come and go sometimes, but I'm too small - they don't see me. 15. You're bigger though. 16. I... 17. I'm tired of waiting. 18. I want to do something. 19. But I don't know. 20. Do you really think I should go up to the camp?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Everyone notices that this was most likely used for ambushes for some time. 2. Many goblin footprints can be seen. 3. Fjolnir sees a pattern in the tracks and follows them to the North, where the archer was trying to get to. 4. There is a path here that leads NW. 5. (Roll a Survival Check) Az Emeri notes, upon further inspection of the horses,that the saddlebags have been looted. 6. Nearby lies an empty leather map case. 7. These are the horses that Gundren Rockseeker and Sildar Hallwinter rode off on a few days ago from Neverwinter. 8. They look to have been dead a day or so. 9. The arrows match the ones used by the goblins Absinthe clears the road after the investigation Hymir secures the unconscious one, and both he and Dirk search them. 10. Each goblin has a scimitar, shortbow, shield, and leather armor. 11. Dirk may position the remaining two goblins how he sees fit.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gillain: You do not see any portraits that contain weapons. 2. Once Gillain calls out that you all are done the serving women appear in the doorway, enter the room and retrieve all the plates, cups, remaining pastries, and tea kettle. 3. With a flourish they leave the room. 4. As the maids leave Rahadin appears in the doorway. 5. In his hand is a sack of what sounds like coins. 6. "My Master bid I give you these for your journey.' 7. With that, he tosses the sack into the room landing at the foot Gillain. 8. Rahadin has a walking staff in his other hand. 9. He strikes the end of the staff on the floor 3 times. 10. The sound seems to echo throughout the room and the vibrations send chills down your bodies. 11. He turns and is gone. 12. At first you feel an odd warmth going through each of your bodies. 13. It turns to an odd uneasiness. 14. Abruptly the room begins to blur. 15. All but Tio stagger a bit. 16. Tio remains motionless, unsure what her companions are feeling. 17. The room starts to spin and abruptly it is gone. 18. There is nothing but blackness for all to see. 19. (everyone) The world comes back to focus and you find yourselves standing on a muddy wet road. 20. Pools of water stand like black mirrors in and around the muddy roadway. 21. Everything within your vision seems to be covered in mist and giant trees loom on both sides of the roadway, their branches clawing at the mist. 22. the sack of coins Rahadin threw lay in the mud in front of you. 23. Behind you, the roadway seems to disappear within the mist and trees. 24. In the distance, you all hear the howl of a single wolf. 25. In response, another howl can be heard. 26. The first comes from somewhere off to your right and a great distance away. 27. The second comes from your left and the sound is much closer, approximately 600 ft. or so. 28. So, what does the party do? 29. You have woods to each side of the road. 30. Thick Mist behind you and an open road ahead of you. 31. Also, please submit a marching order.

Along the black stone walls the party sees a mural carved in relief with expert care. 8. A glance the party can see a mix of elven tribes and beasts of all kinds in various stages of life and struggle. 9. The flickering light ahead is apparent to everyone now the party is curving along with the steps.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Olin, the shriek and laughing seemed to come from further away. 2. This old womans voice is just upstairs. 3. There's a creaking as she crosses the floor. 4. She comes down the stairs, unconcerned about the darkness as she comes down the first few steps. 5. A haggard, heavyset old woman with a face as wrinkled as a boiled apple, and a scowl worn face that shows an unpleasant demeanor. 6. She wears a bloodstained, flour-caked apron. 7. A long, sharp bodkin impales her bundled-up mound of gray hair. 8. A shriek, and then somecackling can be heard again up the stairs and she yells up, non-to-kindly, "Shut it girls, we have visitors." 9. She looks apologetically at the group standing around her kitchen, from half way up the stairs, "Sorry, ma'daughters are noisy and annoying. 10. Well, well, you wish to spend da'night? 11. This ain't no Inn, and I ain't got no spare beds. 12. I'm scrounging a hard life making pies and selling 'em to the townsfolk in Vallaki. 13. I s'ppose if you agree to buy a pie each, you can sleep in the kitchen, but you must stay on the ground floor! 14. The pie's er 1 gold each. 15. Fine fine pies. 16. Hey there, stop touchin my things or ya can get the heck out!" 17. She seems to be addressing Meepo. 18. Meepo had a quick walkaround the room. 19. Too many small bones to pick them all up. 20. The stinky barrel is too tall for him to look into. 21. But he did find several plates, three forks, a spoon, and a handful of what seem to be small teeth. 22. Rat flaps in. 23. The woman points at the flying undead cat creature. 24. "What? 25. How delightful is this? 26. Just wonderful!" 27. Rat smells the pies. 28. No poison that Rat can detect.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. " Dal Quor, " Khova says grimly. " 2. I wasn't being dragged back, exactly. 3. Nirdaya...she was on the other side. 4. This, " she points at the thread of light blue light still extending through the portal, " represents my connection to Dal Quor, small though it is. 5. Just enough to keep me alive. 6. She tracked it down from the Dal Quor side and used it to come through directly to 8925's mind and...kill me. " 7. She bows her head for a moment, grief on her face, before looking up. " 8. Your mission would still have been a success if I'd died. 9. The Dreaming Dark would have been denied of my power. 10. So again...I thank you. " 11. She looks at Vishal for a moment. " 12. All of you. " 13. Khova smiles weakly and stands. " 14. We're still on the Material Plane...sort of. 15. Half in and half out, you could say. 16. If there were guards approaching, you would still see them, they would just look...different. " 17. She rubs her forehead tiredly. " 18. Nirdaya took a lot of energy from me, and I'm going to need more to keep 8925 under. 19. But I'll see what I can do... " Her voice trails off as her eyes fix on a pointbetwee the trees. " 20. Dark dreams, " she mutters. " 21. What is that? " 22. Following her eyes, you can see something appearing in the trees, difficult to pin down, but certainly there. 23. It looks like a distortion in the dreamspace, a silvery ripple in the air.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You all make your way past the slain archer, down the stairs, and arrive on the first floor. 2. The entire way the booming continues along with an increase in the rain fall. 3. Sieghart: That archer you knocked unconscious across the hall is no longer laying there. 4. Sieghart, roll a perception check to pick up on any clues as to the missing guards whereabouts. 5. Arlo and Happy, from looking at the hall's back wall, you don't notice any doors leading out, but there are the two doors that go into other rooms of the mansion that might have exits. 6. Catherine and Lucas, with each progressive bang on the front door that you both stand before, you begin to notice a crack in the solid wood door. 7. No one locked the doors preventing entry to your knowledge. 8. Whatever is on the other side is attempting to beat their way in. 9. You run to the left door and fling it open. 10. This room appears to be used for entertainment. 11. There is a billiard table, a secluded sitting area with a fireplace at the focus, and a cards table with four finely carved wooden chairs. 12. Along the outer wall are two large windows allowing for easy viewing of the back yard. 13. Between the windows is a door with a scrawling tree design crafted from metal. 14. If you want to run to the door and jiggle the handle, you'll find that it is unlocked.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The seven gems are worth about 50 gp each. 2. Drusk has them secured. 3. The bottles, when sniffed and tasted, turn out to contain magical potions. 4. This much you can tell immediately. 5. Two of them are the same kind, the liquid red and shiny, and the taste rejuvenating. 6. One other is in an opaque flask, smells bad, andmakes the taster feel invigorated. 7. And the final bottle contains a redliquid that seems to pulse, and makes the taster feel a little confined in the small space of the dungeon. 8. The book (assuming your Languages are current and accurate on your character sheets) is written in a language none of you can understand. 9. But when Hildigrim goes to turn a page in frustrated fascination, Mortimer hisses, and paws the page back to where it was, scanning the words intently. 10. Edit: I didn't realize that potions already have descriptions. 11. Edited for that. 12. OOC > I say pish tosh to the RAW "taste and know what a potion does," so you get those hints above.Enjoy. 13. Do tell me who carries each of the red shinypotions, the red pulsingpotion, and thesmelly potion. 14. After some down time you can know more, if you remember to ask. 15. ;) Hildigrim finds no traps, tricks, or catches. 16. Very boring secret door.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "Hmm," the warforged looks from Shroud to Copper to Vasha and back. 2. They stroke their chin and it feels like literal days pass. 3. Did he buy the story? 4. Did you reveal too much of your hand? 5. Will time ever move forward??? 6. "Very well." 7. The warforged steps aside. 8. They let you in and direct you to a room. 9. "Oh, welcome?" 10. says the man behind an impressive oak desk.You seem to be in an office much like the one at MU. 11. There is one other person in the room. 12. A middle-aged man in fine clothes sits in an armchair near a corner. 13. The man behind the desk is an old human man. 14. He is slim with heavy receding in his gray hair. 15. He looks small behind the giant desk but he has a sharpness to his eyes that radiates authority. 16. "Sir, these men stipulate they were present during the attack near your office. 17. It would appear they know something about it and would like to speak with you on the matter. 18. Should you need me..." The warforged looks over you all one more time, "I will be right outside the door." 19. "Er, yes," the old man nods. 20. He gestures for you all to have a seat while the warforged walks out of the room. 21. "My name is Garthen Daela."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Zogar: You walk as stealthily as you can up the wall, which basically means only some mild metal scraping together as you ascend. 2. As you get towards the top, you don't hear anything coming from the roof or anywhere nearby other than a gentle lapping of water and you proceed to pull yourself over the side to the top through the weeds and grass that has grown up over the years. 3. You see a large statue representing Helm holding a bucket and water is gently cascading out of it even now. 4. Where the water is coming from is a mystery. 5. You find a rather large boulder that has been placed as dressing for the small pond that has been built up here and are able to tie your rope around it and toss it over to the side for your friends. 6. Hastings: Examining the door, you find it is neither locked or trapped and can be opened easily. 7. Lia: You climb up the rope and get to the top and you can see the bucket in the statues hands has some kind of conjuring magic on it, apparently to make the water keep flowing. 8. Zogar/Aerdeth/Lia: Before you, you see a small pond which is surprisingly clean compared to the rest of the fort. 9. Straight across from the pond from where you are currently is a battered door set into the wall and another in the wall to the left which seems worn even worse and almost blends in behind the overgrown vegetation. 10. Hrothgar/Hastings: As Hastings opens the door, he sees a gray creature with a ragged cloak covering it. 11. It turns and looks directly at him and it's eyes flare with a sickly red light. 12. Hastings Con saving throw: 22 Hastings: You feel a momentary tug on your very soul, but you shake it off with gritted teeth. 13. Everyone: From the front of the fort, you hear the sharp whistle of something flying through the air at high speed and then a loud explosion comes from the front of the fort.
