Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Pockets and Silent head back to the ship, their souvenirs safely stored away, carrying four strange bubble devices. 2. Keyo heads in that direction too, healing potions in his pack. 3. Arael, you know that the Zhelezo are the police force in most cities in the Menagerie Coast, Port Damali included. 4. You can make a History check to see if you've picked up any more information about them. 5. The two tieflings nod and say goodbye, but they resume their previous intense conversation before you've even left the building. 6. Back at the docks, at the gangplank, Three Earrings looks down at you all as you gather. 7. Good. 8. On time is good. 9. Get up here, we're setting sail. 10. Don't get left behind, sweet ones. 11. You walk up the gangplank and the ship starts to move. 12. The refugees are gone, and you see some sign that the ships supplies have been restocked, and a little superficial damage has been tended to. 13. You are free to catch up with each other, and inspect and share what you have bought or otherwise obtained. 14. It's late afternoon; you've a few hours before darkness. 15. The crew bustle around you, but seem friendlier and more chatty with the refugees, and the shock of the fight at Palma Flora, now firmly in the past. 16. Arael, you can roll a History check to see if you know about the Revelry, with disadvantage. 17. Anyone else can do the same, with disadvantage if you're not from the Menagerie Coast.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. .... You've been over the scene a couple of times now. 2. It's clear enough that wolves killed and partially devoured the team. 3. But there's no blood on the wagon seat, no ripped clothing in the brambles,no sign of beasts or robbers having killed or injured a man. 4. The group does find two deer paths leading out of the clearing, but the passage of animals has effaced any human tracks that might have been made in either one. 5. One goes north, the other south. 6. A man could have gone off through the woods in any direction, but the paths would offer the easiest footing. 7. The oxen have been dead for several days. 8. The meat has gone green, and now that the birds aren't flapping about, swarms of flies take to it again. 9. ((I did a couple of skill checks based on player posts about intentions, for the sake of keeping things moving, but of course you are all in control of your PCs. 10. If you want to reroll, feel free. 11. Do whatever you like and post as you please. ))

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. “Well met, Thromkor” the knight says. 2. “My name is Donall” he says as he bows to Thromkor. 3. He continues “we have had no recent news from the City of Splendors up here in the hills but about five days ago a patrol in which I was a member came across a group of bugbears and humans escorting prisoners towards the South. 4. We attacked, and during the confusion some of the prisoners tried to make a run for it; unfortunately they were not successful. 5. We were eventually driven off, after losing one of our own, but not before my Lord managed to rescue one of the prisoners. 6. I saw him fly-off with it after the battle but don’t know where he went. 7. When he came back some time later he was alone.” Well met Thromkor, Merosska says. 8. “As you know, our society has been in existence for nigh on ten years now, but we have only been here in Feathergale Spire for less than a 12 month. 9. Prior to that we trained where we could.” "I don't know where to find them, my Lord might know however" Donall says. 10. "But if you do find them, give them a walloping for me will you" he finishes with. 11. He says with a laugh "but don't hit them on the head - it wont do any damage, brains made of stone you know." 12. The Lord Commander says "thank you for your kind words. 13. As to making the rescuee available, let me see what I can do?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. DM Screen: 1/22 Both of Argos 's precise shortsword strikes punch through the magical defenses of Glasstaff, placing a wound in chest and shoulder each. 2. Glasstaff reels back as Sildar rushes into the fray. 3. Longsword Attack: 21 Longsword Attack: 19 Sildar's face turns into a darkened rage as his sword lashes out, pommel first. 4. "Iarno! 5. Snake! 6. I will see you hanged for this!" 7. His pommel strikes Glasstaff in the throat for 4 damage before striking him again in the center of his forehead for 2 damage. 8. Round 1 Order: Players <===== Nemean is up Glasstaff Sildar shouts at Nemean as he charges, "Nemean, no!" 9. but it is too late. 10. Nemean's scimitar breaks through Glasstaff's magical shield, opening his throat and sending him crashing dead to the ground. 11. Sildar rushes to check for a pulse, then shakes his head as blood begins to pool beneath the dead wizard. 12. "Their 'Glasstaff' was Iarno Albrek, the mage who went missing. 13. His punishment belonged to the Lord's Alliance, Nemean," he sighs and puts his hand up to his forehead, "Nothing to be done about it now, I suppose. 14. That was...impressively quick work, all." 15. Tracking: There is a closed wooden door on the west side of this room. 16. The hidden door you entered from exits this room to the east.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Hati , despite not noticing the coming traveler is still stealthed from earlier. 2. Gerrack returns to the group and then tries to hide, the only real spots to hide is off the road, so after returning to the group leaves immediately to hide in the tall grass, not too far from where he grabbed the hare. 3. he looks around, sees things in the distance, nothing of danger. 4. He does see the party looking at something and talking. 5. Conrick , stands near Misty, he sees only one person in the wagon, as the wagon draws near he believes the rider is a human male. 6. Edmond , Gimble tells you that he sees a wagon heading your way on the road, sadly its not a very detailed answer. 7. Edmond pulls out his warhammer and shield. 8. As you approach the wagon heading towards the party you see a human male, somewhere in his 40s. 9. The wagon doesn't look all that special, it does not have a full load. 10. Thats suspicious but not suspicious like he is a crook or a danger. 11. The wagon continues until its not too far from Edmond. 12. the rider stops his horses. 13. Hammond: (to Edmond, Misty and Conrick) "Hello there, haven't seen many travelers. 14. Its a little worrying the road to the capital is so empty. 15. I've heard rumors of attacks and raids on merchants, so i was a little nervous until now." 16. Hammond: (to Edmond, Misty and Conrick) "To be perfectly honest i was a little nervous to see armed strangers approaching, but your friend there is a servant of Tyr." 17. Hammond says indicating to Edmond's shield. 18. "A soldier of justice is always a good sight, particularly so given the rumors of attacks in the area. 19. Before i get too carried away, my name is Hammond, a traveling merchant."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Robwin mentions King Gnerkil, King Korboz jumps with wide eyes and turns back to his husband. 2. "Oh! 3. Oh I completely forgot!" 4. Before Robwin and Prosper can even enter the room, the King takes out a vial and pours it over the legs and hands of his husband. 5. There is a slight sizzling before the substance completely dissolves away. 6. As he is pouring the vial, King Gnerkil awakens. 7. "Hm? 8. What is going on- oh. 9. You've finally come to senses, huh?" 10. He looks up to see the group. 11. "Oh, and you must be the ones who brought him to his senses. 12. Thank you for that." 13. He slowly pulls himself away from the chair and begins to stretch. 14. "I've been stuck on that chair for gods know how long." 15. King Korboz looks sympathetically to King Gnerkil. 16. "Sorry... 17. I just wanted to keep you safe!" 18. King Gnerkil rolls his eyes and pats King Korboz on the head. 19. "Of course, of course. 20. I know." 21. King Gnerkil approaches the party with a smile. 22. "From what I've heard from my husband, you require magical items to aid you with a dragon? 23. Well, we've plenty to spare." 24. King Gnerkil heads to the bed and pulls out a chest from underneath. 25. Unlocking it, he takes out a hat and wand and returns to the group, offering the items forward. 26. "This is a Hat of Wizardry and Wand of Pyrotechnics . 27. I'm sure these will come in handy."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. For the party minus Mub: Steeling yourselves, you head west down the long road towards the Krakhal clan hold. 2. Mixing in with the crowd of other dwarves heading towards the entrance, you are stopped by one of the three guards, a burly looking dwarf in dull steel armor and a braided beard peaking out beneath the oil-cloak hood that frames his face. 3. Giving your crew a quick scan, he seems to light on Kathra with very little effort. 4. "Ain't seen you 'round here b'fore. 5. Them's some curious marking you have on you. 6. What clan do you hail from and what's yer business with the Krakhals?" 7. For Mub: For a time you stare fascinated by the bronzed art object in front of the large wooden building wondering if maybe your dragonborn friend would find its metals to his liking. 8. When you eventually look up however, you find yourself mysteriously alone on the street, not quite sure where your erstwhile companions have gone. 9. Blinking each eye in turn , you resolve to head north towards the looming watchtower. 10. If nothing else, it would be a high place you could use to seek your friends from. 11. As you trudge up to the tower, you see a couple of dwarves in dull steel plate talking to another, older dwarf wearing what look to be finer clothes and decked out in various jewels and trinkets.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Corryn and Horrence, you sight down the lines of your respective crossbows and send quarrels arching toward the mound of vines and bark. 2. They strike deep, Corryn's bolt managing to worm its way between flowing vines to pierce some inner part of the shambling monstrosity, causing it to howl in agony. 3. Rangor , charging forward in his crag cat form leaps with claws outstretched at the northernmost tree to which a vine is flowing. 4. Rebounbing off the thin trunk he sets about the vine, ripping it to slithers even as a pulse of green energy flows across it to explode from the now severed end ( 2 arcane damage). 5. Across the other side of the glade, the vine wraps around a small tree and energy flows into it. 6. The tree twitches once, twice, thrice and suddenly opens a pair of baleful green eyes. 7. Uprooting itself from the soil on roots of deep wood, it charges toward the party, lumbering forward on its root-born feet. 8. It manages to close the distance to less than twenty feet before you can react further, even as two new vines appear from the large mass, one shooting directly east and the other west. 9. Corryn, you manage to fire off another bolt, reeling the creature backward even as it advances alongside its newly summoned companion toward the group. 10. Ragnor, Horrence and Fodd, what do you do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "Give up the stone," a gravely voice rings out in the artuim it's genderless and sounds as if once the authors throat had been cut! 2. "If you give us the stone I'll let at least one of you live to warn others," they add gruffily. 3. "You have to the count of three. 4. One, two, three...." the voice says as a bang rings out in the atrium as an object flies through the air towards @M12 where Gimble and Retiog disappeared. 5. Attack on the area with garnade like effect 20 ; Upon a hit, everything within 5 ft of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw DC16 or an additional 11 fire damage. 6. If the weapon misses, the ammunition fails to detonate, or bounces away harmlessly. 7. Gimble DEX save 14 ; 0 HP again Top of the round movement recap! 8. Assassin 1 @D1 Duc @I10 Assassin 2 @A11 Retiog @M13 Nat @H11 Alici @H4 Assassin 3 @unknown Gimble @M12 ROUND 2 Assassin 1 moves ahead to E6 ready a attack for the first visible combatant. 9. Duc up! 10. Assassin 2 on deck! 11. Retiog finds Gimble's gear: a belt with small colorful vials, a blundebuss on his hip, and three daggers but not the stone. 12. "Come out, come out where ever you are..." Assassin 3 calls out in his throaty voice chuckling next the hooded figure finally visible near E7. 13. "Don't make us have to search your bodies," they add with a groan. 14. "Hand over the stone," they shout. 15. Holding their attack an other alchemists grenade in their hand. 16. Gimble death save 10 Top of the round movement recap. 17. Assassin 1 @E6 Duc @D8 Assassin 2 @G10 Retiog @N10 Nat @M12 Alici @I10 Assassin 3 @E7 Gimble @M10 (unconscious but 1 success) ROUND 3 Assassin 1 stands from E6 with their crossbow holding their attack for Assassin 3s order to shoot. 18. Duc up! 19. Assassin 2 on deck! 20. "I say we kill them and loot the bodies. 21. I hate negotiations," Assassin 2 says launching a bolt towards Duc (disadvantage because of cover/dodge) Attack: 9 Damage: 7 ; DC15 against poison if hit an additional 13 and you're considered poisoned! 22. Retiog up! 23. Nat on deck!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Galdr - You wrap your spectral hand around one ring and command your bat to inspect the door and the tunnel. 2. The door is sturdy oak and the roof of the corridor is obscured by too many vines and cobwebs. 3. You have your hand and bat pull at the same time, causing the door to swing outward, this shifts the stones in the ceiling above causing a collapse causing the entire corridor to cave in, covering the doors with rubble. 4. You don't recognize the symbols from any religious texts, but you get a feeling like you can almost understand what it means as you look at the nearby runes. 5. But the feeling fades when you look away.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. THE AWAY TEAM GROUND FLOOR 1. 2. Entrance Hall secret - FOUND BY SANA 2. 3. Library secret - LOCKED - Wolf could still try DC10 INT (Investigation), the rest have failed. 4. 3. 5. Study -No secrets 4. 6. Living Area - LOCKED - Carrhae failed, the rest could try DC15 INT (Investigation) 9. 7. THE KITCHEN This kitchen is dirty and damp, with patches of gray mold and cobwebs on the floor, walls, and ceiling. 8. In the southwest corner is some iron cooking equipment with a chimney above. 9. Next to it, under the window, is a cracked and discolored stone sink. 10. To the right of the sink, a small, closed wooden cupboard is fixed to the wall about five feet above floor level. 11. Against the far wall, a flight of wooden stairs leads upward from west to east; the woodwork of the staircase is decayed, and a few of the treads are missing. 12. The stairs are in poor condition. 13. The tracks Sana found continue into AREA 10. 14. From here, you can go to AREA 10, go upstairs, or check out any other room on the first floor again. 15. KALI/INDIGO: The Weekly Market, AREA 15 Built around the first well dug for the fishers in the town’s early days is a large market square where merchants of all descriptions gather on the first day of each week to sell their wares. 16. Initially established to sell fish, the market has grown to include a wide variety of goods. 17. The center area of the square contains a dozen long tables where shoppers can eat communally. 18. All items in the PHB that are 150gp or less are sold here. 19. The Garden Market, AREA 9 A strip of open land that is the place for everything that isn’t fish, salt, or nautical wares, this market stretches among a dozen stalls down to the bridge. 20. A few goats, eggs, cloth, marsh plants, and pots are available, as well as the occasional mule or ox for hauling carts.All items in the PHB that are 150gp or less are sold here.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. ((AlterEgo)) You sift through the rocks, discarding those that seem least likely, but selecting a few that feel right. 2. Eventually, you select a couple to try, and strike them together. 3. It takes a couple tries with different combinations, but eventually you get some that produce sparks, and with a bit more work, are able to sit back proudly from a steadily growing little blaze. 4. ((The sun is a handspan or so above the horizon, so either early morning or late afternoon, the temperature is warm, but not stifling. 5. That's about as much as whoever else rolled could tell, but you can always try too.)) 6. ------------------------- ((trustlife)) You don't spot anything too immediately meaningful, but you do see the assorted debris from what presumably was the ship you were both on strewn about the beach. 7. There might be something useful in there, or that might help you in your current circumstances. 8. You find a pouch on yourself with a handful of coins of different metals, stamped with various animals. 9. ((Calandris)) You bring your hand up to shield the sun a moment too late, having looked directly into the blazing orb and the glowing after image obscures your attempts to spot anything of use. 10. Blue (LordShadow): Big 'Un (Templar): ?? 11. (AlterEgo): ?? 12. (BeastyC): ?? 13. (trustlife): ?? 14. (Caladris): (-1 HP) Memory Die Pool:

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gillain: You do not see any portraits that contain weapons. 2. Once Gillain calls out that you all are done the serving women appear in the doorway, enter the room and retrieve all the plates, cups, remaining pastries, and tea kettle. 3. With a flourish they leave the room. 4. As the maids leave Rahadin appears in the doorway. 5. In his hand is a sack of what sounds like coins. 6. "My Master bid I give you these for your journey.' 7. With that, he tosses the sack into the room landing at the foot Gillain. 8. Rahadin has a walking staff in his other hand. 9. He strikes the end of the staff on the floor 3 times. 10. The sound seems to echo throughout the room and the vibrations send chills down your bodies. 11. He turns and is gone. 12. At first you feel an odd warmth going through each of your bodies. 13. It turns to an odd uneasiness. 14. Abruptly the room begins to blur. 15. All but Tio stagger a bit. 16. Tio remains motionless, unsure what her companions are feeling. 17. The room starts to spin and abruptly it is gone. 18. There is nothing but blackness for all to see. 19. (everyone) The world comes back to focus and you find yourselves standing on a muddy wet road. 20. Pools of water stand like black mirrors in and around the muddy roadway. 21. Everything within your vision seems to be covered in mist and giant trees loom on both sides of the roadway, their branches clawing at the mist. 22. the sack of coins Rahadin threw lay in the mud in front of you. 23. Behind you, the roadway seems to disappear within the mist and trees. 24. In the distance, you all hear the howl of a single wolf. 25. In response, another howl can be heard. 26. The first comes from somewhere off to your right and a great distance away. 27. The second comes from your left and the sound is much closer, approximately 600 ft. or so. 28. So, what does the party do? 29. You have woods to each side of the road. 30. Thick Mist behind you and an open road ahead of you. 31. Also, please submit a marching order.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Linene says with tears in her eyes but still maintaining her edginess, “I thought this was the last straw for us. 2. With these Redbrand bastards and then the shipment lost, I don’t have much but would 10 gold each be fair trade for the shipment?” This building is owned by the Lionshields, a merchant company based in the city of Yartar, over a hundred miles to the east. 3. They ship finished goods to Phandalin and other small settlements throughout the region, but this outpost has been hard hit by banditry. 4. The most recent Lionshield caravan due in Phandalin never arrived. 5. In a back room, Linene keeps a supply of armor and weapons, all of which are for sale to interested buyers. 6. Linene has a few scruples, however, and won’t sell weapons to anyone she thinks might be a threat to the town. 7. Among those with whom she refuses to do business are the Redbrands. 8. She warns the characters that the ruffians are trouble and advises them to avoid the Sleeping Giant tap house. 9. She looks at the used weapons and says she can make fair market trades or buy outright for half value.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. [All may roll an insight check] for when Paren mentions Shamara. 2. The healers seem to stay rather clear of Jonathan. 3. They look at the wound and quickly see that there's nothing they can do for it. 4. You spot several casting glaces back to it as they tend to the others with a bit of medical wonder and a hint of unease. 5. The guard shakes his head. 6. "We hadn't know of its existence before you came. 7. I've checked our records and there is no mention of it. 8. The wizards researching it would be the ones most knowledgeable in that area and they've been slain by the intruder. 9. Perhaps they chronicled their research as they went. 10. I wasn't planning on dealing with dead bodies today. 11. We have preparations we need to make for the voyage and providing His Grace with the security he needs. 12. We can't have additional threats here in the castle while we're away." 13. The guard seems to be experiencing a lot of stress at the moment as he tries to figure out how best to protect the castle as well as protect the fleet. 14. Those that look through Jonathan's possessions would find... 15. The strangest thing you find among his things are a pair of silver spheres about 1 inch in diameter each. 16. They are moderately magnetic, attracted to one another and make a pleasant chime when they hit against one another, but flicking one on its own makes it sound as though it were hollow. 17. It is not something that has much apparent value outside of its material, butyou're able to tell they had quite the importance to Jonathan When Tanni returns to her room, she sees that it has been tossed as if someone was looking for something. 18. In fact, all would find their rooms in similar states. 19. Nothing seems to be missing from anyone's room except for the shard. 20. Had the intruder been trying to find the shard? 21. Did the intruder cause all of this or was it just the guards searching for clues?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Yookini, you can tell that this poison is not lasting, and that she will be fine. 2. She is down a few HP, but otherwise she is ok. 3. The red, watery eyes and red skin were more flavor than any mechanical issue. 4. Zashier, yea you rip the lock off the wood, and pocket it. 5. You now have a lock., but no key. 6. Lem, you are now immune to being frightened. 7. (Zashier you saved earlier, so you are also immune to the effects) Yokini, Thistle, and Yashiera would have to roll WIS saves if they go in the room. 8. You are all now in this side area where you see a bookshelf and a cabinet, as well as the rock poking through the wall. 9. There are really big bold letters painted on the rock, though you cant quite make them out. 10. There is also, of course, the door that Thistle was investigating that leads to an undiscovered area. 11. You kick open the door, but just barely. 12. This door was denser, made of a thicker wood, likely to protect something. 13. On the other side you see a large steel lockbox sitting in front of a steep stone staircase that winds down into the darkness.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rolls: Bason history check: 12 Re-roll Kestrell's perception due to Vassa's help action: 12 It appears to you that the noblewoman is used to being treated differently than the common folks and she wanted to ensure this officer understood that and respected the societal norms. 2. As you're staring across the alley to the other roofs you don't see anything. 3. Then, just as you're about to follow Vassa down you catch a flicker of something. 4. You can't tell what it is, but something is stuck to the roof that this 'puppet' was supposedly on. 5. You're too far away from the officer to hear anything. 6. As you pass the mage you hear him speaking an incantation but it's not a spell you're familiar with. 7. The man catches and quickly pockets the gem. 8. "I saw that the guy you got these jewels off of was running from someone, I saw that much I did. 9. Looked like he was heading toward that manor that's been being renovated. 10. But that's when the explosion happened." 11. As Kestrell lands on the roof he starts to slip for just a moment before stopping. 12. He rises up and walks to where he was sure he saw something. 13. What he finds is a piece of cloth... perhaps part of a cloak? 14. The border of the cloth has a symbol of a gear or cog that repeats all along the edge and appears to have been sewn with some sort of string that reflects the sunlight. 15. As Kestrell is holding the cloth he hears a man clear his throat. 16. He looks up to see the mage levitating at the edge of the roof staring at him, hand extended. 17. "It appears you may have found a clue. 18. Please hand it over and return to your manor. 19. My associate and I will be by shortly to speak with you and your friends." 20. The symbol in question Glaring at Kestrell the mage replies, "I am Barnibus Blastwind, member of the Watchful Order of Magists and Protectors. 21. I work with the City Guard as you no doubt are aware, you saw me arrive with them and watched me investigating the scene already. 22. Please do cooperate, this will go much faster if you do."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Okay, current order: Gregor, Nia, Crispy, Liam, Chubbs, Hag... 2. Currently, everyone is frightened by this hag except Gregor... (For the next minute- you may make another saving throw at the end of your turns) The horrid stench and foul visage of this old witch has shaken most of you to your cores, as she glared with evil intent into each of your souls, and now is somewhere beneath you in the watery marsh of this god forsaken place... You think you hear a whooshing sound from somewhere underneath your feet... then again, somewhere behind you in the marsh... You jump at the faintest sound of water lapping against the shore. 3. It's hard to pinpoint just where she could be creeping... 4. I imagine you're all on the round boardwalk in the middle. 5. Keep in mind you're currently surrounded by fog!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Lucky manages to find three keys among the two corpses and one prisoner, and manages to match them up with three lockers. 2. In the meantime, Fiannaattemptsto pry open the remaining seven, but she's unable to quite manage it. 3. (Somebody stronger can have a turn, or Fianna can start whacking'em with her staff or other weapon.) 4. The three Lucky open containmostly dirty laundry,plus a few personal effects and curios, but also some coin purses. 5. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. For the sake of not making you do a bunch of rolls. 2. We'll say Daisy keeps Miz pinned down for a minute until he regains his senses. 3. The two of you can still here the singing through the fog. 4. You can investigate if you would like, continue to scout around and see what else you find, or head back to camp. 5. Daisy and Miz , you both move quietly through the field, approaching the village. 6. As you cross the field, you come across about a dozen bodies scattered through the tall grass.. 7. They are all human and have been picked clean of valuables. 8. It looks like animals have been at the bodies and it's a pretty grizzly sight. 9. As the walls come into view through the fog, you spot two Kobolds up above the drawbridge. 10. Up close you can see that the moat is about 30ft wide and the walls are about 10ft high. 11. Perception: 11 You are pretty confidant the Kobolds keeping watch above the drawbridge don't see you. 12. Daisy and Miz slip back through the field into the woods and towards the cave. 13. ( 4 ) Nothing happens during your return trip and you arrive back at the cave after being gone for a little over an hour. 14. Kraerd the owl ruffles its feathers, seemingly agitated. 15. So many two legs in the forest tonight! 16. Ask your questions then leave me be! 17. (In the meantime the rest of you can decide who is taking 1st, 2nd, and 3rd watch- assuming you keep watch that is)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Badger weaves the magical energy around him, the air twinkles and sparkles ever so slightly as both Mal and Sickle vanish from view. 2. The small spirit on Sickle's shoulder gasps and leaps to safety on the ground below, scampering under some leaves as he looks about for his vanished pack animal. 3. Sickle smiles at the small thing, though his smile is his own, and heand Mal pad across the massive log with ease reaching the far side. 4. The underbrush crunches occasionally under foot, and vines and leaves are swept aside as they each make their way along the river front. 5. The bricks of the ancient cities byways and alleys sink into the turpid water that moves about in swirls and in small pools off of the main flow of the river. 6. Walls and mangrove wrap around and out of the water. 7. Small swarms of bugs buzz incessantly near the scum covered edges of the waters. 8. Mal carefully counts...three...four...five..six as she passes buildings, attempting to make sure they get the right building. 9. She whispers to the nearby Sickle, seeing a bush move nearby and hearing the gentle pad of his boots on the ground. 10. "This one...above..." They each work their way around behind the building. 11. Mal clambers up the back wall amidst branches and vines, the tree cover overhead stretching above the ruined building. 12. Sickle also seems to quietly begin climbing the back wall of the building. 13. (Roll stealth both please.) 14. Badger, Silas...from the far side of the river and log you wait patiently, eyes peering across into the shadows under the forest canopy, but can see only shifting of shadows as the trees move in the wind amongst the ruined buildings. 15. You wait, and watch, ready to move in a moment. 16. The small spirit with a mask on clambers out of the bushand looks around. 17. It seems to regard Badger and Silas with....a steady stare, before eventually making a judgement and vanishing into the undergrowth.

The greatest gnome among them. 6. Golver sees however his father bringing metals to his chair kneeling and placing them on his chest! 7. Kat and Necey see them both talking to no one but occasionally themselves and miming eating nothing. 8. It's fairly comical if it wasn't for the living dead looming close by as well as coming from the water! 9. The skeleton Kat crushed however rattles again returning to life! 10. Skeleton 2 attacks Necey with his bowAttack: 10 Damage: 3 Golver's new DC16 with 3 failures. 14. Caerlan and Golver are laughing hysterically as phantoms and miming eating with great relish. 15. It would almost be inviting if it wasn't so absurd with Necey and Kat unable to see the company or smell the food. 16. Its an enchantment they know, but how to break it and free their friends? 17. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Late in the evening, you find yourself asleep on your favorite pile of trash, animal bones or dirt. 2. A bird squawkingawakes you. 3. Above you is a small clockwork raven flying in circles, squawkinglike it’s trying to get your attention. 4. Gripped in its tiny, mechanical claws you see a small white rectangle. 5. “This is for you. 6. This is for you,” the raven says as the white rectangle falls toward you. 7. You watch as the raven squawks once last time before it disappears into the night sky. 8. Fallen into your possession is an envelope of white and sealed with a purple wax seal. 9. An ornate “G” I pressed into the wax as well as a fine ribbon. 10. Once the seal is broken and opened, you are blasted with the sound of fanfare trumpet music that lasts only for a few seconds. 11. Inside you find atrifoldedletter of fine parchment paper written with fine handwriting. 12. But what’s evenmore oddis you notice the letter is written completely in goblin. 13. The letter reads as follows: Congratulations initiate, You have been selected to partake in a secret operation that will fulfill all your wildest fantasies! 14. Riches you seek? 15. Power? 16. Opportunity? 17. A permanent home? 18. All can be had after the procurement and return of a few items from the City of Waterdeep! 19. Interested? 20. Great! 21. This letter will transport you to my home where we can discuss business. 22. It’s simple. 23. Place this letteron the ground, stand on it andsay the command word, “ut salire.” You will be immediately transported awayand this letter will burn up in the process. 24. Teleportation using this letter is alegalbinding contract into this endeavor and does not guarantee your mortality. 25. A word of caution though: This letter is attuned to the recipient. 26. Unauthorized use by others will most likely result in dismembermentand/or death. 27. Have a magical day, C. B. Gloomblast

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. While El and Cyndral have their discussion, Verim continues to stare at the orb before settling down in the right hand cave. 2. Buppido, Drendil, Eldeth and JimJar join Shishakli in the left hand cave while Ront, Sarith, Shuushar, Stool, Topsy and Turvy join Verim. 3. Eldeth, hearing Tobias’ question says “Do you think you could make a pickaxe? 4. Some of the more unusual gems can be found down here and they might help us to make a bit of money in some of the cities down here” JimJar sits down with his legs crossed and brings out a small deck of cards, dealing them between himself, Buppido and Drendil. 5. Shuushar goes over to a corner of the cave, finding a small dirty puddle, he proceeds to rub the moisture over his scales. 6. Topsy and Turvy sit whispering to one another and Stool approaches Gnarls “What’s it like up there? 7. On the surface I mean. 8. I’ve heard stories but I’ve never known whether to believe them or not. 9. They say that a ball of fire flies through the sky for hours, burning everything that sees it and that the only time it’s safe to go out is when the ball falls asleep” Shishakli and JimJar both peer over the edge to see 3 pairs of small red eyes with something else glowing on top, emitting a slight red glow, they both stay still and watch 3 Cranium Rats walk into the space below, sniff around the base of the ladder and then leave. 10. The rest of the watch goes by uneventfully and eventually, the rest of the party begin to wake and prepare for the next day of travel. 11. Due to foraging the day before, you've managed to forage and additional 30 rations. 12. Unfortunately 4 of the rations have gone bad. 13. After all of the party have eaten, you are left with 27 rations.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gwen nodded, at Rose, looking in the general direction she had began to head, and seeing Paavu seeming to lean towards the same direction. 2. Down the crumbled hallway it is! 3. I wonder what secrets this place could really have? 4. I mean it's an old fort, I've never heard of, taken over by ... she looks around, making sure that Lark isn't nearby Disgusting goblinoids... No offense to our friend. 5. After what happened though, I have a right to dislike them, don't I moonbeam? 6. she said, seeking justification for her comments and feelings on the matter. 7. Burgee doing just that, and shifting the fog so they could see ahead of themselves, while obscuring the area ahead of them. 8. Pushing into the next room... 9. It's.. eerily empty.The southwest tower of the castle is little more than a heap of rubble. 10. Several ragged bedrolls are scattered across the remaining floor space, and a small, twisting passage leads east through the ruins where everyone just came from. 11. Several straw pillows and more ragtag blankets lay on the floor. 12. Even the most passive of investigations reveal the area is used for little more than another resting room. 13. Piyu responding, but not looking at Paavu. 14. Everyone but cooks and shaman gone.... Maybe Shaman musician too... no no for sure. 15. And Piyu care for self and family. 16. Yerg steal us from clan, make us cook for Grol.. 17. If not do, he kill and feed us to Grol.... 18. This room is where all us sleep.... 19. Corner room is just archer post.... but they gone for now. 20. All march out when Grol say to.... 21. If not for us be cook.. they make us go too. 22. Room to n..norf is big hello hall. 23. Broken door.... Past that is storing room for food and stuff... and barracks for hobbers. 24. Maglubiyet worship in northern hall in middle.... she goes on to describe the areas you've already been to, not knowing you have. 25. The fog moving further towards the true 'front door' and engulfing the entire space as everyone enters the 'bedroom' corner.

Eli: Your up. 6. The platform (and the Gnome) is 10 ft in front of you. 7. Rinn is to your right, Blaire is to your left and Ikki is behind you. 8. Blaire glances at Eli and Rinn then castsguiding boltagainst the Gnome (Attack 10damage 12). 9. The blast of light from Blaire's fist crashes into the Gnome hard from their off angles throwing her out of her seat onto the ground near the southwest corner and as Blaire yells, "We'll get it tied up and stabilized or Pog an the lot will want our heads." 10. She starts towards the Gnome. 11. While she is rushing around the platform to your left to get to the downed asalient, you see her skin turns a vibrant shade of blue. 12. She stabilizes and ties up the Gnome, using its shirt and belt to do so and makes sure it doesn't have anything within its reach. 13. She pulls the female Gnome, judging by her binding, up against the wall, sitting up facing the room. 14. She then takes a few heaving breaths. 15. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Merry Christmas!) 2. AS your short rest comes to an end the sun moves towards the west and the heat of the day is felt on your bodies (2:00pm). 3. The cool mountain breeze still retains its chill and most of you set off towards the next cave. 4. Grunting waves as your paths part ways from each other after taking one more look at the map. 5. As she turns to leave you can truly see the damage caused in your previous battle as white feathers run down her spine and across her wings. 6. The diminutive form disappears into the forest of the mountain as you continue your trek towards the next cave. 7. Survival check from leaders with advantage for map.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Kricam manages to hunt down a few wild boars in his search for food. 2. With a little help from Guffa, he's able to bring them back to the caravan. 3. He tosses one whole boar into Mimi's mouth, to which she happily devours it. 4. He starts a fire with some coal and wood, throwing a freshly skinned boar onto a pan. 5. After a few minutes, a rich smell of pork and many kinds of seasonings fill the area. 6. "Get up, young people! 7. Get ya pig while it popping!" 8. He beams. 9. Eating Guffa's pork, the group gets hit with a spicy taste first, then a wash of...apple cider? 10. Did this guy put alcohol in the meat?? 11. Yes, yes he did.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. What should've been a finishing move for the party ended up being an utter failure, as Hymir, Dirk and Absinthe all miss their targets. 2. Hymir had too much to get around and misjudged the shot, as did Dirk. 3. Absinthe moved past Az Emebri into the room, skirting around the spikes, and flung a dart that just barely missed. 4. (I did add your 9 health back for shrugged damage) The two skeletons, unclear as to why they are still standing, draw and fire, one at Absinthe and one at Az Emberi. 5. vs. Absinthe: Attack: 23 Damage: 3 vs. Az: Attack: 21 Damage: 8 Both hit, these skeletons must be elite. 6. (Damage applied) Az Emberi, Fjolnir, Dustfinger, you're up! 7. 21- Fjolnir 18- Dustfinger 15- Hymir 11- Dirk 10- Absinthe 8- Skeletons AC 13 1) Taken 9 damage, looks rough. 8. 2) Taken 10 damage, looks rough. 9. 3- Az Emberi Az Emberi manages what should've happened in the first place to Skeleton #2, shredding its bones apart across his spikes. 10. Fjolnir lines up a shot on skeleton #1, then Dustfinger steals his thunder and demolishes the arbitrarily numbered undead scum with magical fire. 11. Combat is over. 12. Hymir identifies the boots, they are boots of striding and springing . 13. You hear nothing from the East door.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (As much as I would actually love that, I think Valeera would be a bit more reserved.) 2. Jinara- Though Gaelin seemed partially unconscious, his eyes were open, so he was probably just really into his book or he can sleep with his eyes open. 3. Gaelin, Jinara & Valeera- Kelymar looks back and forth between Jinara and Gaelin, squints and shakes his head. 4. He initially assumes something is amiss but can't prove anything. 5. Jinara's words help shift his attitude and he exhales, a bit of frustration on his brow. 6. "Perhaps you are right. 7. Just please be careful. 8. Some of these tomes are quite old." 9. he says before turning back and stationing himself equidistant between your section and another occupied section of the second floor. 10. Aryn & Mucor- You trot along the wide cobblestone path of the city passing various merchants. 11. The streets are filled with the smells of wood burning in fireplaces and the sweet aroma of bread being baked. 12. After about a minute you come across the Swift Spindle and enter after tethering your horses to a nearby hitching rail. 13. As you enter a tiny bell attached to the door jingles. 14. "Just a moment." 15. you hear a hitch scratchy voice say. 16. The shop is about 12 feet by 10 feet and various cloths and sample items sit adorned on hay manakins or on tables. 17. A short wooden desk sits in the southeast corner in front of an open door. 18. You hear the sounds of fabric being moved and murmuring before a small gnome, with grey hair, spectacles and a quick step, nimbly leaps onto the desk and says in the same hitch pitched scratchy voice, "Hello and welcome to the Swift Spindle. 19. How might I be of service to ye." 20. Aryn & Mucor- The gnome shop keep looks at Aryn then to Mucor then back to Aryn. 21. He nods as each speaks and begins painting the picture of the clothes in his mind and says, "Uhh.." you see him calculating in his head a small grin creeping along his face as he eyes the pouch of coin. 22. "That's a specialty custom order with a heck of a rush to boot. 23. We can do it for... 180 gold pieces." 24. he says with a nod and crooked smile. 25. Gaelin & Jinara- Valeera sighs and says, "You were out for nearly three hours. 26. Are you sure you're alright?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. @lorell - the wolf is still quite a ways away. 2. While it is not hostile to you, it doesn't cover your friends. 3. Do you want to break away from the group a bit and try to interact with the wolf? 4. @garnet - you look at the tracks and the blood and the wagon. 5. Taken altogether, it doesn't require a giant leap for you to make some guesses about what happened: merchant cart carrying goods, arrows from the forest, drag marks on the ground leading to the forest...this was likely an ambush. 6. However, looking at the strange markings around the horse, the presence of a live horse, some of the arrows that weren't recovered - this doesn't make sense. 7. You wait for your allies to join you, a puzzled look on your face while you try to understand this strange thing. 8. You suddently feel very far from home... 9. Currently, Garnet and Ithelion are at the cart looking around. 10. Krom, Daemyar, and Lorell, you are still about 100 feet away. 11. The wolf is a further 40-50 feet behind you. 12. The wolf is not hostile to you, Lorell, but the same can't be said of your companions (however, you can try to convince the wolf they mean it no harm). 13. A charmed creature can’t Attack the charmer or target the charmer with harmful Abilities or magical effects. 14. The charmer has advantage on any ability check to interact socially with the creature. 15. @lorell - the answer is yes. 16. Try to think of the wolf in a similar way to a dog but wilder, obviously. 17. You have advantage on interactions with the wolf but it IS an animal so you might need to get creative ;) Investigation check please.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Torke and Sam work towards a future meal, Wilcox continued to lead on, rambling about the valley to come.In his youth,it, along with the rest of this land, was covered in an ever present Winter, and the river that runs through it was the only recognizable thing that has endured. 2. The forest, swamp, and hills that you had previously gone through, are all the results of imbalanced amounts of ice melting rapidly. 3. Some areas flooded, some ares grew. 4. "At some point in time, before I came back for good but after I had come frequently, this land experienced a tremendous amount of heat, and loss of cold weather at the exact same time." 5. He explained how the inhabitants adapted or didn't, and how many of the more civilized tribes only moved in long after the ice had gone. 6. He has a theory that theolder peoples who traded in the highly rare goods, such as the gold and silver, were driven off by something directly related to the event but he has no evidence other than there disappearance not long after. 7. "It could have just as easily been that they didn't like the hot weather, and left." 8. As he finishes his tale, you all arrive at the edge of the Forest, and have come to the Valley. 9. The dull red sky has given way to a burnt orange, and dawn is close. 10. For milesin both directions lie forest, a thick section of flat lands, and a mountain range, with the largest being directly in front of you all in the distance. 11. (One more post till river, feel free to explore the Valley)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. A simple plan would work best, particularly if orders might need to be relayed more than once, and language might become an issue. 2. As the plan is discussed in the group, several of the fighters of one group or another was asking questions, and the ripple of translation, discussion, retranslation, and further discussion was a sign of things to come. 3. Much to the joy of the Professor however, the fighters at present all seemed to be willing to cooperate, at least for now. 4. Shae, you find only twosmall sentence underneath the lastpart. 5. Don't be afraid! 6. I'm with you. 7. Reassured and inspired, you return to the planning, feeling like you were ready for the coming struggle. 8. With the plan finalised and last preparations made, you start making your way towards the lake, to then follow the shore to the place where you found the hag's lair the last time. 9. The trek is still arduous, but since you know the distance involved, you can keep the rest of the group informed and you ca nall pace yourselves. 10. Though the hot, humid air and the thick sticky mud makes any advance slow, you steadily move forwards, and the travelers in particular are keeping a sharp eye out for mephits or will o'whisps. 11. After several hours of marching, you suddenly come to the realisation though that you must have passed the spot where the hag had made her lair, but there was no sign of either her summoning circle, or of the giant's skull anywhere near you to be found. 12. As you order the group to rest as you discuss how to proceed, you're pretty sure that you overshot the place her skull was the last time by at most half an hour. 13. Some of the lizardfolk immediately step forward as trackers, and Shae, you feel darkness welling up around you, evil magics, in the ground and the air around you, but getting stronger as you start heading west, back into the swampy jungle.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. To have the Tavern open, you need 1000GP and or enough man hours worked, along with 250GP guild membership costs. 2. I don’t think any of that has been paid. 3. I would say a day of labor is 10GP off the cost since none of you are trained in running a tavern or building one. 4. So far you have put in I think around 5 days of work between you. 5. So 950GP left on the building. 6. If you would rather pay people to work on it, 83GP is a full day of labor for a guild to repair the place, they would need 12 full days to fully repair the place. 7. Or you could offer to work for guilds to get their help. 8. You can also ask for a loan, the Zhents are known for giving them along with others in the city, Renaer may be able to help with that. 9. Cora: A day of work on the tavern (10GP off, 940) For your night at the Dock Ward, could I get a stealth roll, a perception roll, and an investigation roll. 10. Advantage on all of the due to Heishe helping you. 11. Heishe: You get a day of labor done at the tavern (10GP off, 930) Could I get a perception and disguise roll from you for the night. 12. Drusilla: You are able to make a decent humble shrine to Erathis in the basement, to make it a nice full shrine, you would want 50GP of statues, incense, and more. 13. You may be able to get that from the church to Erathis if you do them a favor. 14. Vincent: You are able to spend the day fully working on repairing the tavern (10GP off, 920) Lu-Lu: Your training at the Tower of Aster require you to return for training. 15. Roll me a history, nature, and arcane check to see how much longer the teaching part of your training lasts.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Aimee hugs Renaer, her nose is assaulted by the smell of rancid pickled herring.“Apologies Aimee, I wouldn’t get that close if I were you..., my hiding spot was not the most lavish I could have found.”He Gestures towards the door under the stairs, on broken hinges, inside is cluttered with rope, tarpaulin, and splintered wood from smashed barrels. 2. Looking Kerry in the eyes he responds with a wry smile,“And the moon has not risen either. 3. Are you Kerri or Lyss then?” Looking around at the bodies he sighs.”Well, it is a bloodbath, and though it is a shame to see, I don’t think any of these folk have clear consciences.”He points to the wrist of a fallen thug, a black tattoo of a flying snake on it. 4. ”These fellows took me. 5. That symbol, it’s of the black network, the Zhentarim, they were attacked by another group, that’s how I managed to escape. 6. I fear we may be caught in the midst of a conflict between criminal gangs, these deaths are one thing, but I worry for the innocents who may be drawn in to this.” On the mention of Floons name, Renaer hangs his head.“Oh Floony boy, what have I gotten you into.... 7. The group that attacked took him with, I think they may have mistaken him for me. 8. Floon has never rustled any feathers around the city, he’s just known as a likeable chap - but I... 9. I have my fathers name, and he didn’t leave a good impression in this city... or anywhere as far as I know.” “Well, Floon and I do share a certain look... handsome, stylish, strapping, you get the gist.”

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. After returning to Vikram's house that evening, the party is met by the smells of a spicy goat curry and fresh bread. 2. You also hear the movement of several people coming from the apartment above the silk store. 3. Once upstairs, Vikram greets you all and ushers you into the living room. 4. Inside are two new figures - a female halfling and what appears to be a statue at first glance, but is actually an animated construct! 5. (Cue Perkas and Sev!) 6. "I was able to recruit these two for your trip tomorrow. 7. Alas, I must decline any offer to accompany you - one family member lost this month is too many. 8. If I should fall it would be more than my wife could bear. 9. Please, sit, relax, enjoy some tea. 10. The meal will be served soon, and we will celebrate my son's life!" 11. Eventually, Dinesh the cleric arrives, and his sister Nisha welcomes him. 12. Vikram and Nisha serve up a fine meal, with good wine or mead to help cut the heat from the spicy peppers used in the curry, and plenty of fresh bread for sopping up all of the leftovers! 13. Talk turns to Rishi - his life, his loves, his talents and his passions. 14. It is touching, and funny, with an occasional tear escaping down the parents' face. 15. But it truly is a celebration of a life well-lived. 16. The night moves slowly to dawn, and eventually all fall asleep in some fashion. 17. After sunrise, the new group heads back to the park, looking for the grate Penumbra remembered and surmised led to the vampire's lair. 18. (Everyone roll either Perception or Investigation. 19. Were any other preps you wanted to make?)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Cragmyre, as far as you're aware pass without trace is still working but there is probably only 10 minutes left or so before it fades away. 2. Even with Arden's rather persuasive request the dishevelled young man suddenly drops the armful of Pullcot and runs. 3. The chase, if you wish it, is on. 4. As the man starts to flee into the thickening crowd he lets out a loud high pitched whistle. 5. Cragmyre and Arden please roll dexterity checks Klee, just as you start on the lock, which you believe is an easy Fightmarch Tumbler design, you hear the whistle. 6. There is immediately lots of banging and crashing coming from inside, as though chairs are being knocked over. 7. Arden and Cragmyre deftly make their way through the morning crowds and catch up to the man in quick measure. 8. His whistle catches in his throat. 9. What would you like to do with him? 10. You scoop the scruffy little up easily. 11. An Intimidation roll if you would be so kind Mr Cragmyre.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. To Carodoc: “I don’t normally go for short fellas but that grin just might get me into trouble I think.” Kate says with a wink and a laugh. 2. Nudging Morgan with an elbow as she pops a little bit more rations into her mouth and washes it down with the rest of the water. 3. “Good leverage.” And busts out laughing. 4. “Oh man... it’s good to laugh again.” Refering to Carodocs question about the others in the cages. 5. “The 2 over there were dead when I got here. 6. The other 2 got here a day or 2 ago. 7. The human died yesterday. 8. Don’t know about the dwarf. 9. Hasn’t made a sound in a few hours yet.” To Frixori: “I’m impressed with your knowledge... someone worried the guild has gotten that sloppy... 10. I guess I didn’t do a great job of not blabbing either though...” Sitting down cross-legged, she puts her hands together, lacing her fingers together, but leaving the pointer and pinky finger together. 11. Her face suddenly turns hard and serious. 12. “Give me another 1/2 hour to meditate. 13. I am counting on you.” She closes her eyes, and after a few minutes, her body starts to glow with a faint green, yellow aura.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Zander turns to head back to the room with the cloaks and is at first surprised to not see Droop. 2. Moving into the hallway, he finds her huddled just outside the crypt. 3. He mumbles something about her coming along, and she does so willingly. 4. They find more than enough cloaks to bring five back, but do not find any rope. 5. Strangely enough, neither of the Redbrands has a key on them, but Nif is able to pick the locks on both cells. 6. While Nif is picking the first (north) lock, Vondal addresses the occupants, "You would have to forgive the late arrival, people of Phandelin. 7. We would 'ave been 'ere sooner, but ... eheh ... We ... 8. I got a sidetracked chasing after ghosts of all things." 9. He shoots the group a bright smile. 10. The older of the two women in the north cell stands first, and the other two follow her example, though they stand a little behind her. 11. "Who are you?" 12. she asks, confused. 13. Nif moves to work on the second lock. 14. Harbin speaks up, still sitting on the floor. 15. "I recognize you," he says. 16. "You're the dwarves that came to the Hall yesterday. 17. You're the reasonmy wife and I were kidnapped!" 18. As Zander leads the five prisoners through the crypt and up through the north door, Vondal, Karl, Droop and Nif move to the double doors. 19. Vondal examines the doors. 20. The doors are sheathed in copper plate, now green with age. 21. A relief carving of a mournful angel graces the doors. 22. As far as Vondal can tell, the doors are not trapped and are unlocked. 23. Vondal veeeeery carefully opens one of the two doors. 24. Looking in, he sees thick dust covers the flagstones of this somber hallway. 25. The walls are decorated with faux columns every10 feet. 26. The hall is 10 feet wide by 40 feet long. 27. There is a corridor leading south at the other end. 28. Zander leads the group up the short hall, past the door to the armory, and through the secret door into the storeroom. 29. He is followed by Harbin, Alisa, Nilsa, Nars, and Mirna.

The last remaining shadow attempt to strike the monk.Strength Drain v Uri, 5 to hit, 7 necrotic damage and Strength score reduced by 2 The vampire shakes off the stun and tries to grab the dragonborn.Claw v Direcris, 23 to hit, grappledThen attempts to sink in his fangs.Bite v Direcris, 25 to hit, 9 piercing and 7 necrotic damage, max hp is reduced byan amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. 6. There is door shut and locked leading to the upper floor. 7. A mechanical grinding fills the air, the front door slams shut, and bars slide and lock on the outside of the windows Gadston tears down a curtain and puts out the fire before it spreads any further; there is only minor damage to the bookself but many of the books are likely lost. 8. DEX Save v Sacred Flame, 13The shadow disappears with Dench's spell. 9. Without a shadow to target anymore Uri turns his attention to the vampire, striking him twice. 10. (Direcris you can roll the damage since he is only resistant, but ranged attacks are at disadvantage if an enemy is within 5 ft. of you. 11. 19, 18 necrotic) Direcris's spell halts the undead's supernatural healing ability and drains some of its life force. 12. The vampire, spitting out some of the dragonborn's tainted blood will instead try toslash at the wizard.Claw v Direcirs, 8, 10 slashing damageClaw v Direcirs, 25, 9 slashing damage(63 damage, bloody) A red mist begins to fill the room.Everyone take 6 poison damage. 13. Kalman, Jakob and Medskan are up; finish off the ogre before it gets a chance to strike true this time! 5. The ogre takes a bolt to the face! 6. Its thick skull prevents this from being fatal, but enough damage has been done that Mikhael's sleep spell takes over; the ogre falls over onto the cart, crushing the one hobgoblin archer that was still inside. 7. The other hobogoblin is wounded and magically unconscious on the street. 8. The town guard patrol finishes off the ogre, and takes the wounded hobgoblin captive; the captain of the patrol lets you know that if you wish to interrogate the hobgoblin he will be kept at the town jail. 9. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Ragnir and Priton rush to meet the creature it’s speed is something you’ve never seen before. 2. Ragnir spams his sword down, but only meets the stone as sparks fly into the air. 3. Priton tried to hold on but the scaled body slips out before you can get a grip. 4. During the distraction of those attempts Honeyton is able to rush up and swipe a claw striking it in the jaw. 5. As the snake man recoils a burst of black ice condensed around it and shatters. 6. Followed by a dagger piercing it’s side, it goes to yank out the dagger but it’s already gone, back into Tyr’s belt. 7. It assesses the situation and let’s out another hiss. 8. Now his jaw detached and is left hanging wide and two large fangs unfold from the top of his mouth. 9. It raises its whip towards Ragnir and cracks it at Ragnir. 10. Attack: 12 Damage: 5 Following up the whip attack the Snake man strikes forward and tries to bite Ragnir. 11. Attack: 19 Damage: 9 As it recoils after trying to bite Ragnir it swipes its tail at Priton Attack: 13 Damage: 13 (Sorry phone died mid post, living on the edge) The Man Snake creature slides and wriggles free from Priton’s tackle before being bombarded from attacks by Honeyton, Hermenor, and Ragnir. 12. The snake man coils from Hermenor’s strike but bounces back unaffected. 13. To Priton’s plea it keeps its jaw unhinged as it’s tongue hangs out. 14. Hissing wildly as it’s venom drips from its fangs. 15. Yellow eyes darting back and forth at the party. 16. The scale patches shine in the dim light. 17. It brings its whip against Ragnir. 18. Attack: 11 Damage: 7 Following up the whip attack the Snake man strikes forward and tries to bite Hermenor. 19. Attack: 20 Damage: 13 Following up the bite attack it’s tail swings around for a second strike against Hermenor. 20. Attack: 22 Damage: 15 reroll on bite attack; 13 makos forgot to mention party’s initiative.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Valen knows the following - the Oilers are one of a couple of smallish pickpocketing gangs that operate in the Cracks, currently they seem relatively stable, there aren't any sizeable gang wars or similar, the gangs of note nearby are the Unders and the Brave Boys. 2. The Oilers definitely "claim" the Market area from a territory point of view Tybalt's Market is a fairly large market, situated against one of the most obvious routes down into the older settlement ruins, it is almost the only place in the Cracks where you will find City Watch posted continually, this is more for the protection of the locals than crime prevention, but it isn't a dangerous posting. 3. Burning Castle is a large Inn just to the side of the market - it is a rowdy and fun place, with ahigh likelihood of finding a game of chance, company for the evening, or a fight or all of the above as well as some of the least worst booze in the Cracks. 4. Carricks you think is a general store. 5. Imagine a square - you start in the bottom middle, at the Hidden Treasure - the left hand edge is a river, and another part of the Cracks beyond it. 6. there are two bridges. 7. A street, which you are on runs up the centre - at the end there is a large marketoccupying 500mx300mand just to the left of the centre is the Burning Castle, very close to Carrick's. 8. To the right and all through the centre leading up to the market is a warren of curving narrow streets and alleyways, that lead off randomly. 9. The girl looks over at Valen shocked at his approach, clearly not impressed with what she sees she turns her head away and looks back to the young man who is giving Valen a hard stare, he seems ready to stop but checks himself and continues walking with the girl calling out over his shoulder "I think you need to work on your game, handsome. 10. Take care, wouldn't want you to try that again with some of the ladies round here, they've heard it all before and they aren't all so kind." 11. They both laugh as they walk on towards the Burning Castle and the market.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. With another curt nod, Heldred stumps off to tend to his remaining livestock. 2. Drueze is the first to spot the trail, a line of trampled grass leading into the forest to the north. 3. The gnarled trees press in upon a narrow track, scraping with bony fingers over the adventurers' shoulders. 4. Chilly moisture hangs in the air like a smothering blanket, and hints of breeze pierce the travelers' cloaks like frozen needles. 5. A thick carpet of red and gold leaves muffles footsteps, and, as time passes, icy rain begins to drip from the clouds. 6. Free to hunt for other signs, Belleres notices her foot strike something...hollow. 7. Poking the leaves aside, she reveals the top of a rotten wood box, carved with twisting vines and set with rusty rivets, hidden in a hole in the path. 8. At this moment, Necria catches a glimpse of a small black figure darting behind a tree, only a hundred feet behind... What do you do? 9. A long moment passes...then, scuttling from behind the tree, the figure appears. 10. Three feet of black scales, a pointy snout, and two goggling eyes: a kobold. 11. "Ey, look 'ere!" 12. the creature squeaks. 13. "I's just passin' through, I is. 14. 'At's right, just passin' through." 15. He rubs his claws frantically, saucer eyes darting about. 16. "Look 'ere, can you just lemme go on? 17. 'At's right, just go on. 18. Wi' me busy-ness." 19. What do you do? 20. As for initiative, thanks, it may or may not become necessary, but it definitely could save us an unnecessary round of posts! 21. P.S. 22. Really sorry I misgendered Belleres! 23. Thanks for pointing out my mistake. 24. :-)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Nevermind. 2. Don't roll anything. 3. As Barnaby fusses with the girls' bonds, he realizes they are sliding off loosely with his barest touch. 4. They were, apparently, not on securely. 5. The girl who he as attempting to free, as well, has surprisingly rough skin for an 8-year-old. 6. . . 7. The children scowl malevolently and change in form. 8. They grow and grow until they are tall, wicked looking old crones, with long, tangled gray hair, and sunken, yellowish eyes. 9. Their skin is gray, they are wearing long rags, and they peer down at you with looks that display both hatred of you, and also glee at the (momentary) success of their trick. 10. They cackle through crooked teeth as they transform. 11. Oh, you foolish, foolish outsiders. 12. We aren't goinganywhere!! 13. Roll for initiative! 14. As the witches transform, you may all act (because of their terrible initiative roll). 15. As for the cramped quarters, there is a bit of space behind Misalyk down the steep staircase. 16. Anybody may attempt to use it, but - under the circumstances - it will require a DC 10 Acrobatics or Athletics check, or fall down the steps for 1d6 damage and be prone. 17. Either way, you can get to the space down the steps, if it's unoccupied.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Sael and Andrømeda finish up at the Coster and head back to the Inn to get some lunch. 2. The innkeeper greets them with a smile. 3. Kwisatz is upstairs in his room, learning his new spell, and ((I'm assuming)) Rush has been with them. 4. It took you ~30 minutes at the Coster, and then it'll take another 30 or so minutes to get and eat your lunch. 5. So, by this time, we'll estimate that it's about 11:00am when you're finishing up lunch. 6. Kwiz will have finished studying his spell and learning it by this time, as well. 7. So, you're free to take whatever next step you'd like to. 8. Based on the map that Kwisatz got, you know that Butterskull Ranch is about 60 miles away, and it'll take you 2 days worth of travel to get there. 9. You have about 6 or 7 more hours of daylight before the sun will be set and your first day of travel will be over. 10. (Unless you want to risk traveling at night and either exhausting yourselves or running into some sort of dangerous night creature.) 11. You collect yourselves and your gear and you make your way towards Butterskull Ranch. 12. You take Triboar Trail. 13. Traveling is relatively uneventful and as the sun starts to get low on the horizon, you arrive at what was the town of Conyberry.The abandoned town iseerily silent except for the whistling of the wind as it blows through the settlement’s burned and crumbled-down structures. 14. The party notices that there are stretches of ruins that are frozen with melting ice. 15. You notice it because it's not winter time. 16. (It's late summer/early fall.) 17. As the party make their way through or around the ruins, they spot three unsaddled riding horse sgrazing near an old well. 18. Perception Checks: Andrømeda and Sael notice that the horses are branded with the initials "BAK".

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "I will be honest with you," Staget begins. 2. "All of our resources are being used to fight the very gang war that had a battle in this warehouse. 3. Unfortunately, the gangs have spread beyond the Dock Ward and so we need to keep the equipment for the city watch, we've even had to borrow some of what we have to deal with this from the City Guard. 4. We aren't necessarily proud of that. 5. They will probably rub that in the watches faces once this is all over for weeks," he said, in a resigning tone. 6. "Take what you need from here, everything that's happened here is obvious, and it's just another gang attack. 7. Feel free to any of the weapons. 8. The silver is yours, but the paintings need to be seized to make sure they haven't been stolen. 9. If there have been no claims in two tendays, then feel free to visit the Palace in the Castle Ward, and if they have not been claimed as stolen you may be able to purchase them - otherwise, they will go to the city," he added, in regards to the paintings. 10. "This sort of thing can usually end up on the black market, and if they have been stolen - then the owners would have the first rights to them, I hope you understand. 11. They just aren't mine to give away," With that, Staget straightened up, and the twelve city watchmen upstairs take the four kenku out of the warehouse without trouble. 12. The kenku can see their outnumbered and surrounded - they have nowhere left to go, and willingly go with the watch patrol upstairs.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Wash, you're not sure who tended to the wound on the dragonborn's first visit - the hospital is a busy place and you don't know a quarter of the staff and volunteers who work there - but they did a good job. 2. The wound is pretty much healed, and without complications. 3. Wash and unknown dragonborn, there's often a slightly awkward moment at the Dawnfather's Promise whenit's time to turn to the subject of payment. 4. Everyone is treated with no questions asked, that's the rule. 5. But they are always asked for a financial contribution. 6. For those who cannot pay, it's fine. 7. For those who can, there's an expectation they will either make a small payment or promise to do so when times are better. 8. Alton andCalasseus, there's no-one else on the road, and it turns out you are both travelling towards Hupperdook, so you end up travelling together the remaining hour or so to the city gates. 9. Do you chat, or walk quietly and enjoy the scenery? 10. Cala and Alton, you pass a pleasant hour walking together along the road. 11. You reach the gates and see that the guardsare making standard checks; you wait perhaps half an hour behind several large wagons, and then you each step forward; there are two guards on duty. 12. A taller-than-usual dwarven woman asks Cala: State your name, and business in Hupperdook. 13. A smiling middle-aged gnome woman asks Alton: Hello there. 14. What do they call you, and what brings to you our fair town? 15. (OOC: There is a cheap and not-too-rowdy tavern just a few dozen yards from the hospital - it's popular with the medics when they get off duty, and you've been there quite a few times. 16. It's called the Ironheart's Rest .)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. @Terrance and Zaroc "Name's Hooch, this lil lady on the guitar is Lu Lu, and the one on the drum is Zanna. 2. My wife Janis is in the house finishing up in the kitchen." 3. He says gesturing with his thumb. 4. "The wolves come almost every night, seem fairly normal to me from what little I have seen. 5. Mostly going off of tracks found near my dead livestock. 6. The strange part is, my pastures are fenced in and every time it seems someone is opening the gate and letting the wolves in. 7. Now I am a man of few enemies, so I cant imagine who would do that. 8. I have heard there have been bandits on the loose, but what would a bandit gain from letting wolves slaughter my animals?" 9. @Terrance Certainly! 10. Dinner should be ready, and I would be forever in your debt if you could resolve this matter for me and my family. 11. @Zaroc The tracks do indeed lead through the gate. 12. It is clear to me that the wolves are entering there. 13. But no wolf i have ever seen can open a gate by itself! 14. @Terrance and Zaroc After enjoying a lovely meal of chicken, mashed potatoes, corn, and pumpkin pie, everyone excuses themselves and agrees to meet in the field to adress the wolf situation as a team.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The party collects their belongings and packs the camp away. 2. Galwain and Arnnon lead the way out of the ravine and the party heads east towards the Larch Road where they are due to meet Jonah, the Constables boy, to receive information on their next task. 3. The rocky surroundings start to turn into more gently rolling hills and scrubland again as the miles roll by. 4. By mid-morning the group reach the Larch Road and see two figures taking their ease under a tree nearby. 5. They stand as the party nears and younglad dressed in the manner of a shepherd approaches. 6. Morning sirs! 7. I am Jonah. 8. I be hoping your ruckus wit the bandits went well. 9. The Constable has sent me with news that one of the prominent townsfolk. 10. Missus Mithra Mhandyvver has found the location of haunted tomb north of here that she is worried may be the cause of the strange goings on. 11. The constable wants you to investigate. 12. Being that that this is all spooky and magical Ol Harburk has hired a researcher of the, what did you say it was sir? 13. Arcane? 14. Anyhoo this is Mr Othronus. 15. I’ll leave you to get acquainted and head back to Red Larch and let Harburk know you ain’t dead Jonah dips his head in farewell and makes his way West along the Larch Road towards home Once the pleasantries and introductions are complete Galawain and Arnnon stretch out a map of the local area and note the rough location given by Jonah for this haunted tomb. 16. Hmm it looks like it’s about 12 miles from here. 17. Luckily most of it is along the Larch Road so we should make good time and be there in a few hours. 18. Galawain looks to the others. 19. Lets head off then? 20. A few hours pass and the group start to head across country heading North from the road. 21. By mid afternoon they start to get close. 22. Survival checks from everyone please to see how long it takes to find the tomb Ok so Arnnon give me an investigation roll for the door Geltrix checks the entryway to the tomb and as far as you can tell it does not does not appear to be trapped and the engravings are too weathered for you to make out.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Eira and Zargaroth are out in the village looking for supplies. 2. Ethan is keeping watch outside the man’s hut. 3. That leaves Cora and Zadoris for talking with the man. 4. Here we go. 5. Eira/Zargaroth You head back into the village and are unable to find any sort of market-like area, but you continue walking. 6. At one point, you hear a screech as Mara descends from the sky, landing on Zargaroth’s shoulder. 7. Zargaroth: You hear Mara speak to you telepathically. 8. “The green giant is gone. 9. Left the village and went somewhere away from the sea. 10. Give me something to eat now.” Though the voice in your head sounds to be nice, you would used to Mara by now. 11. She doesn’t have the same mannerisms you do, so it’s possible she did not mean to sound demanding at the end. 12. At the end of the road, you see Rhond’s men bringing the wares back to their ship. 13. When you look back, you see some of his other men giving villagers gold for a portion of their crops. 14. What do you both want to do? 15. If you wish, you may portray your characters while you discuss. 16. Cora/Zadoris The old man waits for you to step in, and he notices Ethan staying outside. 17. He shuts the door gently, and invites you two to sit on stools with pillows on them, but you do not have to. 18. When you look around, you realize there isn’t much to see. 19. The inside of his hut is almost completely empty, aside from a seemingly tough cot and the pillowed stools. 20. The walls are chipped all over and have a very faded color, but it’s stone, not paint. 21. You can, however, pick up a strange scent. 22. He sits on one of the stools. 23. He doesn’t bombarde you with questions, just asks these during the conversation. 24. “Hello, young’uns. 25. My name is Lor. 26. What are your names? 27. I hear you arrived with Rhond. 28. Are you here to rent some of my babies?” If you want to do any checks, now’s the time. 29. What do you want to do? 30. Ethan The walls of the little building are not exactly sound-proof. 31. You’re able to listen in to the conversation as you watch out for anything. 32. What will you do now?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. ROUND 6 Seeing the spider in such pain, Serak can barely contain his jubilation. 2. Goading the beast he calls again from the relative safety of the doorway, "Die already you damn arachnid!" 3. Action: Vicious Mockery Target:Spider Spider Wisdom Save: 20 Spell Save DC: 13 Completely distracted from its burst abdomen, the spider ignores the shouts from outside as its front legs plant themselves back onto the floor. 4. Holding its legs in a pincer like fashion, the spider lashes out at Arkhan. 5. Spider Attack Roll: 6 (+ d/a) Weakened by its injuries the spiders legs collapse under its own weight. 6. Letting out a high pitched squeal, the beast makes to retreat over the southern wall. 7. Scuttling backwards, the spider stretches its rear legs above it searching desperately for the wall. 8. With a gap appearing before them, Beetle and Arkhan take their opportunity to strike. 9. Arkhan Attack Roll: 19 Beetle Attack Roll: 24 Arkhan Damage: 6 Beetle Damage: 5 As Beetle stabs again into the spiders body, Arkhan swings in frustration, cleaving off a number oflimply standing legs. 10. The spider hisses loudly as the two warriors withdraw their swords, its body writhing madly in pain before suddenly falling silent beside its fellow fallen spider. 11. Reddened in the dim light, the cultists face trembles as his mask is slapped away. 12. Mumbled broken words fall from his swelling lips, his eyes flicker open - bleary and bloodshot. 13. Suddenly realising his situation the cultist jerks to one side as if to escape, but falls face first into the dirt road, taking in a mouthful of dry, charred dust. 14. “Whu.... what do you want? 15. Let me go!” The man coughs a cloud of ash as he splutters into the ground. 16. Surely in his mid twenties, his face is young but battled hardened. 17. On his left cheek, a scar from an old burn leads back to a small shrivelled ear hidden beneath his blonde hair.
