Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rupert the fisherman looks surprised at first: "Really? 2. I mean... 3. I don't see that kind of gold in a year, but I ain't one to refuse generosity." 4. ( OOC : please remove 5gp from each of your wallets.) 5. The five companions wait patiently as Rupert makes the final preparations. 6. Before leaving, Drazzim , Utar , and Praxx do a final check around the docks just in case Rag has found his way to them, but it seems the friendly thief will have to miss this ride. 7. The first20 minutes of the trip are quite smooth, despite the tight fit inthe dinghy. 8. Five minutes in and the fisherman recruits Graxx to do the rowing for him. 9. Ten minutes in, he encourages Neya to keep the boat on course on his behalf. 10. Once settled, he focuses on his true calling: telling tales. 11. Among the many exaggerated stories of fish caught, loves lost, and adventures conquered, the group does manage to extract a few pieces of useful information (this is still considered part of your previous skill rolls): The second 20 minutes worth of traveling are a bit more treacherous. 12. The boat has to slow down as the currents pick up in counterproductive directions and some sharp rocks hidden just beneath the foamy sea seem to reveal themselves with just seconds to spare as the boat approaches the island. 13. -> I need an athletics check from Graxx , and a survival one from Neya , both {DC 12}. 14. Having Rupert on the boat with you has lowered this DC. 15. Also, I don't think this is the case, but if anyone has the Sailor/Pirate background or proficiency with vehicles (water), now is the time to speak up.

Vesper can roll a DC 17 Perception check if she wishes to decipher their conversation. 8. "The Olmkirk postal building would have no trouble assisting you in contacting your mother. 9. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Jorel, as far as you can tell, whatever medicine Smoke has taken has rejuvenated him to some extent, so that he is not unconscious or dead. 2. The crowd seems a bit surprised at your sudden appearance to the situation, but none really question it. 3. Except for Ester. 4. "Are you with the tabaxi fellow?" 5. Aldin, you are able to quickly and stealthily make it to the backside, and observe the old wooden door seems locked, but not entirely secure. 6. An easy lockpick could do the trick, or the handle could be rather easily broken off with a bit of effort. 7. This building does not seem to have been remodeled in decades, which perhaps fits in with the antique store feel, but also provides the perfect unsuspecting cover for whatever the silver-cloaked figures and half-orcs are doing there. 8. The crowd screams and jumps back in alarm at Nirug's hulking form. 9. Even Ester seems a bit frightened. 10. They all cower before Nirug, awaiting him to kill someone, or smash something. 11. Then Ester works up the courage, once in possession of a coin satchel or two and in safe distance of another bodyguard, he asks, "What do you want, rebel?" 12. Black Cat, stepping on a few noisy twigs, you also make your way to where Aldin is, and, since the door's lock is so outdated and insecure, pick the lock. 13. The door slightly sways open as the lock clicks out of place, allowing entrance to the building. 14. You can immediately hear the sounds of voices, but no one seems to notice the door being slightly ajar. 15. There are many figures in this room--around five, you estimate. 16. If you stay by the door and listen, make additional Stealth and Perception checks. 17. What would you like to do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Tarric shakes his head; "I've never heard of anything like this within the Empire." 2. Sedna speaks up; "You wouldn't have. 3. I hid it out of shame that something had bested me." 4. She lowers her head, looking down at the ground, and continues; "This shop used to be in ruins. 5. I walked past it many times while working as a Hero of the Realm. 6. One day I decided to clean it up and take the upstairs as my home. 7. The place had been abandoned so long that no one complained when I started fixing it up; and then I found it. 8. In the back room; buried under a broken shelf, embedded into the floor. 9. If I had known what would happen when I touched it, I would have ran; fled for my life." 10. Tears are now freely flowing from her face as she tremors in rage. 11. "I didn't want to run a healing shop; wouldn't even have known how to if I hadn't touched that cursed thing. 12. But I did touch it, and now I can never leave. 13. Believe me, I've tried." 14. She laughs a sad laugh to herself. 15. "Do you know what I was going to do? 16. I was going to run a little shop to sell off my trophies from my quest; you know, spare weapons, monster horns, stuff like that. 17. If only I had known that the last adventure was my final one." 18. She sits down onto a wooden stool. 19. "So, I am grateful for your offers to fight, and I'll eager defeat you both as soon as you are ready." 20. A eager smile crosses her face and her eyes light up with energy, even as tears continue to fall.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Everyone is healed up except for Trim. 2. He was the only one to use 2 dice instead of 3, so let's roll for 1 more die plus the Song of Rest: 3 + 1 ... 3. I am ruling that Trim is at full health, in spite of the D&D Beyond die roller.) 4. On the way out, Reverie decides to ask what the Sages are doing in the Shadowfell (since she was curious, way back in the temple of Oghma). 5. The Sages inform her (in more flowery words) that they are spying on the Raven Queen. 6. She is the being in control of much of the Shadowfell. 7. Her minions collect memories and secrets from the dead, the souls passing through or trapped in the Shadowfell. 8. (As they said earlier to Isk, in the Shadowfell dead men do tell tales.) 9. The Sages are eavesdropping on the agents of the Raven Queen. 10. ------ The Sages activate the exit to the Shadowfell. 11. The party passes outside, and marches at a slow pace towards the return point. 12. The land outside the hill is as dreary as it was earlier. 13. You are watching the surroundings carefully. 14. It will be difficult to track a wraith-like Allip, but the Sages assure you it is nearby, and will seek you out (unless you try to avoid it). 15. Your pace is also slowed by Iskander, who is twitching and staggering, while saying that he is feeling better now, really. 16. After a few minutes, there is a dry, deep voice from somewhere nearby. " 17. You met them. 18. What did they say to you? 19. Tell me what I should know... What do I remember? 20. It is there. 21. It isn't there. 22. What is it?... 23. Share my secret. 24. Share my doom... "

Was almost forgotten. 3. A swirling black marble of darkness slides onto the battlefield from the Southwest and walks toward the front door. 4. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Zhudala begins to search the body of the slain drow. 2. He has no money, but she does find a large key with a head shaped like an anvil, as well as the drow's staff with a large spider on the end. 3. Incantis, at the table you find a variety of letters and notes, some in common, some in elvish, a few in undercommon, all of which you are able to read. 4. There are older letters from Nezznar's agents in the region, including Iarno Albrek and Vyerith. 5. There are letters from King Grol of the Cragmaw tribe, discussing details of an arrangement between them. 6. There are documents evidently stolen from Phandalin relating to property right in the local area. 7. There are Nezznar's own notes on the Wave Echo Cave, descriptions of the various hazards - the flameskull and the cave of poisonous mushrooms feature a lot. 8. You see detailed description of his conversations with the flameskull and attempts to persuade it to abandon its watch. 9. Overall you get a sense of Nezznar himself, a curious combination of boldness and caution - a drow with towering ambition to install himself as a power in the region, and yet at the same time almost paralysing slowness and caution in how he approached his goal of the Forge of Spells. 10. In any case, he lies dead now; whoever takes the forge, it will not be the Black Spider. 11. Incantis, if you wish to make an Investigation check to find more, you can. 12. You do also notice the sack lying by the table.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Just FYI, skinning the monster will take an hour. 2. The two of you could either remain on the beach to do that, or try to see if the miners would let you bring it into your compound. 3. (The below section appeared above but was moved here for continuity. 4. I will continue to move this section lower depending on how much you guys want to talk before the cavalry arrives) Gulin Runehammer and Khelnes Bahlnurath: You hear the sounds of horses in the distance. 5. "Now that must be the cavalry finally arriving," Julark remarks. 6. About a dozen Keoland knights arrive. 7. In their midst is two dwarves, Gulin recognizes one of them, a younger dwarven woman with long dark hair partially obscuring a face tattoo, as part of the contingent with whom he traveled. 8. "What happened here Julark? 9. We had just made it to the mine encampment when the alarm was sounded, it was hard to make out what exactly was going on from the towers. 10. Oh no! 11. Noria!" 12. The woman quickly dismounts her horse, and begins to examine Noria's dead body. 13. Julark begins to regale the Keoland knights and the two Dwarves with the tale of you defeating the Peryton and saving his life. 14. The second dwarf finally speaks, "I am Verdun, Manistrad is my distance cousin who governs our clan. 15. While she spends her days in Saltmarsh, I serve as her eyes and ears at the mines. 16. Please return with us to the mines. 17. The Copperlocks will provide the two of you with a proper reward for saving our kinsman, and our fortifications contain bunks where you can rest and recover." 18. Verdun motions towards one of the Keoland knights, "get word to the ship, they are likely wondering what happened to their crew and will want to recover their rowboats. 19. Try to see if they will anchor here for the night, we will need to send a message to Saltmarsh in the morning and I would rather not risk another life delivering the message overland." 20. You watch as one of the knights with a large banner gallops down to the shore and begins to signal towards the White Breaker.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Fenthaza clasps her hands, "Excellent. 2. I knew you would see reason in the end. 3. Any good Yuan-ti knows how to play the end game. 4. Perhaps you would make acceptable converts yourselves." 5. See looks at your caretaker, "Liss'ard, please have your charges select some chores from the list, or force them to do this or that; I don't care as long as it gets done. 6. Cleanliness is next to diabolicalness, you know." 7. She turns towards the party, "Now, I expect you to put your pathetically short backbones into these tasks, and I expect you to work the whole day with no complaining. 8. Liss'ard will show you your nice hole instead of the sacrificial altar at the end of the day as your reward." 9. With a subtle gesture she concludes the meeting, and the guards force you back outside of Fenthaza's quarters. 10. Liss'ard unfurls the scroll and has a look. 11. He rolls his eyes (if that is possible for a snake) and begins to mete out chores arbitrarily. 12. "Goldilocks, you..." he looks at the busted ankle, "ugh, pathetic... you go assist Xopal in the poison distillery... watch your step." 13. Next he looks at Daner, "Wee Man, you look fit for work.. how about you muck out the dinosaur pen?" 14. He laughs to himself, "...that stool is bigger than this fool!" 15. Next he turns towards Tempest, "You look like you need to be somewhere dry, let's send you to rearrange the contents of the storeroom." 16. Then finally he looks at Darion, "You, ordinary...guy? 17. Go to the bathing area and scrub down some of our extraordinary warriors!" 18. Before closing the door, Fenthaza adds one more thing. 19. "Oh, slaves, one more thing. 20. Our most noble leader, Slithotep, do not let him see you. 21. He is known to lop the head off any non-reptilian on sight, hoist the body above his head, and take a shower of blood right then and there. 22. He is not as... pragmatic as I. 23. Please do not fail me in this."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. It takes a bit longer than normal, as you all were a tad off course, but you manage to make it back to the main road and then head west towards Greenest. 2. It's later in the evening when you arrive, around 8pm. 3. You're stopped by a guard post near the entrance to town, but are quickly recognized and led to the central keep. 4. Governor Nighthill, accompanied by Escobert, greet you and have you join them in the meeting room. 5. They have some food brought in for you all and then get right down to business. 6. Nighthill says, "I'm glad you all returned safely." 7. He looks at each of you and smiles, but when he gets to Wex, his smile turns to a slight frown, then he continues. 8. "What information do you bring us?" 9. Leosin scoffs a bit at your statement Wex and then nods in agreement with you Sevrn. 10. "Yes, exactly good sir! 11. We need to find out more and the perfect place to start is back at that camp!" 12. Turning to you Wex he says, "Every town with somewhat of a force near here, has been raided. 13. No one has any soldiers to amass! 14. No, our best bet is to enter with a small force just like you four already did. 15. I know you don't really want to go back, but we need to know what is in that cave, and ultimately what they will do with it, as well as where that loot will be going. 16. I'll leave tomorrow morning for Elturel and speak with the heads of my order. 17. When you get back, head there and meet back up with me."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. With the elemental banished, and the Red Wizards apparently departing the field, Unnirth and the Blaze close in on the last known threat on the field. 2. Hoondarrh continues to rip through the pinnace, skewering one surviving crewman with a claw and slapping another into the water with a wing. 3. A few moments later, Unnirth opens with his cold breath, bathing Hoondarrh in frost just before Cratol, Poljen, Mari and Velon close in for a series of attacks, many of which bounce off of the dragon's thick hide. 4. Perry drops animated daggers, which have even more trouble while Lawrance's lightning strikes a glancing blow. 5. Hoondarrh retaliates with a torrent of flame from his maw, catching both Unnirth and Velon in the blast. 6. He also slaps Cratol with his tail, and beats his wings, buffeting those around him. 7. Velon needs to make a DC 24 Dex savefor half of98 fire damage. 8. That potion of fire resistance should still be up, so that's fortunately already reduced down to 49. 9. Cratol takes 20 damage from the tail slap Cratol, Mari, Poljen, and Velon all need to make DC 25 Dex saves vs 16 bludgeoning damage and being knocked prone (which in this case will mean falling into the water), on a pass, half damage and you don't go prone.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Yuri's sword slices into the beast and spill blood. 2. The wolf is almost taken out by a single attack from the hand of the half-elf. 3. Yuri positions himself on the opposite side of Klarg with Ripper between the two. 4. Klarg releases Ripper to attack Yuri . 5. The wolf clamps down and takes a bite out of Yuri's forearm. 6. Klarg attention is with the barbarian at the moment. 7. Klarg will swing hard against Ren with a morningstar. 8. The morningstar connects against Ren . 9. Yuri - DC 11 saving throw or get knocked prone Kim, Morpetor and Gramgran are up. 10. Yuri is able to pull his arm from the jaws of Ripper, maintaining his fighting stance. 11. Gramgran's guiding bolt streaks across the cavern lighting up everything in a divine light only clerics possess. 12. Morpetor removes his arcane focus to cast a chromatic orb. 13. A streak of arcane energy strikes hard against he bugbear. 14. The strike causes Klarg to spit up blood. 15. Kim isup. 16. Ren take his axe to the bugbear, who is barely standing. 17. Klarg is drained and unable to continue his defense from the raging barbarian. 18. The axe cuts through the bugbear's neck and the bugbear head separates from his body. 19. The head hits the cavern floor with a thud.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. With Titus and Zaxx breaking left and right off the road the rest of the group take the direct path lead by Kargan to the wagons. 2. Kryinor and Kargan begin earnestly searching the still bodies for any signs of life and are saddened to find none. 3. All are men, traders by the looks of them. 4. They have been dead many hours and all the corpses have been roughly looted. 5. Strangely the the cause of death is not obvious,the onlysigns of harm being a redness around the eyes, nose, and mouth. 6. The wagons are in disarray, many trade goods are still there, but anything of true value, and easily transportable, is gone. 7. Stranger still, all but one of the horses and oxen are gone. 8. The last ahuge broad horned beast lies at the front of the train bloody froth on its lips and nose. 9. Titus moves with silent precision through the low scrub on the edge of the trail and notes the tracks of some few goblins and orcs moving off to the south east. 10. He estimates that they take a direct route to the Tor that is the parties destination. 11. Rounding a thicket he sees a man in rugged worn traveling clothes propped up against a small outcropping of rocks. 12. His eyes are closed but his chest rises and falls in shallow sporadic movements. 13. Both Ranger and Druid also feel a faint sting in their nose from some heavy acrid odor that clings tot his place.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Goblin "attack": 10 Nadaar, while speaking to Zack a blueberry muffin whizzes by your head and crumbles against the floor behind you. 2. The Goblin appear to be reaching into the sack, looking for more ammo to throw. 3. While digging through the sack of food she tells angrily "No talk! 4. No betray Hark! 5. You go or be sticky!" 6. As that final threat is uttered you see she found a jar of honey and appears to be ready to throw it. 7. (Despite the "attack" I'm not ready to say your officially in combat so no initiatives at this point) 21 perception roll advantage as zack would likely be helping Before moving to the next building, Nadaar searches the sack for any valuables. 8. Inside he finds a few more food items, blocks of cheese, several more muffins a cooked chicken. 9. There enough food for 3 more days of rations for one person or one for each of you. 10. You also find some cooks utensils, a bullseye lantern, 2 flasks of oil, a frying pan, a pot, a dented silver jug, a jar of saffron,, a jar of cloves, and a cracked hour glass. 11. The spices and silver you know will be worth some decent coin and the hourglass might be worth good coin too if it's fixed. 12. Nadia and Zack, while stowing away the Goblin you can't help but notice a distinct lack of any ranged weapon on Gum-Gum. 13. Looking around, no bow or cross bow is found in the kitchen either. 14. Nadia, the image of the Goblin in the other room with a fresh arrow in its heart is still fresh in your mind.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Sorry guys. 2. I've had a lot going on) Rend makes his way further in. 3. As soon as you get into the larger cave opening you can see a couple things looking around. 4. First it's a massive chamber. 5. Judging by what you can see of it so far you'd guess at least 150'. 6. The roof slopes away out of your sight range in height. 7. Looking to your right you see ledge about 40' off the ground with a large red dragon sitting on it. 8. She hisses out in common "Come in little dragon mutt. 9. You and your friends. 10. I'd like to get a better look at you all" You'd pretty much have to crit but give me a persuasion Rend. 11. To Felicity she just snorts "If you can't tell little one I've no interest in educating you. 12. Perhaps if you come in you'll be able to tell for yourself" I'll also need a DC19 Wis Save from the 2 closest folks Rend and Felicity You're not sure if it's a sneer or smile but she says to Rend "Oh, I doubt you would be here if you came across another of my kind you little bastard halfbreed. 13. You're blood is so polluted I doubt you'd recognize one of your own kind. 14. So here's what's going to happen. 15. I'm going to cook you up nice and crispy and then use you're bones to pick my teeth." 16. Still need the DC19 Wis save from Rend and Felicity.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Edmond , your watch is peaceful, at least the atmosphere is, your mind thinks over the nights events and how close the party came to defeat. 2. You sleep pretty well, but your sleep is filled with a dream... At first you aren't sure you are dreaming cause you are at the camp site at night, but you notice that none of your companions or their items are there. 3. You hear growling in the distance. 4. A wolf approaches out of the darkness. 5. It growls and snarls at you. 6. As it approaches the campfire you notice that it is not an ordinary wolf. 7. you can't explain how but the wolf is off in some way. 8. You hear a voice in your head. 9. ??? 10. : (to Hati) "Your current path leads you to a new test of your powers and commitment to our deal. 11. Knowing what to do is part of the test. 12. Destroy, Free, Kill. 13. Destroy... Free.. 14. Kill..." You no longer hear the voice. 15. You do recognize the voice for you have heard it before. 16. The strange wolf still stood by the fire, glaring at you. 17. It growls again and snaps at you. 18. Then all you see is darkness ending the dream. 19. The rest of your sleep is dreamless.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. It's a two day journey along the road to Alfield, where the road splits. 2. You have the sense when you leave the tavern in the morning that you are being watched, and the feeling only goes away when you are about an hour into your journey north towards the heart of the Empire. 3. The weather is grim and not getting more pleasant. 4. Serious rain begins around midday. 5. Silent, your cloak offers a decent amount of protection, and of course rain doesn't bother Magnum, but you are finding it difficult and uncomfortable to talk in such heavy rain. 6. Will you continue on, or try to find a place for shelter? 7. You find a place that you think is naturally protected from the worst of the rain, and set about trying to get dry. 8. Unfortunately, though it seemed like it might be a good place, in fact the wind and rain get driven between the trees and the rocky outcrop to create both an intensified wind and a horrible noise. 9. Silent, as soon as Magnum casts his spell, you are instantly dry, and then within three seconds you are drenched again. 10. Nevertheless, you settle in for the night. 11. Can I please have Perception checks for standing guard through the night? 12. Just from Magnum? 13. Or will Silent help?2

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Kazri and Rhogar keep an eye on the unconscious orc Chill, Krom and Chip enter the house. 2. (Rekuburk can decide where he wants to go) The front door of the house leads into the kitchen, which holds a large butter churn, worktables, shelves of foodstuffs and ale, and hanging pots and pans. 3. Atop a small table is a skull-shaped wooden butter mold. 4. Foodstuffs are strewn around and dirty orc boots have made a mess of the floor. 5. The cabinets are thrown open and stuff lies around broken open and ruined. 6. The dining room contains two wooden trestle tables flanked by benches. 7. Cattle skulls on the walls add to the decor. 8. A downstairs closetcontains shelves holding dinnerware, most of which has been thrown to the ground and smashed. 9. Searching for a stairway down you only find stairs up. 10. You head upstairs and find a number of bedrooms with openedfootlockers contains once neatly folded clothing and worthless personal effects that have been tossed around. 11. A large master bedroom has alarge bed and a bulky cedar wardrobe dominates this room, which also has framed paintings of landscapes hanging on the walls. 12. You also find an office with a desk buried under stacks of ledgers and papers. 13. Perception roll please

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. ( NOTE FOR POST #349 : While paralyzed , acreature cannot speak.) 2. Darnell, if I could have a survival check to try and pick up on which way Simmeat went. 3. He wandered for a bit, but tracks shouldn't be too hard to locate. 4. After a few minutes of following the dwarf's tracks around the different trees in the local vicinity,Shadow, Darnell, and Mara finds Sammeat curled up on the ground, shivering in a semi-conscious state. 5. Orianna feels like vomiting, buther stomach is empty, as only a bit of bile stings the bottom of her throat. 6. The below is for Simmeat You feel a voice whisper into your ear. 7. "YOU WILL NEVER SEE HER WHILE IN THE TOWER." 8. Thenthe whisps of smokey white begin to choke around Simmeat's throat, some of the "fumes" begin slipping into his mouth and nose, the taste of ash becomes overwhelming. 9. (Please make a DC 15 Wisdom Saving Throw , taking 9 necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much on a success) The time that this is happening seems to stretch out, the choking seemingly close to killing you, but never allowing you to fall unconscious, nor giving you relief. 10. "THE DEADWOOD IS FOR THE DEAD." 11. The voice tells you. 12. "EITHER JOIN US OR LEAVE US BE. 13. OUR GRAVES SHALL BE LEFT TO GROW UNTIL OUR SPIRITS CAN BE FREED FROM THIS TOWER."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Climbing up the roots Pat manages to get to the top and lifts the grate free. 2. Popping his head up through the grate he looks around... Stealth and perception please. 3. Pat sees a darken room with sheets covering several masses and that's it. 4. "It's a storage room. 5. Didn't suspect much but wanted to be sure," the turtle explains before ushering everyone through. 6. It take a little over five minutes tp get everyone through the grate. 7. The tortles barely squeeze through but all make it with Abe leaving a female tortle in green robes with a staff to watch over the exit before pressing forward. 8. Moving through the storage area the party soon realizes their in the street level of another building. 9. "This was the living quarters of the former magistrate. 10. He had a much finer house built but the cells are through their," Abe explains gesturing a doorway ahead. 11. "The sewers were blocked up years ago into the dungeons but there's another grate that bypasses that blockage ahead," he gestures to a doorway to the left of the room. 12. "Quiet," he adds putting a figure to his lips as he slinks forward surprising agile for a tortle! 13. Stealths, please!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Wreckzors - you can remove it's head if you want. 2. I don't know if you can carry it around with you. 3. The small one was a giant croc, I made the bigger one bigger than that Flynt - after viewing the building from different angles and inspecting the architecture you believe this might have been a tomb or burial chamber. 4. But why someone would build it out here you couldn't fathom Galdr - you stand at the opening of the corridor. 5. You only hear the sound of the wind, some swamp fauna and some dripping water from somewhere. 6. The corridor is made of stone and there is a large wooden door about 20 feet in with iron ring door pulls. 7. The rest of you hear Wreckzors yell about another way in. 8. Then disappear into a hole in the wall. 9. Wreckzors the crawlspace goes about 20 feet before opening up into larger room. 10. This room is long like a tunnel, with you on one side. 11. On the opposite side is a painting of a large monster face with its mouth open in a large black O. 12. Painted on the rest of the walls are scenes offields with cows grazing, several wolves in a forest, human, orc, elven, and strange human-animal mixtures goingabout various tasks. 13. Some of the frescoes show rooms of some buildings: a library filled with many books and scrolls, a torture chamber, a wizard’s work room. 14. The floor of the corridor is a colorful mosaic of stone, with a distinct, winding path of red tiles about 2' wide, the line snaking its way south down the corridor.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The group gathers around the portal. 2. Ven suggests using the tuning fork , Shai an enemy's body, and Vishnu her magical floating hand . 3. First, they test Vishnu 's suggestion, though her spell receives no reaction from the portal whatsoever. 4. As Shai turns around to go collect a body to test the second suggestion, Quadere interrupts with a calming but stern voice. 5. She reminds her companion that time is of the essence and Kandolou takes upon himself to show that he understands her plea. 6. Holding the tuning fork , the fighter steps into the portal.Nothing happens until Kandalou steps right at the center. 7. At that moment, he vanishes before everyone else's eyes. 8. Quadere follows, as do Shai , Vishnu , Kalak , and finally Ven . 9. There is not strange trip through tunnels of magical lights or ethereal nothingness. 10. You don't even feel like you have moved at all. 11. Instead, it feels like your surroundings suddenly morphed around you. 12. The portal is still beneath your feet but the cave around you is much smaller. 13. Roughly thirty-five feet by thirty-five feet, this chamber appears to have been rough-cut from the porous rock that makes up this place.It is cold, noisy, and dark, with no natural light. 14. In fact, the only light you see is the faint blue hue of the portal beneath you. 15. Strong, howling winds blow from every direction despite this being a mostly enclosed chamber. 16. The stone walls are so porous they allow the wind free reign here, littering the floor with sand, pebbles, and stones that kick up asyou walk about. 17. These conditions make it so conversations are quite hard to maintain. 18. You have to yell at each other, and even then, you can only hear another's words up to a maximum distance of 10 feet. 19. Someyards away from your central position in this chamber, just at the edge of the faint light provided to you by the portal on the ground, you can see the silhouette of a motionless body on the ground. 20. ( OOC : In addition to anything you might want to do in this chamber, feel free to roll a general arcana or history or survival check to gather more info on your surroundings.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (@Drache: As previously mentioned, the door swings outwardly. 2. As for the mechanism, the handles are heavy, wooden, and fixed in place. 3. There is no locking mechanism but there are four L-shaped metal parts on the inside of the door indicating it can be barred. 4. You do not see the bar used for such purpose near the door.) 5. For now, there is too much hubbub in here, so no one is paying particular attention to the new arrivals. 6. Yalek shrugs and whispers: "What are we trying to find out? 7. The location of the horn? 8. I have a feeling those hobgoblins wouldn't share that information with the cultists so easily, especially not the lower ranks you see here..." "Well, there is some coil over there so let's see if I can make a spring out of it" Villonah responds,encouraged byDoozey(Tinker's tools check: 7.) 9. Villonah breaks a few of the coils with her pliers before throwing the bits to the corner: "I'm not half the tinkerer my father was..." Any words of consolation may need to wait, though, as Doozey's (now boosted) passive perception picks up some approaching footsteps from beyond the supply room's door. 10. DM's Screen: 14 After taking in the scene within the barracks, the group decides this was an ill-fated side trip after all. 11. Neya regroups with Graxx and Utar and the three leave the room. 12. Yalek stays behind to go get Rhonda. 13. Once outside, the trio has to hold in a collective gasp. 14. They see the hobgoblin officer commanding one of four subordinates to open the door to the supply room. 15. Two other hobgoblins are still perched on the catwalk, ready to shoot their bows if need be. 16. The one soldier does as commanded, but his reaction upon opening the door betrays no immediate discovery. 17. Inside the room, Doozey, Taters, and Villonah are all crouching behind some barrels or tucking into some shadowy corner (not hidden, mechanically speaking, but behind full cover.) 18. The commander makes a coded gesture to his subordinates and they begin to move in for a more thorough inspection.

On the table, a glass bottle full of an unknown liquid stands at the center, surrounded by three dirty glasses and plates. 4. He sits down, and lights a cigar. 5. The smell of stale tobacco, booze and cheap incense fill the tent... "You want to know more about the Life, ey? 6. Well I've been with the Families my whole life. 7. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Gathering your things to travel, you look back to see the townspeople begin combing over the body of the Giant. 2. Seemingly now taking their turn looting and picking what they can, now that you have let it be. 3. you begin to travel the road northward. 4. By the setting of the sun you see the edge of the forest that was mentioned to you. 5. It’s at this moment you begin to think about making camp. 6. A thunderous rose rolls across the plains from unknown distance, the ground begins to quake. 7. The tremors fierce and relentless for what seems like minutes on end. 8. The ground slowly stops rioting under your feet. 9. All is still and quiet it seems. 10. Perception check DC 20: You notice the peak of the mountain range to the east. 11. Though miles and miles away, is significantly taller than prior to the quakes. 12. It’s just turned night time you’re on the edge of the forest. 13. The path you have taken is the division line of plains and trees. 14. What would you like to do? 15. (Sorry to kind of jump ahead, but want to get the game rolling again)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Elyse replies to Solomon’s question. 2. “ She’s going to let it go of course, let it find its home until it’s strong enough to fend for itself. 3. Cembessa is about balance, just as The Maker was. 4. She is the embodiment of nature’s grace and looks to restore the world to a state of flourishing. 5. Nature needs to be protected, not used as a weapon.” She tenses up a bit more, the stress in her shoulders that dropped with conversation hike themselves back up. 6. To Arell “ you’re right, we need to keep moving. 7. One of you will join us up front to help scout, the others follow behind Reginald to ensure the egg stays safe.... what are your names? 8. You’ve heard mine and Reginald’s... this is Chryl and Lektyr.” As she points to the two other elves next to her. 9. Arell’s insight: Elyse looks like a woman who takes her role seriously, if only to make sure everyone survives. 10. Definitely hardened by the times over the past year. 11. You detect that she firmly believe in her “faith” of Cembessa, she feels her words are true. 12. Whoever leads, roll a survival check. 13. Others can keep watch or focus on other things if they wish.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Arc, you can tell that you catch the Marshal by surprise, though only for a split- second, before her demeanor sets again. 2. The Marshal gives you a curious smile, but says nothing as Arc, Brandt and Corti make their way out of the tent. 3. Fixing Tarian and Thia, she asks: "Do you not want to take your equipment with you? 4. I am sure our quartermasters might be able to make good use of them." 5. Then, looking at Gyselle, she adds: "Specialist, I entrust you with the care of our guests here. 6. Should you require anything, Othmar knows where to find me. 7. Dismissed." 8. With that, she got up, ready to hand your equipment over and get back to her other business. 9. Anyone that wishes to make an Insight check can send me a PM with the insight roll, and a description of what you're trying to confirm. 10. Tarian, Thia and Arc, all the equipment you check seems to be fine, but you can tell by the slight discoloration around some of the screws that much of your equipment had been taken apart, probably much for the same reason as you are checking it now. 11. All your personal kit and the medical supplies checked, all that remains are the surveying equipment that had been taken apart and the telelith.At Thia's question, Othmar looks at Arc: "That... bead... there- ya sure it works? 12. I figure ye know we want ta help and I fer one trust you ta not want ta do us any harm, but I need ta be sure." 13. For a thorough inspection, including disassembly, I'll need an investigation check for any physical tampering.Arc is capable enough to disassemble the gear and put it back together again, but you still need to look over the items carefully. 14. Should you suspect arcane tampering, I'll need an arcana check on the corresponding item too.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rock enters the room, skillfully navigating the scattered ball bearings. 2. Quickly evaluating the situation, the dragonborn decides to leap up onto the table and strike down upon the bugbear. 3. He leaps, starts to slip, but manages to steady himself, but when he swings his weapon, the table wobbles a little, causing his aim to be off, and he misses the creature. 4. Round 7: HDP & Ian (10/21), baddies, Gruxx (rage; inspired), Glyn (11/21), Rock (rage) Ian hurries into the room as well, slipping and falling on the ball bearings as he is trying to move past the hulking form of Gruxx the Barbarian. 5. He crawls out from under Gruxx and stands up beside him using his agility. 6. (Second DEX save to continue: 8 — oh dear) Unfortunately, as he begins to move again, he once again loses his footing and falls prone beside Gruxx. 7. But, hey, he's a rogue, so he can move really swiftly, so he stands again and closes in on the bugbear on the opposite side of the table from Glynquinal. 8. (It's a good thing you can dash twice.) 9. "Whatever you were thinking of doing, its not worth losing your life over. 10. Surrender, and maybe we will spare your life." 11. So, HDP moves into the room with the others, deftly maneuvering through the minefield of tiny metal balls. 12. Stopping on the other side of Gruxx (X7), he speaks a magical phrase of healing to Glynquinal, healing some of his wounds. 13. The bugbear lifts the unconscious form of Gundren and holds him like a meat shield. 14. "I don't know why you're here, but you need to leave now, or this one will pay the price for your trespass." 15. This bugbear speaks like no other bugbear you've heard before, but you also see now that this might be the oldest bugbear you've ever seen. 16. Gruxx, you're up! 17. You're raging, but unless you attack something, your rage will end. 18. You are also inspired. 19. Again, we're still in combat, so we'll keep going in initiative order. 20. (Man, that's a good roll.) 21. Glynquinal, you're up!

Start of Round 2 Raynor shouts some profancities and insults at the skeleton but the skeleton seems unaffected by the spell. 5. (Made save in last post).Gotch move forwards, surverys the battlefield, seeing two remaining skeletons fires at the ones charging the party. 6. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Persuasion check (on Asmodean's encouraged behalf) 22 The combination of Virran's attempts to threaten followed by the gentle, reassuring lilt to Asmodean's words convinces the Redbrand to engage. 2. With the heat of battle now subsided, the youthful appearance of this lad is visible through the layers of dirt covering his face and the sound of his voice. 3. He mustn't be more than 21 - clearly inexperienced was the reason behindhis lack of engaged in the previous fight. 4. Having intensely watched the outcome of your work against his fellows, he stutters out a response to Asmodean's question. 5. “My name’s S-s-shawn. 6. Are you going to kill me, too? 7. ” He starts sobbing, his body convulsing embarrassingly against the restraints. 8. Shawn then drops his head against his chest and deflates completely. 9. “You’re going to kill me. 10. They said you would kill me.” Naivara’s childhood comes flooding back for a moment, but is gone quickly - forced out of her mind. 11. Experience with this kind of trauma is something she can related to. 12. She is certain the youth’s emotional state is honest and not a cleverly role-playedfacade. 13. Shawn continues to sob quietly, not offering up any more words in his current state.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The centerpiece of this wood-paneled dining room is a carved mahogany table surrounded by eight high-backed chairs with sculpted armrests and cushioned seats. 2. A crystal chandelier hangs above the table, which is covered with resplendent silverware and crystalware polished to a dazzling shine. 3. Mounted above the marble fireplace is a mahogany-framed painting of an alpine vale. 4. The wall paneling is carved with elegant images of deer among the trees. 5. Red silk drapes cover the windows, and a tapestry depicting hunting dogs and horse-mounted aristocrats chasing after a wolf hangs from an iron rod bolted to the south wall. 6. The silverware tarnishes, the crystal cracks, the portrait fades, and the tapestry rots if removed fromthe house.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Kyo attempts to channel his power into the blue panel, but after several attempts, his magic has no effect. 2. Fiorello sighs. 3. "I think 'water' may refer to healing magic, specifically. 4. If I may, master Kyo?" 5. The aarakocra places a wing on the sapphire and mutters an invocation. 6. A holy white light flares around him, which is slurped into the gemstone oval. 7. The water symbol glows blue, and the central faceplate lights with a rainbow aura. 8. (Fiorello is no longer able to heal! 9. Perspicacious , the faceplate rejects anyone else who tries to offer their corresponding "weapon"; looks like it's up to you!) 10. The empty bow stays put, however... Before you finish moving your head into position, Perspicacious, the colors flash and you feel a weighty fuzziness enter your mind. 11. There is a flash of light, a sudden rush of air, and the gate is gone! 12. (Perspicacious, youwill apply -5 to all INTchecks moving forward. 13. Ignore your current modifiersand subtract 5 from those rolls. 14. You also lose the ability to take the Help action under any circumstances!) 15. Beyond the gate you see a large circular atrium. 16. The wall reaches upward 60 or 70 feet, and an enormous tree in the room's center stretches its branches toward the glass ceiling. 17. Vines cover much of the walls, and a spiraling staircase is crumbling as it winds its way to the top of the room. 18. There is one exit directly across from the entrance: a dark tunnel that you can see if you peek around the tree in the middle of the room.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. ((I won't begrudge Thont a Dice Set.)) 2. Armond points out to Gavin roughly where they found the attacked expedition. 3. He notes that they were a ways off the main trail, likely due to an avalanche pushing them off course. 4. For Kathra: It's not too strange, as Druids and their Circles tend to really "get around" in their travels and pilgrimages to find some patch of untamed wilds to call their own. 5. You don't recall any notable ones inhabiting the Storm Horn at any point though, and you can't think of any ancestral stories that featured any either. 6. ((Alright crew, once you are all ready to go, we'll start our hike through the mountains. 7. Just let me know when you all are ready.)) 8. For Gavin: Any gear or supplies you can see look to have been either thoroughly picked over or are far too ruined to be of use to anyone anymore. 9. Honestly, what is most odd is what you don't see. 10. While it is very likely that the rescue party fished out some of the bodies of the travelers and brought them back to town for burial, it would be nearly impossible and extremely unlikely that they'd try to dig out the horses as well and drag those corpses down the mountain, yet here you have a smashed cart with no horses and more than enough blood stained snow in the area to give the impression that the cart-team didn't just break free and run off into the night or something. 11. For Peren: It's pretty quiet up here on this abandoned trail, but nothing really dangerous seems to be within eye-shot of you. 12. ((For those who wish it, Investigation, Perception, and/or Survival rolls would be helpful, though I'd gladly entertain other skills you may want to use as well.))

As it moves, Trigger sees that his hand is now attached only by a cable that seems to become root-like after Beatrix's tinkering. 6. As his hand soars, Trigger can tell he can still manipulate all the joints in his hand. 7. BAM! 8. His hand punches a crater into one of the walls in the shop, but when he looks over at Beatrix all he can see are stars in her eyes. 9. "Perfection!" 10. Trigger's Reach (Right) Range: 20 ft. Proficient: Yes If used for a punch, use unarmed statistics. 11. Can grabobjects, but can't grapple a guy. 12. Offers advantage on any checks meant to scale structures. 13. Based on how the map is marked, the only clue you have to go on is the shape of the tunnel before you reach the sewer. 14. It's possible those of you who have lived in Sharn could know where this might be... 15. If you lived in Sharn, roll with disadvantage for History! 16. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Baku rises into the room at the top of the stairs and is blasted by heat. 2. The room is filled with leaping flames and burning elementals, all circling what appears to be a portal in the center of the room. 3. From within the portal, wisps and plumes of fire escape every so often, forming into more elementals as the room begins to crowd with them. 4. Ashissa feels the burning heat singe her skin as she also finds herself in the same room, across the chamber from Baku. 5. The two stairways rise around the central dais, meeting next to a smoking fire-fall of molten stone. 6. It flows in a moat around the portal and seeps into the floor, only cooled by the touch of the blue energies from the base of the tower, far below. 7. Small stone bridges cross to the center platform from the two entrances. 8. A lone man stands within the inferno on the dais, fighting what seems to be a losing battle. 9. A weakly shimmering shield of energy stands between him and certain death. 10. His arms are raised to the ceiling and blast of fire seem to respond to his pleas, surging around the portal and pumping blue light into his shield. 11. Facing away from the stairways, he takes no notice of those entering the chamber. 12. He chants with a terrified fervor - "Histia alkubraa ، 'asmae sarkhatan baladi. 13. Thabat ydy waismah li bi'iighlaq hadhih albawabat. 14. Waqad ghadab Kerakys wayaseaa lileuthur ealaa tariquh 'iilaa alyawm min khilal alnaari. 15. 'Asmae sarkhati! 16. The creatures in the room all seem focused on him and circle him slowly, looking for a point of weakness in his shield, testing its boundaries. 17. Some of the smaller creatures break away from the main group and come to investigate the two newcomers. 18. They do not look happy. 19. Anyone in the room, roll for initiative. 20. OOC I am not even familiar with the rollback function. 21. How does that work? 22. Yeah, that crap sucks. 23. In the future, if you take a screenshot before you edit, feel free to let me know and we can count the original rolls. 24. This isn't a dictatorship.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. OOC Let me know which kind of source of light do you use to proceed. 2. Also, you can roll a Perception check, if you wish. 3. The party continues the journey through the evening. 4. After 3 hours, they finally see the hill where Mbala is. 5. The path is a much easier route to the top. 6. It begins on the north side of the plateau. 7. Through many switchbacks, it winds across the cliff face for 3 miles before reaching the top. 8. The path width varies but averages 5 feet. 9. Tumbled boulders and tangled roots block the path in many places, but as long as party members aren’t being chased by anything, they can clear the obstructions safely. 10. The first ascent takes 3 hours; once the road is cleared, it can be climbed or descended in half that time. 11. About a hundred feet below the lip of the plateau, the path (which is proceeding west across the cliff at that point) veers directly into a natural cleft in the stone face. 12. Steps are cut into the 15-foot-wide crevice, and scenes of jungle predators, flying lizards, and erupting volcanoes are carved in shallow relief onto the walls in ways that make creative use of the natural shape of the rock.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Everyone: Oda listens to all that Arissa has to say. 2. All the while, the old wizard is silent and focused as if she's sifting through Arissa's words, looking for tiny clues. 3. She does not interrupt, and she asks no questions. 4. When, at last, it is Oda's turn to speak, she speaks first of her dismay about the death of Ro Venna. 5. "Such a thing has never occurred. 6. No Windhover has ever died while wielding a fragment of Aeris. 7. I cannot comprehend this. 8. I cannot." 9. Oda's tone becomes a bit more somber and far less facetious as the conversation continues. 10. She is quiet for a minute or two and thenanswers Xellos' question. 11. "Two days ago, the creatures you see outside interrupted a peaceful fall evening, master sorcerer. 12. I fared well as you can see. 13. Ten minutes after the battle I entered the Broken Oar to talk to Cordo, a local fisherman who had been telling some rather unbelievable tales about walking skeletons he'd seen on Grimshaw. 14. Cordo is a good fisherman, but he's a better drunkard; so most of the time, people pay little heed to what tumbles out of Cordo's mouth. 15. As you can imagine, after my encounter with the wights I was inclined to reconsider what Cordo had been babbling about lately. 16. Cordo stuck to his story; so I set the Magic Mouth spell to trigger on the opening of my front door, and off to Grimshaw I went. 17. My Cloak of the Bat served me just fine, and I made it to that barren rock in the sea without any trouble." 18. She hops up and pours more tea for everyone before continuing. 19. "I found no undead on Grimshaw, however. 20. I found something far more worrisome, I believe." 21. She looks at each of you as if she's trying to read your thoughts before she asks you this question. 22. "Have you any knowledge of shadow crossings?" 23. Xellos: The needle is aimed southwest, which coincides with the destination Bharash wrote about in his letter.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Sorry about the delay. 2. A crazy day. 3. Our house is listed, though!) 4. Titus , Rethan , Morph , and Laniel arrive at pier 17 after darkness has fallen on Waterdeep. 5. It is hot and muggy still, but a breeze occasionally blows welcome cool air across the Dock Ward from the bay. 6. Trying to look nonchalant, the quartet enjoy a drink outside a tavern as at least one of them keeps on eye on the pier. 7. A large ship is docked there, the silhouette of a sailor sometimes emerging from below deck only to disappear below again a few minutes later. 8. The night wears on and the four men begin to feel weary as well as worry at the early morning work at the orphanage. 9. Thoughts of abandoning the stakeout bubble up into suggestions to head home but the four stay seated, either due to tiredness or stubbornness. 10. Whatever the reason, it is worth it. 11. Sometime after midnight 6 figures approach. 12. Four appear to be a human, half-orc, dwarf, and a halfling. 13. The other two are bugbears, easily identifiable even in the dim light. 14. They arrive at pier 17 and begin hushed, inaudible conversations with someone aboard the ship. 15. They do not appear to have noticed the four watching them from across the street. 16. "That seems like a good plan. 17. We'll hire a bugbear." 18. Laniel chuckles . 19. "Never thought I would say such a thing."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. With a new smokey fang resting in the halfling's pocket and a new name given to the barbarian's horse, CRAP departs even before the sun is fully out. 2. The next few hours worth of galloping are fairly quiet. 3. With the mid-morning sun high above gathering storm clouds, the party finds themselves well on their way west. 4. It is then that the group should chance to come across a wagon pulled to the side of the road. 5. Even at some distance, you can tell that one of the vehicle's axles is broken. 6. A young human boy tends to a campfire while a man in traveler's clothes searches for something in the back of the wagon. 7. As the group approaches, they can hear the boy yell: "Papa... horses are coming. 8. Horses and... a dog? 9. The man comes out of the back of the wagon to see all of you approaching. 10. Not so expertly, he tries to hide a handaxe he got from his vehicle as a safety measure. 11. A horse whinnies from beyond a large bush as the man speaks: "Howdy travelers... 12. Nothing to see here, just an small mishap with the wagon. 13. Nothing I can't take care of, so have a good trip ahead." 14. A few feet away, the boy simply watches quietly from the background, poking his campfire with a long and thin stick. 15. He seems mesmerized by Biscuit .

Aliez (and everyoneelse) who passesa DC10 INT check would be able to figure out: It sounds like Selachai and those that were following her would be part of the cult. 2. It also makes sense that the book 'Liturgy of the Tides' that Oden foundand read passages from to you all (and what some other members of the party have discovered outside the main thread that are similar) are related to the cult. 3. As a reminder the part of the book that Oden read out was: "Anon comes the Slaughter! 4. The Red Feast signals the gorging on the unbelievers! 5. The consumed apostates will fail to sate the Hunger and time itself will be devoured!” "And on that moon when the tides glisten with blood, the Hunger will awaken and woe to the world of the sun. 6. Their sands, mountains, and green lands will all drown in their own blood.” "The blessed feast on the weak and the faithless. 7. The Red Feast comes anon! 8. Rejoice the voracity of the Devourer!” The Champion, you also learned some minor information in this post. 9. There may have been other breadcrumbs too. 10. Aliez, you can have used that roll as an Arcana roll to have figured out what spells were cast (even though you do not have access to them, based on your background you have been around higher level casters a fair bit). 11. I'll provide that info later (busy right now).

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. " Absolutely amazing, with no digging by the goblin herself, she manages to continue on as if nothing happened. 2. LeShanna on the other end will have to try again if she wants to get through !" 3. " Whisper creates a maddening blend of colors that seem to only affect her own teammate Toxic, who drops to the floor as his eyes begin to swirl! 4. We have a challenge here folks! " 5. Khan - Digging for the keys is an action. 6. Suggestion is one of those tricky spells lol it may have to go on the Survivor ban list due to the complications. 7. However based on the line "It pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability". 8. Toxic will pull the lever as soon as he is given the opportunity (Whisper beginning the puzzle). 9. However, it doesn't explicitly state the it makes the creature want the result to happen....so to that effect, I will say that Toxic can advocate for aid in ending the spell, but cannot attempt to end ithis self, or not pull the lever while under the spell. 10. Now, because Toxic is now incapacitated by hypnotic pattern he obviously cannot pull the lever, unless he is knocked out of the trance. 11. However, after consulting some Sage Advice, I do believe that suggestion continues to last on Toxic, due to it's duration of 8 hours, as long as Seth remains concentrated on it.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. With feline agility, Rumble races forward and into the fray. 2. Unfortunately, the Vistani is ready, knocking the spear tip downward. 3. Rolling with the momentum, the tabaxi plants the spear into the ground and delivers two fierce kicks. 4. The first strikes the man in the chest, knocking out his breath, and the second crushing his windpipe. 5. He falls to the ground, hands clasping his throat. 6. Rumble, the dark mists seem to be emboldened; thrilled with the kill. 7. Graeme eyes his companion with an elevated eyebrow and states, "Hate to be overshadowed, fluffy." 8. He swings his hefty greataxe for the last of the Vistani's neck, cutting him deep. 9. With a primal grunt, he digs deep and spins around to deal the final blow. 10. In the knick of time, the bloodied man gets just a hair's breath away from the blade. 11. Attack: 17 Damage: 10 Attack: 6 Damage: 5 The man has the fear of death in his eyes, drops his weapon, mounts up, and disengages. 12. Initiative: Arrigal(Bane) Ben Rumble [Graeme] Vistani 3 (Bane) - Bloodied and retreating on horseback. 13. Allen **** Arrigal looks around, the Vistani encampment devoid of interlopers. 14. Three of his men lay dead around him. 15. He sheathes his curved blade with excessive force and withdraws a wicked and ornate dagger. 16. The garnets on the pommel seem to shine hungrily in the shifting daylight as Arrigal looks the tiefling straight into his deep purple eyes. 17. In one swift movement, as if a venomous snake striking it's prey, Arrigal throws the knife deftly towards his fleeing man. 18. Stricken dead center of the back, the Vistani falls to the ground in the distance; his horse galloping off into ever welcoming mists without its rider. 19. Arrigal motions to the wagon quickly, skulking forward to retrieve his dagger. 20. He quickly returns, looking about and keeping low. 21. He firmly states in a quick whisper, "Make no mistake. 22. You, nor any of your kind, have no hope of killing me. 23. You don't know who or what you're dealing with, and never openly say anything. 24. We need to go; now!" 25. He hops into the wagon, pulling his hood low. 26. Ismark looks to Allen for confirmation. 27. "A-are we taking him?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Syn. 2. You look like Madeline. 3. Or at least the woman who was impersonating her. 4. Wolf looks to Matue "I said nothing of the sort. 5. If you wish to overthrow your Father that's your concern. 6. I can, however, deliver him to you" He then nods at Dox and looks to Bones. " 7. You speak true. 8. So let's dispense with the pretense" He laughs at himself a bit. 9. "I want you to travel to Silvertree and work your way into the Lady's graces. 10. You see she fancies herself a connoisseur of the arts. 11. That's what all this" He waves his hand around "is all about. 12. Finding the best fit " "As I said, I've heard the rumors and I'm sure you have too. 13. That I'm keeping Madeline here as a hostage. 14. I am in fact keeping her safe. 15. If my guess is right, this one here" He gestures to Bones "can fill you in on some details, but the youngest Son has gone missing. 16. He's always been a spiteful shit and I have a feeling he's not missing at all. 17. I think he is, in fact, planning on trying to take control of Silvertree. 18. That would be... bad for me." 19. "Perhaps I'm mistaken but I think starting with the mother is the shortest route to finding the son. 20. The ultimate goal though is finding the son" Wolf nods at Syn as if to say "clever girl" You open the chest and nothing happens. 21. It's very heavy when you try to turn it around as it's filled with gold. 22. I'm not sure if you've seen a chest filled with gold before to judge exactly how much is in there, but your sure it's 10's of thousands.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ok, i'm not sure when Dani will be online, but let's push ahead and she can describe how drunk she gets when she logs in. 2. The vault is buried under a very old mage tower on the edge of Waterdeep city. 3. You have no problem finding it, but it's in a very remote location. 4. There are no people and guards here to either see you, or support you. 5. You enter the tower, head downstairs, and underground is the door to the vault.A 20-foot-high, 20-foot-wide stone corridor ends before an adamantine double door bearing Dwarvish runes. 6. The doors have neither handles nor hinges. 7. The writing on them reads, “THE THREE KEYS. 8. BRING THEM FORTH.” Zeli holds up her scale, Pheral shows the door the picture, and Dani vomits on the floor. 9. The doors open with a pop, and remain open. 10. You all walk into the main area. 11. There are no light sources, so Zeli conjures up a magnificent longsword and makes it glow brilliantly.Three age-worn columns support crumbling stone bridges 60 feet overhead, with the ceiling rising another 20 feet beyond that. 12. Set into alcoves are twelve sets of double doors made of iron. 13. Each door is 10 feet wide, 10 feet high, and embossed with images of dwarf warriors in plate armor. 14. It doesn't take long to realize most of the doors are false, and the ones on the top left of the map lead into the next area.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Reginald, as he is looking around, discovers that one of the white rocks atop the hill acts as a stone plug embedded in the earth. 2. Seruk You and your bat don't notice anything else around. 3. Reginald You toss a rope around the large stone, then, pulling with a great heave, topple it to the side, revealing an opening into the hill underneath you. 4. Nothing comes out to attack you though. 5. As Reginald and Last Tree approach the floating lanterns they both suddenly have the ground fall out from under them... Each of these pits is 5 feet wide, 10 feet deep, and dug out of the earth. 6. Rows of rusty swords are embedded into the floor of each pit, whose tops are covered by rotted wooden planks hidden under a thin layer of earth. 7. Any creature that steps onto a pit falls into it, taking 1d6 bludgeoning damage and impaling itself on 1d4 swords, each of which deals 1d6 piercing damage. 8. Reginald's damage: 6 bludgeoning and he is pierced by 4 swords, each doing 2 piercing damage. 9. Last Tree's damage: 5 bludgeoning and he is pierced by 3 swords, each doing 3 piercing damage.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. 17th day of Ches, 1492 DR We begin our adventure on a chilly spring evening. 2. It’s a busy night at the Yawning Portal. 3. The tavern is full of people, but you’ve managed to secure a table right next to the tavern’s namesake- a forty foot diameter pit that descends into the undermountain. 4. Yagra Stonefist, a seven foot tall half orc woman who hires herself out as muscle, is in the middle of an arm wrestling bout with a well muscled red dragonborn. 5. Threestrings, the resident bard, is making his way through a ballad. 6. He isn’t entirely on key, but a group of patrons rowdily sings along anyway. 7. At another nearby table, a group of loudly dressed men and women play a dice game, shouting with excitement at both good rolls and bad. 8. As you all share a few plates of food and tankards of ale, go ahead and describe what your character looks like and what they are doing.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Oh the horror. 2. Aren't you glad that you used reckless attack? 3. lol) Erro pants as he pulls Ellis from the zombie with all of his might and drags him across the jungle floor onto the road. 4. "Ellis, can you stand? 5. Good. 6. You can't see? 7. Merciful gods! 8. Poor Rawk is being torn to shreds, I must go help her! 9. Ellis, stay here and attempt to aid us with your magic as best as you can; back up towards the cliff. 10. If we can lead them to the cliffside perhaps we can shove them from the edge, or perhaps we can climb down out of their reach. 11. Fasten a rope for us to hang from if you have time!" 12. Erro goes breathless trying to spurt all of this information all at once, he then turns back towards the zombies and Rawk. 13. He waves his hand in the air, "This way! 14. Rawk! 15. Use the cliffs!" 16. (in game terms, Erro recommends disengaging... if a Barbarian can do such a thing!) 17. Erro will back up 10ft away from the cliff and ready an action to attack and shield bash (feat) the first zombie that comes within range. 18. He will be loud and attempt to draw the zombie's ire as he screens for Ellis and, perhaps, Rawk.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Kargan and Breccha stand back to back, unbridled rage and Dwarven endurance and determination a deadly combination. 2. Both warriors carve chunks of rotting flesh from walking corpses. 3. Kryinor leaps upon his undead opponent again this time bringing it to the ground and after a viscous shake it lies still. 4. A high pitched cry signals Eedim's appearance on the field of battle he swings his axe in defense of his shaggy friend. 5. Eedim Attack Zombie Z11:Attack: 6 Damage: 3 Titus meanwhile moves around the skirmish in the courtyard looking for a good vantage to make a pin cushion of this master of the dead. 6. Zaxx seems lost for words at the Barbarians intrusion on negotiations... 7. The Red robbed figure raises his hands again and shouts over the din of battle, "What are you ruffians or bandits? 8. Why do you disturb my research, there's nothing your kind would find valuable here!" 9. His walking dead servants continue their attack... Z12 Attacks Kryinor:Attack: 6 Damage: 5 Z3 Attacks Kryinor: 14 Damage: 9 Z10 Attacks Eedim: 15 Damage: 5 Z11 Attacks Eedim: 9 Damage: 7 Z4 Attacks Breccha: 6 Damage: 9 Z5 Attacks Breccha: 18 Damage: 8 Z6 Attacks Breccha: 7 Damage: 8 Z7 Attacks Kargan: 23 Damage: 10 Z8 Attacks Kargan: 21 Damage: 7 Z9 Attacks Kargan: 23 Damage: 7 Kargan and Breccha , Kryinor and Eedim , hack, stab, bite, rend, and tear into the ever increasing numbers of dead clawing at them. 10. More Zombies fall to the ground. 11. Titus from his concealed position sends a long shaft and a sincere pleaat the red robbed Necromancer on the tower. 12. The arrow sinks into his shoulder and the Ranger is rewarded with a cry of pain and the bloom of darker red upon the wizards breast. 13. The wizard falls to his knees... Zaxxs' voice rings out echoing off the crumbling stones of the wall and tower. 14. The Red Wizard raises a shaking hand, and the Dead still. 15. His angry pain filled voice booms, "Parlay!"

You are just to the other side and are ready to let go.... 4. Suddenly your feet slip and you go slipping down to the edge of the rope. 5. Your hands are cut and bruised. 6. You clung on to dear life as your hands grab the knot. 7. The rope is 10ft long. 8. You have to go up. 9. You climb 1ft with each dice roll. 10. Roll 17 d6s. 11. With each roll more than 3 you climb up 1ft. 12. With each less than 4 you slip down 0.5 ft. After 17 rolls roll with disadvantage (format roll1, roll2) in sets of 5. 13. This will continue till you cover your 10ft or slip down into the abyss and who knows what awaits you there. 14. The whole result will considered. 15. For example, if you climb till 10ft but the last roll moves you down 0.5 ft then you will move to 0.5 ft.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The choice was a courtesy. 2. There really is no choice," Sanchez sighs loudly. 3. "Guards," he then calls as three more armoured men appear bringing the numbers to six. 4. "Put that one in the cells," he points to Pat Sanchez's patience worn thin as the other paladins put Pat into a cell and lock it. 5. The other prisoners have perked up watching the exchange between Sanchez and Hrain. 6. "Your pride, like all Sunites, is your greatest enemy," the older man adds with a deep frown. 7. "I have no power to let you keep your armor or shield. 8. You will yield them or face further dishonored after we've taken them from you," he adds with hus hand in his greatsword hilt waving off the others to stand back even as they ready their blades and mauls. 9. "It's down to me," he says grimacing. 10. "Yield or die," he adds next seemingly taking no pleasure in the standoff. 11. >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> "Why this sir," Mace replies to Nick patting the mace on his belt. 12. "It's been in my family for generations," he adds stroking the grisly instrument of death. 13. "What sort of conjuring do each of you do? 14. Marion's a wizard," he then whispers loudly. 15. "The former tutor of our Ultus until...well I'm sure you can fill in the blanks," the old dwarf adds as Marion sits on a stool in her cell. 16. Come to think of it Maroin's doesn't look practically drower like yours. 17. Furniture like a bed, two chairs and a small dining table, and even tge stool she sits on. 18. There are also countless books. 19. "Hush Mace! 20. You say too much," the elven woman scolds him as the dwarf chuckles. 21. "Get back," Sanchez exclaims as the other paladins begin to move forward. 22. "Praying won't help you now but if you must die so be it," he adds. 23. "I curse you," he adds casting action: bane DC CHAR save DC17. 24. Initiative 8 At the beginning of the cells however a young female cleric takes off up the stairs disappearing from sight.

The dark stone of its construction is uneven and rough from the advances of time. 6. What once was an intricate rug stretching across the floor now lies in faded tatters. 7. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. 6 Thasa - Scanning the crowd you don’t catch any glimpses of people having any allegiance to the Ash King. 2. You hear whispers in you had like tuning a radio. 3. People feeling emboldened to go join the resistance at Mulptar, some want to flee to N’jast or Kront. 4. Others want to make a break for it and flee far away to the south seeing the kobolds are gone. 5. Some plan to stick to their basements and cellars if anything happens. 6. Korsh - looking around you do see the priest from the Mill amongst the crowd. 7. He is helping route traffic and sort through the items on the cart, bringing peoples possessions back to them. 8. Misery - the crowd seems to take the words to heart and begin to focus at the task at hand, whatever that may be for each individual. 9. The questioning and arguments subside. 10. A voice speaks in the back of your head “ Well that was a close one! 11. You are going to be a fun one to watch. 12. If you got taken out by some kobolds, care to take a wager what the big bad dragon might do to you? 13. As the voice begins to chuckle a bit. 14. Gathering your things to travel, you look back to see the townspeople begin combing over the body of the Giant. 15. Seemingly now taking their turn looting and picking what they can, now that you have let it be. 16. you begin to travel the road northward. 17. By the setting of the sun you see the edge of the forest that was mentioned to you. 18. It’s at this moment you begin to think about making camp. 19. A thunderous rose rolls across the plains from unknown distance, the ground begins to quake. 20. The tremors fierce and relentless for what seems like minutes on end. 21. The ground slowly stops rioting under your feet. 22. All is still and quiet it seems. 23. Perception check DC 20: You notice the peak of the mountain range to the east. 24. Though miles and miles away, is significantly taller than prior to the quakes. 25. It’s just turned night time you’re on the edge of the forest. 26. The path you have taken is the division line of plains and trees. 27. What would you like to do? 28. (Sorry to kind of jump ahead, but want to get the game rolling again)

You can all see what patrice saw before. 5. you are on the upper level of the library, stairs lead down to the lower section. 6. What do you wish to do. 7. The only other door is the one at the lower level. 8. The door on the east side of this room has been smashed down, but any light from the courtyard isn’t enough to illuminate the room. 9. Characters with darkvision or a light source see the following: What used to be some sort of laboratory lies in ruins, its furnishings broken and heaped against the walls. 10. In the middle of the room, painted on the floor with mud, is a ten-foot-wide symbol depicting three lightning bolts joined at their tips. 11. Any character who succeeds on a DC 15 Intelligence (Religion) check recognizes the symbol as that of Talos, the evil god of storms. 12. A cleric with the Tempest domain succeeds on the check automatically. 13. Where the lightning bolts converge, a half-orc wearing hide armor performs an eerie dance while consuming the entrails of a dead possum. 14. Standing around the half-orc are several small twig figures.

Andor, Carrow, Ladrian, and Rixton (with his reptilian sidekick) methodically make their way through the remaining structures in Nightstone. 3. After a span of 70 or 80 minutes, the only part of the the village that hasn't been investigated is the keep. 4. A summary of what was discovered in the other buildings: After posting himself atop the guard tower for twenty-minutes or so, Vigan sees the first sign of movement. 5. Two human males, wielding spears and wearing garb typically associated with that of a guard, are making their way northward through the village. 6. Based on their direction of travel and the fact that the party of adventurers has searched every part of the village, Vigan can only assume these two men have come from the keep. 7. They walk, with spears at the ready, toward the pile of dead goblins and worgs. 8. When they are approximately 40' from the southern edge of the square, one of them calls out, " Ho, there! 9. We are guards of Nightstone! 10. Hello! 11. We are in need of aid!" 12. Andor, Carrow, Ladrian, and Rixton hear the unfamiliar voice from where they are gathered in the inn.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The horse clearly appears to be domesticated, since it hasa saddle, saddle bags and reins. 2. Other than the many puncture wounds from the stirges, there are no other wounds on the carcass. 3. Inside the horse's saddle bags, you find what would amount to a common selection of rations and basic equipment for travel. 4. Looking around in the grass near the horse, you find its rider. 5. About 30 feet away, you see a fallen humanoid lying face down in the grass. 6. It also appears to have sustained a number ofpuncture wounds as well. 7. Lumen and Chrys, I need Intelligence checks from both of you. 8. You examine the fallen horse rider and see that he's a well-toned human man of average build, probably Chondathan, with a broad nose and a full, but stubby patch of brown hair on top of his head. 9. His garb is plain, with a well worn cloak purple with jade colored trim. 10. His medium length, full beard is forked and braided. 11. He wears a daggeron his belt and a light crossbow is slung around his shoulder, along with a quiver of 12 bolts. 12. In a pouch at his waist, you find a purse containing 20 sp. 13. Aside from his personal effects, and the explorer's kit on his horse, he doesn't appear to be carrying anything else. 14. Chrys You find it odd to see stirges flying around in broad daylight. 15. (It's still a couple hours from sunset.) 16. In your experience with underground halls and caverns, you usually know stirges to be creatures who inhabit dark places.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Effort, I hope you don't mind me rolling for you in this instance. 2. With Kurama's 25 I didn't think there was a lot of tension left about perceiving anything, haha. 3. Investigation: 20 Brask trails the group heading down the stairs and as they enter the large chamber, he pauses. 4. Listening and watching up the stairwell, the only thing he sees is a bit of light dancing off the walls from his torch. 5. Kurama pauses a moment, moving his gaze thoughtfully and letting the contents of the room enter his consciousness. 6. Not much sticks out - there are obvious bits of stone, wood, and a few old weapons being stored here. 7. Nothing looks particularly exciting - a few rapiers, a lance, what look to be arrow heads. 8. Something does catch his attention across the room though. 9. The doorway looks unremarkable enough, with more stairs heading down further into the mountain. 10. On the wall a few feet to the right, however, Kurama picks up on a tiny bit of stone dust built up on the floor. 11. As he casts some light over it, he sees something etched into therock just above the floor. 12. Destiny leads us down dark roads but sometimes they are necessary to see the light Effort joins him in observing the etching as Burik and Pip dig through the storage area. 13. As she stands, she gets a strange sense about her. 14. Roll an arcana check. 15. Cadmael drops off of Effort's shoulder and flits downward. 16. You watch as he and his shadow fly through the stairwell, eventually exiting your torchlight. 17. It certainly is dark down-Hey!...I found the bottom, he thinks. 18. Only another sixty or seventy feet.Just past where your light is currently shining. 19. Through his eyes, Effort, you can barely make out the opening of the stairwell into another room. 20. Cadmael peeks in, noting that it seems to branch off in two directions. 21. No movement or light, though. 22. He turns, flying back up the stairs and returning to your shoulder. 23. You make your way downward, waiting to reach the bottom. 24. You travel sixty or seventy feet, but the bottom never arrives. 25. The stairs continue, another sixty feet. 26. Another sixty feet. 27. This...isn't right, Cadmael thinks. 28. There was another room. 29. There isn't any way it was this far. 30. The light from Burik's weapon illuminates his face and his furrowed brow is clear for all to see. 31. "I don't like this one bit."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ruttman starts crying and begging. 2. He swears to go straight after this. 3. Kate says, "Come on, Tomoe! 4. You know as well as I do that this guy's lying. 5. Didn't you see how easily he ratted out his fellow gang members?" 6. Lucia says, "As part of the Ultemor Guard, the law requires me to tell you guys that we should turn him over to the guard." 7. She then scratches her head and says, "Buuut... my memory has been spotty recently and I think I forgot to tell you this." 8. She winks at you at the end of her sentence. 9. "Though if you're done with him, I'd like to ask him some questions myself." 10. Lucia leans in on Ruttman and says, "Look, I can protect you from my allies. 11. Just tell me what I need to know and I'll convince my allies to spare you. 12. How's that sound? 13. Now tell me, do you know Capo?" 14. "Capo?" 15. Ruttman looks confused, "What's that?" 16. " Alright then. 17. What about Equazer?" 18. "Is that a balancing tool of some kind?" 19. Lucia stands up and shakes her head. " 20. Looks like this guy doesn't know anything I need. 21. Ah well." 22. She turns back to Ruttman. 23. "A promise is a promise." 24. Lucia looks at the two of you and says, alright no one kill this man. 25. I made a deal with him and I intend to keep it. 26. Ruttman looks relieved and Kate looks dismayed. 27. But before either Kate or Tomoe can say anything, Lucia raises her leg above her head and breaks Ruttman's neck with her heel. 28. "I didn't say anything about killing him myself."
