Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. 11 Burgeee @ Hobb:Attack: 4 Damage: 3 Attack: 6 Damage: 1 Lark @ hobb:Attack: 14 Damage: 8 Burgee only hears the words in his own head as he's still within the silence bubble. 2. As soon as the door opens, Rose charges in, attempting to attack but in her excitement, she slips on a loose stone, and the attack is lost. 3. Paavu following up, his spear sinking into the side of the closer hobb But its pained flinch moved it out of the way of the followup. 4. Burgee, seeing that he was still within the silenced bubble,charges forward, trying to brain the hobb now....but he nearly trips on the stumbling Rose, and his attack is lost even worse as the weapon strikes the ground.. suddenly realizing he could hear again. 5. Lark, sighs, watching this perfectly good ambush going to waste before his eyes. 6. A tragedy if he ever saw one... With his crossbow, he fires at the hobb everyone had beentrying to take out but Rose and Burgee stumbling near each-other, lark had to shift his shot too much, and it clattered against the wall above it's head, harmlessly. 7. Lark moves out of the silence bubble himself, and gives Paavu bardic inspiration. 8. Surprise round over. 9. Party is up. 10. As quickly as it began, the scream was drown out. 11. A bubble of silence filling the area. 12. Burgee and Lark catching the hint and rushing in, though only lark can make it past due to the right space... And Lark makes an attack Attack: 13 Damage: 4 Just barely missing. 13. So he moves farther in as the goblin considers running. 14. Burgee coming up behind with his staff... as Paavu moves to let the little bird through. 15. Attack: 4 Damage: 3 However, he fails too... 16. The goblin, seeing it's chance only to realize it's effectively trapped... with nowhere to run... and it can't hear... it screams in silence as it drops a bag of caltrops by throwing it in the air, causing them to land randomly in a 10 foot radius. 17. Any movement by anyone within the hall requires a DC 8 Dex save, or take 1 damage, have your speed reduced by 10 feet until you heal atleast 1 HP.

The bar begins to look around a bit more, folks murmuring and there being two dead bodies on the floor. 5. Nikoli looks at the lot of you, his lips pursed together. 6. "Get downstairs, now, and quick. 7. Bring the bodies." 8. He then looks over at Yorvalor. 9. "Play something, fast...." It's clear he worried about the destruction around. 10. Not that it's uncommon in the city, but, he doesn't want any unwanted attention. 11. Especially as a few patrons take the moment to run out the door. 12. The last thing anyone needs is some guards showing up and asking questions. 13. The Guard, who seems to probably be the now-leader-of the group speaks up as folks move downstairs. 14. "Listen, I don't want no trouble. 15. Just here for a job. 16. Didn't know this place had protection already..." he says as he keeps his hands up looking between the group. 17. A little bit of swelling across his cheek and brow from the blow from Elric. 18. "What can we do to make this little problem go away and we all leave happy. 19. Gotta be something, right? 20. Some coin? 21. A favor? 22. Somethin'."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Last Situation.... 2 ) The group turns and begins to move. 2. Carrying the box they slip out of the first area. 3. Heading back the way they came, the large building still remains quiet. 4. The guards dead up on the roof. 5. They begin to head out, cutting through the back passageways until they get within line of sight of where they entered the fort. 6. They stop short, a lone figure and two of those six legged moving turrets glancing at where they came from... 8 (Does he roll a 20?) 7. The figure hasn't noticed the crew.. yet. 8. One thing is for certain, he isn't wearing Kevinter clothing. 9. The elven man is armed, the hilt of a pistol on one hip, simple leather armor and helm across his lithe frame, and currently investigating the cut in the perimeter.He's blocking your escape, and seems to be on the lookout. 10. You do have the element of surprise (advantage on initiative checks) if you decide to open fire from here. 11. But... it could signal an issue to people at the fort who are a few minutes away... besides any possible cannon attacks.. And you know you still have to make it through the woods and away from here. 12. What do you do? 13. ( If deciding to start combat, roll initiative with advantage & actions.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Vondal does a complicated maneuver, but the nimble blight he aims for is able to dodge the first attack, and the second doesn't quite take out the creature. 2. Karl swings his hammer beside the monk, smashing sideways into his own blight, and the follow-through finishes off Vondal's. 3. On the other side of the building, Adrom swiftly takes out his blight. 4. Nif? 5. As Vondal is finishing the final twig blight, Daran sighs in disappointment. 6. "I didn't find anything, so let's move on to the next building. 7. Thanks for having my back." 8. The party exits the building and walks north. 9. When they get to the fork in the road, Daran suggest, "There are less buildings to the left. 10. Should we start that way?" 11. Map Daran turns left and walks further along the path. 12. "The old codger said there are more blights up here. 13. Hopefully more twig blights, as you seem to be able to pick them off easily enough." 14. As they walk, the party can see the next buildings areruined, side-by-side cottages that look as though they might have been the homes of prosperous shopkeepers or well-off farmers in their time. 15. All that remains are collapsed walls and piles of debris. 16. Several young trees have grown up in the midst of the ruins. 17. "These look promising," Daran comments with a smile. 18. "Mirna's family might have lived in one of these. 19. Anyone want to scout ahead?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The woman, standing about 5'2", thin build, black hair curled up in a bun with the bun and rest of the hair hidden under a straw hat adorned with flowers. 2. She is wearing a gray/blue jacket with gold buttons. 3. Under the jacket, she is wearing a white and pink dress. 4. She is also wearing black boots with white boot covers, She pulls a pocket watch from her pocket and seems to turn about 240 degrees, and ends up facing the party. 5. She promptly puts the watch away, picks up a large bag, and puts an umbrella under her right arm, and marches right up to the party. 6. She stops, standing about 6 feet from the party, her stern gaze falling on each member of the party. 7. There are no introductions, no pleasantries. 8. Just a firm, demanding question. 9. "Where did he go?" 10. she asks. 11. "My watch tells me he was just here and he hangs around with the likes of you so, I ask again where did my Val go?" 12. (Assuming the rest of the group is heading to the Dancing Lady) Rictor, Flynn, and Bill leave their companions behind, and to their own fate, they head for the Dancing Lady. 13. Each of you does notice Keth is not with you but, he has a tendency to make his own way around, and folks look suspicious of a halfbreed in most civilized areas of the country. 14. The three of you travel toward the lady when you notice 2 things. 15. 1) you see a man dressed in a short black cossack robe with a white-collar standing on the side of the roadway. 16. He is calling out to those who pass by, talking about God and the church message. 17. 2): You see riding into town 6 men dressed as Cavalry Soldiers. 18. Val: Val quickly retreats into the door of the Doctor's Office only to find it empty. 19. There are no books, no equipment, nothing that would say this is a doctor's office. 20. The room is 20 ft by 15 ft. with an open doorway along the northeast corner of the wall. 21. Walking through the open doorway, Val finds a room empty save for an open mattress on a wooden pallet.

You find a millipede and a small toad but neither of them have traveled out of the immediate area or know know anything useful. 6. The toad is bummed the millipede isn't good food, but did find a worm earlier. 7. (more coming shortly) DM Stuff 3 As you travel through the rest of thepass it seems that the storm has driven most of the wildlife into hiding. 8. You can see clear evidence of the storm as you travel. 9. There's downed trees and some large boulders sunk into new mud. 10. You make it through the day of travel without incident. 11. Just as night is falling you hear the sound of water and find a spring at the end of the pass. 12. It's a very idyllic looking spot. 13. A crystal clear flow of water trickles down moss covered rocks to collect in a small pool. 14. The pool itself looks shallow and is about 6' around, nestled in between a few boulders. 15. There is a cluster of purple irises growing in one of the spaces between boulders on the right. 16. To the left is a brier of black-caps.

The cave narrows to a steep fissure at the far end, and is filled with the stench of animals. 5. Savage snarls and the sounds of rattling chains greet your ears where three wolves are chained up just inside the opening. 6. Each wolf's chain leads to an iron rod driven into the base of a stalagmite. 7. The wolves can't reach you where you are (standing on the steps), but they seem ready to attack if you take a step closer. 8. Sylric also notices that the main passage from the cave mouth climbs steeply upward, the stream plunging and splashing down its west side. 9. In the shadows, a side passage leads west across the other side of the stream. 10. As Avier brings out his hand axes, the wolves stiffen their legs, ears held high. 11. Their eyes are wide, watching the axes in Avier's hands, with their tails straight up. 12. One of the wolves positions itself between the other two and the party.

Note: Randrak you have a Tag above from Uldran While Torvin is secreted away with the Rune Shaper, Randrak and Uldran speak quietly apart from prying ears. 9. You,Freak wander down toward the galley where you find Torg hard at work mopping the deck. 10. At your offer of help Torg responds with a beaming grin and slaps you in the back with a enough force to send a lesser dwarf sprawling. 11. "Good lad, good lad. 12. Tell me how are you rats?" 13. he produces a cudgel from his belt and presses it into your hand. 14. "The damned crew quarters are lousy with them and aspry dwarf such as yourself could have a fine time drubbing the life out of the little blighters!" 15. He points to a bucket by the door, "Take that there bucket and fill her up with the hairy buggers. 16. I'll slip you a silver or two for yer trouble." 17. he gives you a wink and urges you off toward the door.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The night again passes without incident. 2. Cadmael, while watching the camp from above, runs into a few bats over the course of the evening, and Kurama sees a set of what seem to be fox eyes glowing at the edge of the clearing. 3. Brask begins to doze again but a swift *bonk* on the top of the head from Cadmael keep him awake for the rest of his shift. 4. Everyone wakes in the morning, rising to a sunny but again brisk day. 5. Small tendrils of breath can be seen as you pack up camp and get moving toward the mountains. 6. By mid-day the hills are getting steeper and steeper, and moving across the peaks and valleys becomes quite tiring. 7. The sun at your back feels wonderful, though, and helps to keep you moving. 8. Eventually the trees become thinner and thinner. 9. The vegetation as a whole is shorter and less dense, as rocky terrain begins to replace the sandy soils of the past few days. 10. Let me know again what you'd like to do while traveling. 11. I've been on vacation all week (sorry!) 12. and will probably be scarce while traveling home the next two days, but by then we should be at the mountains and can get this next chapter moving full steam ahead!

[No Attack of Opportunity is available because Midian has already used his Reaction, but it is now his turn and the woman is 30' away, running.] 4. Drawing a second dagger, the uninjured Midian shakes off the last lingering effects of the spell and quickly catches up with the staggering woman preparing to put an end to this battle before she can use her magic on him again. 5. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The group throws down a rope and collectively begin to lift up Driver as he walks up the slope while holding on. 2. Silas dispenses his healing, everyone takes a moment to catch their breath. 3. One by one the townspeople begin to come out of their homes, hesitantly walking closer to you. 4. The soot covered workers, the Halfling running the tavern, other humans and half orcs dresses in plain clothes. 5. One of the workers is visibly choked up, knowing his friends are either trapped in the mine or dead. 6. “I don’t know where you lot came from, but ..... you saved us, you’re heroes! 7. Thank you, thank you. 8. I’m sure this town would’ve been destroyed if it wasn’t for you. 9. ” One by one each townsperson comes up and relays similar sentiments. 10. Some crying, some stoic. 11. Others begin to rush over to the mine and begin trying to haul debris out and clear a path while shouting for the ones down below. 12. The group continues making a bit of small talk with the towns people as the ones the begin working to clear the mine pause momentarily to watch Driver hauling things out twice as fast as everyone else without seeming to slow down. 13. Everyone except Driver (because he is busy) three humanoids come up quickly at quick pace on horse back. 14. Though they all have different styles of armor, they all have matching components. 15. Clearly working for a certain order. 16. Hopping down, the first one a half Orc in heavy plate armor and a war-hammer on his side, shield on his back. 17. Gold wing like emblems etched on his helmet and gauntlets. 18. “ We saw the black smoke and heard the rumbling from the distance. 19. We made haste to lend aid. 20. Is everyone okay? 21. ” He speaks eloquently but very straight forward . 22. You get the sense he holds some station of power. 23. The townspeople begin to retell the story while pointing all of you out.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rhudall's axe clangs rather harmlessly off Jokun's clear coating. 2. In response, Jokun breathes a cloud of glittering crystal, enveloping the frothing Rhudall and Kathra's prone form, as well as Mirabel and Thont. 3. The glitter-mist coalesces around each of you, beginning to form a hardening crystal shell. 4. Prism Breath Attack: DC 14 Strength saving throw or become restrained by crystal formations for 5 minutes. 5. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. 6. ((Yeah, the only person it was going to miss originally was Gavin, but you moved just in time. 7. Anyway, it's Thont's turn and he needs to maybe do some stuff that doesn't require moving and then make a DC14 Strength Save.)) 8. ((Sure, you can use your action to assist a crystallized individual. 9. It will give them advantage on their next save.))

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Calelle and Drakus - The Halfling girl drops the bag at Calelle’s feet. 2. Going through it you find some leather straps and scraps, 2 rough clearly unfinished daggers - you assume recent projects and supplies of Torvald, 15 copper pieces, and some dried biscuits, jerky rations, and fruit - enough for her for maybe 2-3 days if she stretches it out. 3. “ Please don’t hurt me, I just need so little, I’m not worth it, please.” —————————————————————————————— Marley and Andris - The dark elves greet you with a firm but pleasant demeanor. 4. “ Greetings, we are the Tolvin emissaries sent to join in the research of the portal as agreed upon by the Drovian Royal Family and the Tolvin Council. 5. We have a parchment signed by both governing bodies for your commander to grant us housing and supplies .” The dark elf removes and rolled scroll with a wax seal, but doesn’t offer it to you before she puts it away. 6. “ Is this stretch of the journey needing patrol? 7. Should we require an escort? 8. ” At this time of day you know that it would be about time for you to start heading back to camp for shift change, being this far out. 9. Marley you are able to see two more Dore in the following wagon, their gear is under a thick blanket probably meant to keep it out of the elements during travel, but aren’t able to make out any details. 10. ————————————————————————————— Ewan and Flux - The four wolves stand down as the Red Wolf approaches slowly. 11. Circling around both Ewan and Flux. 12. “ We don’t know what portal is, just den of man close to here, they only take from us. 13. None ever bother to speak though.” Of course Flex doesn’t understand any of this.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Vah'Lhorn and Yuri leave Kim and hungry Gramgran in search of the druid. 2. As you two approach the fork, you will be able to see building 4.This small house appears to be in better condition than theruined and dilapidated structures you have encountered so far. 3. The doors arereinforced with heavy iron bands, and thick shutters protectthe windows. 4. I assume that would pique the interest of Vah'Lhorn and Yuri, but they pass up the house for the moment. 5. Building 6 isnear the middle of the village. 6. To the north is a narrowlane winds up the steep hillside to the north. 7. Directly to thesouth is a ruined building (6) that might have been a store orworkshop. 8. Webs stretch across the lane, from the building tothe trees on the north side of the road. 9. A lot of webs, clearly untouched for some time. 10. You both continue on to building 9. 11. Another dilapidated structure.This ruined shop is cluttered with sagging storage shelves andbroken furniture. 12. Shards of glass and pieces of pottery glint inthe weeds and rubble next to rotted books and casks. 13. A quick look finds nothing that appears to be a druid. 14. Building 8 is still mostly intact. 15. A wide chimney and rotted piles of firewood jumbled outsidethe walls of this sagging building suggest that it was a smithyin its day. 16. The windows are dirty but you two move in, wipe some dust away and can see two bodies on the floor. 17. They appear dead and unmoving.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Wulcrath can tell, using the well-drawn artistic interpretation, this is the man depicted in the wanted poster. 2. According to the short description at the behest of the Major of the human town of Salthill , Mayor Valyss von Dis with the upmost discretion. 3. While an exact figure isn't given, a large amount of gold is implied if all requirements are met. 4. Looking around, Aazel notices this room to be storage of all sorts; unlabelled barrels, boxes, sacks of leather and hemp. 5. There's a puddle underneath one barrel... Khazan is quick to deal with the cuffs of everyone. 6. The bindings are made of rags, but the cheap material has chaffed a lot of the prisoners wrists and cheeks. 7. Bart , can you please edit in a Medicinecheck:- With no evidence of severe bruising on the head, you can only surmise the same experience you had before ending up in the place is what the poor civilians are going through; a magical, dreamless slumber. 8. Khazan's splatters on six of them . 9. They stir, eventually wake rubbing their wrists and flexing their jaws. 10. However, they see strangers looming while realising their not where they once were. 11. Two of the screamare stunned with fear, three of them look to half-orc and run away from him back to the wall and one screams in shock, causing three more to awaken. 12. He then turns to the dwarf with his raised fists, "Monsters! 13. You're not taking us without a fight!" 14. This rallys the other three who ran to defend themselves also...

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Arvel finishes off the fleeing nothic, helping to ensure his secrets are a bit safer for the moment. 2. Ethan and his cannon each successfully blast the behir once, drawing out a high pitched scream from the creature as it rears its head back in pain and fury. 3. Tarja joins in on the melee, her bear form appearing next to Elra and biting at the scaly hide of the monstrosity and drawing blood while at the same time her flaming sphere scorches the behir on its other flank. 4. Elra heals Zeke to ensure the group's primary protector can survive the tangle with this powerful creature. 5. Still clinging to the west side of the chasm, the behir seems intent on catching its prey in Zeke but first takes out its fury on the ranged attacks coming from afar with its own, which makes Ethan the target. 6. It twists its long next around, bears its long, sharp teeth and then opens its maw to unleash its lightning breath at the artificer. 7. The cavern lights up with bright blue and white light for just an instant, the cave walls dancing with the jagged lines given off by the energy blast. 8. As the flash of light dissipates the party can then see if Ethan is still standing... DC16 DEX vs.54 damage(half on save) Meanwhile, Arvel catches a glimpse as the bugbear and redbrand look at each other in fear andturn and run down the same dark corridor that the Glasstaff had run. 9. Fae is up to end the round and anyone can post for round 8.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. For Mirabel: The Seree stone amulets seem decently made and about as safe as one could expect for effectively being a chunk of magical uranium radiating untested magical energies. 2. On the plus side, you've had a similar stone in your pocket for the better part of a day now and don't appear to be suffering any ill effects and those dwarves that wore similar charms back in Rockmount hadn't seemed to be mutating in any noticeable way. 3. You'd give these items about an 8/10 by wizarding safety standards. 4. For Peren and Gavin (and anyone else who is paying attention): Gavin's divine ministrations appear to greatly ease Peren's splotchy rash. 5. You're pretty sure with a good rest in a clean non-flea infested environment, Peren should make a full recovery. 6. ((Kathra, I need a Wisdom saving throw from you and then we will move to initiative.)) 7. ((EDIT: Oh, and I need Perception checks from Gavin and Peren.))

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Let's find out. 2. Fumble roll: 16 ... You called it: "Ooops! 3. You hit an unintended random target." 4. Now, since we're doing this theater of the mind, I need to decide who is within 10 feet. 5. Obviously not Glynquinal or Ian. 6. Let's let the dice decide ... Who was Ian aiming for: 2 — wolf4 Who is within 10 feet: Gruxx: 1 , Rock: 2 , HDP: 2 , other wolf: 2 — Gruxx only — does he hit Gruxx? 7. 24 , 10 As HDP uses his weapon to deflect the wolves and run for the tree. 8. (If he is climbing up, roll an athletics check, please.) 9. Ian steadies himself on the tree branch before attempting to fire again, but as he is pulling the trigger on his crossbow, a bird swoops down and angrily chirps in his face, causing him to jump and utter a sound of surprise. 10. The bolt, intended for wolf4, instead lands in the back of Gruxx's calf. 11. Gruxx, your response? 12. You're up! 13. Even inspired, the bolt sticking out of the back of his leg causes Gruxx's aim to be a hair off, and the barbarian misses his intended target. 14. Round 4: Rock (29/29), Glyn (7/21), wolves (2 left), Ian (10/21), HDP (4/24), Gruxx (12/32) Rock attacks ( 1 ) wolf1, swinging his battleaxe at the creature. 15. The blade cuts a mortal wound, and the canine falls to the ground dead. 16. Glyn, you're up! 17. HDP, please roll a survival check to find out whether sleeping in a tree is doable.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Andmarir, Neya, Rag, and Graxx put their ropes together and count up to just shy of 200 feet worth. 2. Neya leads the group in planning things out and the group agrees it to be a solid set of guidelines. 3. Graxx chimes in with general logistical points on how he expects the hemp of the rope and the smooth old rocks forming the obelisks to interact, but his fellow planners are not too convinced of the usefulness of that information. 4. Tired of talking, Rag grabs the ropes and starts tying them together according to the agreed upon layout. 5. A few minutes later, everyone is back at the cell-room and ready to pull on the single strand of rope coming through the eastern wall. 6. Drazzim finishes bringing Villonah to safety along with Rillo. 7. Before he can put her down and join the rest of the party in demolition services, someone comes through the main entrance to the secret prison.An elf stands before the door into the tunnel, having come into the room quietly. 8. She has an arrow nocked and trained on Drazzim, but the threat is made to the entire group. 9. “Put the gnome down and leave. 10. You will not take her anywhere and torture her more. 11. There may be more of you, but some of you will not survive the fight if you try to take her. 12. That I promise.” The elf lady listens to Neya's and Graxx's words carefully. 13. Her eyes change focus between the speakers, Rillo, and Drazzim, who is still carrying the girl. 14. The bow aims towards the ground now: "Very well. 15. And does the father have enough coin to hire such a large contingent? 16. Your poise does not betray your words, so I am likely to believe them, but something is still not right." 17. She ponders on something for a few extra seconds and says: "I have cared forVillonah for years now, without her fathers' knowing. 18. Will you hand over the girl?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Everyone posts up at their position, and lets say Thistle stands at the corner, and can see both Zashier and Yashiera. 2. Thistle counts down with her fingers "3....2....1...." and nods her head. 3. Strength: 13 . 4. 20 Brother and sister, the powerful duo, easily kick/ram the doors in. 5. The wood splinters, and the doors fall off their hinges. 6. Standing at the entry, Zashier, you look in and see two rows of scorched, wrought-iron bedframes that take up most of the space in this soaring chamber (25 foot high ceiling), resting between a fire-blackened altar to the southwest and double doors to the northeast (where you see Yashiera standing, Thistle at her side). 7. A second set of double doors leads to the northwest (Where Zashier, Lem and Yokini are), and a single iron door exits the chamber to the southeast. 8. Brightly colored holy figures stare down from the stained-glass windows built into the blackened stone walls, their visages noticeably less damaged than the rest of the room. 9. Lem, knowing your history the way you do, you know that back when the church was first built, this large chamber would have been the sanctuary. 10. After the church was destroyed by raiding orcs, the sanctuary was converted into an infirmary for the plague victims. 11. You all see the burned out room, the beds scorched, all that remains are the bedframes, no mattresses. 12. Its haunting you, a bit, this room. 13. Looking around at the blackened walls and floor, knowing that everything in this room, the patients and the healers, all. 14. met their end during this fiery destruction. 15. You are all standing at the doorways, but have not made your way into the room. 16. (Updated map on Discord)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As you leave the room, you feel the change immediately... 2. The temperature begins to rapidly fall, and in seconds your breath comes out in streams of white. 3. Frost begins to coat the walls, and your metals weapons become ice cold. 4. From behind, the maniacal laughter starts again. 5. Turning you see the skull back on the nightstand, and the hairs on your arms and neck (or scales) rise up as an evilforeboding lays heavily on your spirit. 6. A light catches your eye as the orb, clearly a skull, emerges from room 9 (2 doors down). 7. The skull is encased in an oversize lantern, and as a spectral arm emerges holding the lantern by a long chain the skulls features morph and become that of Olena. 8. I look of mad glee in her eyes as she turns toward you. 9. Ice now begins to coat the walls, and frost even clings to your clothes. 10. Any metal now burns cold to the touch. 11. As the spectral figure emerges fully though the door it lifts the lantern up toward its face, you see the shadowed face looks similar to that of the bartender. 12. The twisted, hideous look on its face speaks of eternal torment and a terrible loathing of all life. 13. With an unholy scream the abomination moves towardyou, death in its eyes!! 14. Andolin, Cellica, Wren Passive Perception vs DC 10 Though you don't know what the creatures are, but theyare clearly the most fearsome of the horrors so far. 15. Darwin Religion: 18 You recognize both apparitions. 16. Olena is a Specter , and the inkeeper is a "White Specter" [A 1e monster, more than 2x as nasty as the Guards you faced], Both hunger to devour the life and souls of the living. 17. Horus Arcana: 24, Religion 18 You recognize both apparitions. 18. Olena is a Specter , and the innkeeper is a "White Specter" [A 1e monster, more than 2x as nasty as the Guards you faced, in 1e it is an 8HD monster, capable of life draining].Both hunger to devour the life and souls of the living. 19. Any soul devoured becomes the slave of White Specter. 20. Even at your best, you are no match for these creatures. 21. Are you still going for the door? 22. The way is currently open. 23. BTW, there are 13 "patrons"...

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The Sea Ghost Initiative: 6 ROUND ONE THE SEA GHOST As the Belle approached the Sea Ghost, Misha kneeled and prayed. 2. Bane, my Lord General, grant me and my comrades honor, and glory this day. 3. I will do your work in Your Name as you wish it and destroy Tharizdun's followers and our enemies. 4. I will fight in the name of Acher- Her praying was interrupted. 5. The Ghost came around and a shot was fired from the Ghost. 6. A massive ballista arrow headed towards the ship. 7. BallistaAttack: 26 Damage: 25 The shot slammed so hard into the Belle, it threw Misha off her feet. 8. An explosion could be heard down below, the ballista impact from the Ghost had caused a fire to erupt down below - striking something flammable. 9. A calm militaristic voice was heard blaring on the ship. 10. *WARNING! 11. FIRE DETECTED IN CARGO DECK. 12. WARNING! 13. * Hull: AC15 HP 275/300 (15 Threshold) Helm: AC18 HP50 Sails: AC12 HP100 (-5 speed per 25 dmg taken) Speed: 45 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 60 ft. while sailing with the wind Cannons: AC15 HP50 Crew Quality: 5 FIRE DETECTED: DC10, 3 SUCCESSES. 14. THE BELL OF THE SEA RETURN FIRE! 15. Misha said something in Acheronian and ran to Sana. 16. "I weel help you aim!!" 17. she cocked her head back to Carrhae. 18. "Captain! 19. Fire in the cargo deck!"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The hag answers Mindartis with a shrug, "I only weave portals and help process the vict--the subjects we've collected. 2. I've never seen one cured. 3. Annie Bracken would know. 4. I expect they will all be released when our mission is finished, though. 5. Maybe you should help us. 6. You look like you're from the Feywild, I'm sure they could find work for you to do there." 7. -------- The cat gives Del a strange look when he tries animal talk on it, and merely hisses and flies higher, perching on the wall by digging its claws into the shoddy wooden wall. 8. The scruffy winged cat relaxes at Raven's attempts to comfort it, and suddenly drops form the wall to land on her shoulder, gracefully curling around her neck and occasionally spitting suspiciously at Del. 9. - The sea hag nods. 10. "When the Arch Witch returns, all the hags and fey will benefit. 11. She will bring us power, knowledge, and domination over the lesser beings. 12. You could be one of us. 13. Most of your companions are inferior creatures, but the power of the Feywild runs in your veins." 14. The chest has no visible lock or hinges. 15. It does have a metal plate with a kitty's pawprint on it, though.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Yaalin: The group turns to look at you. 2. At first, the hobgoblin steps forward. 3. Hand going for it's weapon. 4. Fingers wrapping around the hilt of a arm sized ax, just standing there to make sure there's some distance between you and the fire-haired goblin woman and the mask wearing one. 5. They all seem to just.. stare. 6. Listening to your words. 7. "She seems nice," the fire haired woman begins. 8. "Yes. 9. A reef-walker. 10. Don't see them here often," the hobgoblin replies. 11. Speaking in common, although with quite the thick unknown accent. 12. "I'm Keetra," the goblin woman says. 13. "Seventh born to the Prince." 14. She steps forward, the masked person saying something which she seems to just wave off. 15. Her head leans in, wafting her hair over your hand. 16. Her locks thick, soft, and oddly warm. 17. "And I'm touched by the Heart of the Mountain, as we say where I'm from. 18. Who are you searching for? 19. And... what's the reef?" 20. she asks, both to Yaalin and her bodyguard. 21. Cora looks at Abigail with a questioning look, before giving a bit of a shrug and leaving the subject alone. 22. Abigail, looking in the water, also has a hard time getting a good look at the fish. 23. They're not very big, but there are a good amount of them darting to and fro. 24. Bursts of speed as they dive down and up.

Recwyin fires an arrow straight through the fungal stalks comingoutof the Drow's left eye, and it falls down dead. 2. **Bwahhhahh, it finally happeneddd** Tigrexx runs towards the walking tree and slashes across its trunk, sending bits of hard fungus flying away. 3. He then takes a BITE of the INFECTED tree monster, and rips a piece of its body off and the tree tips one way, then another, then falls down dead with a loud thud. 4. TiGarruk, please make a Wisdom saving throw... **you're all out of combat, everything is dead, the field is on fire but not a crazy amount** Recwyin - all of the Drow's items appear to have some form of fungus on them, you think it would be better to leave them. 5. Recwyin - you can recover all your arrows. 6. Garruk - you feel a little odd for a moment, until you spit out the wood, and feel normal again. 7. Stool responds to your inquiries, " Umm, I don't know how long its been. 8. The Drow man grabbed me a while back, we traveled over the water, and I was trapped with you for a bit... Uhh, and then we all left, and traveled again..And now we're here. 9. So like eleventy-three days? 10. We aren't far from Home, its just a ways that way" and he points his body across the field to another tunnel that heads into the dark. 11. Standing there at the mouth of the tunnel is several Myconid creatures, watching you.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Morgan : The shop keeper shakes their head a bit. 2. "Can't do 25. 3. And we're the only post in a days travel in really any direction, so it ain't like your friends have a choice. 4. That bein' the case, I like your moxi. 5. I'll give it all to you for 33 gold. " 6. (Your total was 38 g, 7 silver) When you head over to the armory, the don't take outsiders wares. 7. After all, they aren't a shop per se. 8. But the fort's actual armory. 9. They do, however, take any donations and will put in a kind word with others. 10. Abigail : The shopkeeper gives you a small deal on the rations; 2 gold instead of the 3 gold, 2 silver. 11. The total cost of everything is 70 gold. 12. The clothing set that's a itchy overalls, pull over shirt, tall boots, thin gloves, and wide set hat. 13. Seems made to be knee deep in water, although it'll probably smell after. 14. Lizard-Oil-Tin: This tin of oil can be applied to various things. 15. One tin will roughly cover a 5x5 area, like a bedroll, or set of clothing. 16. Applying it to a item you're sleeping on (or in), prevents water and water-critters from getting at you while you sleep. 17. Lasts 5 days before it needs to be applied again. 18. Also, it can be applied to a melee weapon. 19. The melee weapon will not have disadvantage in the water for 5 days. 20. Last, it can be applied to a firearm & 20 bullets; enabling the weapon to be useable and fired under water. 21. The oil smells like farts and earwax. 22. Cure-All-Potion: When you drink this potion, roll 1d6. 23. 1: Oh god what did you just drink?! 24. (DIsadvantage on all saves until your next long rest). 25. 2: Pretty sure that was acid... (take 5d4 acid damage). 26. 3: Water! 27. Stay hydrated. 28. 4: Invigorating Water! 29. +5 Temp HP. 30. 5:Mash of healing tonics. 31. Advantage on all checks for disease / conditions until your next long rest. 32. 6. 33. Healing Tonic. 34. Cure any conditions / exhaustion / diseases. 35. Heal 2d8+2 HP.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Mystically strengthend by the druidic magic of their as yet unknown lupine ally, the four Silverstar guards revert to their training, with the two out front raising shields and spears to form a paltry-seeming wall before thelooming ogre even as they strike outwards with their steel-tipped weapons at their larger attacker. 2. The tallest of the four, an almost gaunt human woman, manages to drive the tip of her spear through the ogre's hide wrappings... barely. 3. The ogre doesn't react in the slightest to the hit and easily knocks aside the other Silverstar's spear strike, even as the massive giant-kin raises it's huge greatclub above its head in readiness to squash one of its foes. 4. The ogre's club blow lands with a resounding *THUMP* into the tall human guard, who perhaps due to the magically imbued vitality imparted to her by druidic magic, miraculously somehow survives the blow and stands ready to fight... despite being bloodied and looking somewhat unsteady on her feet. 5. Behind their allies, the two remaining Silverstars turn back-to-back to each level a cross-cut longsword blow at their orcish antagonists, the first striking true and inflicting further injury to the orc that Wolf-Dewi had bitten. 6. The other guardsman's sword blow is turned aside with relative ease by the orc he is facing. 7. Where'd that witch go?" 5. Vaalu you don't see any tracks leading from the spot she was standing, and you can't smell her anymore, you think she has teleported away, and is not just invisible. 6. Ireena heads upstairs to check on Alexander, Anders and Brom, " What's happening, are they all gone?" 7. Faron -The cage is locked with a simple latching mechanism that is unreachablefrom inside the cage but easily opened from the outside. 8. Vaalu holds the young girl, trying to calm her down, as Ireena and Ismark run in, shocked to see the bound children. 9. Ireena comes over quickly and kneels beside Vaalu, " By the gods I know these children! 10. They're from Barovia!" 11. Ismark holds up some loose clothes laying on the ground, "These clothes don't look like they fit those children, I think there were other children here..."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. I think currently, everyone else is in their rooms? 2. Those resting. 3. While you rest and doze, your minds think about the days just past... Yasei : You noticed something about how Mr Bradley looked at you when you told him your full title, like it had some weight to it. 4. Most noticably, ow that you think about it, was the fact that he addressed you as ‘princess’- the first real recognition of your status outside your homeland. 5. Rosli : Your mind cycles through the architecture of the guild. 6. You run through all the possible exits, walls, doors that you’ve seen in your mind, constantly thinking about noteworthy trophies, weapons and the storage coffers... Dani : As a sheriff of the lands, you wonder if the guild knew anything of the City of Rust and Arid’s civil war? 7. Additionally, how can yiu be sure that this hunter’s guild is an ethical practice? 8. Bobo : You need to bring everyone tigether to make an announcement, but haven’t found the right time just yet... when will that be? 9. And besides, who will know you here? 10. Is this a chance at a fresh identity? 11. Rosli: you each have the luxury of your own rooms! 12. A thorough search turns up 4 gp, 10 sp and a whet stone. 13. Riv can recall a description of what they look like and their general rust ability, but not sure how it works or how potent it is.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "You’ve been spotted, and seen. 2. Your faces were visible to those who accuse you.” He states. 3. Yorvalor, as you talk with him, the little threads of memories come back to you. 4. Overhearing that two members of a order were seen coming off a boat. 5. The crossed-blade pattern being distinct. 6. Hearing one in the Cathedral. 7. Keegan saying that he saw one of them being around the warehouses. 8. Learning that one of these shadowy agents was hiding in the room with Masus when you came in to investigate. 9. The fact that Masus always seemed to flare up in anger... but somehow calmed down rapidly. 10. Now with you seeing this person having some potential for magic, could have been manipulating the entire scene. 11. In fact, the person setting you up may not be some superior. 12. It could be these two agents themselves. 13. And here you stand 5 feet away from one of them. 14. “One last chance. 15. For the lot of you. 16. Surrender now.” He returns to his fighting stance. 17. What do you all do? 18. The agent.... (Will Save: 18 ) ....looks over at Yorvalor, hearing the words but digging down mentally. 19. A small chuckle coming out, as if the spell was beginning to work before it stopped. 20. (Emund & Cade, your actions. 21. Then it’s the agents) The Agent, seeing them not surrender, continues his fight with Cade. 22. While the spiritual weapon takes a stab at Yorvalor. 23. (Cade) ShortswordAttack: 18 Damage: 9 (Yorvalor) Spiritual WeaponAttack: 21 Damage: 7 ... 24. In that moment, Yorvalor and Emund, you see the brief opportunity to flee while he's focused on your friend.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. When Nyx & Baeshra venture into the storage room a little further they see that the western most door is open, as if someone ran through in a hurry. 2. Inside that room are more cots. 3. The wall has hooks for mounting spears, longswords, greatswords and morningstars. 4. Most of the weapons have been removed, although a quarterstaff remains. 5. It is engraved with stylized feathers and is surprisingly light. 6. As you all gather in the storage room, Gundren recognizes Sildar's gear as well "That there is Sildar's gear! 7. We should take it back to him." 8. And both Gundren and Lyngheid enter the storage room their eyes are inexplicably drawn to a small cask underneath some other barrels and crates. 9. Gundren cracks it open and sniffs it. 10. "This is fine dwarven brandy!" 11. He takes a gulp of it and smacks his lips. 12. Is anyone going with Nyx? 13. Nyx, Umbriel, Baeshra, Droop and anyone else who is accompanying them move from door to door counter-clockwise. 14. Nyx listens at the first door...nothing...she moves on to the second door...again no sound. 15. At the third door she thinks she hears something for an instant, but then realizes it is just her own heartbeat. 16. As she and Droop and Umbriel approach the fourth door Baeshra notices a trip-wire in front of them. 17. Before he can dino-snort a warning, they walk through the trip wire and a cave-in of wooden beams and heavy stones come loudly crashing down onto them. 18. Droop, Nyx, Umbriel make a DC10 Dex save. 19. Take 6 bludgeoning damage on a fail, half on a save. 20. Droop Dex save: 15 The trap was pretty loud, but you don't see any other danger.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Timber had grabbed the small pendant from the Unkh statue. 2. As the party moved from that hallway and passed near the obelisk Timber felt the pendant tug him toward the hidden tomb entrance. 3. Now within the first corridor Kirinar steps bravely forward looking for trouble. 4. As he steps past the second door 28 a small dart catches him in the neck and he takes 3 damage. 5. He feels a bit woozy and realizes the dart is poisoned (DC 15 Con Save 14 ) and takes an additional 12 poison damage. 6. Kayleth looks through the window. 7. This vaulted tomb is overgrown with moss and creepers. 8. A stone sarcophagus rests on a stepped dais in the middle of the floor. 9. On the wall behind the sarcophagus, two large statues of bears grip a five-foot-diameter bronze disk embossed with a dozen glaring eyes. 10. Six desiccated corpses slump on thrones in niches along the walls. 11. Each corpse wears a black mask made of papier-mâché and feathers. 12. ((As a reminder, my maps will update as I go along, so you can look back at the last posts to see the map as it updates. 13. I will try to have the map show up on each page of the thread.))

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (You may if you wish but he already got a 15, which is high enough) As Anders says his morning prayers, he feels the warmth of the morning sun bathe over his skin like a gentle touch. 2. Anders spirit fosters seeds of prosperity, feeling "Inspired" by the blessing of his patron. 3. The soft warmth never seems to fade for the rest of this day due to the paladins diligence. 4. As Anders leads the way, through the charred, husk of the forest, perhaps it was pride, or humility, but the blessing his patron had bestowed upon the man distracted him enough thathe, despite his best efforts, managed to start walking off the path several times, however Salazar and eventually Ryner course corrected, pointing out the slight remainder of the goblin footprints, now much easier to follow between the melted snow, and the lack of foliage. 5. Keeping on the path, Anders eventually spotted a hole in the ground. 6. Though shallow, it could cause someone injury if they fell into it. 7. However, once again, thanks to the fire burning almost every inch of the forest on this half of the road, the trap was easily spotted by (everyone's passive perception) allowing them to easily walk around it entirely. 8. Eventually, the group comes up to an area that seems to be where the mountain truly begins, and the incline increases drastically, aside from a final, large flat area. 9. A copse of burnt trees to the right that likely would have made for an excellent blind, now left a charred husk. 10. Against the mountain itself, was a large mouthed open cave, a stream trickling from within, creating a twenty foot wide stream, that was a little more than soul-deep. 11. (shoe). 12. all the trees in the area had been decimated, removing almost all cover. 13. In the distance, Two goblins seem to be looking at where the copse of tree's had been before, arguing dejectedly with eachother at their apparent loss. 14. Their backs were to the party. 15. They do not notice their approach, being about 100 feet away.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Nicely Done!) 2. Erok: Though the tombs are designed to get you lost, you keep the group headed steadily Southward through the maze. 3. Adoor finally opens into a wide chamber (50 ft x 60 ft). 4. The ceiling of this room is only 10 feet high, and it’s supported by square columns spaced every 10 feet. 5. The ever-present glyphs flow into this room from the necropolis behind you. 6. Beneath these symbols, carvings of Anu-Akma leer angrily at you from every bit of wall space. 7. Piles of sand cover the stone floor to a depth of several inches in all parts of the room. 8. There is another doorway on the opposite side of the room .

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Narstin roll Sleight of hand with advantage (because of Beegred) Here's an example of the Influence thing: Base DC 10 - 5 - 5 = 0. 2. Minimum is DC 5. 3. Rolling for Beegred for this example: 16 So 16 - 5 = 11 Narstin starts with -100 influence towards Beegred. 4. Now Narstin has -89 influence. 5. (Need 100 to for Narstin to consider Beegred a true friend.) 6. It works the exact same way with NPC's. 7. From now on, you all keep track of your own efforts to build friendships. 8. Submit what you think are DC modifiers in your favor, and to make my life easier, you can submit DC modifiers not in your favor (I'll be grateful!). 9. Then roll your persuasion check. 10. I will review and post your result. 11. @Tozer: During your work detail, there are plenty of items that you spot that you could take. 12. However some would be immediately noticed if gone missing and others would be too big to hide. 13. Your perception roll wasn't great, but your sleight of hand was a Nat. 14. 20. 15. So, you can pick from these two choices:

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Before setting out, away from the gaping abyss, the party hops in Cree's wagon as she commands Scath to move down into the salt flats. 2. The sounds of the wagon moving go from a smooth, constant rumbling, punctuated with squeaking of a wheel to the crunching of a dry, cracked terrain. 3. Even in the shelter of the covered wagon, the temperature noticeably increases. 4. Outside, Cree is continuing to keep her kruthik on task. 5. 3 Thankfully, the ride is uneventful, due to a combination of the heat and the thoroughly uninhabitable soil. 6. It is little wonder so few venture into such a hostile area. 7. As soon as the ride seems starts to feel far too long, the butte that is their destination is now beginning to fill their vision. 8. Cree pulls the wagon to the shaded area of the gigantic stone structure and brings the wagon to a stop. 9. @Gulgin: As the wagon moves to the shade you notice that the movement of the cart was slightly more smooth compared to the rest of the salt flats, starting around 400 feet away from the butte to about 150 feet away. 10. "Been down this way a few times, but I haven't seen any inklin' of this hawk o' yers. 11. Kinda curious on how yer gonna try and find it." 12. "Considering what my research has revealed and what our friend Gulgin has also heard, this may be the only location where the hawk was nesting." 13. Nessarian says as he searches his bag and pulls out a small wand that has a partially helical shaft and the end looks somewhat like a doorknob. 14. "However, I believe its nest was not on the butte. 15. I don't have many charges in this wand, so any clues as to where we should look will be of great help."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As the party files out into the hallway, you can spot the door down the hall to the right that leads back to the front hall. 2. There are also two doors on the left. 3. The one directly across from the door to the front hall is where Ruggero spotted the dining room. 4. Closer to you is another door on the left just next to the dining room. 5. Sorry, at class right now, so I don't have a map. 6. Just know that there are only two other rooms on this floor that you have not explored. 7. One you know is the dining room. 8. You enter the kitchen. 9. Several shelves and counters line the walls of the room. 10. Bowls, chopping boards, and other kitchen implements are arranged along the counters and on the shelves. 11. The overall impression is one of neatness and order, though the thick layer of dust that covers all the surfaces suggest that whoever arranged this room has not been back for a very long time. 12. Two staircases lead out of the room, one downwards and one upwards. 13. Ruggero: Nothing seems amiss in here, except for the fact that that there is still some food on the shelves (grains and a few root vegetables mostly) that still look edible, aside from being coated in dust. 14. But, if this place is a hundred or more years old, how could the food still look untouched or not even the slightest bit rotten? 15. New map! 16. https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5QowkU494u9cldjd1hyb3ZfNVNXZWFhS1g5bUtiRDNlNHNJ/view?usp=sharing The stairson A4 and A5 are going up (marked with a "U") and the stairs on C4 and C5 are going down (marked with a "D") You'd have to go back out to the hall to get to the dining room. 17. Stairs are blocking the way.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. ( Lol, I just posted that.) 2. Darren also just barely makes it across, watching as some of the marble slabs crumble and fall beneath his feet. 3. However, whether by sheer luck, or just a little bit of skill, he avoids falling into the debris lined trenches that open as the slabs crumble down. 4. (The ledge goes around the western side to the door, the pit itself is 10 feet wide. 5. To make a harness with your rope and backpack would require a Survival check. 6. Ekk does not need to jump over the pit as he can walk around the ledge to get to the door, unless he really wants to.) 7. Cade is the first to breach the door, followed closely by Rivon, who is moving as quiet as a shadow. 8. When you enter the room you see that this circular area is cobbled with cracked granite, upon which sprawl the bodies of four goblins, apparently slain in combat. 9. One corpse stands with its back against the western wall, the spear that killed it still skewering it and holding it upright. 10. Three wooden doors lead from this area. 11. A hollow tower of loose masonry reaches thirty feet into the air, but the intervening floors and stairs are gone, except for a couple of crumbled ledges.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Otrov you quickly run downstairs and past the empty stable into the backyard. 2. You don‘t see anyone around, but you hear birds singing to greet a beautifull morning. 3. Dain, your room is as you remember it and everything looks normal while you follow Otrov to the stairs. 4. But as you make your first step downwards, Sebastian calls you back. 5. Your familiar noticed bloody fingerprints on first door next to the stairs. 6. You remember that this room belonged to Relgalyn. 7. There are two beds in the room. 8. The one on the right side is empty and Relgalyn used it to put down his backpack and instruments. 9. On the left one you see the body of the bard, the sheets soaked in blood. 10. You don‘t see any sights of a fight. 11. Otrov, you don‘t see any movement outside. 12. Woken by the noise Sildar comes out of his room, sword in hand and looks what is going on. 13. As well as Toblen Stonhill who pokes his head out to see what the commotion is about. 14. Black Ooze still just heavily damaged. 5. Reminder about the acid in the air and the Black Ooze's fire returning, and Badrizar has Bless on. 6. The two dagger strikes defeat the ooze just before it releases it's burst, and the acid in the air vanishes with it. 7. The shield and scorching are all the remain of the oozes. 8. If there was a ward on the door, it was destroyed when the door shattered. 9. The servant is undoubtedly dead. 10. The noise caused by the battle hadn't been very loud, and no servants or guards yet come. 11. Presuming you go to loot... 12. In the room, several items are set in glass displays, more pictures on the walls. 13. The thrum of magical energy can be faintly heard throughout the room, telling of years of the aura of these treasures. 14. All of them are accessible by simple operation of a latch. 15. All of you have the unshakable feeling that there are numerous people in the room watching, but as far as anyone can see, its just you three. 16. There are no traps. 17. You find the following. 18. Each of these items are extremely potent . 19. Merely carrying two causes strain in time, having an extra-dimensional space allows you to carry three. 20. There are non-magical treasures as well, totaling 12 pounds and perhaps worth over two thousand gold.

The door in the northeast corner appears to be newer than the surrounding stonework and is shut tight. 6. Barnabus: You hear nothing at the door. 7. No arcane wards or symbols. 4. No specific magic items or rituals come to mind. 5. There is magic all around it, but no signs that it is "intelligent" (doesn't have an alignment). 6. Jack cannot tell if this is something used by evil beings, or something to be used against them. 7. Nothing comes to mind, but Jack is not aware of every minor religion or rare ritual. 8. Cara mentions "town talk". 9. Reverie is reminded of the evening after Iskander and the sailors were liberated, and the town gossip while having dinner (posts 1600 -1610).The party had stoked the flames of those tall tales. 10. It was mostly Jack, but everyone pitched in, including Reverie (post 1608 ). 11. Cara faces the setting sun (west) and raises her right arm (north). " 12. That way ." 13. (As a peasant, and apparently simple-minded, she may be limited in her knowledge.) 14. " I not sell to great lords. 15. You would beat me and my boy for bad wagon. " 16. You can probably convince her, but she is afraid that you will get angry and think she was cheating you. 17. The wagon was in poor shape (old nearly rotted wood) before the last 3 days of fleeing. 18. It is in bad enough shape now that they were lucky to get this far.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The party eats an early dinner at the inn (3 Silver each) and turns in early so they can get a good start in the morning (2 GP for the 4 rooms, Droop pay 5 silver for their room). 2. Everyone sets out on the 19th of Flamerule, Gundren leading the way. 3. You travel for about half a day, going quickly, no time for foraging, and Gundren announces that you are getting close a little before lunch time. 4. He leads you to a norrow tunnel whose entrance is hidden within the Sword Mountain foothills. 5. The entrance tunnel leads into a large cavern supported by a natural pillar of rock and containing three stalagmites. 6. In the western part of the cave, behind the column of rock, are three bedrolls and a heap of ordinary supplies—sacks of flour, bags of salt, casks of salted meat, lanterns, flasks of lamp oil, pickaxes, shovels, and other gear. 7. Amid the supplies, you see the body of a dwarf miner, dead for at least a week. 8. The northeastern section of the cavern has collapsed, forming a ten-foot-wide, twenty-foot-deep pit. 9. A sturdy hemp rope is tied off around a nearby stalagmite and dangles down the side of the pit, at the bottom of which is a rough-hewn tunnel heading northwest and east. 10. Gundren rushes over to the dwarven body, turns it over and stands silent for a moment. 11. "This was our camp. 12. And this was my brother. 13. Poor Tharden! 14. Lyngheid, help me dear!" 15. After they cover Tharden's body, Gundren says "That damned Black Spider. 16. He must still have Nundro. 17. I'll take Tharden back to town. 18. Will you please find Nundro in the cave?" 19. OOC: Climbing up or down the wall of the pit with the rope requires no check. 20. What does the party do now? 21. You don't see any gricks! 22. It looks like the passageway goes on for a ways, with maybe another coming in from the north. 23. Droop Stealth: 20

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Before he can continue, the group feels a warm breeze blow through the tunnel. 2. It smells a bit of cinnamon, and mint, and a bit of apple....a fragrant lovely smelling scent. 3. As you smell it, you feel a sense of joy seep through your body, and even Mal, in her downtrodden, defeated mind, feels the slightest touch of hope. 4. YOU MAY EACH LEVEL UP. 5. Looking about, small smiles quirking at each others mouths, you feel like a solid group of friends suddenly. 6. The moment hangs there, until Badger turns and crawls down the crawlway. 7. Badger gets to the section of the crawlway that should be blocked off, but instead finds the tunnel continues. 8. However, he notices a fine seam in the tunnel at this point...and figures that the tunnel ahead can move. 9. He thinks through it. 10. It is probably weight based, near the center. 11. But....is there another tunnel above this one...and this will sink and rotate again and trap them both...or will it cause it to rise and rotate and free the man, but trap Badger? 12. Badger, thankfully, can't hear the moaning of the peasant, him being stuck between several feet of solid stone, as long as he doesn't focus on the arcane eye...only hearing a thin quiet drone from where he is. 13. His hand can only carry 10 pounds at a time so he slowly pushes the skeleton, and then pack back into the middle of the hallway. 14. He pushes his own two man tent...and as is nears the center of the hall there's a loud grinding "clunk" and the hallway before Badger begins rising up and rotating, quickly vanishing from view while he sees solid stone sliding past the hallways mouth before him. 15. A few moments later another hallway rotates into view, filled with light and a moaning man who looks around....he looks back at Badger, and says, "AFALDFKJF ASDFSL!! 16. ADFKSDJLS!!!" 17. He then begins crawling quickly back towards Badger, relief plain in his eyes......as he crawls as fast as he can.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. ((That plus the undecideds is enough of a quorum to continue on from here.)) 2. Working the lever contraption and opening the left-most door, you find yourselves in a dim, cold room that is rectangular in shape, about 30 feet across and about 70 feet long. 3. You're pretty sure it would likely be longer if not for the collapse of white stone and ice along the southern end near where you enter. 4. Across from you, along the western wall, there is another familiar looking arched stone tube hallway that leads deeper elsewhere. 5. To your immediate right along the eastern wall, you see another door that likely belongs to the parallel tunnel you didn't take. 6. At the northern end of this large room, there is an open archway that leads to a room beyond. 7. Soft light from this beyond room spills out into the large rectangular room on that end, revealing what looks like a huddle or pile of bodies in the shadowy northwest corner.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The merchants shrug in response to Dawani’s questions. 2. “We know no more than anyone else.” One of them replies. 3. “The delegation was heading from Mirabar to Summit Hall, but they were waylaid on the road.” After repeated questioning, Sparks manages to extricate the following story from the half-orc’s drunken muttering. 4. Apparently the half-orc, who refers to herself as Zomith, was involved in a brawl with several guards who were accompanying the delegation. 5. She couldn’t say for certain, but she estimates that this was about fifteen days ago. 6. This tale is punctuated with violent denials of any involvement in the disappearance, regardless of whether anyone dares to insinuate it. 7. The barkeep hurriedly procures your drinks, assisted by the rotund, red-haired cellar keeper, Justran. 8. Torvin’s two gold pieces coverthe cost of all the drinks. 9. (Zomith does not recall where she encountered the delegation, but considering it was fifteen days ago she most likely met them on The StoneTrail from Westbridge to Beliard.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Angus McTavin: Zi leads you towards the northern hallway. 2. As you follow the floorboards creak. 3. A loud crack follows and you watch as the floor shatters. 4. Zi Dexterity Saving Throw: 12 You watch as the cleric barely throws herself clear of this section of the floor. 5. Where she used to stand there is now a 7 foot hole in the floor. 6. Gulin Runehammer and Caspia Aspergina walk down the eastern hallway and reach the easternmost door. 7. As Gulin reaches forward to open the door, it clicks, locked. 8. Lying on the ground in front of the door in the open is a dull metallic key. 9. You hear a loud cracking sound come from the hallway behind you. 10. You hear Zi shout, "Angus, stay here, I'll check out these rooms on my own! 11. That was a close one!" 12. Over your shoulder you watch as the light from Zi's shield disappears, she most likely has walked around a corner. 13. Gulin Runehammer: While some boards are obviously broken, with the dim light from the rising sun you can't tell for sure where the floor is at it's worst. 14. Thankfully you do spot a trail of distrubed dust. 15. Perhaps this is how the figure got, or was taken, across the room. 16. Gulin silently points out to Caspia the potential path across the room along the walls. 17. Gulin Runehammer: Your eyes sharpen as you focus your entire attention on Ned, however, you are unable to glean any useful information. 18. The shivering man stripped down to his skivvies seems honest enough. 19. Angus hastily comes down the hall and fishes the oilskin coat out of his pack. 20. "Not sure I'd want to wear this smelly old thing but beats being naked." 21. As Ned is getting to his feet he happily accepts the outstretched cloak. 22. "I haven't really heard anything since I was hit. 23. Well correction, at one point I heard a horrible ghostly scream echoing throughout the house, a voice said something like, "welcome fools, welcome to your foolish deaths!" 24. Ned pauses, looking slightly shaken. 25. "Assailants? 26. What did you find?"

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. So you all start to make your long trek around the town, Pokim holding his chest of toys, Kulsee bouncing on Ash's back, Darastrix twirls his sword around, Vruuk letting out a large yawn, and Ash carrying some new equipment in his arms. 2. As you go around town it is fairly uneventful, the sun is shining and there is a slight breeze.Before long you are on the path heading up to you house. 3. As you approach your home, something doesn't feel right... by now you would normally be able to hear the sounds of children playing and yelling and smell the delicious sent of supper being prepared... but instead it is just silence... other than the sounds and smells of the trees and forests around you. 4. As you approach closer and the orphanage comes into view, you can see that the front door is open blowing in the breeze. 5. Pokim knows that normally he is swarmed with children climbing all over him without the mention of toys.. but after making an announcement like that.. he should be completley engulfed in a sea of children. 6. Instead the only sound he hears is his voice echo off of the stone floor of the old monistary. 7. As he looks around, he does see a small table appears to have been knocked over, which while not uncommon... would normally have been set back the right way immediately to prevent a lecture from Ruby.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As Penny disembarks, Ormond deems it a fine enough idea to simply wrench the brake level out of place. 2. That should be a good enough distraction to buy them enough time while at the same time avoiding woundingthe turtle’s sensibilities. 3. Meanwhile, Penny has collected the poor pigeon, it coos and sniffles once more. 4. However, it seems to be very uneasy without its preferred nest, which would be the pad of paper. 5. As for the trip, you all are still on a very mountainous locale. 6. Despite being only an hour out, who knows what might delay you. 7. (Speaking of which, for winning against the militia, you all get 138xp, but I’m going to round that to 200xp for a clever plan.) 8. It is currently, by your judgement, a bit past noon, likely around 1pm. 9. Below you, the mountain is covered by thick shrubland, so you’ll need to be careful on your descent. 10. Besides, these are still wild lands, so who knows what animals might be nearby. 11. With a strike like that, you sink the blade about an inch or so in. 12. You have decided to show mercy to the weak controls. 13. They aren’t worth your time. 14. As for the bird, it’s simple. 15. You press down the bird’s head to project a message. 16. If a message travels to the pigeon, then it will automatically begin writing.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Having decided to approach Don-Jon with the idea to kill two birds with one stone approach, you find him staying at the Stonehill Inn in town. 2. [Tooltip Not Found] "Take care of some trouble out at Butterskull Ranch?" 3. Don-Jon says with a thoughtful look at the group. 4. "Guess I don't have any issue with helping you all out with that..." He shrugs as he pushes up from the table he was sitting at. 5. "Let's be off then..." As you head out the doors he starts telling you tales of his previous adventures. 6. All that day Don-Jon recounts stories of his past deeds to you, as you travel East out of town towards Conyberry. 7. The trip there takes 2 days, so you end up camping twice on the journey, but hte land is mostly well-settled these days, with nothing bothering you as you set up your camps and rest. 8. On the third day you come to conyberry, a ruined town along the Triboar Trail. 9. The abandoned town of Conyberry is eerily silent except for the whistling of the wind as it blows through the settlement’s burned and crumbled-down structures. 10. As you make your way through or around the ruins, you spot three unsaddled riding horses grazing near an old well.

You find Sildar sitting at one of the tables writeing a letter. 6. The sound of the opening door made him look up and he waves you over. 7. If you aproach, he will shift some papers to make space on the table. 8. "Well, i can not vouch for them yet, as i have spoken with them only briefly, but they made a a good impression. 9. As for the weapons and the armor, if you drop them of at the Lionshield coaster, i will look through them and make you a fair price. 10. Also, Nobody ran off to fast, i am afraid i may have insulted him by returning his gift. 11. Anyhow, he mentioned some telepathic creature that is still down there, do you have any clues what we may be dealing with? 12. I would like to recover those two bodies that Nobody mentioned, but i don't want to endanger people more then neccesarry either. "

Rhogar launches another firebolt at the guard blasting him in the back sending him sprawling into the guard tower dead. 5. The second drow in the tower stops ringing the bell and emerges from one of the windows, loading a bolt into his crossbow and firing at Bigsby who is in the lead. 6. Attack: 14 Damage: 5 - Saving throw if needed: 2 Bigsy falls immediately unconscious, collapsing ahead of everyone on the bridge. 7. Garruk blasts frost across the chasm and through the window hitting the drow, coating his arms in icy crystals Jimjar continues running with the rest of the group Rhogar commands Sut in his mind to distract the second guard. 8. Recwyin fires his longbow at the first Drow hitting him square in the chest. 9. Lucky follows behind, firing his crossbow at the second Drow, which goes straight through the Drow's eye and out the back of his head, and he falls down dead. 10. You all make it the rest of the way across the bridge, the side of the bridge is still slightly on fire but not in immediate danger of snapping. " 11. Follow me, upstairs." 12. Sarith says before heading up a tight spiral staircase into an upstairs room **both guards have a crossbow and 20 bolts. 13. Nothing much else. 14. ***Is anyone going to help Bigsby? 15. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The redbrand nods and continues down with new light to guide the way. 2. Wrapping around another landing and set of stairs down the party finds a landing looking out over the cellar of the former manor. 3. No light exists here either save for Fae's and the air is damp and musty. 4. Old crates and barrels line the walls and stairs lead down a few feet on either side of the landing to ledges that are still higher than the cellar floor. 5. The dimming light at the edges of Fae's magically illuminated area reveal a water filled cistern near the center of the cellar. 6. The large redbrand leads the way down and to your right where a doorway leads to another hallway. 7. He pauses there and turns back towards the cellar, pointing to the opposite landing. 8. "We'll need a few of those." 9. Where he points sits a stack of half a dozen long, sturdy planks of wood over ten feet long each. 10. Looking at Zeke he says simply "pit trap."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Feel free to retcon any conversation you wish to pursue). 2. The party rests and sets out. 3. With Krizzibond adding his voice to Valthana, the party concedes to providing a source of light for the otherwise blind fighters. 4. Eventually the tunnels widen slightly and ease the sense of claustrophobia, allowing members to walk side by side. 5. Sarith leads in his usual careful manner, providing hours of downtime between progress as he investigates various tunnels before choosing his path. 6. This provides plenty of time to work on minor crafting tasks (has to be portable) or quiet conversation. 7. The walls of the cave eventually changes from a natural pockets with solid walls to sloping scree falling down into darkness below. 8. Sarith doesn't even hesitate and walks across the angled loose surface, forcing everyone else to follow or be abandoned. 9. Sure enough, when the party is too far from either end of the scree to avoid danger, the scree begins to shift and slide downwards, providing the slightest window of reaction time to avoid the incoming avalanche of stone. 10. Everyone make a DC 12 Dexterity Saving Throw. 11. The party does their best to avoid being buried by the avalanche of scree, mostly succeeding. 12. However, Valthana shields Stool with her body and suffers a devastating blow, knocking her prone and unconscious. 13. Stool lands on his feet, ready to run as fast as his stubby legs will let him. 14. Khilseith begins to laugh maniacally at the first signs of the incoming avalanche, and the laughing stops abruptly as Derendil drags him thru some largish falling stones, knocking him out. 15. Khilseith falls prone and is still tied to Derendil. 16. Xilyrah and Beegred take some painful blows but manage to stay on their feet to keep running. 17. Everyone can perform one action and then roll DC 12 DEX saving throw again to continue moving across the expanse of scree, as waves of rubble fall past. 18. (I have applied damage to all PC's and NPC's that hadn't already done so.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Some of the onlookers craning their necks to get a glimpse of the dead bodies in the street are distracted by the sudden music. 2. One man scoffs in indignation over the type who would play music at a murder scene, but other people start to bob their heads a little, one dragonbornnods approvingly. 3. "Really sets the mood," he says, and is promptly elbowed by his friend. 4. By the time Phineas' performance comes to an end there is a total of 6 copper and 3 silver in her box. 5. As the group starts to turn away from the scene, a greasy-hairedgnome beckons from where she leans against a building across the street. 6. "Can't tell which ones Z's and which one's X's when they all dead." 7. A slow grin spreads across her face.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The first watch begins with Nick but without a perception roll to work with I'm going with his passive 13. 2. Nick doesn't notice anything out of the ordinary and watch passes uneventfully. 3. Hrain takes second watch and notices several lights in the distant near the lighthouse. 4. The lights go back and forth across land or sea he's not absolutely sure at this distant and unfamiliar with the terrain how they're moving but they're there bobbing in the distant. 5. His watch passes without incident. 6. Waking Folzi next the captain and the gnome exchange thoughts on the lights before Hrain turns in for the night. 7. Folzi's watch seems boring to tge gnome who occasionally reads his book but then an hour into hus shift he sees the lights for himself. 8. Oddly moving in a pattern in the distance back and forth like the human pointed out. 9. Ending hus watch Folzi wakes Pat. 10. Pat seems too tired to grasp the lights which Folzi points out but tge half-orc fails to see them. 11. He then promptly falls asleep on watch minutes after Folzi himself is snoozing in his bedroll! 12. Lyra wakes up with a start looking around the camp the fire having died during Pat's neglected watch and begins to build it back but when the sounds of twigs and branches breaking from the treeline near the beach alert her. 13. Peering into the darkness without the fire is hard for the human but noticing the band of armored people coming from the trees is not. 14. Lyra then raises the alarm! 15. "You should have reported to your garrison upon first arriving," the make human retorts stowing his blade. 16. "I'm Hector Herrera-Sanchez and I'm captain of the Mystra watch. 17. The island is our sanctuary for learning but...did...do you mean commander of Sune from the Waste," he then asks hand on his sword again as everyone else seems to get twitchy too! 18. "How many is in your number," the female half-orc repeats her tone annoyed looking to Lyra curiously not in uniform and still holding her staff tightly in her grip. 19. "I count two shepherds and one...girl but who's in the tent," the orb moves closer revealing both Nick and Folzi's silhouettes! 20. "Declare yourselves," she adds as two more mage-like clerics flank her. 21. There are six visible Mystrains on the beach.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ringo, the bard gives a wry smile. 2. "I don't knowif I'm in need of pointers, friend, but there may indeed by a way you might help me. 3. The names Mereg, but most call me Threestrings. 4. I'm proud to call myself a memb—" Kalmar, Fluttercloak watches silently as Jak eyes his dice once more with a length pause. 5. "Hmmm," he says, "Four si—" Then all the noise is eclipsed by a shout: “Ya pig! 6. Like killin’ me mates, does ya?” The half-orc who was arm wrestling is hit by a wild, swinging punch from a male human whose shaved head is covered with eye-shaped tattoos. 7. Four other humans stand behind him, ready to jump into the fray. 8. The half-orc cracks her knuckles, roars, and leaps at the tattooed figure — but before you can see if blood is drawn, a crowd of spectators clusters around the brawl. 9. Kalmar, Dalton gives a 'I-don't-know-nothing' shake of the head, his eyes wide and staring at the fight. 10. Fluttercloak stands from the table, watching Ringo's back from a distance. 11. Ringo, the crowd thickens as patrons pour through the already crowded tavern to get a better look. 12. Let me get an initiative roll from everybody, just for fluidity. 13. Where are you twoat this point? 14. Fluttercloak: 5 Ringo: You don't know what those tattoos mean, but your sure you've seen people sporting their like before, only in Waterdeep. 15. Ringo, you push your way through the throng, aided considerably by your less than considerable size. 16. Standing up on an abandoned stool, you see that the attack wasn't as successful as hoped, and the half-orc has the tattooed man pinned underneath her, his four companions poised to jump in. 17. Kalmar? 18. Fluttercloak takes advantage of the chaos to surreptitiously cast disguise self , transforming into a human dressed like the four thugs. 19. He moves forward slightly. 20. You two are up.
