Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Once she is sure that her saviors are alright, the dwarf notices that the anvils are still glowing and blue flame isstill coming out of the dais. 2. "Oh my, the Great Forge is still connected to the Plane of Fire. 3. Give me ten minutes and I can perform the ritual to sever the link." 4. She turns and starts the ritual motions and chanting. 5. Jacob: You look around the room from where you're standing and you see nothing of interest in the room. 6. You nudge the bodies. 7. Yup, they're dead. 8. What do the rest of you want to do while you wait for the dwarf to sever the link with the Plane of Fire? 9. Stone: You walk to the door on the east side of the room and carefully peek inside. 10. Twisted, scorched metal fills this empty room to the ceiling. 11. It was obviously once an area for smelting ore, but the equipment is torn and demolished. 12. The stench of burning is overpowering. 13. Jacob: You walk to the door on the west side of the room and notice blood smeared on the open door in a shape of some sort of rune. 14. In the room you see hunks of twisted, partially melted metal covering the floor and walls; the remains of suits of armor and weapons. 15. Natasha: You watch Polla as she performs her ritual, unsure of her motives. 16. Unfortunately, you can't determine if she's really closing the link, or doing something more nefarious. 17. Penelope: You also watch Polla, curious about the magic she is invoking. 18. Make an Arcana check to see if you can follow along.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. the party completes its morning activities (getting dressed, having breakfast, etc) and begins their adventure for the day. 2. Hati is a sneaky one, despite the conditions he knows how to hide even when logic would dictate it is impossible. 3. Using clouds, trees and groups of birds when available, no one looking would notice hati is actually a tiefling adventurer. 4. sadly the extra effort of trying to be stealthy has kept him from keeping an actual good eye out. 5. Plus Hati was thinking of last night, from the battle and what came after. 6. All the more reason he should pay attention. 7. Gimble, leading the party and keeping your eyes peeled for danger, you watch as your two airborne allies sort of make fools of themselves not doing the job they said they would do. 8. You do not see any danger, but you see a wagon on the road heading towards the party. 9. the rest of the party hears Finnian's merry shanty, keeping a good marching tempo. 10. (speaking of which is the traveling speed still at normal? 11. or are we increasing or decreasing the speed? 12. i can review the speed rules with you all if you have forgotten what i posted when you left the city.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The arrow slits are six inches wide, and 2 feet tall, like those in a castle for firing at intruders. 2. As Mal and Badger scan the hallway, they notice that there are three large panels in the floor that looks like they move. 3. However pushing on them, they seem to be very solid....even carefully putting weight on them doesn't cause them to flip, spin, slide, or collapse. 4. They are 5x5 and between the three of them they nearly fill the 15 foot long hallway aside from foot wide gaps between them of structural bricks. 5. Looking into the arrow slits carefully, they are filled with cobwebs. 6. Clearing them out a bit, you see a dark room. 7. A bit of light reveals a cobwebbed filled room beyond with a statue of a coiled serpent dominating the room. 8. the statue is missing it's head, which lies broken on the floor next to a stone cube. 9. On the other side, you see a similar room, large statue of a coiled serpent, but this one hasits head. 10. Clutched in the statue's jaws is a stone cube. 11. At the end of the hallway, it opens up into another room. 12. In the middle of this room, a stone cube rests on a plain stone pedestal. 13. Statues of twelve tribal warriors jut from the surrounding walls, aiming bows at the pedestal. 14. The floor in front of the pedestal bears a mosaic depicting a monstrous serpent constricting a furious monkey. 15. Moss obscures much of the detail.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Suneni, Kelezur, and Ogged unleash a staggering combine of attacks on one of the fire giants, nearly felling the burning undead. 2. It stands, but not for long... (Wounds: 105) Garrus immediately sights upon the damaged giant and uneashes two Eldritch Blasts which take the giant off of it's feet. 3. Constitution Save: 19 With a shuddering groan the fiery titan falls in a second death. 4. Volgiah once again plunges into the heat of battle to provide medical aid to her bloodied companions. 5. Cleft, you may take your regular action. 6. Fire Giant Constitution Save: 10 Cleft leaps into the air, hooves flailing, and delivers the killing blow to the giant's midsection. 7. Putrid yellow liquescence secretes from the wound, drenching Kelezur, followed by the giants corpse itself, which the warrior only barely manages to evade. 8. The skirmish is won, but the undead fire giant war effort is barely delayed. 9. The main war host can be seen across the plains, leaving in its wake small fires burning in the dry grass and massive footprints in the dirt. 10. 600 XP each!

Taman, as you approach the guild house you can see a few candles in the lamps by the gate, a few flickering in windows of the guild house, but otherwise the place looks fairly quiet. 5. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "If no one has any questions about the extra loot, we'll move on." 2. "I drew these up myself. 3. They should help out a lot." 4. Chad passes out maps of Waterdeep done up to mark the wards (outlined in red), districts (marked by a green district number) and locations of the treasure (marked by the blue dots). 5. To move between districts, the district must touch the district you are currently in. 6. Diagonal moves are allowed where applicable. 7. Each move needs to be decided together before you move. 8. When you post your suggested direction, also post a stealth roll. 9. A group stealth check will determine if you go unnoticed or spotted by the city guard. 10. The DC will increasewith the more you steal, drawing more heat from the city guard. 11. With Wensa'surchinbackground, you all are allowed to move two spaces at a time. 12. (example: I want to move from district 14 to 50. 13. Stealth: 17 ) "Going unnoticed will allow you to move into the new district without incident. 14. If spotted by the city guard, they will give chase. 15. You will have to make a run for it from district to district ." 16. If spotted, you all decide a direction together without rolling another stealth check. 17. The guards will then roll a d20 to determine if they can follow your tracks. 18. If they track you through 3 districts, they will grab one of you. 19. On a 20, they will grab you automatically. 20. On a 1, you'll be able to move to any district you'd like. 21. "I recommend you stay out of the City of the Dead. 22. If you do not have family buried they, the undead that protects the grounds will attack you." 23. (Hopefully, that's clear. 24. Have questions? 25. Click the map toget a larger view.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Headed into the swamp, like three people versed in the ways of advance scouting, Akaas, Crispy, and Friedrych leap ahead and begin the process of ensuring a safe passage. 2. Akaas: As you search around, you identify some fresh tracks, maybe a couple of days old, not too far from the tracks of prior caravans. 3. They appear to be clawed prints of what may be lizardfolk, and it is in large numbers, perhaps a score of them. 4. Crispy: Checking the nearby vicinity, there appears to be signs of some sort of battle that happened not too long ago. 5. Looking around the area, there are faint scorch marks on some of the plants, and bits of dried blood elsewhere. 6. However, there is no sign of bodies nearby. 7. Friedrych: Keeping an eyeout ahead of the group while Akaas and Crispy keep their eyes focused on the nearby environment, Friedrych checks and can tell that there has been some disturbance to the foliage up the path. 8. It could be that the leaning tree fell naturally, but it has made a good bit of cover to compliment the large hedge bush nearby it. 9. It looks like a prime ambush spot should anything be skulking in the swamp. 10. (Cripsy, if you'd like to roll Stealth , too. 11. Also if anyone else is following these sneaky two will need to roll as well.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Running up and joining Brandor and Squelch you deftly fire your arrow towards the crates, your new position giving you a vantage point over the crates so that it no longer gives them cover. 2. It finds it's mark, skewering the goblins temple as it falls to the ground dead. 3. Yeemik looks past Grum and Brandor at you, who he hadn't yet taken much notice of. 4. "B-but... if I take Klarg place I become boss and Grol no hate me? 5. or... wait? 6. Huh?" 7. The goblin on the stairs looks backwards at Yeemik and says "They're right Yeemik! 8. King Grol will be very mad!" 9. "Shut up Glink! 10. Yeemik think first." 11. A few moments past as Yeemik begins to ponder, and his arms grow tired. 12. "But... King Grol must appreciate the strong! 13. Or, maybe..." Unable to make a decision, he brings Sildar back on to the ridge, muttering to himself.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The Ettin's two heads roar in unison as Valrish rushes up to attack. 2. It raises both of its weapons over its head and brings them crashing down on the dragonborn at the same time. " 3. S M A S H ! " 4. they say together. 5. Battleaxe on Valrish:Attack: 21 Slashing Damage: 18 (Half damage due to rage) Morningstar on Valrish: Attack: 15 Piercing Damage: 20 As the battleaxe slams into Valrish it shoves him just out of the path of the Morningstar which misses him. 6. "HEY! 7. No Fair!" 8. shouts the head wielding the morningstar. 9. The derro cease their chanting and move to assist the Ettin. 10. Two of them draw crossbows and shoot up at Oorr. 11. The third reaches out to Valrish to knock him over with a hooked spear. 12. Crossbow 1 on Oorr:Attack: 7 Damage: 7 Crossbow 2 on Oorr: Attack: 16 Damage: 8 One of the bolts strikes the Aaracokra in the side. 13. Hooked Spear on Valrish: 3 The derro misses, the Ettin getting in his way. 14. Round 2 20 Death Dog 18 Valrish/Eldeth 13 Ettin (73/85 HP) 12 Oorr/Zippy 11 Derro (3 on platform) 09 Belwar/Derendil 08 Grimnir/Jimjar 08 Narrak Narrak runs away from the flaming sphere, crossing the ritual circle towards the area the Ettin came from, as he does so, a shimmer of light encircles him as he casts mage armor on himself. 15. The Death Dog, foam dripping from both of its mouths, slams into the door of the cage. 16. (Athletics: 8 ) The door bulges out, but the latch holds. 17. It will probably not sustain another attack. 18. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. If Trogdor flew to find Art when you awoke, he would have caught the half-elf as he was leaving the Lawmaster's house, and missed any conversation with the Lawmaster. 2. If you would like him to try to eavesdrop on the conversation between Art and the black-cloaked elf, make a Perception and Stealth check for Art. 3. Silent, neither the elf nor the cloak ring any bells. 4. You enter, and are shown immediately to the same room where you met Lawmaster Hector Atterly for the first time. 5. This morning he is not alone; seated across from him is Starosta Theanor Whisperthin, who Balassar met the previous day. 6. Both halflings wear serious and unhappy expressions, and the Lawmaster waves at you to sit. 7. Geta salutes and leaves, closing the door behind her. 8. Thank you for coming so quickly, and for not giving us any trouble over the last two weeks, the Lawmaster begins. 9. Your conduct has been expemplary, in fact. 10. Let us get the first matter out of the way quickly. 11. You are clearly innocent of the accusations Master Hellet made against you. 12. My investigations confirm this and this morning the young man withdrew his previous statements. 13. Master Wildcloak, here is your map. 14. He reaches across the desk and hands the map to Alton. 15. Alton, assuming you check the map now or later, it is indeed your family's map, apparently undamaged. 16. Well, as for that... the Lawmaster and Starosta exchange a glance before the Lawmaster continues to speak: it's out of our hands now. 17. Master Hellet seems to have friends in high places. 18. You noticed the elven gentleman on the way in, I suppose? 19. That... is a representative of a member of the Cerberus Assembly. 20. I have been instructed to release Master Hallet into his custody, and have done so. 21. That, I'm afraid, is all I can say on the matter. 22. (If you are from the Empire, which I think is most of you, you would know that the Cerberus Assembly is the powerful organisation of mages in the Dwendalian Empire. 23. Otherwise, you would need to make a History check.)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Deciding to finish up your exploration of the ground floor of the manor, you first head into the room opposite the entry hall. 2. The room was clearly the dining room. 3. Though in need of a good clean, it remains remarkably intact. 4. A large table and eight matching chairs in the Cormyrian style dominate the room. 5. The furnishings are high quality, and those of you who have experience in the upper-class areas of Faerûn's larger settlements recognise this as a set that could fetch 100 gold in a major town or city. 6. Unfortunately, their size and weight is such that getting them there would prove to be troublesome. 7. Gingerly heading into the final room with Brozak in the lead; you find that this area was clearly the kitchen, as evident from the oven and the numerous cooking utensils scattered around the room. 8. Less indicative of a typical kitchen is the shattered remains of a statue scattered across the middle of the floor. 9. On further inspection, it appears that parts of the statue resemble a large beak, a large bird-like talon and part of a shortsword or dagger. 10. At the opposite end of the kitchen,a fallen cabinet strewn with utensils and broken crockery has been fashioned into some kind of crude nest. 11. As you begin to look through the kitchen as a group, Abner kicks part of the nest and scatters it across the floor, revealing what appears to be the handle to a trapdoor beneath the mess of cutlery and pottery.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Round Summary: 1. 2. Melkias - Dissonant Whispers, 17 damage 2. 3. Ajax - reaction, attacks Monster 2, 9 damage; attack - first attack misses, second 6 damage 3. 4. Mulligan - reaction (riposte) critical (Yes, double dmg, so I will just double the 8), 26 damage; (applying attack to Monster 3), 9 damage 4. 5. Delg - Inflict wounds, 18 damage 5. 6. Raya - looks around for a target, sniffing the air Monsters: Monster 1 - WIS Save - 8 - fail The bugbear suddenly grabs its head, howling in pain, then collapses to the floor, dead. 7. Monster 2 -15 HP The bugbear, seeing his companion fall, roars in anger. 8. His voice is suddenly cut off when Ajax attacks. 9. He dodges the first swing, but is caught in the stomach by the butt of the weapon. 10. As he doubles over in pain, he is hit by Mulligan. 11. With a vicious swing, Mulligan drops the monster. 12. It lays on the ground, one side of its skull caved in, the jeweled eyepatch incongruous against the gore. 13. Monster 3 -9 HP Turning, Mulligan swings at the remaining monster, connecting with a loud whump! 14. The bugbear howls in pain. 15. As the monster is distracted, Delg darts in and casts Inflict Wounds, dealing a fatal blow to the monster. 16. As soon as the last bugbear falls, you all hear the voice in your heads. 17. "Yessss, hairy meat. 18. Bring. 19. Trade," the gravelly voice says, then cackles hideously. 20. ((The immediate danger is past, so we are no longer in combat. 21. Raya - you may retcon another action since the monsters were defeated prior to your turn.)) 22. ((Also, everyone take inspiration!))

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Epos and Xel rush to help the fallen Khial. 2. There is a burnt smell in the air as they approach the fallen rogue. 3. Despite his medical training from the monastery, Epos is unable to stabilize Khial. 4. Xel, however, recognizes the symptoms of what seems to be electric shock in Khial (he remembers watching a miscast Shocking Grasp cantrip during his magical training) and is able to stabilize the rogue. 5. The Herr Doktor Professor rushes up and examines the fallen Khial. 6. "He seems to have stabilized," the Herr Doktor Professor says. 7. "It is a pity I have no healing spells to help him with, isn't it, nicht wahr? 8. "However, I do have this healing potion," he says, pulling out a vial. 9. "I vill expect compensation for using it, of course." 10. The Herr Doktor Professor feeds the healing potion to Khial; the rogue regains 7 hit points. 11. When the rogue regains consciousness, he tells Xel and Epos that he remembers being struck by something after touching the sigil, but did not see what it was before being knocked unconscious. 12. "A most excellent idea," says the Herr Doktor Professor. 13. He looks the party over. 14. "However," he says, "I notice that none of you are carrying that adventurer's staple -- the 10-foot pole. 15. Such a thing would be most useful now, I think."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Kazri, you cannot leave the keep from H9 as the outer walls only have arrow slits which are too small for a medium sized creature to fit through. 2. The only places you can exit the main floor is the door at the bridge to the gatehouse and the 2 sections that have collapsed. 3. Sheer cliff walls are below those areas and it would take skill to climb. 4. It is clear the keep was built to be easily defended from attack as the only access is the narrow path with the gatehouse creating another bottleneck. 5. Continuing up the stairs you find yourself in a large room (H19).Ice covers the walls and floor while the ceiling is covered with jagged ice hanging from it. 6. It is considerably colder in this room and outside you can hear the cold wind howling. 7. Frozen rain can be seen falling outside if you look through the arrow slits. 8. The floor becomes slippery but if you move slowly you keep yourself from falling. 9. (difficult terrain so half movement.) 10. Smashed doors indicate that at some point the dragon came through here. 11. It may even lair in here at times. 12. The half eaten remains of a large orc chief lay in the corner frozen in place. 13. A hand still clutches a large greatsword. 14. Unlike the other weapons found in the keep that were rusted and pitted this one still gleams with a sharp edge.The room is decorated with the spoils of war, including impressive-looking furniture that is mostly destroyed. 15. Also heaped about the room are furs, antlers, the rotting heads of dwarves, humans, and orcs mostly, as well as other trophies an orc chief might collect. 16. Everything is covered in ice and frozen in place.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Vondal, you don't recognize the design of the masks and cloaks per se, but seeing as how they are the same, you get the distinct impression that these are cultists. 2. "Cultist" is a broad term describing an individual who works with a group toward a common — and often fanatical — ideal or goal. 3. Just because someone is a cultist doesn't mean they are evil or can't be trusted, but those that make it into books and museums are most often notorious. 4. The masks appear to have stylized horns, and the robes, which you can see now are more cloaks, have a reverse scallop design. 5. The standing cultist looks at the one on the floor and back at Karl. 6. "We heard you knock, and we decided to not answer," the man says, anger coloring his tone, though he appears to be holding himself back. 7. "That means we don't want to be disturbed. 8. It's allowed, you know. 9. It's not an invitation to break our door down." 10. He looks down at the one on the floor again. 11. "Oh, get up," he snaps. 12. "You're not hurt." 13. The cowering one gets up, cradling an arm as he retreats through the interior doorway behind the standing cultist. 14. Karl watches the man leave, and catches a glimpse of a few more masks peeking around the talker. 15. "We have nothing to offer you, so if you'll kindly leave, we have a door to repair," the cultist growls. 16. As soon as Vondal mentions the dragon, the lead cultist turns and begins speaking quietly with the others behind in a language neither of the dwarves understand. 17. The monk finishes what he says, but is fairly certain most of it is being ignored. 18. Karl speaks up to regain command of the conversation. 19. The cultist turns back to the dwarves. 20. "What are your intentions with the dragon?" 21. he asks, clearly judging Karl and Vondal's motives. 22. The cultist looks put out by all the talking in Dwarvish, folding his arms over his chest. 23. "We have a tribute," he says warily. 24. "We were waiting until an appropriate time to present it. 25. And, no, it isn't one of our number," he says in an "Are you an idiot?" 26. tone of voice. 27. Vondal, he seems to be telling the truth, however carefully. 28. He clearly doesn't trust you fully.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The employees don't seem to notice Kasha tickling Alys wildly. 2. After your massages are finished, the four of you are led to another room where you're given mani-pedis. 3. The nails on your fingers and toes are clipped and filed to be of a more normal length. 4. The attendants massage your hands and feet before bringing out four small tubs and washing your feet before they bring out pumice stones to get rid of the dead skin on your soles. 5. It tickles a bit. 6. Then they paint the nails on your fingers and toes, whichever color you want and while you wait for it to dry, the four of you are given your facials, complete with the eye fruits. 7. After about 30 minutes, your mud wrap is finished and the four of you are washed off, feeling clean as your pores have been cleared by the wrap. 8. You are then led to a hot tub and a charcuterie board is placed next to the tub for you all to snack on while you relax in the tub.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Strix, your first blow with the quarterstaff pierces his chest, and obviously hits something vital; he slumps to the ground. 2. You race towards your friends, seeing Incantis and Dekhan both on the ground, and thwack, once with the quarterstaff, thump, once with your first. 3. The last bandit is hurt, very hurt, on the last of his strength, but a terrible grin crosses his face. 4. Better to die free than... 5. He stares at you, then at Scupper, readying his next and possibly last attack. 6. Round Six Varinth and Dekhan (bleeding out) Bandit 9, on death's door Incantis (bleeding out), Strix and Scupper - also Zhudala. 7. Dekhan, make a death saving throw. 8. Varinth is up. 9. I will assume that as the mage is dead, Varinth will hurl that at the other bandit? 10. If so, feel free to describe how you kill him. 11. Note that we are still in initiative. 12. Incantis, make a death saving throw. 13. Scupper and Strix are up. 14. Incantis has two successful death saves and one failed. 15. Dekhan has one failed death save. 16. The final bandit has no life and also no head, plus not much remaining flesh that hasn't burned away. 17. He's dead. 18. As death saves are still going on, we're staying in initiative and Scupper and Strix are next. 19. Options include making Medicine checks, the first at advantage because Zhudala is helping, possibly by eating charred flesh around the wounds to help with the application of bandages, I'm not quite sure and you never really know with imps. 20. Anyone got any potions?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Team Bird With all the buildings looking samey and lined almost into gridlike patterns, Thursday feels completely lost already. 2. The guide ushers the group to follow him, "Please, sir, this way to the Lord's halls." 3. He says, gesturing to head further within the city. 4. The Lord's Halls appear to be a two-story building that looks to be as wide as five of the normal buildings. 5. It doesn't appear that opulent, but does stand out because of its greater size. 6. Above the large archway that appears to lead beyond the entrance there is a marking on a sunburst. 7. "Our Lord and the court are within, Mahi ." 8. The guide says. 9. "It would be my honour to announce you to the court." 10. Team Bug It is quite difficult to not look inconspicuous as a group in completely different attire to everyone else within the walls. 11. Looking around Darnell can see that therea group appear to be playing with some wooden blocks and have a small pile of coral in the middle of the table. 12. The patrons seem to slowly notice the outsiders, watching them as they wander in. 13. Some seem to mutter to one another, looking at the genasi as if it were an alien lifeform. 14. At that point a shorter person rushes into the tavern, "Everyone!" 15. The youngish voice calls to the tavern folk. 16. "An avatar has arrived. 17. They look like Mahi!" 18. The tavern seems to stir at this noise, quite a few patrons getting up and following the youngster out, leaving their drinks.

Glasstaff, staff in one hand, reaches out the other to the giant spider in front of him and casts Shocking Grasp. 9. Attack: 23, damage: 2. 10. As a bonus action, he casts Misty Step to vanish without prompting attacks of opportunity, and then reappear in the corner, cowering behind Alotta. 11. "People, people, please. 12. I give up, I surrender. 13. Everyone cease this nasty business!" 14. Miss!Quick as an eye Alotta lashes out at Lyngheid with her Shortsword "Sorry, sweety, you wanted the big one, but all I have is this little one for you!" 19. Attack: 16. 20. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. It’s early morning, you probably get to Ankhapur by mid day tomorrow if you left right away by the sounds of it. 2. And yes you’d have some long rests. 3. You thank the orc for his hospitality (maybe?) 4. and set off towards the East on foot. 5. The environment stays very much the same. 6. Low flat green plains on the left and as the path veers left and right you get some glimpses of the water in the distance to the right. 7. Occasional groups of palm trees and fallen coconuts. 8. There is a more refreshing coastal breeze that brings that salty smell to the atmosphere. 9. After a long day of walking and the sun is close to setting. 10. You begin to look for a place to set up camp. 11. However just creating over the next hill you see a large group of humanoids walking down the same path in the opposite direction. 12. Walking towards you. 13. As they get closer you see it’s a group of soldiers 4 in all walking a line of chained prisoners to some destination back West. 14. The six prisoners are exhausted and caked in mud. 15. Their rough sack clothing crusted into a box like frame. 16. Perception check DC 15: Seeing the grungy and malnourished prisoners walk bye, the chains around their necks and hands clasped in front of them. 17. The second to last prisoner Is a Goliath, bald and clean shaven. 18. Underneath the tattered tunic, on the left forearm you see a tattoo that looks like the tail end of a snake (very reminiscent of a symbol of Asmodeus) Perception DC 20: You see everything in the DC 15 window in addition to. 19. Under the shin guard of the last guard in line is a matching iconography of an Asmodeus tattoo hidden from those who wouldn’t know the meaning.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Captain just squints his little puppy eyes at you. 2. Meanwhile, if the DM may interject to summarize what you’ve learned. 3. The Port Masons currently have a front in the Guildmaster district, operating as a legitimate business for whatever reason. 4. The fact that these gangs seem immune to the shadow’s vision is concerning. 5. Melvin was thankfully able to provide information. 6. As it stands, this is your only real lead on the Port Masons. 7. However, Wick is still missing, he hasn’t been seen in about a week. 8. Furthermore, Thuluku is still missing as well. 9. The small “babyholders” are the first to act. 10. Childish and maniacal, the small aberrations cackle with an uncomfortably deep voice as they shoot various rays at those around them... which happen to be you all! 11. Alijurn and Sunny are the most notable as they aren’t hiding. 12. The first ( 2 and 2 , 4 ) fires a yellow and a purple ray toward Alijurn! 13. The second, ( 2 and 3 ) fires a yellow and a blue ray at Sunny! 14. The third and final, ( 1 and 4 ) fires a pink ray and a purple ray. 15. The pink streaks toward Alijurn and the purple toward Sunny. 16. Alijurn, make a WIS, STR, and WIS save! 17. Sunny, make a WIS, DEX, and STR save!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Wilson's approach definitely catches Shatter's attention. 2. As he approaches, the mounted bird swirl to gain some height and a better advantage. 3. Pistol being drawn and quickly aimed over at the figure. 4. As Wilson get's closer, the pistol falls down to the side. 5. Hammer moving from the cocked to a relaxed postition. 6. The darkened T-shape visor of his adamantine helm looking over at Wilson as he approaches. 7. His bird continuing it's more forward approach; keeping a steady pace. 8. "The Wilson..." Shatter's voice muffled and echos inside his helm. 9. "Why are you here...." From down below, the crew sees Wilson and the large bird in the distance. 10. Nothing seemingly hostile going on between them. 11. Abigail takes a look around while Morgan is gone, closer towards the lone figure while Wilson is up in the air. 12. Knowing that time is of the essence, she looks around. 13. Seeing some of the crops that are bustling about. 14. Staying off the roads is key... and while wading through the terraced fields may be slower.. it will give some cover from the sky. 15. The gnome grumbles, but doesn't give too much of a complaint. 16. Following the tabaxi to get out of sight. 17. It seems like this could certainly work. 18. Opposed Notice:21Remembering the smell:10 Morgan goes to reach down, attempting to slink through the tall grass. 19. Getting closer and closer. 20. A hand reaching out to attempt to grab towards the belt before a loud thwack rings in Morgan's head. 21. The Loxodon's massive fist coming around andstriking right across the shoulder and collar bone; like being hit with a hammer (4 dmg). 22. "Thief, I have no time for you, or your plight." 23. He makes a head gesture for them to scurryoff, hand moving to rest on the blades and tonic. 24. Other hand still out reached, waiting.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The next morning everyone wakes up and prepares for their journey. 2. After glancing over Sylrie and trying to use your magic on him...something just isn't working. 3. His eyesight is still gone, and his eyes are milky white with hints of purple specks in them. 4. Medicine check on Sylrie, whoever would like to look him over and has that skill. 5. Arcana would work here as well. 6. Over the next few days, the special unit called Greywind from Aundair moves carefully through the countryside towards Gregorsin. 7. Keeping to animal trails and off the main road to not call any more undue attention to the mercenary group. 8. Dot will keep to herself, going over maps and giving simple instructions. 9. Sarge will make sure camp, patrol, and travel is taken care of as you get closer to your objective. 10. Four days after the cave-in, the sun will rise behind a conglomeration of clouds. 11. You can barely tell that it's morning when the rains start. 12. Sylrie, still blinded... give me a Con Save, please? " 13. Wake up, you lot. 14. We're getting close to Gable's Run. 15. A small village of hunters. 16. LT wants us to stop there and locals, maybe hear about any word from Gregorsin. " 17. Sarge will go back to the covered campfire and try to salvage the porage he was making for breakfast. " 18. This rain ain't helping us one bit today ."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Looking around Timber and Ransyl see an18-foot-tall stone statue of a Chultan warrior in splint armor, wearing a helmet festooned with tyrannosaurus teeth and bearing a shield of intricately patterned leopard hide, towers over the chamber and looms above a wide, octagonal cistern. 2. The chamber echoes with the sound of rainwater dripping from the ceiling into the gaping pit. 3. The face of the giant warrior statue is obliterated by deep gouges, but the rest of the statue remains intact. 4. Clutched in the statue’s right hand is a stone spear, and resting on the floor beneath it is a clay urn. 5. North of the statue is an open balcony overlooking a flooded garden. 6. Standing to one side of the giant warrior is another statue, this one much smaller. 7. Exquisitely lifelike, it depicts a man reaching for the urn, his face turned toward the balcony. 8. In his lifeless eyes, you see terror. 9. Stone steps ascend along the curved wall to the level of a second floor, but that floor is almost entirely collapsed. 10. Someone’s been up there, however, because a message of some sort is scrawled across the domed ceiling. 11. The eastern side has a door that worked previously but due to the building shifting slightly when the roof collapsed is now stuck. 12. On the western side is another doorway, the hinges broken and the door laying to the side. 13. Both Keyleth and Kirinar hit the mantrap with their attacks for 23 total damage. 14. The mantrap moves 5 feet closer to Kirinar. 15. Who would have thought a plant like that could move through the dirt. 16. Keyleth is up.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Esmee thinks the shelter will be OK as long as no big boulders fall on it. 2. The two trees that make the bulk of the roof are stout, around 14"-16" diameter. 3. With Vicious tethered securely he waddles out to take a look. 4. DM Stuff 7 - 4 - 2 - 1 - 1 - 3 - 1 - 4 19 - 59 - 7 - 74 - 77 - 50 - 63 Eikis using Vicious as her eyes sees that there is a possibility of stuff falling on the shelter. 5. It is getting harder and harder to see though with the sun going down. 6. However there's stuff falling up and down the pass from the shelter also. 7. So you're in a bit of a quandary. 8. You can stay in the shelter and hope it's strong enough to survive anything that might come down on it, or leave and hope you can see anything falling in time to avoid it. 9. In doing a thorough search of the area you don't find anything alarming. 10. Barmo doesn't recognize the type of mushroom but with Eikis's purify it doesn't matter so much. 11. There aren't any tracks going or coming from the water. 12. The recent storm has washed away small tracks but you don't see any larger tracks either. 13. Ed easily find stuff to build a fire. 14. Although most of the wood is wet, with a little searching you find some dryer pieces tucked away under small ledges. 15. Until the fire really gets going it will put out a lot of smoke.

Theodore, you sense that Shalech is close to the magic aura on the first floor; though you are having difficulties seeing it clearly. 3. You believe that you'll be able to identify it better if you go inside. 4. At a glance you can tell that the kitchen has been without use for years. 5. But to ensure not to miss anything that may be hidden from view, you search around the counters and cupboards looking for anything out of the ordinary. 6. The only thing you found was a small metal vial in one of the cupboards, covered in grime and the occasional animalfaeces from some small critter. 7. It has an open metal lid that looks like it seals the vial. 8. It is laying on its side and a black goop has pooled around the opening.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Leon missed again - the cat was too quick. 2. However, Alyssa's appearance with all the noise of falling and splashing, Ramious raging up there and Leon's attacks were scary enough for the panther to back of and run. 3. Black cat disappeared behind the door and got lost in the corridors. 4. It was only you now in the terrible room - Bernard, Leon and Alyssa with her glowing hands downstairs, while enlarged but now docile Ramious up in the giant's private quarters. 5. The light is not an illness itself - that much is clear. 6. Curing wounds did not affect it in any way. 7. It does not hurt, but the numbness of the skin in the spots is not reassuring. 8. And by now, looking at them in the light of the well, Alyssa can swear the spots are growing, if slowly. 9. It does not feel like anything anyone would want on themself. 10. Meanwhile Ramious searched the lair of the now dead giant. 11. The monster did keep some nice things around: a wooden cylinder that holds a spell scroll of detect magic, piles of rich cat furs, eight of the furs worth 5 gp each. 12. Two leather bags beneath the furs hold 1,000 sp each. 13. And lastly, an intricately carved ivory cube about 1 foot tall (worth 100 gp) which looks like a trick box.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Thank you for the laugh. 2. :) OK, to be fair to everyone else, let's roll a fumble for that first shot: 17 —17-18. 3. Ammo Accident. 4. Your quiver spills (50% strap broken, 50% you tilt it over by accident), and the remainder of your arrows / bolts fall to the floor. 5. If you remain still you can use a bonus action to pick up one a round and still fire using your action. 6. Otherwise you can use an action to pick up 2d8 and put them back in your quiver. 7. OK, so, no exploding bow. 8. Anafrey quickly draws an arrow, being a bitslipshod about it and doesn't realize it. 9. As she's about to loose her arrow, her quiver shifts on her shoulder, throwing off her balance. 10. She fires the arrow, it goes high, and then the sound of her remaining arrows clattering onto the stone floor echoes off the walls of the cavern. 11. A few roll off the ledge/bridge to the floor 20 feet below. 12. Saying a few choice words, she bends down and begins collecting her arrows. 13. Trying not to laugh (and not succeeding too well), Erric picks up where the huntress began and slings a projectile at each chest. 14. The first rock hits the chest at the end of the ledge/bridge, makesno sound ... and sticks to it. 15. The second rock tonk s against the chest below, bouncing off.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Dolgrim's hammer almost hits when the creature just creates a hole in the middle of itself (like a donut), making the hammer hit the floor. 2. A handlike form stretches out of both blobs and tries to hit Dolgrim and Barthrum. 3. Attack on Barthrum: 23 Damage: 6 bludgeoning damage plus3 acid damage. 4. Attack on Dolgrim: 22 Damage: 12 bludgeoning damage plus4 acid damage. 5. Both Dolgrim and Barthrum are hit, and the blobs hit hard. 6. Barthrum manages to take the hit but Dolgrim is thrown 5 ft. back and almost falls down. 7. Usually, this kind of blow would knock him unconscious, but this time it didn't. 8. It seems like his vitallity had risen, somehow. 9. Maybe sparring with Daran did it for him. 10. He's still badly hurt, but not out just yet! 11. (Dolgrim, congradulations! 12. You just hit lvl 2. 13. You can update your character sheet to match. 14. Do note that, while you are stronger and better trained, you didn't have time to try your magic yet so you can't use it yet. 15. During your next short/long rest/downtime you can roleplay experimenting with it to be able to use it after.) 16. Barthrum is up! 17. (Yes, you can move without provoking opportunity attacks this turn.) 18. As another chunk of the monster gets vaporized, it recoils back and begins to climb up the wall, all the way to the ceiling, and then starts to move a bit while sticking to the ceiling.Meanwhile, the other half moves forward towards you, but it moves relatively slow and it doesn't look like it will reach you in a few seconds. 19. (Thenmer and Dolgrim are 10 ft. away from the monster, who is right next to the door, and 20 ft. away from the wall on which the other one began to climb. 20. Barthrum ran out the door and is 15 ft. from the monster there.) 21. Barthrum is up!

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. honor as your two companions turn back, you continue on down the path to the South. 2. About 20 minutes later you come up to the sensation that you’ve been following. 3. It has been getting stronger the further south you go, clearly not moving away from you any longer. 4. Eventually you come to where a heavily muscled man is standing where the path turns back east. 5. The man has a shield and is wearing chain mail armor with a long sword at his hip. 6. He looks to be a little impatient. 7. As you walk up he glances in your direction but makes no threatening move. 8. The shield has your attention though. 9. He draws you like a magnet. 10. You have the very strong sense that it belongs to you. 11. "Oh, Higgul?" 12. Walter asks. 13. "He's as dumb as a box of rocks, but strong as a bull. 14. I'll have no problem getting him to see reason." 15. He considers it a moment. 16. "As for what he looks like... Never really thought about it much before. 17. He's bigger than me, with huge biceps. 18. He wears chain mail, always clinking around and scaring off the game you see. 19. He uses a longsword and shield, and is piss pour with his crossbow."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Spyro looks at you with a questioning look. " 2. Why not just head there in the morning and go down stairs? 3. Oh wait, guards and stuff. 4. So you need a secret way in eh? 5. I happen to know a few ways in to such an area. 6. Are you trying to break into the Justice building? 7. That might be interesting to see though I'm not really sure what's in there worth stealing. 8. And honestly those chaps with you don't look to be the stealing kind. 9. I suppose I could show you the way, for a fee of course ." 10. He grins very large, " We're friends Tisto, but not that good of friends. 11. I'll point you in the right direction for 10 gold pieces. 12. Easy work for easy money. 13. It's kinda a maze down there but easy enough if you know the way. " 14. Spyro drops 5 gold pieces into the outstretched hand of Callaphe. 15. She then gives a quick nod and motions you to follow her. 16. You settle in behind Callaphe as she moves up the street and around the corner. 17. Hardly seen, anyone passing by would have likely missed it, she slips behind a small opening in a fence beside a rundown building. 18. She then enters the building and down a flight of stairs. " 19. These lead to the old city ." 20. She informs you. " 21. Follow me ". 22. Lighting torches you enter acombination of natural tunnels, caves, and cellars that run under the city. 23. About 15 minutes in you see the flicker of torchlight up ahead from a room off to the side and hear hushed voices but you can't make out what they say. 24. You are about 50 feet away.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The sky is churning grey and black, and the kobolds are in a fervor around the shadow dragon.. Barxik, Emeny, and Nox combine their skills and magically produce a treasure pile with ease. 2. It looks so real. 3. All of you glance at it before making your moves. 4. Vappa has retreated into the brush and is watching the rest of the party and the surrounding area. 5. Kyu has persuaded Bartimaeus to head back towards town and they are going to look for the Mayor. 6. Ironwall is waiting by the treeline hoping to get to the fissure. 7. After the illusion is cast Barxik, Emeny, and Nox meet with Ironwall. 8. Rotleaf would love nothing more than to rush in and slay as many Kobolds as possible, but his better judgement overpowers his bloodlust. 9. He joinsKyu and Bartimaeus in their trek towards the mayor's home, on the other side of Bittborg, a tall tower is still strangely illuminated there. 10. Stealth roll 23 He also uses survival skills to track any other humanoids about 19 Anybody looking at the enemies suddenly loses sight of the dragon! 11. It is as if it simply faded into the dark and shadows and vanished. 12. The kobolds all start murmuring amongst themselves, yipping, shouting, and then all at once they start rushing towards the treasure pile! 13. Some of them are kicking and biting each other to get there faster. 14. Some of you are a bit taken aback as you see several of the kobolds jump into flight above the others! 15. Some can fly it seems.. 16. They show zero interest in whatever is happening in all of your directions. 17. In about 30 seconds to a minute some will arrive near the illusion.... All of the players waiting to go to the fissure hear a small familiar voice in their minds as Rotleaf tries to sneak with Kyu and Bartimaeus....: "Kyu and Bart want to go back in to town so I'm accompanying them. 18. I suggest you all either join us or take the chance to rush to the fissure until we can meet again." 19. His voice fades away and you are all left to make a decision...

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. OCC: We'll your not all dead yet... And you are close... As you jump into the water, the current quickly pulls you under and through the tube. 2. You tumble quickly as the river, swollen from the rains moves you along. 3. Struggling, you are able to occasionally gasp a breath of fresh air. 4. Enough, so that when you are ejected into the ocean's salt water a few minutes later you are still able to breath. 5. Though your weapons weigh you down, you are able to surface. 6. You find yourselves in a secluded cove, surrounded by a steep rocky coast. 7. To the southeast, there is a small passage leading out to the sea. 8. To the west, for about 30 ft. the climb up would be an almost vertical climb, with no visible shore, and to the east, the land rises from the sea only a mere 10 ft. to hide the cove and create a breakwater. 9. The rest of the shore boasts a small rocky shore, before climbing steeply about 40 ft. 10. The sun is now halfway between the its zenith and sunset, leaving you little time to find a way off the island.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Jove Investigation: 18 For Jove, Abraxas, Balin and Halsen: You notice a piece of crumpled paper laying next to the imp's fallen body. 2. The front doors of the ballroom slam shut, and the captain of the City Watch turns to the crowd. 3. "No one is allowed to leave until we conduct an investigation!" 4. Aria stumbles to her feet with the assistance of another City Watch guard, who helps her to the side of the stage and begins stabilizing her neck wound. 5. The captain walks to the stage and announces loudly, "Anyone willing to assist in the investigation, please step forward." 6. The crowd inside is composed mostly of commoners, nobility, and servants, and none of them seem eager to volunteer their help. 7. Shaking his head, the captain approaches the party. 8. "That was great work from you all. 9. I don't know if my men would have reached the devil in time if you had not intervened," he says, "Will you assist me? 10. I need to find out why an imp has suddenly appeared inside the villa, and my men and the Cassalanter guards will have their hands full keeping the crowd calm." 11. Abraxas History/Arcana: 10 For Jove: You notice a couple of interesting people when you scan the crowd:A human man who seems quite happy despite the circumstances, and a tiefling woman who is near the Cassalanter family who looks anxious. 12. For Abraxas: The rough shape of the page makes it difficult to determine anything about the book it came from. 13. You remember Aria motioning with her hands frequently during her performance, and don't recall seeing a paper in her hands at any point. 14. You are certain that this drawing is an ancient sigil representing Asmodeus, but are not certain what else that might mean. 15. A guard by Aria shouts to get Captain Staget's attention, and he walks over to the bard, who locks eyes with Harmony and motions for her to join them. 16. Ammalia draws her children to her side as she returns to her husband. 17. Her daughter lets out a squeak and clamps her hands over her mouth, staring at the party as they pore over the torn page.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ab, your shortsword pierces the Bugbears tough hide, and is solidly implanted in his back, nearly to the hilt, but to your horror, the monsterous humanoid turns back and gives you a bloody grin. 2. His body is visually sagging, he’s coughing up blood at a wonderful rate, and his body is more red then brown from the blood soaking his fur but he’s still barely up and running! 3. Berrus, Mav, and Kor, your turns are up! 4. No more flanking advantage for the rest of combat. 5. Mav, I’m assuming that means you’ve used relentless endurance. 6. Gotta say these things for record keeping purposes! 7. The mighty bugbear suddenly collapses to his knees once your elbow catches the side of his throat. 8. He quickly falls unconscious, and is splayed out on the floor, still bleeding freely. 9. The She-Wolf “She who dances in the hunt” gazed upon her fallen companions, before slowly backing off of Val’s body and trying to stalk towards the door leading out of the room. 10. She has apparently deemed the furnace too big a risk. 11. You all have about 2-3 minutes in game time to act out the after-battle before I continue things. 12. Val, as your slowly helped up, the party can hear the sounds of Goblin partying getting louder and louder, practically reverberating off the walls. 13. The She-Wolf is inching closer and closer to the exit, trying her hardest not to stick out. 14. Your buddy Berrus is starting to look particularly pale, blood is rushing out at a rather fast pace. 15. None of the three goblins are dead yet, btw, just bleeding out heavily into the cave floor.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The group makes camp. 2. Setting up the tent, cooking some food from small game and other things found during the journey. 3. So far, outside the ration Diadochi bet away, you all have yet to break into supplies. 4. Looking ahead and the eventual steep climb, it's a blessing. 5. Higher elevations, a temple, all places that there may not be things to eat, at least easily. 6. But you know you have at least another day or two before reaching there. 7. The night is crisp, the sounds of the ecosystem waking up filling the air more and more. 8. Colors of the old world swirling brighly in the sky out here. 9. The first watch group goes by without any issue. 10. Some light talking as they rotate on sentry duty letting the others rest, meditate, patch up the wounds from the day. 11. Sometimes sharpening a blade or making sure armor wasn't too tented. 12. As Abigail, Lefatha, and Yaalin maintain their watch, the fire suddenly goes out. 13. Both Abigail and Lafetha look around as the world shifts to a more grey color - your darkvision becoming stronger without the firelight. 14. as you turn to find out what happened, something's already gone. 15. Bags and supplies lay scattered around. 16. Yaalin, you find yourself in the dark suddenly. 17. Then, something grabs at one of your backpacks, trying to yank it away from you. 18. While you maintain your stance, you feel one of the bags get lighter. 19. Some of your items hitting the ground and spilling out. 20. When Lafetha and Abigail turn to the sound, you see one of Yaalin's sacks torn open just enough to let a small hand go through. 21. You search again, only to see a Goblin's face. 22. The same Goblin you saw on the ice field. 23. It placing a finger over its mouth, as if telling you to keep quiet, before it takes step away out of the range of your darkvision and into the night. 24. You glance back at Sim and Diadochi, they're physically fine. 25. Just bags turned over and some things scattered. 26. Yet, nobody has finished their long rest... and pursing now will lead you to chasing them in the dark... What do you do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The bears agree to aid you on the mission and follow you through the grove before you depart. 2. Button nods as the familiar legs uproot from the ground and now stands about 3 feet tall. 3. This huge mushroom (huge b mushroom standards) stands with an innocent smile and says, "Let's kill some bad people." 4. (You have faced guards that have 18, 24 and 36 health so far. 5. You aren't sure how hearty these guards are.) 6. "For the most part no. 7. However, they do check at least once every two hours. " 8. Inara responds. 9. The group goes their separate ways to prepare and gathers back in the grove to depart about 25 minutes later. 10. Inara opens a portal and you step through to a deep evergreen forest. 11. The air is slightly cooler and you make your way south until you come to the edge of the forest by the northwest side of the orphanage. 12. You see the guards patrolling the grounds and stationed by the front entrance now stand four guards and two hell hounds. 13. Stealth and Initiative! 14. (no combat yet, just saving time) map :

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. After a few minutes of following the dwarf's tracks around the different trees in the local vicinity,Shadow, Darnell, and Mara finds Sammeat curled up on the ground, shivering in a semi-conscious state. 2. Orianna feels like vomiting, buther stomach is empty, as only a bit of bile stings the bottom of her throat. 3. The below is for Simmeat You feel a voice whisper into your ear. 4. "YOU WILL NEVER SEE HER WHILE IN THE TOWER." 5. Thenthe whisps of smokey white begin to choke around Simmeat's throat, some of the "fumes" begin slipping into his mouth and nose, the taste of ash becomes overwhelming. 6. (Please make a DC 15 Wisdom Saving Throw , taking 9 necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much on a success) The time that this is happening seems to stretch out, the choking seemingly close to killing you, but never allowing you to fall unconscious, nor giving you relief. 7. "THE DEADWOOD IS FOR THE DEAD." 8. The voice tells you. 9. "EITHER JOIN US OR LEAVE US BE. 10. OUR GRAVES SHALL BE LEFT TO GROW UNTIL OUR SPIRITS CAN BE FREED FROM THIS TOWER."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Uthal was so focused on spitting blood on the zombie’s emotionless face that he failed to put any type of dexterous effort behind hitting the thing with his weapon. 2. Swinging the hammer down, he completely missed the zombie’s head, and the rest of him for that matter, simply bringing it down in empty space. 3. Fortunately, none of his compatriots happened to be standing there at the time. 4. Ander’s sword, however, once again cleaves in the fabric and the spoiled flesh of one of these creatures, hacking deep into the neck, right above it’s collar bone. 5. The creature buckled under the force of the blow, but still remained standing as Ander withdrew the sword. 6. As Uthal advances to the mouth of the corridor and proceeds to it, he sees a figure, one whom he’s familiar with, standing in the hallway right before it turns a corner and continues elsewhere. 7. At the same moment, the figure sees Uthal and smiles “Softie! 8. You’re alive.” There standing, with dual short swords in hand, that looked like they had been used in a similar manner to Uthal’s hammer, due to the evidence of decaying flesh and bodily fluids on them, was none other than the third part of his and Atal’s thieving trio, Richter. 9. ”Though I’d say with a much lighter load.” Richter continued, pointing out, with one of his blades, to Uthal’s lack of furs, armor, or bulging backpack.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Sitting at one of the dining chairs, Ron responds first to Van. 2. "There are my assistants at the lab, but other than them, none other in the area really research Heroics. 3. The Harlequin training grounds has a library. 4. It's about five miles out, opposite my lab. 5. I'd presume there's some books, here, too. 6. Sir Razgerah and the lady are also knowledgeable, as well as Master Tenebrum, though I'm not sure where to find him, if he's not at the training grounds." 7. He turns to Amandil. 8. "It is true that some arcane forces do react poorly to crossing planes, and some that simply fail in the process, but I don't think it's a common issue. 9. While I know a fair few things more about it than most, there happens to be a true expert on the subject here in the manor. 10. I doubt you'll find anyone as knowledgeable. 11. With Sir Razgerah's permission, you may be allowed to speak to him." 12. Shortly after, he rests his eyes while you tend to yourselves. 13. Varus returns on the balcony, informing you that Sir Razgerah will see you when he is ready. 14. He goes about the manor, first to the 2nd floor left wing, then to each wing on the first floor a few minutes later. 15. He then returns outside. 16. A few minutes later, a servant crosses the first floor, giving you a wide, respectful and silent space as he begins his duties for the day, looking a bit tired. 17. Ten minutes after that, another pair of guards come change shift with Varus and the other, and they go to the right wing at the first floor. 18. A few more servants move about the first floor, a couple going up the stairs. 19. Just seconds after one goes in the right (west) wing at the second floor, you hear a scream come from the same hall. 20. ((If you act, your rest is interrupted.))

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. At Brand's first question, the sphere goes up and down a little, perhaps about an inch. 2. At Brand's second question, the sphere goes from side to side a little. 3. The sphere then moves a few feet into the tunnel that is opposite the one Brand came up. 4. [[And it's once more after midnight. 5. Ciao.]] 6. Brand is unsure of the answer—an apparent 'no'—as he follows the glowing ball up the dark tunnel.In the distance, he can see a faint lightening of the darkness ofthe roof of the tunnel and he thinks he can hear the sound of more falling water in that direction. 7. [[Is Brand going to continue to use his Stone of Uplifting?]] 8. Using his stones to keep out of the water, Brand heads along the second tunnel, the light ahead of him growing stronger as he does. 9. There are other inflows into this tunnel, but none of them large enough for a man to pass through, and about thirty metres on, Brand reaches thetunnel's endwith more water—and the flickering of torchlight—comingin through an open grille in the roof about six or seven feet above his head. 10. Someone has attached a small length of rope to one ofthe hinges of thisgrille and he can see the scraping of dirty bootprints on the sides of the wall.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (The party rests, eats, takes a nap, and is up and ready to go at 3 am. 2. Augustus is very sleep deprived, constantly yawning and not going at a particularly good pace, but you all reach the Tapwell compound right around dawn. 3. The fence and gate wouldn't be particularly difficult to get around, though the gate does seem to be locked up.) 4. DM's note: Lena, go ahead and give me 2 Perception rolls and 1 stealth roll. 5. I need to know what kind of animal you've decided to go as. 6. You have 3 choices of routes: North Orchard, South Orchard, or up the Main Road. 7. (Lena continues towards the Cider Mill.) 8. Spoiler for Lena: As Lena approaches the Cider Mill, she notices an area where a gas lamp is shining some light and heads towards that area. 9. As she approaches, she sees a Goblin-like figure sitting against the wall, sleeping. 10. Observing more closely, she sees that this figure is actually NOT a Goblin at all! 11. It appears to be a Halfling, wearing a kind of half-mask on top of his head that, when down, would probably make them look like a Goblin. 12. It's a young male, Lightfoot Halfling, who is also wearing dirty Goblin armor. 13. His light snores ring out and drool runs along the side of his mouth. 14. Lena, you now have a choice of going to the Manor House, the Main Road, or going back to your party. 15. DM's note: Everyone else please give me a Perception check. 16. Everyone ignore this: 6

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Rain falls hard on a warm spring morning in the town of Knotside. 2. The battering against the windows of the Venerable Swordsman inn makes for a less than pleasant morning for our group of adventurers. 3. Around one of the tables, trying to enjoy a mornings breakfast before the day ahead, sits our party. 4. Brazzak: The Dragonborn Fighter, Heilamin: The Half-elf Bard, Loom: The Tiefling Paladin, Lorilla: The Forest Gnome Rogue, and Modron: The Rock Gnome Wizard. 5. Ava, the bartender and proprietor of the Swordsman, tends to her usual morning patrons and ensures the morning after drinks are topped off. 6. The group had just finished a long and hard fought campaign against a band of orcs and ogres, who had planned to raid and plunder the town of Knotside of it's people and goods. 7. They were able to defeated the band of orcs and slay the mighty orc leader, Gargus the Brutal. 8. The towns folk helped the adventurers celebrate with their grace and aflow of spirits at the Swordsman well into the night. 9. After a few jokes, laughs, and great stories of the hard fought battle, the doors to the Swordsman fling open violently and a small humanoid dashes in. 10. The strange fellow gives a quick glance around the room, see you all being the only large group of people in the inn, then bolts towards you. 11. Just as the anxious stranger is about to speak, two cloaked figures, both easily over six-feet tall, enter the Swordsman. 12. Both carry odd, wavy daggers on their belts. 13. It doesn't take a whole lot of smarts or wisdom to realize that these two are probably looking for the small creature standing by you. 14. While the cloaked figures glance around the room looking for their quarry, the small stranger gasps and reaches into its pocket. 15. With a clawed, orange hand he hands you what looks like a medallion of some sort. 16. "Keep it secret, keep it safe," he begs you through a thick goblinoid accent. 17. Before you can react, the goblin bolts outside of your reach and heads towards the back of the inn and runs out the back entrance. 18. Immediately, the cloaked pair notice the fleeing goblin and begin to move quickly in the same direction. 19. What do you do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The sleepy village of Heldren has rarely seen so much excitement or concern. 2. Hunters from the nearby Border Wood speak of unnaturally cold weather at the height of summer that descended on the forest just days ago. 3. Heavy snow followed, and those who returned spoke of an uneasy presence in the woods, as well as new, dangerous predators. 4. No one knows what this event means, but the town’s soothsayer, Old Mother Theodora, claims dark times lie ahead. 5. As if in proof of that dire prophecy, a badly wounded mercenary arrived in town yesterday, claiming to be a bodyguard of Lady Argentea Malassene. 6. He told the village council that the noblewoman’s escort came under attack by bandits and strange, wintry creatures near the edge of the Border Wood. 7. He alone escaped, and Lady Argentea was dragged away into the forest. 8. Now the townsfolk cast fearful eyes toward the snowy forest, worried what else might emerge to threaten their peaceful village. 9. Task One: To gather more information about these events in the Border Wood, roll a Persuasion check to gather information from the villagers. 10. There is no set DC for this check, but the higher you roll, the more information you will gather. 11. Task Two: As you go around the village asking about the events in the Border Wood and the unnatural cold, you very quickly notice that you aren't the only one searching for knowledge and that a few other eccentric individuals are also going through the same level of inquiry. 12. Introduce yourself to these weirdos your fellow party members.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The party continues to follow the ravine to the camp, pretending to be another group of raiders that lagged behind the main group. 2. Araider by the fire at the entrance looks up as he hears the group approaching, but doesn't bother to standor challenge you as you enter the camp. 3. As you pass the watch fire the ravine widens out and you enter the camp itself. 4. Enough cook fires are spread around the camp to allow you to see the basic layout, even in the dark, if not all the specific details, and provide dim light in most areas of the camp, at least near the tents, though it gets darker in between clusters of tents. 5. They've set up their camp in the hollow of a rocky plateau that’s shaped roughly like a horseshoe. 6. The lower portion of the plateau rises gently from the surrounding land, but it quickly steepens and ascends to a height of about 150 feet above the landscape. 7. Boulders form jumbled heaps at the bases of the cliffs. 8. The level shelves and top of the plateau are covered in long grass, and brush and scrubby trees grow in patches, reaching 4-6 feet high. 9. (Everyone give me a charisma check with disadvantage. 10. Maythus with a -4 penalty as well)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ront is slowly moved into the smaller cave, watched over by Gnarls and El as the rest. 2. Shishakli and Cyndral continue their watch before Tobias and Sarith start theirs. 3. The rest of the evening passes by uneventfuly, with a few moans and groans from Ront as he sleeps. 4. After 8 hours, everyone begins to wake. 5. (During this time you’ve all had time to reflect on your predicament and the day you’ve just had. 6. You’ve now all reached level 2) While thinking about the day, Gnarls looks at the small doll that he’d found on one of the Drow. 7. Before going on his guard shift, Sarith sees it “Where did you get that? 8. The Drow call them Kinfel Dolls. 9. They’re normally given to warriors as good luck charms from loved ones” Ront groans once more as he wakes up and sees Gnarls and El in the cave with him “What happened? 10. Where’s that dwarf?” He goes to stand up and stumbles as he puts weight onto his wounded leg. 11. Ront grunts at El’s words, still groaning as he stands. 12. The big confident Orc appears to have grown a more ashamed and embarrassed side but is too proud to accept it. 13. (Stockpiling the rations for the group will be the best way to keep track of food for now. 14. I’ll let you all know how much everyone has if the group splits up for any reason. 15. Having disregarded all OOC rolls for traveling etc. 16. I’ll require a new roll for the vials, it’s a bit odd if we only keep the good rolls and get rid of the bad ones)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. All around the tavern and common room serving boys and girls quickly set the tables and several overturned chairs back to their rightful place and gather the fallen creatures. 2. Rather quickly it s business as usual except for the grouo of young adventurers who have lost one of their friends. 3. Duncan tries to see if he can help but they turn their back to him. 4. The leader's body is still at the bottom of the well. 5. Silently they move to the main door and dissappear in the night. 6. At the table Volo nods his greetings at the Goblin and then at the Kobold. 7. "Well." 8. he says " that s a rather nice surprise. 9. I seem to remember a story beginning just like that. 10. It was in Amn before the..." he stops himself and blushes a little. 11. Self aware. 12. "Well yes, sorry I was late there was something I needed to do a'd got held up.... 13. Literally." 14. he chuckles to himself. 15. "Sorry, I need to introduce myself." 16. he says when the others arrive at the table.He strokes his mustache, adjusts his floppy hat, and tightens his scarf. 17. “Volothamp Geddarm, chronicler, wizard, and celebrity, at your service. 18. I trust you’ve noted the violence in our fair city these past tendays. 19. I haven’t seen so much blood since my last visit to Baldur’s Gate! 20. But now I fear I have misplaced a friend amid this odious malevolence. 21. “My friend’s name is Floon Blagmaar. 22. He’s got more beauty than brains, and I worry he took a bad way home a couple nights ago and was kidnapped — or worse. 23. If you agree to track him down with all due haste, I can offer you ten dragons apiece now, and I can give you each ten times that when you find Floon. 24. May I prevail upon you in my hour of need?” Insight roll DC 10. 25. Read if succeeded Volo seems genuanly worried abut his young friend.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The axes fly through the air and slam true against their targets digging hard into their respective steel armor pieces. 2. The powerful attacks even cause one of the suites to temporarily stagger from the blow. 3. But both armors were already moving from the moment Sora stepped into the dining hall. 4. The same unnatural movements driving the constructs forward as before, however these movements felt quicker, and smoother, as if better suited for combat. 5. The armors walk up next to Sora, swinging their gauntleted fists towards her. 6. Combat Start Animated Armor Attacks Attack: 19 Damage: 4 Attack: 5 Damage: 3 Attack: 22 Damage: 3 Attack: 19 Damage: 3 Sora takes 5 points of bludgeoning damage (after resistance) Initiative Rolls: 9 - 18 Kal'Duros - 12 Khorzik - 19 Nemeia - 20 Sora - 5 Witt - 9 The party can now take their turns The group continues their collective assault against the walking plate armors, both constructs appear very close to being completely ruined. 7. Despite this, they manage to persist the collective attacks, as their sturdy metal plates manage to deflect most of the attacks, leaving them dented and scuffed, but still moving. 8. One of the armors continues attacking Sora with its heavy metal fists but the other turns to face Khorzik, trying to put an end to his constant electrical attacks. 9. First Armor Against Khorzik Attack: 10 Damage: 3 Attack: 5 Damage: 3 Both attacks miss. 10. Second Armor Against Sora Attack: 5 Damage: 7 Attack: 21 Damage: 5 2 more damage after resistances. 11. As Sora's swings land with powerful blows to each of the animated armors, they finally succumb to their battered forms and crumple to the ground. 12. The various ruined and dented metal plates scatter across the floor as the magic that moved them can no longer remained contained and disperses. 13. Just like that, the large dining hall is filled with silence once again, with nothing other then the group members moving throughout the entire room. 14. Combat End

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Fang, the stairs go down for about 20ft before opening into a 30 by 30 foot room, full of broken crates and piles of rubble from the partialy collapsed celling, you can tell that no one has been here for ages, exept for the few bugs that have made their homes in the rubble, but why? 2. You see 2 wooden doors, one in front of you, and one to the left. 3. At about this time Baxthon walks in behind you, much slower and calmer than you did. 4. Daeron, Panavor and Baxthon, you notice that the room does in fact have adequate support, so the celling could not have collapsed on its own. 5. The simple wooden door opens to a tunnel that goes about 30ft forwards to a metal door with a lever next to it. 6. Pillars support both walls, but one is collapsed, causing the ceiling above that part of the wall to shift and fall apart a bit.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Darik : You are walking out from the temple you are immediately are met with stares and whispers. 2. There are people moving about, devotees of Chauntea as well as humans who work within the temple. 3. You have seen dwarves, elves, and half-elves among those in the temple but now outside the city seems dominated by humans! 4. You have yet to seen another dragonborn but even with the stares and whispers no one tries to stop you. 5. Outside the temple you realize the central market is before you. 6. It's decked out with decorations of bows of wheat and other greenery for the festival of Chauntea. 7. The mood is relaxed even as you begin to move through the crowds. 8. You then see Erevan playing with a male blonde halfling playing a drum! 9. Darik: "How about I sell you none for nothing," retorts the half-elven man with a smirk. 10. "It takes my wife and I days to find these herbs and months to prepare these bundles. 11. If you want a discount friend take you business else where," he adds firmly crossing his arms over his chest which he's puffing out. 12. You then see the two women return from the inside of the caravan. 13. Roll perception please! 14. Erevan: Roll investigation please

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Demetrio, you see the empty countryside around you, with little movement to speak of. 2. From time to time, as you pass through a few hundred feet of woods, you keep a keen eye out, but notice nothing out of the ordinary. 3. The oxen seem to get over their initial anxiety in the morning, and you all continue on your way. 4. The sun reaches its peak and continues to descend; you reckon you are not far from the turning south to Phandalin. 5. You approach a corner in the path headed through a forested area; there are steep embankments and dense thickets to either side of the road. 6. You turn the corner, and before you on the trail you see two horses lying still across your path, about fifty feet ahead of you. 7. There are black-feathered arrows sticking out of each. 8. The horses appear from this distance to be dead. 9. They block the trail, and will need to be moved in order to get the cart through. 10. What would you like to do?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Wisdom Saving Throw: 11 ) The spider wretches in agony as the black smoke of the spell enters its body. 2. It looks to and from, seeking out the unseen enemy which seeks its end, momentarily ignoring the enemies in front of it as it turns from side to side. 3. Valji continues electrocuting it as the spider retreats towards the nearest pillar, blinded by the pain wracking its fragile mind. 4. As the last of the black smoke coming from Darvins mouth fills it, the spider shrieks, its dessicated carapace cracking under the weight of the combined assault. 5. Green light flows out of the growing rifts in its exoskeleton until there is an explosion of arcane energy which fills the entire cavern with an otherworldly light. 6. As your eyes readjust to the dimly lit cavern, the lifeless carcass of a giant spider lays in front of you, legs pulled inward in a last ditch effort to protect itself. 7. All is quiet with the exception of the skittering of the smaller spiders all around, terrifying in their own way, but mostly harmless without the leadership of their queen.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Incantis, your Eldritch Blast hits the remaining skeleton with such force that some of the bones turn into a cloud of dust that lingers in the air for a moment. 2. Dario and Incantis, you made extremely short work of these undead - combat is now over. 3. As silence comes over the crypt, you do suddenly hear a noise - coming from the door on the east side of the north part of the room. 4. It sounds as though someone is locking the door, and then immediately, you seem to hear a bar being dropped in place. 5. What would you like to do? 6. An ability check is when you attempt to do something, rather than reacting and trying to save against someone else's actions. 7. An example would be an enemy that attempts to grapple you and would therefore need to make an athletics check. 8. You could use Hex to give disadvantage on Strength checks, which would affect the enemy's athletics check. 9. Dario, the sarcophagi mostly contain dust, as the corpses that were previously inside seem to have been your enemies in this battle. 10. In the one belonging to the sword-wielding skeleton, you find a signet ring made of platinum; you estimate it is worth a fair amount, but don't know for sure. 11. No need to roll again, no.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Salida looks back at Fenrir and nods thanks. 2. Speaking in a low voice, she says, "Don't worry, we're not in any danger here. 3. It's just a couple of dinosaurs. 4. Stay quiet and they'll ignore us." 5. As if to back her up, Ambrosious Q. Stompers snorts and takes a bite from a nearby plant. 6. True to her word, the lumbering noise grows louder, and after a few minutes you are confronted by the sight of two enormous armored dinosaurs crossing your path, on their way to do... well, whatever the hell it is a pair of anklyosaurs get up to in their free time. 7. Raff's dart strikes one of them in the flank, and it snorts and flicks its tail, as if it suspects the presence of some kind of stinging insect. 8. Salida shoots Raff a particularly venemous look. 9. The anklyosaurs pause to snuffle around Ambrosious Q. Stompers' general facility before continuing on their journey. 10. Salida lets out a long sigh, then turns to Raff. 11. "In the future, maybe don't attack everything we come across, yes? 12. I'm trying to keep you lot alive. " 13. With a curt motion, she indicates the party should follow and takes off, muttering something under her breath that you don't quite catch ((unless you decide you really want to hear it and roll perception I guess)). 14. For the remainder of the day's march, the jungle seems surprisingly quiet. 15. Salida calls a hot to the march in a small cluster of trees. 16. "We'll camp here," she says, and begins setting up a tent for herself. 17. How do the rest of you help to prepare camp, if you help at all? 18. A handy list of options is below:

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Zeno again manages to shake off the effect of the myconids' spores, but does notice though that the myconids seem to shy away from the edges of the sunlight that Dawnbringer continues to shed throughout the garden. 2. He also notes that the ramp at the southern end of the garden, originally guarded by the land-lobsters, is now only blocked by the myconids and large fungoids nearby. 3. His efforts with Rhayna appear to be working as she leaves him and heads back toward the group, but Rhayna's whip strikes the drow's rusty crusty chain mail with no effect. 4. The air around the rest of the party is thick with clouds of spores of different hues, odours and effects. 5. Kaylyn is retching, Sekkar is confused and attacking Pax, and Kastix decides enough is enough and bolts. 6. But the chaos only gets worse as the demon speaks an Abyssal spell that only Rhayna can recognise, causing sticky, slimy, orange toadstools to burst spontaneously from the ground below. 7. Kaylyn/Pax/Sekkar: Make a DC 22 Strength check or be restrained by the Entangle spell. 8. S11 STR save: 6 The spore servants still within melee range of the group are also engulfed in the sticky mass, but they seem to lose interest in Sekkar and push in to attack Pax. 9. S2: Shortsword v Pax: Attack: 17 Damage: 6 piercingS4:Shortsword v Pax: Attack: 21 Damage: 4piercing Once outside the palisade, Kastix looks down into the basin of the grove and sees the groups of myconids still melding in their groups, seemingly unaware of (or unconcerned by) the chaos happening nearby. 10. Rhayna (29), Kaylyn (21), Kastix (18), Zuggtmoy (16), Spore Servants (16), Sekkar (13), Chamberlains (12), Pax (11), Zeno (7), Myconids (5), Bridesmaids (2) MAP: The orange box is the area of Entangle. 11. Yellow circles = Dawnbringer light. 12. Purple circle = Zuggtmoy spores. 13. Green circle = Yestabrod spores. 14. Map of south for potential escape route:
