Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Damian unleashes a blow against a goblin, but the goblin is too quick and blocks the attack. 2. Rashana's meanwhile also tries to strike a goblin in rapid succession. 3. Unfortunately, these goblins seem to be quicker than first thought as Rasshana's attacks are too blocked. 4. However, your luck changes as Saravena raises her crossbow and shoots a bolt at a goblin. 5. She manages to pierce the creature in the eye killing it instantly. 6. With another goblin killed, six goblins currently remain on the field of battle. 7. Then Eniwin steps up and casts fire bolt at one of the remaining goblins. 8. Instantly, the creature is immolated and it screams in agony as it burns to death. 9. Leaving just five goblins on the field. 10. In order to get some distance between you, the goblins back away from you (Nimble escape: disengage as a bonus action) before firing another arrow each from their short bows. 11. (Damian - Attack: 10 Damage: 6Eniwin - Attack: 13 Damage: 6Rashana - Attack: 22 Damage: 7Saravena - Attack: 13 Damage: 6Tagret - Attack: 16 Damage: 5) Rashana's attacks are quick and accurate. 12. The goblin can barely react before her quarterstaff cracks his skull, and her punch finishes him off. 13. Quickly afterwards, Saravena fires another arrow and piercesanother goblin in the heart killing him too. 14. Then Eniwinwho was caught by the arrow fired from a goblin, steps forward and casts fire bolt at thelast remaining goblin. 15. However, the goblin ducks out of the way of the mote of fire, which soars of his head. 16. After standing back up, the goblin takes a few steps back before firing an arrow at Tagret. 17. (Attack:Attack: 24 Damage: 12) DM Note: Yeah, if you want to take a short rest you can do.

She is an entity who focuses on scavenging, hoarding, and living off the oceans bounty. 4. They are slightly xenophobic. 5. As a whole, they are a bit crazed and excitable. 6. Dawnbringer says, "I will if they attack. 7. I don't like harming innocents. 8. We don't know their intentions yet." 9. You hear a watery voice cry out in Undercommon, "Prepare to be boarded and captured! 10. We will escort you to Sloobludop! 11. In chains! 12. Praise the Sea Mother for our bounty!!!" 13. Stagger yourselves and meet me there, away from prying ears. 4. Then we'll plan out how we're going to discover what's in those wagons." 5. "Arliden, these guards are more insular than uptight. 6. No telling how they'd react to you singing, but they would definitely know who you are on sight by now. 7. "Fjordix, I'm not sure that openly challenging them is the wisest idea, but that would certainly get their attention." 8. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. DM Screen: 127/144 Unarmed Strike vs. Gruun: 12 Unarmed Strike vs. Gruun: 27 (no advantage on these because they happen before Reckless Attack) Killian WIS Save: 15 (advantage from Countercharm, +6 because I messed up the roll) Releasing the vampire, Gruun throws his weight into two heavy swings of his axe. 2. The vampire stops both with his hands, allowing the blade to cut into seemingly resistant skin. 3. Killian strides forward, tearing into the vampire's back twice while his attention is turned. 4. Unlike Gruun's axe and the daggers of Hox , which have similar trouble sinking in,the man lets out a howl of pain as Killian's sword draws black blood from vicious wounds. 5. The vampire's hands begin to smoke and repair themselves while he steps toward Gruun, punching both arms forward and dealing 5 bludgeoning damage. 6. Looking to Killian, he states, "Put that thing away before you hurt someone, will you?" 7. The sound of Zane 's lute plays like a beacon of clarity to the paladin's mind, reinforcing her will to ignore the sudden compulsion to comply. 8. Across the deck, the three sailors fall over the second intruder, who ignores them while pulling the patrolman in toward him. 9. With a horrible ripping and gurgling sound, he bites down and tears the sailor's throat out, leaving him to bleed out on the now-stained deck. 10. Round 3 Order: Players <===== Vampire Placement: The vampire is engaged in melee combat with Gruun, Hox, and Killian. 11. Zane is 20 feet away. 12. Tracking: The vampire has taken light damage. 13. Gruun and Killian have taken light damage. 14. Killian has bardic inspiration (d8).

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (I realized I never answered Halt's question.) 2. @ Halt The people in the car are either too busy setting their luggage about or recovering from the rush. 3. The few passangers that are already set in are is just making room for the other passengers. 4. The half-elf beams brightly, "Well I was sent an invitation from my cousin in Sharn. 5. He wants me to help him with an expedition he has planned. 6. If everything goes well, he'll recommend me for Clifftop's Guild!" 7. The boy says proudly. 8. @ Faereth The goblin nods, "Yea, just gotta go past the coach car. 9. It'll be in the car with a bunch of tables at the front of the car. 10. I can save your spot for you, toots." 11. The goblin grins. 12. @ Carric From previous studies, you remember that warforged can repair themselves through something similar to your trance. 13. Though they have to remain inactive, their armor will repair themselves through magical means powered through their core. 14. The train suddenly shifts in place as it slowly starts moving. 15. A crewman comes into the steerage car as he raises his hand, "Attention please, attention. 16. We shall arrive in Sharn in two hours. 17. If anyone needs a meal, the chefs will have something prepared in thirty minutes. 18. Head to the dining car and our staff will serve you a meal according to your ticket. 19. If there's any problems, please tell a crewman and we will try our best to help you." 20. The man gives a slight bow as he heads to the cargo car in the back. 21. @Carric As the man finishes his speech, you can sense the magic around the warforged dissipate. 22. As it does, the warforged seems to be more alert. 23. Once the man is in the cargo car, the one besides Carric stands up, "Excuse me." 24. He says as he walks out of his seat. 25. He heads to the cargo car.

Chubby can do at advantage due to his face bandanna. 5. The room you’re in looks like this below: the small door to the north looks caved in and blocked by solid rock, you can travel east or south. 6. Through the open doorway to the East, you make out a rope bridge. 7. The open doorway to the south shows a coridoor leading down. 8. You peer into this large room. 9. Quite sizable at 30x40 feet, it features a number of wooden pannels which look like shelves running around the room attached to the walls, and at different heights. 10. On some of these, especially the higher ones, expensive and fragile looking vases sit atop. 11. Scattered around the floor are wooden posts, around 5’ high, covered in a paperbark which has a very similar texture to finer carpets you have seen in travel vendors before. 12. Along the roof, you see a number of small mirrors in a line and on the Eastern wall, there appears to be a lever. 13. You see four other exits other than the one you just entered, leading through the north, south, east and western walls.

The weather is grim and not getting more pleasant. 4. Serious rain begins around midday. 5. Silent, your cloak offers a decent amount of protection, and of course rain doesn't bother Magnum, but you are finding it difficult and uncomfortable to talk in such heavy rain. 6. Will you continue on, or try to find a place for shelter? 7. You push through. 8. 16 Your progress is slowed a little by the rain, but you keep to the road, passing the occasional cart, though few others are braving the road in this weather. 9. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Effort and Brask find Burik outside training, swinging his weapons and blasting energy into the ether. 2. When he realizes it's time to go, he stuffs some things into his pack and joins you. 3. He remains shirtless for awhile, letting the breeze cool his overworked body. 4. It's an absolutely beautiful day. 5. There's still a chill in the air - you're quite high up, after all - but the sun's warm rays counteract it as you travel south. 6. For most of the day, the landscape remains the same. 7. Mountains to your left, pine forest and descending hills to your right. 8. You see a glistening river off in the distance beyond the hills, the most southern and largest of the tributaries extending out from Lovilra. 9. The peaks seem to be getting lower as the afternoon passes by. 10. Cadmael, scouting out ahead, notices some movement on the trail. 11. 4 Burik, the next time you attack or cast Chill Touch, you may do so with advantage. 12. He cruises down a bit lower, before noticing a skunk climbing out of a bush on the side of the trail. 13. Oh, I would watch your step as you move forward. 14. The skunk doesn't seem rabid or strange, but is foraging just ahead of you, about 100 feet. 15. You can continue going straight, you can climb up and around him to the left into the rockier section of the hills, or down and around to the right, into the denser forest.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Perception rolls for everyone: Bason: 16 Kestrell: 13 Phaedra: 6 Selinae: 5 Silver: 6 Vassa: 21 As you all are going about what you've said, Bason, Kestrell, and Vassa will notice the City Guard shifting around and standing straighter, all looking towards a pair of men who just walked into the alley from the north entrance, near the manor. 2. One of the men is wearing a City Watch uniform while the other man is dressed as a mage. 3. Behind them you see twenty constables following them into the alley. 4. The mage quickly gives orders to the constables and guards. 5. Soon everyone is being told to return to their homes if they live in the alley. 6. Those who don't live there are each paired with a constable who starts questioning them. 7. The mage starts examining the bodies. 8. Bason overhears a conversation near him: A constable approaches Mrs. Hornraven, "Ma'am, I know that you don't live in this area. 9. Is your husband nearby?" 10. The woman's entire demeanor changes. 11. While you still see some of the emotion she was just showing, this woman has stilled her face and is now all business. 12. She lets out an airy laugh, "No sir, Constable. 13. Seeing how I came here to hire a private investigator to check into some of his dealings I thought it prudent not to bring him along. 14. I assume we can settle this matter quickly and let me get back to my estate?" 15. "Absolutely ma'am," replies the constable, "Please follow me to the side here where we can speak in peace and I'll take your statement and then ensure the City Guard lets you exit the alley." 16. Bason is approached by another constable, like everyone else. 17. "Sir, do you live here in the alley? 18. If so I need you to return to you home where someone will come and question you shortly." 19. Within moments there's a group of three constables heading to the east side of the alley. 20. "Excuse me? 21. The group of you will need to be questioned. 22. Do you live here in the alley?"

It takes Connar a moment to determine what is happening as the door suddenly tumbles away from him into the yawning void down to the countryside far below, the entire room beyond the door from has fallen away and he is staring down at the passing scenery. 4. Connar grabs for the door frame but misses...he is moments away from falling to his death.... Dex Save: 10 OOC: Well it depends what your doing...tackling him away from the edge would be Athletics, Just grabbing him would be a straight Dex roll...etc. 5. strength check to stop you both going over as he's not exactly a lightweight.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Back Alley of "Lightning Toad" *************************To everyone behind the tavern except Nawien for obvious reasons******************************* All of a sudden there is a playful chuckle from the roof across the lightning toad, the laugh seems to fall from above getting closer. 2. From above an elf drops toward the cobble stone right beside the the now pale elf lying on the ground. 3. He seemingly lands hard yet your suprised when not even the slightest noise is made. 4. He stands about 5'11, he has two big daggers on either side of his richly made belt, the attire he wears itself looks similar to the below description *ooc* sorry its so big. 5. He looks toward the elf for a few moments before turning toward everyone else in the alley. 6. "W hat the machine says is true, this elf has been a key component to a very deeply and corrupt ring of deaths. 7. Its a shame he is dead, I could have used him to get even more information however. 8. . . thats the least of my concerns. 9. This elf was of high nobility and humans and elves have never got along too well. 10. I can take care of that situation however, if anyone is interested in stopping all of the sudden, staggering amounts of deaths all around Arkadia then speak now." 11. He then turns toward Thokk specifically before adding "And if its money your after, there will be plenty if the tasks are complete. 12. Dont decide too hastily however, the adventure can get very dangerous." 13. Discussing what to do next you and Ben dont even notice the elf that has approached from behind. " 14. Hello " he says, startling the both of you before continueing " My name is Zephyre, im sorry to intrude but i may be of some help as to what is happening and what "that" is " he points at the medallion in Bens grasp and waits for a reply. 15. The elf stands about 5'11, he has two big daggers on either side of his richly made belt, the attire he wears itself looks similar to the below description *OOC* Your character is unaware of the happenings several feet away as you and Ben have been completely distracted and occupied with each other.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Silas the trees in this forest are much more plentiful then you are used to, have grown thick and close together. 2. They choke out the ground and make travel threw them rather difficult but you become accustomed to it fairly quickly. 3. Leading your group threw the trees in the quickest way possible. 4. While you see no humanoid tracks, You do see Wolf tracks. 5. 2 or 3 at your best guest and a decent size as well. 6. This Thicket seems to be their territory which means their Den should be somewhere close by, Keeping your eyes peeled for a potential ambush by the Wolves you press on until you catch a familiar smell in the air. 7. Wood Smoke, there is a low burning campfire roughly 160 feet away from you. 8. You all get the scent of the Campfire but are unable to see its source until Silas point it out to you. 9. Sat by the campfire, sharpening a curved blade is a figure wearing a Red Cloak, the hood is down but they are sitting with their back facing you. 10. How do you guys want to handle this?

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Aluzira, thin columns of mist rise from the bog and the fallow fields in the chilly morning light as you make your way north to the city gates. 2. Mires full of quicksand are occasionally visible on either side of the trail. 3. Your slow pace makes you late for your meeting, but prevents you from losing the trail and getting lost in the bog. 4. Just before noon, you arrive from the south and rejoin the rest of the group, assembled and ready. 5. A well for travelers stands near the gate, so everyone can fill their waterskins before setting out. 6. While the city is well known and easy to navigate, the bog is anything but. 7. It hasn't been mapped with any consistency, and measurements have not been taken. 8. I'll sometimes refer to distances in terms of leagues, when they are known,which I'll define for the purpose of the game as the distance one can travel at a normal pace under the prevailing circumstances inabout an hour. 9. Torrent, even though it's already mid-day, you're confident that you'll reach your destination before nightfall. 10. By mid-day, the temperature has only slightly raised from the overnight chill. 11. The region of the Bog is still in the grip of Winter. 12. Across the steaming fields in every direction, a line of trees marks where the marsh-lands begin. 13. The paths are narrow, so walking in single file, or at most two abreast, will be necessary.Roughly in order, I have Torrent leading the way, Rowan and Ulben following closely behind, and Fluin, Anakis, and Tarek bringing up the rear. 14. Rowan and Tarek have said they'll keep watch for danger, and I'll assume everyone else except Torrent, who's busy navigating, does so as well unless Aluzira or anyone else has anything they'd like to do instead along the way. 15. Okay, after looking around for a moment you notice something shiny peeking out from under a tree. 16. Upon closer examination, you find that it's a thick cloth garment embroidered with sequins, half buried in the mud.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Alban : "The missing gnomes? 2. Poor lads," the gnomish woman sighs. 3. "Warryn was a tinkerer. 4. Not a head tinkerer, but a good one in his own right. 5. Orryn was a barrel crafter, which the kingdom used to store our mushroom wine. 6. They were close friends...thick as thieves. 7. Warryn was the gnome to invent the barrel crabs...contraptions that can pick up barrels too heavy for a gnome to handle. 8. He was always working on them, in the room he called a "garage." 9. He almost never left his garage, so I assume it was there he was...well, it's the last place we assume he was. 10. Orryn kept him company in the garage some of the time, but he generally made his barrels in the wine storage. 11. It's the last place any gnome saw him." 12. The party makes its way south, following the splatter of purple goop. 13. This leads them through a room in which a large crossbow contraption is set up. 14. The gnome manning the weapon waves them through, having been informed by the guards of the visitors' arrival. 15. Alban does not notice anything out of place or suspicious as the party travels. 16. The path leads to a storage room, 40 gallon barrels set into wide alcoves in the wall. 17. Four barrels at the south of the room are tapped, the eight barrels in the north and east remaining unopened. 18. The trail tappers out about the center of the room.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Camilla gives Bell a loving pat on the head, happy she found something that made her happy. 2. AREA 22 - SLEEPING AREA This area appears to be a sleeping area, with sleeping bags and straw piles and makeshift pillows. 3. Unfortunately, there is nothing else in the room. 4. AREA 21 - STORAGE CLOSET This area is lined with shelves holding hundreds of mundane and exotic reagents and components. 5. Most of the supplies have evaporated, congealed, or decayed over long years. 6. AREA 23 - TIME CHAMBER Two massive hourglasses occupy this irregularly shaped chamber. 7. Their glass globes are nearly fifteen feet across, with each hourglass rising almost to the ceiling thirty feet overhead. 8. Each is suspended by chains, pulleys, and gears in such a way that it can be turned over to set its sand running. 9. Slumped against the wall at the far side of the chamber is the cultist who called to you from the balcony of the tower. 10. His dark robes are charred and torn, and a blue dragon mask is clutched in his red-stained hands. 11. It appears undamaged.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. D7: 14 F7: 13 E8: 15 Nevermind, I finally found it in your character sheet. 2. The rats are quick to avoid the radiant light that emanates from Theo. 3. A couplescatter behind the water pipes only to peek out once the coast is clear. 4. Half of their brood may be gone, but they're still willing to fight to defend their nest. 5. Back to Viaya again, and here's a new map with where we are now. 6. Ruggero, you're still going to need to make a dex save for Kelvin's ice spell, but otherwise, everything else has resolved. 7. https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5QowkU494u9cngzVmpad3kxWGR2SHl3SmJVM3M0MEVGUE13/view?usp=sharing The ratin E9 moved to F7 during the rats' turn. 8. Just so you are up to speed. 9. Still within range, though. 10. Another rat drops dead, this one looking more like a rat icicle, thanks to Kelvin's spell. 11. Now only one cornered rat remains. 12. Aside from the collateral damage Ruggero took as a result of Kelvin's spell, yeah, it did go okay, all things considered. 13. There really isn't much to see in this room. 14. It once served as a water storage area so that the temple always had clean water. 15. But, after decades of abandonment, it has fallen into incredible disrepair. 16. No wonder it became a hot spot for scavenging creatures like the rats. 17. It's a wonder, really, that more wildlife has not made this abandoned place their home. 18. Then again, it may be all the traps that have prevented things from getting in. 19. The walls are sturdy and solid. 20. Aside from the places where some of the mortar is falling off, everything is in place and doesn't look like it'll budge for a long while.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "I hail fromCormyr," he says, watching the dice roll. 2. You figurethe brown-haired man is more than twenty summers old, but fewerthanthirty. 3. He wears cleanleather clothing,wornfrom age.Kelten rolls6. 4. "Well, today is off to afinestart." 5. He smiles, then tipshishead toward the three dwarves in the group, Cath, Fen'r, and Gramdal. 6. "My half-brother was a dwarf. 7. Talented around a spit." 8. He whistles. 9. "Damn dwarf was born to roast boar." 10. He kisses pinched fingers, throwing the blessing to the heavens. 11. "The best chefs in the city threw bags ofcoin at him forhis secrets. 12. Henever touched them." 13. He turns away. 14. "Knowledge can't be bought, he would say. 15. Imagine, a dwarven poet?" 16. He laughs heartily. 17. You notice thefaces of Kelten'smetal diceare etched with dwarven numerals. 18. "Haven't seen him in years. 19. I'm sureheheard the callofthe mountain—as all dwarves do." 20. "Orcs? 21. Can't say I've heard anything significant. 22. You?" 23. OOC. 24. So you know, I have a pile of index cards, minor encounters, which, when triggered are introduced to the adventure. 25. Waiting in line sucks, even at Disneyland. 26. So, to pass the time, you decided to test your luck against the bones. 27. I like to reward characters, not for how frequentlyactive they are at the Table, but for how engaged they are. 28. One post per day might be your limit. 29. Ten posts. 30. Participation is what matters. 31. I try my best to make sure that is said, and rewarded. 32. Your DM, AdventureHalz.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The shop keeper finally turns her eyes away from Autzen and looks at Adolmain. 2. "He doesn't talk much does he? 3. Oh well, I sleep alone tonight…" she says whimsically. 4. "My name isLinene Graywind and I operate this fine establishment on behalf of the Lionshields. 5. And you are right, I hate the Redbrands. 6. Bunch of cockless cowards if you ask me. 7. Killing them makes me happy…not as happy as other activities however" she cracks as she looks at Autzen again. 8. "I have a full assortment of armor and weapons, some of which are even of the magical kind. 9. My prices are fair, and nothing is over 500 GP each. 10. Please take a look. 11. If you steal anything, I'll gut you myself. 12. You've been warned." 13. (All armor and weapons in PHB prices under 500 GP a piece is available (prices are noted in PHB). 14. Magic items that are "common" or "uncommon" according to dungeon master guide are also available. 15. Prices are not listed for magical items so if you want to buy any of the magic items, you'll need to barter for them. 16. Common magic items range from 50-100 GP. 17. Uncommon magic items range from 100 GP to 500 GP) "Now that's a fair offer. 18. Yes, I can do that." 19. the trading post operator says. 20. "A fine weapon for a fine man."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Berrus manages to hack through the strained rope with a single, sharp blow, rolling away from the ballista as it crashes through the railing and tumbles to the jungle floor 80 feet below. 2. He rolls to the side, so as to slam against the railing himself. 3. His heavy armour cushions the blow enough that he will likely only take some bruises away from the ordeal, and he gets up and stands unsteadily upon the main deck of the ship. 4. What he's most upset about in this precise moment is that his hand axe got stuck in the ballista and also fell to the ground. 5. As he looks around him, he sees Shae standing a couple of feet away, with Zip attached to her, the Captain hanging in the ropes that tied her to the helm on the quarterdeck, and Flax hanging of a broken beam off the forecastle, with nothing but the forest floor below him. 6. Upon being shaken, the captain wakes up, dizzy, and confused. 7. Dried blood cakes the right side of her face, from when she must have hit her head on the helm. 8. The captain's eyes strained to make Maxine out as one of the crew or one of the passengers, but failed. 9. It seemed that Captain Thasselandra Bravewing wasn't sure whether she had suffered a concussion, or whether she was face to face with a scavenger. 10. Although the rope floats over to Flax, he is hanging off the ledge with a single hand, his other arm standing off at a weird angle from below his left elbow. 11. Although the unseen servant is trying to help, it is all but enough that Flax manages to hold on, he doesn't have sufficient strength to pull himself up onto the ship with a single hand alone.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. There is a brief jolt of inspiration within the Hunter as he remembers something important. 2. He whips about to Grahl and hands him a leaflet. 3. "There's some useful information about demons in there that you may want to know. 4. I noticed earlier that you're kinda looking around the way I was when I first saw all of this stuff, and while this note might not be useful to them..." he gestures to the other five with a hand to his face and a thumb in their direction "...for a beginner it could be a good read." 5. He shrugs his shoulders, "I couldn't get into it, but maybe you'll have better luck." 6. In the Abyss, there are levels that for the most part war with each other for complete and utter chaos to reign in their specific way. 7. Demons that come to the physical realm are usually, USUALLY, here for a brief time to serve out goals of summoners (temporary)\callers (less temporary) then disappear back to their level. 8. Demons of enormous strength and power may leave the abyss, but they do so at the risk of putting both their status within their level and their level's place in the hierarchy of demons in jeopardy so they seldom do. 9. Lesser demons are almost entirely at the whims and wills of greater demons. 10. They subside by getting by without being noticed, and hopefully the raw chaos of the abyss sees fit to promote their abilities to that of a greater demon. 11. "Might explain why they keep looking around."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. (Kei relays a room something like this - the light bar in the middle represents where the opening is in the ceiling. 2. Toktok is to the right/north.) 3. Oceanus, relaxing on a boulder, adds to Gerrard, in Elvish: "I hear water. 4. A river, maybe. 5. That way somewhere." 6. He points west. 7. Gerrard glides down the rope next, his moon blade glowing cooly in the dusty dimness of the crypt. 8. Oceanus and Kei remain above for the moment. 9. Suddenly a cold wind blows through your collective souls as you hear the clicking of bones from all around. 10. The bones at the foot of the altar stir and form into a pair of towering skeletons clutching greatclubs. 11. The dead orc warrior looks up at you and grins evilly, green fire burning in its hate-filled eyes as it stands. 12. "Life," it rasps, tonelessly. 13. Initiative:Dead orc:17Huge skeletons:8Dwal:21Peri:4Gerrard:16Kei:6Oceanus:14Bjorn:10Trill:19 Dwal and Trill may act first. 14. (Trill may not attack, but can do other actions, if needed.) 15. The magic missiles sear bits off the undead orc. 16. You have its full attention now. 17. It unsheathes a filthy longsword and makes a shockingly fast thrust at Dwal.Longsword attack:12.Slashing damage:4 "Join me," it creaks, and reaches out with its free arm to grab Dwal.Attack: 13. 18. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. A Rude Awakening - Day 7, FirstTen-day, Month of Tsarkah (The Claw of Storms) You wake up in the morning, when the weak sun beats down on your face, a crab runs across your face or an inquisitive seabird pulls at one ear. 2. Despite the weak sunlight, you find yourself shivering because you are still wet from being immersed in the icy water the night before and it is only about 45 degrees with a cold wind blowing. 3. As you all look around on the beach you can see your shipmates all lying there and starting to stir. 4. Scattered along the beach at the high tide line you can see boxes and bales of the silk that the ‘Blue’ had been carrying in her cargo. 5. Like you, all you shipmates are shivering with cold and peering out to sea where through the low lying sea mist you can all see the wreck of your ship, largely above water, on a reef about 100 yards offshore. 6. It is then that you recall the massive storm of the night before. 7. The ‘Blue’ as you affectionately called your ship had been heading for South Great Head strait, expecting to dock in Kythos the next day, when during the first watch, not long after most of you had retired and Floki had helm with Gilly in the look-out when the sudden storm came out of nowhere; so sudden as to perhaps not being normal. 8. You all rushed on deck and the Captain Vhon Cedaerk took over the helm while the rest of you rushed to reef in the sails. 9. All that you could do was run before the storm when Gilly called out white water ahead. 10. Before the Captain could do anything the ship had run up on the reef and ripped out her bottom. 11. As the ship settled to the bottom, all you could do was jump overboard and make for land as best you could.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Dekhan, as you take a step towards the tent, there is movement in the ruin of the tower, and a creature steps from behind a crumbling stone wall into your view. 2. At the same time, what you thought was a pile of rocks stirs, and another figure rises. 3. More figures stand or walk out from the shadows, another, and another, and another. 4. Zoria, you are close by and recognise all these creatures as zombies, reanimated corpses of the dead. 5. They are incapable of thought or speech, and you know (from your religious training) that they are very hard to kill, and that they often rise again when they seem defeated. 6. Everyone please roll initiative, and also confirm where you are. 7. To the best of my knowledge, Dekhan, Incantis, Zoria and Strix are up near the tent, while Scupper and Varinth, along with Soodi, are quite a way back (120 feet? 8. Or did you get a bit closer?). 9. There are three orcs with Strix's group, and three who stayed behind with Varinth's group. 10. Round One: Group A: Incantis Group B: Oggor, Morg and Fekar Group C: Zoria Group D: Zombies Group E: More zombies Group F: Dekhan Group G: Yet more zombies Group H: Scupper, Strix and Vaz Group I: Kosst, Jukk and Vroh Group J: Even more zombies Scupper, Varinth, Soodi and the other three orcs are about eighty feet to the south of Zoria and Incantis. 11. Incantis is up.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. "Ah, okay, I give!" 2. Smokey laughs as his gangly digits cannot keep up with the superior reflexes of Tahia. 3. "Man, there's no way I can catch quick fingers like yours. 4. Guess it's a halfling thing, being quick and nimble." 5. There is a loud banging on the cabin door. 6. "Ten minutes 'til shift!" 7. Calls through a gruff deep tone that the group recognises as Durgonn , who keeps the rotas going. 8. "Man, Stoner never lets us have a lie in." 9. Smokey complains somewhat jokingly as he goes to collect his pack, ready to move out and go on shift whilst someone else uses the bunk for a few hours. 10. Durgonn Stonehewer : Durgonn is a hill dwarf of around 130 summers and has a very thick ginger beard. 11. Whilst he was a blacksmith back in the day, he ended up drafted into Daverro's military some twenty years ago,rising the ranks to becoming a lower officer. 12. However, that doesn't matter as much as he is one of the top five on The Dutchess , in charge of Humanoid Resources, and making sure that rooms are cleared for the next lot of folk who need somewhere to rest that night. 13. He's pretty gruff and straight forward in his methods, but gets the job done.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. When you return, the creature has left his position that he once stood. 2. You do not see him, but he continues talking in your heads. 3. To Pops, "very good bug killer. 4. Now just throw him in the bottom here and leave me to my meal." 5. With a thud, the dead Redbrand lands at the bottom of the cavern after rolling down the crevasse walls.This steep-sided fissure is 5 to 10 feet wide and 20 feet deep. 6. At the bottom are bits of rubble and rocks scattered across the almost flat floor. 7. As Petros begins to walk toward one of the bridges, the voice stops you. 8. "Wise choice story teller. 9. The other bridge will collapse if you were to cross it. 10. Be wise not to come back through on the other bridge." 11. The north bridge is the once you are crossing. 12. The south bridge the creature says is trapped. 13. Nyana will put a hand on Pops shoulder before he opens the door. 14. "Do you hear that? 15. No, not in the room, but the way we came." 16. Pops stops himself from opening the door further. 17. Pops can now hear a soft beating and it's getting louder. 18. Nyana will look at Pops. 19. "That sounds like a lot of people..." Louder, now echoing. 20. Sven pulls his halbred up in a guard stance. 21. "What do we do?" 22. A few seconds pass. 23. Petros can now hear the beating. 24. Nothing rhythmic about it, Petros notes.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. You all look forward, trying to identify the source of this sudden red light. 2. You notice that it is coming from the other side of the sailing ship that your are approaching, such that it is obscured by the vessel. 3. A terrible tearing sound is heard, followed by a third and much louder blow of that same warhorn. 4. A heavy mist rises from that point beyond the sailing ship. 5. The wind carrying it picks up once more. 6. It feels hot and stuffy despite you being out here in the water. 7. The screams in the wind are deafening. 8. Whatever this is, it is probably not good news. 9. Graxx pokes Doozey as the pair sees this strange occurrence as the distraction they needed to hurry towards the ship. 10. As the longboat is brought to a stop next to the ship's port side, the halfling and human man can see a rope ladder leading onto the deck above. 11. The clanging of metal on metal and the dying screams of the people above join the several other sensory stimuli you have been dealt during this approach. 12. Looking around for potential explanations, Neya and Utar notice that fire has now erupted from The Third Dracolich's other side, opposite from where the party approached.They notice that the ship now has a slight tilt to it, as if the fiery side was heavier. 13. Before any plans for climbing up the ship can materialize, the monk and the cleric notice that Biscuit is staring at the distance, towards the mainland's shore. 14. Neya and Utar look in that direction and find the beached shape of a familiar vessel. 15. Warsh's raft is abandoned there, almost coming apart and sporting a few flames of its own. 16. The light of the moon reveals a few bodies lying next to it. 17. Whatever happened there was quick and recent. 18. Neya : The new tingling feeling on your hands ( Insignia of Claws ) make you want to test them out in battle, which can likely be found just beyond the sailing ship's rope ladder right behind you. 19. Nonetheless, that scene at the distant beach is quite intriguing.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Recwyin attempts to punch the distracted guard while he has the chance but the Drow manages to dodge the blow Garruk casts Shillelagh on his club using the root as a focus, then runs up and swings at one the guards, but narrowly misses. 2. Rhogar instructs his owl companion to assist him by distracting the Drow guard that Recwyin swung at. 3. He then launches a fire bolt at the Drow and hits him square in the chest. 4. Bigsby shakes off that embarrassing clumsiness. 5. He stands up and mutters a prayer to himself before casting sacred flame on the most hurt guard. 6. Jimjar, having gone thus far unnoticed, attempts to sneak up on the most injured guard. 7. He leaps up with only a stone in his hand delivering 2 quick blows to the back of his head, rendering him unconscious. 8. Jorlan, the drow with scars on his face, runs over and grabs his comrade. 9. Swinging him around he sends the other Drow careening over the edge of the cliff. 10. He turns to you all, hands raised, and says "All right, keep it down before somebody hears us." 11. You all drag the unconscious guard around the corner and start removing any useful items (crossbow with 20 poisoned bolts, set of studded leather armor, sheild, 2 daggers, 1 shortsword **you guys Dan divide it in the chat**) Jorlan calls out to the guards playing cards in the barracks, " You two, with me. 12. We're needed at the south entrance, someone was sighted down there" and the two drow duck through the opening you had made earlier and follow Jorlan off up the path.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Anton, Scar, Obsben, and Geth- From where you are you can see the glow is centralized and coming from a stone casket with brass clasps. 2. But Geth, oddly enough you still feel nothing coming from it. 3. Boh- As you peer behind the statue in the alcove, a faint shimmer in the wall tells you that it is indeed an illusory wall. 4. The room beyond is small and dusty. 5. A thin patina of cobwebs obscure some runes carved into the wall. 6. Boh- As you and Anton climb into the room , your acute hearing picks ups the sound of breathing over by the door. 7. A small, tinny laugh fills the room and a voice says, "You have broken the seal! 8. My watch over the Dragon Priest is ended! 9. Thank you stranger!" 10. You see tiny puffs of dust as a small invisible creature runs into adjacent room.

Valji disadvantage: 16 Valji had just about given up on finding Darvin when the little gnome noticed the telltale magical shimmer of his disguise in the distance, shortly away from a tent with a large... green gem of some sort on the top. 7. Interesting point. 8. No; it's too far back at the end of the valley. 9. Skiaceq and Valji have seen it, but Darvin has not. 10. A quick double take later, he recognizes Skiaceq and Valji, well camouflaged and apparently tracking him. 12. Walking in the direction that the drunkard had pointed leads past the tent the cultist and dragonborn had headed towards. 13. From inside comes the sound of giggling. 14. They're far enough out of earshot that you don't think it will be an issue a bit later into the night, but that while everyone is up and about you may have some issues. 15. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Ranik pats Balgrim heavily on both shoulders, laughing heartily. 2. "And the fresh face is fresh-faced! 3. Aye, always good t'see the wee bairns showin' an interest in their spiritual health. 4. The young are sponges, they are, they just suck the knowledge up, not like us old stubborn greybeards. 5. If'n it's a scholarship ye be after, work hard, study hard, an' the brotherhood will be happy tae 'ave ye. 6. Always work for the order, there is." 7. Ranik says, giving Balgrim a thump on the chest. 8. "Aye, nice n' solid, like the faith! 9. And how fortunate fer ye, if'n it's work yer after, I'm just the brother ye need. 10. Come, come, let's away from the frenzy, always a melee when the shipments arrive." 11. Ranik says. 12. At Hyre's question, Ranik looks a little surprised. 13. "Oh, them? 14. We call them labours, on account of all the labourin' they do fer us. 15. Ancient dwarven spellcraft, that is. 16. Hardly a one o' us left who are true masters of the art. 17. Ye should see the labours the dwarves 'ave at Wolfbane. 18. Gates are guarded by giant sentinels. 19. Not much of a call for such grand designs here, we just use em' so we don't have accidental tramplin's and it saves on .... cleanin' up, if ye catch the drift."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. After a few hours pass, the tavern begins to clear out and there is still no sign of Jerub. 2. The fire grows dim while the common room is slowly abandoned by the patrons, either returning to their room upstairs, or stumbling out into the dark and rainy streets. 3. Soon you are left almost completely alone except for a few quiet patrons sticking to the company of their flagons. 4. Alandell approaches your booth andbeckons at Barrel to join. 5. Barrel approaches the booth, says a quick hello, and thenturns to Arandell as the stately barman begins to speak in a low-tone to the party. 6. "Listen fellars. 7. Jerub wishes to meet with ye privately." 8. Alandell's eyes dart back and forth conspicuously. 9. The barman lowers his voice even more, almost to a whisper, as he leans further over your table with a hand outstretched on the tabletop for balance. 10. "You lot head down to the cellar, through the back hall there." 11. Alandellmotions with eyes toward a narrow hallway at the back of the common room thatyou all assumeleads to a back entrance. " 12. Help yerselves to brandy and ale and the like down there. 13. I'll be downto check on ye in just a few minutes. 14. And try not to draw too much attention to yerselves, gentlemen." 15. Alandell straightens up and begins speaking loudly, in a somewhat obvious attempt to seem casually inconspicuous. 16. "Very good chaps. 17. Thank ye for yer patronage. 18. Please visit us again soon. 19. It was our pleasure to serve ye. 20. If ye need anything else please ask just ask Lolli!" 21. With that, Alandell pushes off from your table and strides back across the room. 22. He straightens up a few glasses on a shelf and then disappears through the stockroom door behind the bar.

You return to the room where you fought the guards and cultists, and take the eastern passage. 3. It's short, only fifteen feet or so, and opens into a new and rather better decorated room. 4. You see a writing desk with a small wooden stool. 5. Light comes from two lit lamps, on hanging from a wall, one placed upon the desk. 6. There are several tables strewn with books and pieces of parchment. 7. There is a smaller area to one side of the room, where you see a bed with rich purple sheets and two sturdy wooden chests at its foot. 8. There appears to be no-one in the room. 9. You also notice several rugs on the floor, one of which has been moved aside to reveal a large hole leading down.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Berrus, using up almost all the silver, you do your best to coat as many weapons and blades as possible, since you will likely need them sooner than later. 2. Once satisfied with your work, you share out the weapons, and then go to sleep. 3. Shae, as you ask yourself, whether you had prepared enough, you see a meteor streak past, leaving a bright tail. 4. You choose to interpret it as a sign of Kam's continued favour, and after opening your tome of secrets to the by now well-known page, you find a new short note there: "The hag will be preoccupied with her ritual, it is then you must strike. 5. While she will be at her most powerful, I may be able to help you as well, particularly if she is distracted. 6. In your gravest hour of need, read my name, and I will come from the heavens to help you and your friends in your battle against this ancient evil." 7. Just below, you see in shimmering silver, Kam's true name in Celestial. 8. Inspired by the direction that once seemed to involve little more than somehow making it through the day, the group enthusiastically gets to work packing up their gear and getting ready to leave the camp behind. 9. Within an hour, most is packed up, until you realise that a lot of the bulkier items had been behind and buried: Weneed to travel light if we want to cover as much ground as possible. 10. If we need to, we can always get back for our gear, thanks to Shae’s map”, Falx states, flatly. 11. With the matter decided, you start heading out soon after, with Gruk and the Professor, flanked by Berrus and Brax, leading the way according to Gruk’s thoughts on where they would likely find isolated hunting parties or small warbands. 12. Everyone, please roll either perception to try and spot other grung, nature to determine where they would likely be found, or survival to look for travks that could be evidence of grung nearby.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Everyone is rejoiced once Kestrell has the stench from the rotting corpse covered in the scent of lavender. 2. Both Cinna and Eldon compile information regarding vampires.Awakened to an endless night, vampires hunger for the life they have lost and sate that hunger by drinking the blood of the living. 3. Vampires abhor sunlight, for its touch burns them. 4. They never cast shadows or reflections, and any vampire wishing to move unnoticed among the living keeps to the darkness and far from reflective surfaces. 5. Eldon specifically recalls that every vampire remains bound to its coffin, crypt, or grave site, where it must rest by day. 6. If a vampire didn’t receive a formal burial, it must lie beneath a foot of earth at the place of its transition to undeath. 7. A vampire can move its place of burial by transporting its coffin or a significant amount of grave dirt to another location. 8. Some vampires set up multiple resting places this way. 9. Eldon recalls the lore of how vampire spawns are bred. 10. If the victim of a vampire bite is killed, and then buried in dirt, the victim will rise as a vampire spawn, being under the control of the vampire that bit them. 11. Once the vampire spawn consumes the blood of their master, they become a true vampire themselves and are no longer under the control of their assailant. 12. Additionally, after Eldon spends more time reflecting on his knowledge, he also remembers thatavampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. 13. Any sort of running water is also hazardous to vampires, it becomes acidic.Lastly, Eldon remembers that avampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is incapacitated in its resting place. 14. Cinna will notice that with the wooded area covering the road, there's quite an abundance of sticks at her disposal. 15. Gathering the sticks and sharpening them will take several minutes.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. As you near the source, the tunnel opens into another large room, much like the one you were just in. 2. It’s already lit, and you don’t see any immediate traps. 3. What you do see, however, is 3 normal looking red kobolds sitting at a large iron door. 4. Occasionally, they look into a small hatch in the door, and shoot a blowdart into something, and it looks like the same type of dart that were used in the traps. 5. When they do so, whatever’s inside makes a mix of a scream and a moan, as if this has been going on for a long time, and it’s accepted this. 6. They also have crude shortswords. 7. However, before Dorceran can see what’s behind the door, one of the kobold sees you. 8. It sits there for a moment, frantically looking between Dorceran, Alax, and Meilannan (I’m assuming you also went that way) before screaming ‘ Intruders! 9. INTRUDERS!’ (In draconic, of course) Two of the three get up and grab their blades, while the third one begins to unlock the door. 10. Roll initiative for just the three of you, not Ekane or Sylvalur. 11. You two can enter the battle in a surprise round, or just stay in hiding. 12. The whole group of kobolds seems collectively confused. 13. The kobold who is being grappled manages to shake Ekane off of them, but only backs up with shortsword in hand. 14. The one at the door tries to push Sylvalurback (7). 15. The third kobold looks around for a second, before noticing their friend at the door and making an attack at Ekane. 16. However, they are hit by Meilannan’s acid splash, and fall to the ground, dead. 17. The kobold nearby manages to dodge the blast. 18. Suddenly, however, the door is hit by something on the other side, hard. 19. It begins to buckle, but holds as the thing inside roars in anger. 20. The kobold looks at you frightenedly, but seems to roughly understand you. 21. (I’m going to wait because it’s not their initiative yet)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Utar makes sure that you all see the phrase in question, written in Thorass: "TOE MONO, TOE MEGALO." 2. There is also a clear indication that one must be touching the intended target of this incantation. 3. As you all make note of these instructions, Shandra places a hearty breakfast on the table for you all to enjoy, wishing you all a good morning and good luck out there investigating the mystery of the Lighthouse. 4. She then leaves, with a curtsy. 5. Drazzim interject: "So folks, where to in this fine mornin'?" 6. The West Tower is wholly empty save for dust and cobwebs. 7. Thesmell of wet, freshly-turned earth is even stronger once you make your way in. 8. Upon arriving in the basement, you find that somebody broke open the floor and dug down to the stone. 9. The earth and tile are stacked neatly alongside the walls. 10. Digging tools lay scattered about the room. 11. There is a severed rope tied to a ring in the wall leading to a stone slab deep in the earth. 12. Three other 50-foot coils of rope lay on the floor beside the slab. 13. The stone slab is approximately10 feet on a side, is bordered in worn glyphs, and has an indentation in the shape of a human hand approximately six inches away from the leading edge of the slab. 14. Neya takes a careful look around the room, focusing on the overturned earth. 15. In it, she finds a leather bag, with straps and a flap that closes. 16. The bag looks fairly new, which is quite the contrasting feature with its surroundings. 17. Inside, the monk finds a collection of random items: a single piton, a half-burnt candle, a tiny brass bell, and a bundle of mint leaves.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Sildar, comes out of the inn, heading round the building, surprised to see Salazar, and two people he had yet to meet, and neither of them were Ryner. 2. Upon seeing the Goblin, Sildar, now wearing a full set of armor, and a less extravagant, but still fine sword. 3. Which he Drew, upon seeing Lark, the goblin.. 4. Bringing the sword to the Goblins throat. 5. Rage clearly written on his face. 6. Divine light began flowing into the blade What are you doing here? 7. Looking around, Seeing Salazar again Were we followed? 8. Did they not keep their word afterall? 9. And now they're suing disguises? 10. (Sorry for the delays, life. 11. WIll be on most of the night to respond to make up for it)! 12. Sildar grunts, saying, T he long and short is: The Lords’ Alliance is a coalition of rulers from cities and towns across Faerûn (primarily in the North), who collectively agree that some solidarity is needed to keep evil at bay.The rulers of Waterdeep, Silverymoon, Neverwinter, and other free cities in the region dominate the Alliance, and every lord in the Alliance works for the fate and fortune of his or her own settlement above all others. 13. So you could say we are a coalition of towns, and cities that wish to aid the weak and defenseless, with the only catch being we protect our own before others. 14. But we have networks all throughout Faerun, I am simply an agent from Waterdeep myself.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Mirica is able to cure some of the wounds...which...is a good thing because by her assessment they were on the path to death in a day or two. 2. Even with a cure spell upon each, and some of their caustic burns healed, they are both still unconscious.They appear to be poisoned by whatever alchemical ichor was sprayed on them, and they remain unconscious. 3. She can't say how long for, though a lesser restoration she figures would purge the poisonous influence from their system. 4. Jahren's instinct to trust feels right, as he thinks these Halflings are a trustworthy folk, at least when it matters. 5. Maybe he figures they might be the mischievous type, but are clearly in no mood for games at the moment, and much too stressed. 6. As Toc mentioned, there's only the faint haze of some magical influence left on the remains of the goblins when Fianna focus' on them with her eldritch sight. 7. Otherwise, she's never seen anything like this. 8. There seems to be a mixture of alchemical and magical influence on their bodies, having transformed them into some twisted version of a goblin. 9. The one that exploded, based on the bits left over, was as twisted inside as outside. 10. She figures it's more than a simple spell. 11. There is evidence of some physical alchemical reagent having melded into their skin and organs. 12. Strike that last thought. 13. She has seen something like this before. 14. During the war against the Shadovar....and the floating city of Shade, there were demons that had been 'enhanced' through the Shadovar's dark arts. 15. These goblins alterations remind her of those. 16. Though....where the demon's changes were crafted into making it into a killing machine and enhancing it...these ones seem sloppy, partially harmful, and obviously poorly administered. 17. The halflings re-iterate that the attack was four days ago. 18. FinFin goes flying around on a scouting mission. 19. The path the goblins cut through the wheat is surprisingly easy to see from the air, even after 4 days, and does indeed head parallel to the road and straight south towards the forest, which FinFin can see on the distant horizon, 6 miles south of here. 20. Roll survival for FinFin for tracking.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. The streets are not empty, but it isn't the most busy hour either. 2. The ones that are still outside enduring the humid mist that covers the citygo on their bussines. 3. And the mist makes it hard to see anything and cast goshtly shadows from the torches that lit some streets and the entrance of some buidlings here and there. 4. They go to the Golden Sphynx with easy and they have no doubt that had reached the place for it one of the most illuminated buildings they had seen, with several . 5. In front of the Governor Palace they see the stone stairs that head to a couple of wooden and decorated doors, lit by some lamps with spells of continual flame and their blindports open. 6. Above the wooden doors rest a relief of a sphynx laying on the ground with one of his pawns raised. 7. Great windows, mostly covered by yellow and orange cortinage on the inside, gives glimpses of some kind of ballet hall inside the walls. 8. A couple of guards, dressed in white and golden clothes over their leather armors and armed with swords and light crossbows, are each at one side of the door. 9. When they are approaching an old couple well dressed with silks are just finishing to enter a carriage, helped by a vallet dressed in a similar way that the two guards, but with no weapons or armor visible. 10. The young woman closes the door fo the carriage, accepts with a nod a couple of coins that the man gives to her and the horse starts moving, carrying the elegant carriage into the night. 11. The vallet turns and heads inside. 12. Molly: While you are walking towards it, in one of the allies that are near the building, you clearly see a figureamong the shadows near the end of the alley. 13. You pass the alley and its just when you just pass it when your brain alerts you that you just had seen some kind of creature. 14. It appeared to have a couple of horns and a big cape around its shoulders, or it was a couple of folded wings? 15. You are not sure, even if you had seen something. 16. You take two steps back and look again inside the alley. 17. And you find it empty.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Searching through the corpses, Skiaceq and Valji find 28sp, and a sack on one of the kobolds containing 3 pewter candlesticks, a silver serving dishes, and a small ivory carving of Chauntea. 2. Taken together, it looks like the contents of a small family altar which have been looted. 3. The weapons of the cultists are of shoddy make and have seen a lot of use. 4. Skiaceq spots what he believes the cultist described a mile down the path, as well as a as more circuitous route while would allow the party to skip it entirely at the costs of an extra couple hours travel. 5. On the path towards the likely ambush spot, Skiaceq also spots two kobolds skittering towards the relative safety of the cults forces. 6. They are close enough for him to catch, but too far away for Valji and Darvin to make it on foot. 7. The Kobolds never saw what was coming from their aerial predator, and were quickly dispatched by Skiaceq. 8. Finding nothing on their bodies, he heads back to his companions. 9. The route around was quite rocky, and uphill most of the way. 10. By the time you get sight of the camp it is quickly approaching dusk. 11. You see smoke from the camp fires, as the smell of cooking meat wafts it's way to your nostrils. 12. Muted sounds of laughter and conversation become louder as the party approaches. 13. (Has Skiaceq cleaned up? 14. He did get a little carried away in the last fight. 15. Bird man covered in the blood of his enemies might cause a stir.)

As you all progress further into the forest (need at least a Stealth check from everyone), you can see figures up ahead, though they are obscured by the dense foliage. 2. Soon enough, you come to the edge of a small clearing, in which stand three figures: two rather small, squat and the other a huge, hulking beast. 3. The smaller creatures appear to be covered in chitinous plates, like a bug, and they have two ridged antennae protruding from the backs of their heads. 4. The larger one is covered in small scales that glisten in the sunlight, and its head resembles that of an viperfish. 5. Its fingers and toes are exceptionally long, but its nails/claws are rather short. 6. It has two wings folded on its back that resemble the fins of a fish, almost. 7. Strapped to a belt is a crude, jagged longsword and a whip. 8. "Come on move it! 9. We've got to get moving before master gets worried." 10. The large one says.

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Graxx voices some concern about the goats. 2. Elisande responds with a puzzled look: "Dey look healthy 'nough to me." 3. Utar provides the group some comfort by communicating that, to the best of his understanding, both the people and animals in this village are likely to suffer from some food deficiencies due to their limited diet. 4. The half-orc guesses they probably miss an essential vitamin or two, or maybe half a dozen. 5. The animals are unlikely to eat anything but scraps and leftovers, so they probably get even less nutrients. 6. Eager to be helpful, Elisande then lists a handful of foods that seem to be the staple in these parts: "Fish, shellfish, roots, berries, and nuts. 7. Sum Folk eat leaves or rock soups, but dey usually get the runs aft'wards. 8. Me favorite're de berries. 9. Do ye Outsides have sum on ye?" 10. Looking around, the group sees no active agriculture of any kind... ( OOC : Speaking of food, each of you should go ahead and deduct two rations from your inventories to reflect supplies used over the horseback ride and camping session.) 11. DM's Screen : Random CRAP: 2 CRAP then ties up the horses within the barn, albeit hesitantly. 12. Glühoof , Edith , and Garnet seem to not mind it (I'll assume Biscuit is not staying, but let me know otherwise). 13. As they do, they get a better look at the inside of the barn and its inhabitants.There are noother peoplein the barn, but the goats follow and watch the adventuring party everywhere they go, even whenever they are outside but within the vicinity ofthe barn. 14. The milky-eyed doe, in particular, seems to stay close to Graxx and follows his every move. 15. Doozey tells their guide where they'd like to go next. 16. Elisande agrees, but waits until the group is finished getting their animals settled. 17. While she waits, she clarifies: "Yan goats? 18. Nothin' special... Dey're just yan like me, not old like ye." 19. ( OOC : I need each of you to roll a check for me. 20. You may choose to roll a Perception , a Survival , or an Investigation check, each with{DC 12}).

Pitero: "This was given to me by Sir Ballen as an offering to Chauntea but priestess Hyghland refused to take it as our gift. 5. She it was not ours to give," Brida explains still seeing the plain stone in her hand. 6. "She charged me to return it and said she would deal with Sir Ballen's overreaching," she explains bitterly. 7. "To think what happened here might be all my fault," she adds turning the stone in her hand now as it still glows to you but she still can't see it! 8. Pitero/Andulra: "Priestess Hyghland insisted that this stone, this stone was never meant to leave the village," Brida began. 9. "I should not have taken it and I should have asked more questions of Sir Ballen before blindly leaving here with whatever this is in my pocket. 10. It's been nothing but trouble since I left here," she explains. 11. Erevan: "I see no coffins and no lady," Aldaryn looking at you like you're crazy gesturing about what he sees as an empty chapel needing a good once over as he realized not in a corner at the far end of the room was a great pile of ash! 12. The crew of the Christmas Carrier cheers loudly as Tam jumps into the water with Tori. 3. Both of them can now see the Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls deep below them. 4. The Main Palace seems to be the primary source of glittering, as it is indeed completely covered in shiny pearls, but the rest of the City offers a stunning display of multicolored aquatic plants and corral, as well as ancient stone buildings and statues. 5. Merfolk swim around in the thousands, using all sorts of creatures as mounts, and beasts of burden. 6. Tam's Interplanar navigation tools seem to point towards the very center of the City, in the middle of a crowded commercial Avenue, where Merfolk merchants display their wares. 7. Tori is pretty sure the Merfolk soldiers said something along the lines of "Halt! 8. What are you doing here?" 9. They also seem quite unnerved at the sight of the Plesiosaurus... Tori may gain advantage on Intimidation rolls if she wishes. 10. They definitely fear the big water Dino... Well, there are 5 Mermen soldiers, and 5 hammerhead sharks. 11. The City lies 200 feet below...

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Harq When you take control of the helm, Brynn runs down the stairs and yells something to her crew before heading inside. 2. You were unable to hear her over the heavy rain and thunder, but you see the crew looking at you as if they expect orders from you. 3. Skarhys approaches you seeming almost panicked, which may just be a first. 4. In his usual variety of voices, he says “Was in Brynn’s quarters looking for map. 5. Have to start going to land. 6. A huge threat ahead.” As he finishes his sentence, a large line of jagged rocks comes into your view, in the path of the ship. 7. If the ship continues straight, it will take full damage from the hit. 8. What will you do? 9. ((I know the choice is obvious but I’m leaving it open for your creativity)) Lia/Helena/Brodan The pirate turns to Brodan and says, “You look like a wizard. 10. Why don’t you just use some magic to fix the damage?” Kronk You see Brynn run down the stairs towards you and her crew. 11. She points towards Harq and yells, “I’m going belowdeck. 12. The helmsman up there will be giving orders until I return!” She looks to you and beckons you over to her. 13. “I might need your help. 14. Come with me please.” Skarhys runs past you and seems to be going up to Harq. 15. Harq 5 Made a mistake there, I think. 16. To simplify this, I’m going to roll a dex check for Harq and if it doesn’t meet the DC, the ship will take a certain amount of damage. 17. 8 . 18. Alright. 19. Harq, you attempt to maneuver around the jagged rocks, but are unable to fully move around them. 20. The ship has taken 48 damage. 21. You can hear some of the wood splinter as it moves through the rocks. 22. You are clear now. 23. What do you do? 24. Helena/Lia/Brodan There are no buckets in your immediate vicinity. 25. You can look for one and try to dump the water out. 26. Also, being in the hold, you have first-hand experience of the jagged rocks ripping through the floorboards. 27. You can see even more water start seeping in. 28. What do you do? 29. Anyone who is joining Helena with this should roll for investigation. 30. If you want to do something else, feel free. 31. I’ll roll for Helena since her post is already up. 32. Investigation: 20 (not nat)

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Zindra wishes the adventurers well as they depart the Triboar Arms. 2. The five hopon their horses and make their way down the narrow path that leads back to the Long Road. 3. As soon as they reach the road and make the turn to the north, they are met withthe sudden screams of women and children, followed by a man yelling, “Giants! 4. Run!” Perplexed residents and shopkeepers emerge from their domiciles in time to see a large rock fall from the sky and crash onto an old cart in the center of town, splintering it. 5. As a cloud of dust erupts from the wreckage, a second rock hits the ground, tumbles through a fence, and slams against the wall of a building, startling a pair of mules tethered to a post nearby. 6. All around you, people begin to shriek and scatter. 7. In the distance, two buildings that stand on the northern edge of town are ablaze. 8. What has caused the fires? 9. Where are the giants? 10. Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Hallanann slides the key into the slot and turns it. 2. The sidereon bellows and whines and hisses light flashes, and the floor shakes. 3. As the Sidereon’s machinery winds down, a shimmering, prismatic gate opens, and an Emissary from the Plane of Dreams appears: a translucent, opalescent thing like a hybrid of jellyfish and salamander, floating in the air as if drifting in gentle waters. 4. Its head has three faces, each smooth except for a single eye and a flat, expressionless mouth. 5. It speaks telepathically to the characters: The strange creature’s thoughts fill your head as if youwere remembering an old song, heard in your youth andsince forgotten. 6. “We are an Emissary from the Realm of Dreams. 7. We come forth from the luminous shadow of the Silver Gate to give you warning, for one passed from here and returned with what she should not have taken, and it is a doom to the worlds, for her dreams, dark and venomous, flowed out from her in our realm as ink from a quill. 8. She intends to conduct a ritual to resurrect a titan, and she already has the first object she needs to do this." 9. "TheAtrophian Orb," Xurxos says. 10. Between all the sounds, shaking and flashing, Xurxos seems to have entered the room. 11. "So that's where she got it from. 12. The Magister once spoke of this. 13. What did he says? 14. Ah yes: such things as good for the sort of magic only the mad would dare perform – at least if you don’t want to see this poor world more broken than it already is." 15. The Emissaryvanishes as theSidereon grinds to a halt. 16. "So now what do we do?" 17. Xurxos says. 18. "Chasing her doesn't seem to be working."

Input.DM_Text: Dungeon Master:1. Admora hastily, but meticulously blended her herbs together and dumped them into the boiling water Hercule had prepared for her and after about ten minutes decided the concoction was at full strength. 2. She placed the pan off to the side of the small fire to allow it to cool some and then strained it into an empty water skin with some cloth cut from a thin garment someone had offered. 3. When it was cool enough to drink, everyone passed the skin around, taking small mouthfuls to make sure there was enough toshare with everyone. 4. The tea worked wonders. 5. The stomach cramps and headaches faded away over the course of around fifteen minutes and everyone was up on their feet and ready to go. 6. Rory had finally woken up and was out of his delirium, which was a good thing, but after absorbing all the info of what had transpired, his mood grew dark and he seemed troubled. 7. "This is not good, not good at all. 8. I hand picked Phil and Terrance, I've used them more times than i can possibly count. 9. I can't believe they would have done this. 10. Especially not on a job like this." 11. Finnlaughed, "Don't worry, we'll find them and make them pay for this. 12. We've already got bets going." 13. Rory looked up at him incredulously, "I don't think you quite understand. 14. This isn't just a guild job that got screwed up, it came straight from Griskel himself. 15. It was something he wanted specifically done for reasons and interests of his own. 16. It should have been a milk run, and apparently we've been outplayed by two wagon drivers... How do you think that's going to make us look in his eyes? 17. He's going to hold us all responsible for the loss of whatever was in that crate, and we don't even know what it was or it's value. 18. Let's get moving, the wagons are going to be faster, but maybe we can hitch a ride if someone comes along. 19. This is a trade route after all." 20. You set off at a brisk walk south along the road, eyes wary of anything that might come out of the dense woods on either side, and after roughly two hours you find some tracks veering off the road and to the east, seemingly straight into the midst of the trees.
